Tavern.name: Tavern
Tavern.text:
Unless Raskovar has cleared the place out for a private meeting, the tavern is busy. It has the following features:

  • “The tavern buzzes with raucous conversation and clanking steins. A human and an orc bouncer scan the room for trouble while a tired orc bartender pours a drink.”
  • “Large scrolls illustrated with landscapes and portraits line nearly every inch of the walls, swaying gently whenever the front doors open and close.”
  • (Secret) One of the wall scrolls in the back hides a portal that leads into the stairwell in the meeting area (area @UUID[.9F3n3WFtwYFMyukW]{O2}).
  • (Secret) An ivory shaker hidden behind the bar teleports whoever shakes it to the bar in the Dohmain (area @UUID[.g86Yt6xK9Cn2RPWH]{O8}).

The portal hidden behind the wall scroll that leads to the meeting area can be enabled and disabled by using the @UUID[Macro.VnpUpIPMs5wMZWMF] macro. It is initially disabled to prevent player characters and other tokens being teleported without first investigating the secret.

Raskovar. @UUID[Actor.4upTFOYk32kxwJrv] tends the bar and makes friendly conversation with patrons, who know him as Roscoe. He makes polite conversation with any character who orders a drink, asking where they're from and what brings them to the Hanging Tree. If asked about the Ivory Throne, Raskovar claims to know nothing special about the mercenary band. He deflects personal questions, saying he's just a tavern owner. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill insight 16]] check knows Raskovar is lying.

If a character orders a boiling oil, Raskovar's demeanor changes. He invites them to sit at a table and joins them, introducing himself as Dohma Raskovar and asking what services the Ivory Throne can provide. For adventurers, he's willing to order an assassination or a skirmish — if they'll provide one for him in return. If he suspects the characters mean him harm, he calls for help from the bouncers and uses the shaker behind the bar to teleport to the Dohmain (area @UUID[.g86Yt6xK9Cn2RPWH]{O8}).

Everyone is welcome at the Hanging Tree. It's only when I find someone poking around where they don't belong that things turn violent. Care to explain why you're down here before we draw steel? I'm happy to listen after instead, but it'll be so much harder to understand you when your lips are bleeding.

— Dohma Raskovar

Bouncers. An @UUID[Actor.PVc35FqDD1Yj4wRI] and a @UUID[Actor.FJA2WBtzV613aGFk] act as bouncers at opposite ends of the room. If a fight breaks out, a second @UUID[Actor.PVc35FqDD1Yj4wRI] disguised as a patron rises from their seat at the bar and helps escort the riffraff out. A character can recognize this patron is ready for combat with a successful [[/skill insight 13]] check.

If a character searches the room or otherwise acts suspicious, they must succeed on a [[/skill skill=stealth/deception 13]] check or be asked to leave by the bouncers. If a character refuses to leave, the bouncers attack.

Patrons. There are twelve patrons in the bar who are noncombatants. If a fight breaks out, they flee the tavern.

Portal. A character who searches the tavern and succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 13]] check notices the portal in the south wall behind a scroll depicting a red-striped orc facing off against an army of faceless knights. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the portal's aura of conjuration magic. If the characters remain in the tavern for 10 minutes and don't notice the portal, the character who has the highest [[/skill perception passive format=long]] spots two @UUID[Actor.DHWWCrTe5ptVrsQ9]{Orc Blitzers} quietly slipping out of the portal behind the scroll to join the bouncers. The portal leads to the meeting area (area O2). The characters can sneak into it unnoticed by succeeding on a group [[/skill skill=stealth/deception 13]] check.

Shaker. A character notices the ivory shaker behind the bar with a successful [[/skill perception 15]] check. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the shaker's aura of conjuration magic. When a creature uses a bonus action to shake the item, they are teleported behind the bar in the Dohmain (area @UUID[.g86Yt6xK9Cn2RPWH]{O8}).

Meeting Area.name: Meeting Area
Meeting Area.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “A stone stairwell leads down from a swirling green portal into a wide, stately meeting room and then continues down into another level of the complex.”
  • “Two oak tables meet at the center of a red rug. Six orcs and five humans gather around the tables playing cards.”

Mercenaries. Brunsa (an @UUID[Actor.8k3hRgqIovr7UTVK]), five @UUID[Actor.DHWWCrTe5ptVrsQ9]{Orc Blitzers}, and five @UUID[Actor.s8TRjucquCTx1nLY]{Human Guards} are absorbed in their game. If they notice the characters, Brunsa questions them.

Narrow Hallway.name: Narrow Hallway
Narrow Hallway.text:
This dimly lit hallway has the following features:

  • “This narrow hall has wood-paneled walls.”
  • (Secret) A secret door on the east wall hides an orc in a narrow room behind the wall.

Secret Room. A character who has a [[/skill perception 16 passive format=long]] or who succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 16]] check notices the outline of a square door, 2 feet on all sides, at the bottom of the wall. A Medium creature must squeeze to get through the entrance.

Garroter. Yarl, an @UUID[Actor.454neOq1bNefpBOq], hides in the secret room. She only attacks the characters if they enter the secret room and the base is on alert. Otherwise, Yarl waits until the characters leave the area, then shadows the group. If her observations make her believe they are intruders, Yarl attacks the next time a fight breaks out or when the characters enter an area where they are outnumbered by mercenaries. A character who has a [[/skill perception 16 passive format=long]] notices Yarl shadowing them.

Holding Cell.name: Holding Cell
Holding Cell.text:
This area doesn't have blades wedged in the ceiling (see @UUID[.abonmVURv1nLswCf#hanging-tree-features]{Hanging Tree Features}). It has the following features:

  • “The west side of this room is a long cell with iron bars. The cell's door swings lazily on its hinges.”
  • “Along the room's east wall hang two hefty bronze keys, each over two feet long. Each key has a colored pattern on its ring: one banded green and one spotted blue.”
  • (Secret) The green-banded key is a mimic.

Cell Door. If the characters are imprisoned in the cell (see @UUID[.abonmVURv1nLswCf#ivory-throne-mercenaries]{Ivory Throne Mercenaries}), the door is closed and locked. The lock can be picked with a successful [[/skill thief 18]] check. A character who doesn't have thieves' tools can still attempt the check with a small pin or similar object but makes the check with disadvantage. The cell's bars can be bent open with a successful [[/check strength 18]] check. The cell door has AC 19, 27 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Attacking the door or bending the bars causes the mimic to attack.

Keys. The key with blue spots opens the door to the Dohmain (area @UUID[.g86Yt6xK9Cn2RPWH]{O8}). The other key is a trained @UUID[Actor.tY4fbWlrjeW1hjQl] who attacks if touched. The mimic fights until reduced to 15 hit points or fewer, then flees.

Storeroom.name: Storeroom
Storeroom.text:
The storeroom has no light sources of its own and the double doors from the hallway are locked. A character can pick the locks with a successful [[/skill thief 16]] check or force the doors open with a successful [[/check strength 16]] check. An orc rampart at the dohma's door (area @UUID[.ukGRVyiEsBbLTT0e]{O7}) holds the key to these doors. Each door has AC 17, 27 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

This area has the following features:

  • “This room is a mess. The remnants of destroyed crates, produce, and spices are smeared all over the floor, which has several shallow holes in it.”
  • “An excited, whimpering mole-like critter covered in carrot pulp hops up from one of the holes, sniffing the air.”

Mohler. A @UUID[Actor.WMmi5aPRZUg3FHDb] from the feed room (area @UUID[.IrNqS0mYCX0sLuGO]{O6}) accidentally got locked in the storeroom. They don't attack the characters. At the GM's discretion, if a character shares food and kindness with the mohler, the beast might follow them as a @UUID[Actor.L29h4z99qT6v0VaL].

Treasure. Only one crate in the storeroom remains undamaged. It contains eight @UUID[Item.PNMXTZHvrZ23AtLY]{clay bottles of tonic water} (worth 1 cp each), four @UUID[Item.bG0J85Qgu3szjhtB]{clay bottles of ginger ale} (worth 2 cp each), and two @UUID[Item.OZNQ4Tr7304tzcTM]{potions of healing}.

Feed Room.name: Feed Room
Feed Room.text:
This area doesn't have blades wedged in the ceiling (see @UUID[.abonmVURv1nLswCf#hanging-tree-features]{Hanging Tree Features}). It has the following features:

  • “Several mole-like creatures leap in and out of this room's dirt floor, chasing each other around stone feeding troughs in the center of the room.”
  • “Three orcs watch the beasts from the inner portion of the feeding trough.”
  • (Secret) The troughs are magically trapped.

Mohlers. Three @UUID[Actor.WMmi5aPRZUg3FHDb]{Mohlers} play in the dirt. If the orcs attack, the mohlers join the fray. The mohlers fight until the orcs are defeated, then retreat into the dirt.

Orcs. Nalan (an @UUID[Actor.6Qzo6gSRlgPHWUhF]) and two @UUID[Actor.nItUYQIKjxtLj7KG]{Orc Furies} watch the mohlers play, trying to determine whether one is missing. If combat breaks out here, the orcs try to bait the characters into stepping inside the trough ring to trigger the trap.

Scyza Trap. If a creature other than a mohler or an Ivory Throne mercenary moves into the circle inside the troughs, a 10-foot-diameter portal connected to the vault (area @UUID[.gcF2VFglaXZ1iDyp]{O9}) opens at the center of the troughs. This allows the @UUID[Actor.IYZ7peXyB6hI1lPP] who guards the vault to stick just his head through and attack intruders. The portal remains open until the triggering creature is dead or no longer in the feed room. As the portal closes, the scyza retracts his head unharmed.

A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the troughs' auras of conjuration magic. Each trough has a 1-inch-square symbol carved onto it that holds the trap's magic. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 14]] check finds the symbol, and a character who succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 16]] check knows the symbol controls a trap in the room. Scratching out one of the symbols with a tool or weapon as an action permanently deactivates the trap and its magic.

Dohma's Door.name: Dohma's Door
Dohma's Door.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “A stone fountain endlessly sprays water in a tall, cylindrical curtain, obscuring its center.”
  • “Two ornate ivory doors at the back wall stretch to the ceiling, flanked by lanterns twice as tall as the others in the complex.”
  • “Two alert orcs stand in front of the door like statues, intent on keeping out uninvited visitors.”
  • (Secret) An orc conduit hides in the fountain.

Orcs. Kevlic and Liway, two @UUID[Actor.PVc35FqDD1Yj4wRI]{Orc Ramparts}, let no creature near the door without the dohma's permission. They can't be convinced otherwise through mundane means. They first warn then attack creatures who insist on seeing the dohma without an appointment. The hidden @UUID[Actor.5KI1FYqfqaG7VSaN] waits for trouble to break out before striking. A character who has a [[/skill perception 16 passive format=long]] notices the hidden conduit through the sheet of falling water.

Ivory Doors. The doors to the Dohmain (area @UUID[.g86Yt6xK9Cn2RPWH]{O8}) are locked. A character can pick the locks with a successful [[/skill thief 22]] check or force the doors open with a successful [[/check strength 20]] check. Each door has AC 17, 54 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. The key to these doors hangs on the wall by the holding cell (area @UUID[.9v0UpaO1FBHqpBcs]{O4}).

Keys. One rampart holds the lock and key for the holding cell in area @UUID[.9v0UpaO1FBHqpBcs]{O4}. The other holds the key to the storeroom (area @UUID[.3wyh0dpsnPAkhy7C]{O5}).

Treasure. The fountain's water flows from a @UUID[Item.nuScMUMeo8uypvNv] affixed to its center. A creature can remove the decanter from the fountain as an action. All the mercenaries know the decanter is a prized possession of the dohma and attack any creature they notice carrying it.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Lion's Toss.name: Lion's Toss
Lion's Toss.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be moved up to 20 feet in any direction.

save.condition: follow-up to the attack

Volant.name: Volant
Volant.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the chimera can move up to their speed toward an enemy they can see.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item mP2ORzdhwAQZsI6K]] attacks. They can replace one attack with a [[/item l0wbhZgm9qYmGuXG]] attack or a use of [[/item n14ogFjG0b5mwtPO]], if available.

Dragon's Eruption.name: Dragon's Eruption
Dragon's Eruption.description: The chimera spits a volcanic explosion at a point they can see within 120 feet of them. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Roar.name: Roar
Roar.description: Each enemy who can hear the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and is within 60 feet of them must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[frightened] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). If a creature succeeds on a saving throw against this effect or if the effect ends for them, the creature is immune to the[[lookup @name lowercase]]'s [[lookup @item.name]] for the next 24 hours.

affects.special: must be able to hear the monster

Ram's Defiance.name: Ram's Defiance
Ram's Defiance.description: When a creature within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] misses them with an attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move up to half their speed in a straight line toward the creature. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ends this movement within 5 feet of the creature, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked &reference[prone].

save.condition: when a creature within 30 feet of the monster misses them with an attack

Bite (Group Attack).name: Bite (Group Attack)
Bite (Group Attack).description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 piercing damage, and if the target is not a Construct, an Elemental, or a Plant, each [[lookup @name lowercase]] who joined this attack regains all lost hit points.

Ripping Claws.name: Ripping Claws
Ripping Claws.description: Spaces within reach of one or more [[lookup @name lowercase]]s are difficult terrain for Medium or smaller enemies. When an enemy leaves the reach of one or more [[lookup @name lowercase]]s who can see them, the enemy takes 2 slashing damage.

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Relentless Hunger.name: Relentless Hunger
Relentless Hunger.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is reduced to 0 hit points by any damage other than acid or fire damage, they don't die or fall unconscious, and can continue moving and taking actions as usual. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] only dies if they end their turn with 0 hit points, if acid or fire damage reduces them to 0 hit points, or if they take acid or fire damage while they have 0 hit points.

Signature Attack (Gladius).name: Signature Attack (Gladius)
Signature Attack (Gladius).description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 plus PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 plus PB piercing damage. Beginning at 7th level, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is not a Construct, an Elemental, or a Plant, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. If this attack reduces the target to 0 hit points, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains twice as many hit points as they otherwise would with this attack.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

Sluggish.name: Sluggish
Sluggish.description: For 1 hour after sleep or another period of unconsciousness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s speed is halved and they can't use Multiattack.

Sluggish.name: Sluggish
Sluggish.description: Your speed is halved for 1 hour after sleep or other period of unconsciousness.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item AKAfu1KQGWqikzKW]] attack and two [[/item 2OfrZjyOJrJG8eNr]] attacks.

Relentless Hunger.name: Relentless Hunger
Relentless Hunger.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is reduced to 0 hit points by any damage other than acid or fire damage, they don't die or fall unconscious, and can continue moving and taking actions as usual. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] only dies if they end their turn with 0 hit points, if acid or fire damage reduces them to 0 hit points, or if they take acid or fire damage while they have 0 hit points.

Crash Through.name: Crash Through
Crash Through.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to their speed in a straight line, smashing through mundane obstacles in their path. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can enter the spaces of Large or smaller creatures during this movement, forcing those creatures to make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage and falls &reference[prone]. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone.

During this move, mundane objects that aren't worn or carried by a creature take 14 (4d6) damage when the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters their space. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves into the space of a Large or larger object and this damage doesn't destroy it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s movement stops and they are &reference[stunned] until the end of their next turn.

Spiteful Retort.name: Spiteful Retort
Spiteful Retort.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is reduced to 0 hit points and doesn't die, they can make a [[/item AKAfu1KQGWqikzKW]] attack against a creature within 5 feet of them.

utility.condition: When the monster is reduced to 0 hit points.

Corrosive Claw.name: Corrosive Claw
Corrosive Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. (10 ft. with Grow), one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage, or 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage while under the effect of Grow. If the target is wearing mundane metal armor, they must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity throw or their armor takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. If the armor is reduced to an AC of 10, it is destroyed.

Feline Resilience.name: Feline Resilience
Feline Resilience.description: When Shtriga Nonna fails a saving throw, she can immediately turn into a cat of her size (Medium in her normal form, Large while under the effect of Grow) and succeed instead. While in cat form, Shtriga Nonna retains her game statistics and ability to speak, except she can't cast spells or use Soul Steal. She reverts to her previous form at the end of her next turn.

Supernatural Resistance.name: Supernatural Resistance
Supernatural Resistance.description: Shtriga Nonna has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Shtriga Nonna makes two [[/item 9zj9L4E2SA57BKcB]] attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of [[/item svyqPvz6puV2WPfM]], if available.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
Shtriga Nonna has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

[[/item pnD06MzJPqw4Ce6a]]

[[/item 3LNO1sPZ0J4omR2P]]

[[/item aapZxkSYrJXBSSQY]]

Soul Steal.name: Soul Steal
Soul Steal.description: Shtriga Nonna inhales deeply in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Shtriga Nonna regains 10 hit points for each creature who fails this saving throw.

Grow.name: Grow
Grow.description: For 1 minute, Shtriga Nonna magically increases in size, along with anything she is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, she is Large, her reach becomes 10 feet, she deals an extra 3 (1d6) damage on Strength-based weapon attacks, and she makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Shtriga Nonna lacks the room to become Large, she attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

Grow.name: Grow
Grow.description: You are Large, your reach is 10 feet, your Strength-based attacks deal an additional 1d6 damage, and you make Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage.

Gobble You Up.name: Gobble You Up
Gobble You Up.description: Shtriga Nonna feeds on the body of an unconscious creature within 5 feet of her. The target takes 10 (3d6) piercing damage, and Shtriga Nonna recharges her Soul Steal action.

Turned Upside Down.name: Turned Upside Down
Turned Upside Down.description: When a creature hits Shtriga Nonna with a melee attack, she magically reverses gravity around her. Each creature within 5 feet of her must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or rise vertically 10 feet into the air. A creature levitating in this way remains suspended until the end of their next turn, then falls unless they have an ability that keeps them aloft.

save.condition: When a creature hits Shtriga Nonna with a melee attack.

Utility Spells.name: Utility Spells
Utility Spells.description:
In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Shtriga Nonna can cast the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

At will: alter self, detect thoughts, thaumaturgy

3/day each: fabricate, legend lore

1/day: scrying

Snackies and Sweeties.name: Snackies and Sweeties
Snackies and Sweeties.description: The air within 30 feet of Shtriga Nonna magically fills with the scent of rotten food. Each other creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

Feline Felicity.name: Feline Felicity
Feline Felicity.description: Shtriga Nonna grows four cat legs in a burst of magical energy. Each creature within 5 feet of her must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10 (4d4) force damage and is pushed 10 feet away from her. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. Shtriga Nonna can then move up to twice her speed, after which the extra cat legs disappear.

Open The Oven.name: Open The Oven
Open The Oven.description: Shtriga Nonna opens a portal to her massive oven in the palms of her hands, creating a blast of heat and noise in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) fire damage plus 13 (3d8) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Lair Actions: Shtriga Nonna.name: Lair Actions: Shtriga Nonna
Lair Actions: Shtriga Nonna.description:
When fighting inside her lair, Shtriga Nonna can take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), she can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects; Shtriga Nonna can't use the same lair action two rounds in a row:

Fatten You Up. Shtriga Nonna chooses a point on the ground she can see within 60 feet of her. A 20-foot-square feast of pasta, gingerbread, and roast goose centered on that point appears on the ground until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round. Each creature in that area when the feast appears must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[dazed] by the bounty for the duration. The feast is difficult terrain for all creatures except Shtriga Nonna.

Kitties of Despair. Illusory cats hiss at three enemies Shtriga Nonna can see within 60 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or their speed is halved and they can't regain hit points until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

Sugar and Spice. Magical herbs and spices rain down in a 20-foot-radius sphere at a point Shtriga Nonna can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on Constitution and Wisdom saving throws until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

Kitties of Despair.name: Kitties of Despair
Kitties of Despair.description: Your speed is halved and you cannot regain hit points until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

Sugar and Spice.name: Sugar and Spice
Sugar and Spice.description: You have disadvantage on Constitution and Wisdom saving throws until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

Signature Attack (Halberd).name: Signature Attack (Halberd)
Signature Attack (Halberd).description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 plus PB to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1d10 plus PB slashing damage. Beginning at 7th level, the mercenary can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, plus an extra 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the target is grappled or restrained.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage, plus an extra 2 (1d4) slashing damage if the wildcat had advantage on the attack roll.

Agile Landing.name: Agile Landing
Agile Landing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes no damage from falling 40 feet or less, provided they aren't incapacitated.

Hunter's Pounce.name: Hunter's Pounce
Hunter's Pounce.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits a Small or smaller target and had advantage on the attack roll, the target is &reference[grappled] (escape DC 12). While grappling the target in this way, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't attack another creature.

Natural Camouflage.name: Natural Camouflage
Natural Camouflage.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in their native terrain.

Natural Camouflage.name: Natural Camouflage
Natural Camouflage.description: The monster has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in their native terrain.

Sprint.name: Sprint
Sprint.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves on their turn in combat, they can triple their speed until the end of their turn.

Creature Size.name: Creature Size
Creature Size.description: A Little Wildcat can be Tiny or Small. Enable this effect to easily adjust the size.

Backpack.name: Backpack
Backpack.description: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Cozy Meals.name: Cozy Meals
Cozy Meals.description: A cookbook filled with common local recipes.

Traveler's Clothes.name: Traveler's Clothes
Traveler's Clothes.description: A set of clothes worn by travellers.

Green Dragon Breastplate.name: Green Dragon Breastplate
Green Dragon Breastplate.description:
This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

This breastplate has the image of a green scaled dragon inscribed onto it.

Quiver.name: Quiver
Quiver.description: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

Shtriga Nonna's Pot of Plenty.name: Shtriga Nonna's Pot of Plenty
Shtriga Nonna's Pot of Plenty.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

This black iron pot weighs only 2 pounds. As an action, you can speak one of the following command phrases to activate its effect:

Boil, Boil, Until You Spoil. The cauldron fills with a hearty stew. It creates enough stew to feed fifteen Humanoids. The food is tasty and seasoned well, and spoils if uneaten after 24 hours.

Bubble, Bubble, Toil and Trouble. The cauldron fills with stew, as if you said “Boil, boil, until you spoil,” but the stew is poisoned. A creature who consumes the stew must succeed on a [[/save constitution 16]] saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] for 24 hours.

Once the pot has been used in either of these ways, the pot can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sparkling Green & Purple Stone.name: Sparkling Green & Purple Stone
Sparkling Green & Purple Stone.description: A sparkling purple and green stone that bards, sorcerers, warlocks, and wizards can use as a spellcasting focus.

Potion of Greater Healing.name: Potion of Greater Healing
Potion of Greater Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 4d4+4 hit points when you drink this potion.

Broom of Flying.name: Broom of Flying
Broom of Flying.description:
Wondrous item

This wooden broom, which weighs 3 pounds, functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and speak its command word. It then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air. It has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to 400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land.

You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you if you speak the command word, name the location, and are familiar with that place. The broom comes back to you when you speak another command word, provided that the broom is still within 1 mile of you.

utility.condition: Command word.

Delicate Platinum Bracelet.name: Delicate Platinum Bracelet
Delicate Platinum Bracelet.description: A delicate platinum bracelet set with three diamonds.

Crowbar.name: Crowbar
Crowbar.description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

Longbow.name: Longbow
Longbow.description: A thick shaft of laminated wood is bowed by a taut string capable of launching deadly arrows at long distances.

Treasure Rat.name: Treasure Rat
Treasure Rat.description: When you open the door to this white-furred, red-eyed rat’s cage, they point their nose in the direction of the nearest magic item, if any, within 30 feet of them that isn’t being worn or carried by another creature. They continue pointing their nose at that item for 1 minute or until you shut the cage door. After pointing at a magic item, the rat refuses to do so again until they consume a piece of cheese worth at least 10 gp.

Hammer.name: Hammer
Hammer.description: A tool with a heavy metal head mounted at the end of its handle, used for jobs such as breaking things and driving in nails.

Jeweler's Tools.name: Jeweler's Tools
Jeweler's Tools.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in jewelry.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Green Dragon Shield.name: Green Dragon Shield
Green Dragon Shield.description:
A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

This shield has the image of a green scaled dragon inscribed onto it.

Arrow.name: Arrow
Arrow.description: Standard ammunition used for bows of all varieties. These mundane arrows are made of smooth wooden shafts with goose feather fletching and hammer metal bodkins.

Dust of Disappearance.name: Dust of Disappearance
Dust of Disappearance.description:
Wondrous item

Found in a small packet, this powder resembles very fine sand. There is enough of it for one use.

When you use an action to throw the dust into the air, you and each creature and object within 10 feet of you become invisible for 2d4 minutes. The duration is the same for all subjects, and the dust is consumed when its magic takes effect.

If a creature affected by the dust attacks or casts a spell, the invisibility ends for that creature.

Rations.name: Rations
Rations.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Potion of Healing.name: Potion of Healing
Potion of Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 2d4+2 hit points when you drink this potion.

Oil of Slipperiness.name: Oil of Slipperiness
Oil of Slipperiness.description:
This sticky black unguent is thick and heavy in the container, but it flows quickly when poured.

The oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.da0a1t2FqaTjRZGT]{Freedom of Movement} spell for 8 hours.

Alternatively, the oil can be poured on the ground as an action, where it covers a 10‑foot square, duplicating the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.etgcR9wqmrhyZ0tx]{Grease} spell in that area for 8 hours.

Piton.name: Piton
Piton.description: A metal spike that is drive into a seam in a climbing surface with a climbing hammer. It can also be used like iron spikes to block doors in a pinch.

Spell Scroll: Remove Curse.name: Spell Scroll: Remove Curse
Spell Scroll: Remove Curse.description:
3rd Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Shtriga Nonna's Hut.name: Shtriga Nonna's Hut
Shtriga Nonna's Hut.text:
Optimized for Five 4th-Level Characters

Content Warning: Pet Violence and Cannibalism

If your group won't have fun attacking Shtriga Nonna while she's in feline form, you can change the descriptions of Feline Resilience and Feline Felicity to make her a four-legged demon instead of a cat. If you don't want cannibalism in your games, Shtriga Nonna could capture humanoids and force them to make bad deals for their freedom instead of killing and eating her victims.

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00003 inline]

Hut Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Cat Maiden. The characters encounter Radlena, a tabby cat who transforms into a halfling woman every full moon. Radlena is a victim of one of Shtriga Nonna's powerful hexes, and only the hag's death can reverse the curse.

Promise of Vengeance. A @UUID[Actor.lPZ13jTTNwfSr1eq] named Diedre confides in the party that as children, she and her friend Valyr were kidnapped by Shtriga Nonna, but only Diedre managed to escape. Racked with guilt over abandoning her friend, Diedre asks the characters to join her in taking revenge on the hag, offering that the characters can keep any treasure in the lair.

Sweet Scent. A delicious, sweet scent has been wafting across the mountains, driving the local fauna into a frenzy and making them attack travelers. A tiefling ranger named Zerphe has tracked the scent to Shtriga Nonna's wandering hut, but he is too scared to enter. He offers the characters 1,250 gp to investigate it.

Hut Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of Shtriga Nonna's hut has the following features:

Cursed Food. A detect magic spell reveals that the food and cooking ingredients in the lair radiate auras of necromancy. If a creature who doesn't live in the hut eats any of the food found within, they must succeed on a [[/save wisdom 15]] saving throw or be cursed. While cursed in this way, a creature has disadvantage on saving throws. A cure ailment power or a remove curse or greater restoration spell can remove the curse.

Doors. The doors in Shtriga Nonna's hut are made of rough-hewn wood. Each door has AC 15, 27 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. If a door is locked, it can be unlocked with a successful [[/skill thief 15]] check, or forced open with a successful [[/check strength 16]] check. Shtriga Nonna (see area H8) has the key to all the doors in the hut.

Fireplaces. A creature who touches a lit fireplace for the first time on a turn or starts their turn touching it takes [[/damage 2d4 fire average]] damage.

High Ceilings. Rough-hewn wooden beams cross overhead at a height of 20 feet, but the ceiling's peak is 30 feet high.

Illumination. Fireplaces and low-burning lamps fill each room with dim light to the rafters. The areas above the rafters are dark.

If a player or other creature that does not live in this hut eats any of the food and fails a saving throw, as per “Cursed Food” above, you can use the @UUID[Macro.Roawzmfd8EQms8Mz]{Cursed Food} macro to apply the curse to any tokens you have selected.

Chimera, Trolls, and Cats

Shtriga Nonna's hut is also home to her servants and pets. A young chimera, a troll, and the troll's whelps serve as her guardians in return for the hag's special meals. These creatures attack intruders and fight to the death.

Spectral Cats. Shtriga Nonna's spectral cats are Tiny noncombatant Constructs with climbing and walking speeds of 30 feet. Each wears a collar with a name tag. Though the cats and their collars look solid, they are incorporeal — they can walk through walls and furniture, they can't be harmed, and they can communicate telepathically with Shtriga Nonna if they can see her. Unless attacked, they observe the characters. Once the characters attack the cats or move to a different area, a cat heads to Shtriga Nonna to report the intruders' actions.

Defeated Characters. If the characters are defeated in combat while in the hut, Shtriga Nonna retrieves and stabilizes any survivors, puts them in cages in the kitchen (area H8), and tosses their gear in the kitchen's debris pile.

Trolls do make the most delightful lackeys. My beauties require so little maintenance. Their wounds get better without any care from me, and the trollies work for food! Oh, they're not fussy when it comes to payment — as long as it's meat, dearies. If you're really clever, you can carve off a piece of one troll to feed another and save the rarer meats for yourself.

— Shtriga Nonna

Resting in the Hut

The characters can take a short rest in any area without incident, provided they deal with any enemies in the area. If the characters try to take a long rest, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>50]]{50 percent chance} ten @UUID[Actor.79okH7SIZfkc3Liq]{Troll Whelps} find them halfway through their rest.

Entering the Hut

While stationary, entering Shtriga Nonna's hut is as simple as climbing the front steps. If the characters chase the hut while it is moving, the hut has a walking speed of 30 feet, and climbing onto the porch requires a successful [[/skill skill=athletics/acrobatics 12]] check.

Kitchen.name: Kitchen
Kitchen.text:
Shtriga Nonna's kitchen has the following features:

  • “Two 15-foot-tall stone ovens dominate the northeast and northwest corners of the room, radiating heat in shimmering waves.”
  • “Three iron cages are clustered in the southeast corner of the room. A kobold huddles on the floor of the middle cage.”
  • “Tall shelves stand against the walls, filled with jars and bottles.”
  • “An oversized cauldron sits above a fire in the center of the room, bubbling and steaming.”
  • “An old woman stirs the large pot, her face wrinkled like a prune and her thin hair pulled into a wispy bun atop her head.”

Shtriga Nonna. If @UUID[Actor.cFAqqlAH6dBBXIce] heard the characters coming along the hallway (area @UUID[.YvpAROpmemTvFWdM]{H7}) or one of her spectral cats warned her about them, she turns to greet the characters as they enter. Otherwise, she is absorbed in preparing her stew and doesn't notice the characters right away, giving them a chance to surprise her.

If the characters don't attack the hag right away, she smiles when she notices them and offers them a deal: each time they bring her a live Humanoid to eat, she'll give them a gift from her hoard (see @UUID[.jgTnwkFfTdfiw3F5]{Shtriga Nonna's Hoard}). At your discretion, Shtriga Nonna could offer another deal, tempting the characters to bring her food in exchange for something very important to them. If the characters refuse, she attacks, intent on making them her next meal.

Shtriga Nonna fights to the death without seeking reinforcements, confident her power far surpasses the characters' might.

Cages. Each iron cage is 10 feet tall and has AC 19, 27 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. The cages are locked and can be unlocked with a successful [[/skill thief 16]] check, or forced open with a successful [[/check strength 20]] check. Shtriga Nonna holds the key to each cage.

Kira. One cage holds Kira, a @UUID[Actor.QNaPfj3W9WUhLpUV]. Her equipment is in the troll room (area @UUID[.SwgLf8PxPO2JuO0Y]{H4}). If the characters free Kira and either return her equipment to her or succeed on a [[/skill skill=intimidation/persuasion 15]] check, she battles Shtriga Nonna with them. Otherwise, if the characters release the kobold, she flees the hut.

Cauldron. The Medium cauldron bubbles with onions, herbs, and spices as Shtriga Nonna prepares to cook Kira in a stew. A creature who touches the cauldron or fire for the first time on a turn, or who starts their turn touching it, takes [[/damage 1d4 fire average]] damage.

Ovens. Each oven has a 5-foot-square opening. A creature who touches or enters an oven for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there takes [[/damage 2d6 fire average]] damage.

Shelves. These shelves are filled with spices and ingredients for Shtriga Nonna's meals (see “Cursed Food” in the @UUID[.JOmWnCzLxPpkT6rf#hut-features]{Hut Features} section).

Treasure. Shtriga Nonna carries a ring of keys. The keys unlock the cages and doors in the hut.

Honestly, it is a lot of work. Their hide is tough, they have so little marbling, and there's not a lot of meat at all once you get all those scales off. But if you prepare enough of them then make a stew and let it simmer for hours, you'll kick yourself for having not tried kobold sooner, my loves.

— Shtriga Nonna

Lair Actions

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.P5FNkNw7tl73jtqW inline]

Bedroom.name: Bedroom
Bedroom.text:
The door from the kitchen (area H8) is locked (see @UUID[.JOmWnCzLxPpkT6rf#hut-features]{Hut Features}). Shtriga Nonna's bedroom is in darkness. It has the following features:

  • “A mixture of mildew, grease, and rot permeates the air of this filthy, cluttered room with garbage all over the floor.”
  • “Rolling on her back, a fluffy white cat lounges on an unmade bed in the corner of the room.”
  • “An empty iron cage stands across from the bed.”

Bed. The bed holds a plush, comfortable mattress, a feather pillow, and thick, luxurious blankets, though all the bedding is stained with grease and bits of food, as if Shtriga Nonna eats meals here with little care for the mess.

Spectral Cat. Thumbscrews the cat rests on the bed and hisses at any creature who comes into the room. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=animalhandling/insight 12]] check can tell Thumbscrews just wants to be left alone. If a character tries to touch Thumbscrews or the bed, she yowls and later reports them to Shtriga Nonna. If they leave Thumbscrews alone, she doesn't report their movements to Shtriga Nonna.

Cage. This empty iron cage stands 10 feet tall and is unlocked. Shtriga Nonna (see area @UUID[.as0HcYKyXtRwqzEG]{H8}) holds the key to it.

Treasure Room.name: Treasure Room
Treasure Room.text:
The treasure room — formerly a guest room — has the following features:

  • “Piles of stinking garbage and an old straw mattress litter the floor of this room.”
  • “Amid the trash, something glints. Many somethings! There is treasure here.”

Treasure. The objects on the floor are Shtriga Nonna's hoard. See @UUID[.jgTnwkFfTdfiw3F5]{Shtriga Nonna's Hoard} for more information.

Shtriga Nonna's Hoard.name: Shtriga Nonna's Hoard
Shtriga Nonna's Hoard.text:
Shtriga Nonna's hoard is piled in the corner of an old guest room (area @UUID[.VmrP1oRLO5ylwGWj]{H10}). The hoard contains items taken from her victims that she thought looked particularly interesting, along with a few of her personal belongings. Additionally, the front room (area @UUID[.U5xQyBRhqagwp7Dw]{H2}) contains @UUID[Item.ADNO620SmbGWcQUo] (see below).

The hoard contains the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.ObraFDHXDKj4yyHv]
  • @UUID[Item.pDLpI5hu56U2iwRR]
  • @UUID[Item.Ge3PWMS6wpKDz9R4]
  • @UUID[Item.TazxwZlRzKWpQNWH] in a wire cage (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.2W8F29t1HDblBbvS]{Backpack} containing a set of traveler's clothes, a crowbar, a hammer, 7 pitons, a bedroll, 3 days' rations, and a set of jeweler's tools
  • @UUID[Item.TAlZqvWePa67iyMh]{Longbow}
  • @UUID[Item.7Kq2NsBn3oem8sDw]{Quiver with 40 arrows}
  • @UUID[Item.DZju2Eb2x1VPxj21]{Sparkling purple and green stone} that bards, sorcerers, warlocks, and wizards can use as a spellcasting focus (worth 10 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.ww9nweOfoIlj0x2o]{3 minuscule sapphires} (worth 25 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.DvFZV72qf9OsyfSK]{3 minuscule emeralds} (worth 30 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.HpadCNiYmL9FcCbA]{3 minuscule diamonds} (worth 50 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.pzubUqGtcbG81uQn]{3 gold bars} (worth 75 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.SN4uPp6cIBLVJ0qW]{Delicate platinum bracelet set with three diamonds} (worth 400 gp)

Shtriga Nonna's Hut Areas.name: Shtriga Nonna's Hut Areas
Shtriga Nonna's Hut Areas.text:
The following areas are keyed to the Shtriga Nonna's Hut Map.

@UUID[.sI9UC1073qcDWaec]{H1. Front Porch}

@UUID[.U5xQyBRhqagwp7Dw]{H2. Front Room}

@UUID[.PYSNCjdlxex9Oa77]{H3. Dining Room}

@UUID[.SwgLf8PxPO2JuO0Y]{H4. Troll Room}

@UUID[.0ETAzwA4NjDEqG3y]{H5. Pantry}

@UUID[.8qBekn8h9375m0NS]{H6. Sitting Room}

Front Porch.name: Front Porch
Front Porch.text:
The porch has a 10-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “This wide porch wraps around the front and sides of the hut.”
  • “A table with six chairs sits at one corner of the porch, and three wooden rocking chairs sit along the hut wall.”
  • “Four square windows dot the hut walls. A wooden door with charming scrollwork stands directly across from the front steps.”
  • “A sign on the door carved with flowery script and images of kittens reads, ‘Be kind to the cats, or they'll fetch Mommy!’”

Bigger on the Inside. Before the characters enter the hut, it magically appears as a small one-room cottage with a large porch. On the map, areas @UUID[.sI9UC1073qcDWaec]{H1} and @UUID[.U5xQyBRhqagwp7Dw]{H2} — the only areas visible from outside the hut — are surrounded by a red box. Once a character enters the front room (area @UUID[.U5xQyBRhqagwp7Dw]{H2}) and finds the hidden doors, they realize the hut is far bigger inside.

Windows. The 3-foot-square windows (AC 11, 4 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage) are made of thick, wavy glass that distorts images seen through it, imposing disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see into the front room (area @UUID[.U5xQyBRhqagwp7Dw]{H2}). The windows don't open.

Front Room.name: Front Room
Front Room.text:
The door from the front porch (area @UUID[.sI9UC1073qcDWaec]{H1}) is locked (see @UUID[.JOmWnCzLxPpkT6rf#hut-features]{Hut Features}). The front room has the following features:

  • “The cozy, warm room smells of hearty stew, fresh-baked bread, and woodsmoke.”
  • “Above a crackling fireplace, a pot of stew bubbles and a long ladle rests in it.”
  • “The room is furnished with a table, some chairs, a tidy bed with a straw mattress, and a shelf holding a cookbook and a few jars.”
  • (Secret) A spectral cat hides beneath the bed.
  • (Secret) Two doors flank the fireplace on the north wall, hidden by illusions.

Stew Pot. The pot over the fire is filled with a meat stew (see “Cursed Food” in the @UUID[.JOmWnCzLxPpkT6rf#hut-features]{Hut Features} section). A character who examines the stew and succeeds on a [[/skill medicine 15]] check identifies pieces of Humanoids in the stew.

Bookshelf. The bookshelf holds several jars of spices (see “Cursed Food” in the @UUID[.JOmWnCzLxPpkT6rf#hut-features]{Hut Features} section) and a cookbook filled with common local recipes titled @UUID[Item.3XxigTEH7TLmJmq8]{Cozy Meals}.

Spectral Cat. A character who looks under the bed or succeeds on a [[/skill perception 16]] check notices the spectral cat Briar Tom, a long-haired tabby with piercing green eyes. Briar Tom doesn't respond to any attempt to coax him from under the bed, but if a character calls him sweet names or tries to pet him, the cat doesn't report the intruders to Shtriga Nonna.

Hidden Doors. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 13]] check finds the doors despite the illusion. If either door is opened, the illusion hiding both doors ends.

If the characters fail to see through the illusion, eight @UUID[Actor.79okH7SIZfkc3Liq]{Troll Whelps} enter from the dining room (area @UUID[.PYSNCjdlxex9Oa77]{H3}) 5 minutes after the characters enter this room. The trolls are hungry for stew but won't turn down an adventurer appetizer.

Treasure. The pot over the fire is @UUID[Item.ADNO620SmbGWcQUo].

Dining Room.name: Dining Room
Dining Room.text:
The dining room is in darkness. It has the following features:

  • “Bones, dirty dishes, and filthy utensils cover the floor and table of this filthy dining room.”
  • “A cold, ash-filled fireplace stands in the room's southeast corner.”

Bones. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=nature/medicine 12]] check recognizes the bones are from Humanoids.

Troll Room.name: Troll Room
Troll Room.text:
This room is in darkness. It has the following features:

  • “Logs sit unlit in two large, cold fireplaces.”
  • “Piles of smelly, bloodstained clothing dot the room.”
  • “At the south end of the room, snoring echoes from a 15-foot-tall tent made of tattered fabric that stretches nearly wall to wall.”
  • (Secret) A troll and his troll whelps sleep in the tent.

Trolls. Gorfus (a @UUID[Actor.SgGzCqMIf8pRpRhm]) and four @UUID[Actor.79okH7SIZfkc3Liq]{Troll Whelps} are asleep in the tent when the characters enter the room. Characters trying to search or sneak across the room must succeed on a group [[/skill stealth 13]] check or wake the trolls. If a character opens the tent to look inside, they must succeed on a [[/skill stealth 17]] check or wake the trolls.

Fireplaces. Shtriga Nonna keeps the fireplaces stocked with wood to intimidate the trolls in this room, but she only lights them if they disobey her. A creature with flint and steel, a lit candle, a spell that deals fire damage, or another way to create fire can use an action to light a fireplace. While the fire is burning, a creature can reach into the fireplace and grab a log to use as a torch (no action required).

Treasure. A character who spends 1 minute searching through the clothing piles finds [[/award 30cp 17sp 8gp]], and a @UUID[Item.W6A28ehFrMIbPms3]{shield}, @UUID[Item.6OB5DjCCnduRTYgw]{breastplate}, and gladius each sized for a Small Humanoid and bearing the image of a green-scaled dragon. The equipment belongs to Kira, the kobold prisoner in the kitchen (area @UUID[.as0HcYKyXtRwqzEG]{H8}).

Pantry.name: Pantry
Pantry.text:
The pantry has the following features:

  • “This cramped pantry smells of mildew and spices.”
  • “Tall shelves hold jars, bottles, and boxes that spill spices and ingredients onto the floor.”
  • “A fluffy gray cat sleeps atop the shelf on the south wall.”
  • (Secret) A door to Shtriga Nonna's bedroom (area @UUID[.gIrKMwMfovodYgVn]{H9}) is hidden behind a shelf.

Shelves. The shelves hold spices, herbs, wines, and salts for cooking (see “Cursed Food” in the @UUID[.JOmWnCzLxPpkT6rf#hut-features]{Hut Features} section).

Spectral Cat. Rotten Peaches, the cat atop the shelf, is asleep. Characters who move through the area or search the shelves must succeed on a group [[/skill stealth 14]] check or wake her.

Hidden Door. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 20]] check notices scratch marks on the floor where the bookshelf hiding the secret door has been moved before. Moving the shelf reveals the door, but also wakes Rotten Peaches.

Treasure. A character who takes 10 minutes to search the shelves finds a @UUID[Item.l1aTKeUPQNGjdrwj].

Sitting Room.name: Sitting Room
Sitting Room.text:
The sitting room has the following features:

  • “The smell of woodsmoke and animal musk fills this room, and books on cluttered shelves spill out onto the floor.”
  • “Three fireplaces burn low. In front of the largest, an enormous overstuffed chair holds a black cat looking at the fire and mewling.”
  • “Debris in one corner of the room forms a wide, flat pile.”
  • (Secret) Tearmonger, a young chimera, lurks in the rafters.

Books. A creature who looks through the books discovers several journals, each by different people. In addition to personal details about each author's life, most feature entries toward the end about Nonna, a kind woman who promised to make their problems go away over a homecooked meal.

Spectral Cat. The spectral cat, Putrid Paul, mewls at the fireplace because he has batted the tibia bone he was playing with into the flames. A character who looks at the fireplace and succeeds on a [[/skill perception 14]] check notices the bone, and a character who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=nature/medicine 12]] check can tell it belonged to a human. If Putrid Paul is given this bone or any other, he stops mewling and doesn't report the characters to Shtriga Nonna.

Debris Pile. The debris pile is Tearmonger's nest, made from the discarded belongings of Shtriga Nonna's victims. A character who looks through the nest finds gold-and-white fur and a few red scales. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill nature 14]] check knows the fur and scales belong to a chimera.

Tearmonger. Tearmonger, a @UUID[Actor.6HtATYkqspitQXKu], hides in the rafters above the characters. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill perception 14]] check notices Tearmonger, prompting her to attack. Otherwise, the chimera watches until a character looks through the books, investigates her nest, or opens the door to another area before attacking, and the characters are &reference[surprise]{Surprised} during the first round of combat. Tearmonger starts combat by using Roar or Dragon's Eruption to attack from range before moving in for the kill.

Treasure. A creature who spends 10 minutes searching the room discovers a spell scroll of @UUID[Item.rer1dtvWIM5BZmUA]{Remove Curse} among the books and a tiny paper packet filled with @UUID[Item.juLD1unjIfDG6CQf] wedged between the chair's cushions.

Hallway.name: Hallway
Hallway.text:
The hallway has a 10-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “A long hall extends before you, its floor made of rotting boards. Skulls, loose sheets of paper, filthy rags, and other garbage are strewed over the floor.”
  • “Despite the trash, the savory scent of meat hangs in the air. Something is cooking nearby.”
  • (Secret) The ceiling in this room can rain seasonings onto intruders.

Creaky Floorboards. The hallway has creaky wooden floorboards, which the characters notice immediately after stepping onto them. Characters who want to avoid notice while approaching the kitchen (area @UUID[.as0HcYKyXtRwqzEG]{H8}) must succeed on a group [[/skill stealth 13]] check or alert Shtriga Nonna to their presence.

Seasoned Snow. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill perception 14]] check notices the numerous grains of salt and pepper among the trash. A detect magic spell reveals that the ceiling radiates an aura of conjuration magic.

When a creature who doesn't live in the hut reaches a bend in the hall, the ceiling begins to snow salt and pepper, seasoning intruders for Shtriga Nonna. The hall snows seasonings for 1 minute, then can't snow seasoning for another 24 hours. For the duration, a creature who starts their turn in the hall or enters it for the first time on a turn must make a [[/save constitution 12]] saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is &reference[blinded] for 1 minute, and if the creature doesn't have all their hit points, they take [[/damage 1d4 acid average]] damage. A creature can use an action to wash a blinded creature's eyes with water, ending the effect.

Nine Lives.name: Nine Lives
Nine Lives.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

Whip.name: Whip
Whip.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet toward Baron Uthrak.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Bloodstones.name: Bloodstones
Bloodstones.description: When [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw while holding his magic longsword Nine Lives, he can choose to succeed instead. If he does so, he takes 7 (2d6) necrotic damage as one of the bloodstones set in the sword's pommel fills with his blood.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When [[lookup @name]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes two attacks using [[/item XznYvRtOo5KgaD4Y]], [[/item X2Q9qVCrPX7ArLPS]], or both.

Kneel, Peasant!.name: Kneel, Peasant!
Kneel, Peasant!.description: [[lookup @name]] kicks a Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or take 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked &reference[prone].

Riposte.name: Riposte
Riposte.description: When a creature [[lookup @name]] can see misses him with a melee attack, [[lookup @name]] makes a melee attack against that creature.

utility.condition: When missed by a melee attack.

Shoot!.name: Shoot!
Shoot!.description: Each ally within 60 feet of [[lookup @name]] who can hear him can make a ranged weapon attack (no action required).

Form Up!.name: Form Up!
Form Up!.description: [[lookup @name]] and each ally within 60 feet of him who can hear him can move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. [[lookup @name]] and each ally enters a defensive stance that lasts until that creature moves or is restrained or incapacitated. When two or more allies in a defensive stance are within 5 feet of each other, attack rolls against them are made with disadvantage.

Defensive Stance.name: Defensive Stance
Defensive Stance.description: You have entered a defensive stance until you move or are restrained or incapacitated. When two or more allies in a defensive stance are within 5 feet of each other, attack rolls against them are made with disadvantage.

Lead from the Front.name: Lead from the Front
Lead from the Front.description: [[lookup @name]] moves up to twice his speed without provoking opportunity attacks. During or after this movement, he can make up to four Nine Lives or Whip attacks with advantage, each against a different target. After he attacks a target in this way, each ally within 5 feet of that target can make a melee attack with advantage against the same target (no action required).

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
Baron Uthrak has three villain actions. He can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. He can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.
