[[/item mg4ZPDUNb0Str5ql]]

[[/item vI1XxeJi2cwjWvus]]

Half Plate Armor.name: Half Plate Armor
Half Plate Armor.description: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

Heavy Crossbow.name: Heavy Crossbow
Heavy Crossbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

Bayonet.name: Bayonet
Bayonet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Point Blank Shooting.name: Point Blank Shooting
Point Blank Shooting.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits a creature within 30 feet of them with a ranged weapon attack, they deal an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage. Additionally, being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose disadvantage on the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s ranged attack rolls.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Ricochet Bolt.name: Ricochet Bolt
Ricochet Bolt.description: The trickshot uses a special ricocheting bolt to make one [[/item U2wpLj3SjWK0Zqda]] attack against a target within 100 feet of them, then a second Heavy Crossbow attack against a different target within 30 feet of the first target.

Signature Attack (Halberd).name: Signature Attack (Halberd)
Signature Attack (Halberd).description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 plus PB to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1d10 plus PB slashing damage. Beginning at 7th level, the mercenary can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The apprentice can breathe air and water.

Signature Attack (Zap).name: Signature Attack (Zap)
Signature Attack (Zap).description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +3 plus PB to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) lightning damage. This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when the apprentice reaches 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Handaxe.name: Handaxe
Handaxe.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

Charge.name: Charge
Charge.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits the target with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) damage.

Padded Armor.name: Padded Armor
Padded Armor.description: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting. Padded armor offers a comparable level of protection as stiffened leather but is somewhat less encumbering to the wearer.

Splinter Shield.name: Splinter Shield
Splinter Shield.description:
When the raider is wielding a shield and is hit by an attack made by a creature they can see, the raider gains a +4 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this causes the attack to miss, the raider's shield breaks, and until they get a new shield, their AC is reduced by 2 and they can't use this reaction or make a Shield Shove attack.

Foundry Note

To reduce the raider's AC, unequip the @UUID[.c1Af1iRhoahkHooP]{shield}.

utility.condition: When wielding a shield and hit by an attack.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Shield Shove.name: Shield Shove
Shield Shove.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away from the raider.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Death Chant.name: Death Chant
Death Chant.description: When an enemy succeeds on a death saving throw while within 30 feet of three or more [[lookup @name lowercase]] who aren't incapacitated, the success instead counts as a failure, and if the roll was a 20, the enemy doesn't regain hit points.

Exploit Weakness.name: Exploit Weakness
Exploit Weakness.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes or joins an attack that's made with advantage, the attack deals an extra 1 damage per [[lookup @name lowercase]] who made or joined the attack.

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Transfer Life (Group Attack).name: Transfer Life (Group Attack)
Transfer Life (Group Attack).description:
Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 necrotic damage, and if this attack was made by more than one [[lookup @name lowercase]], a creature of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]s' choice within 30 feet of them regains 1 hit point per [[lookup @name lowercase]] who joined this group attack.

Foundry Note

You can use the Heal activity to decide how many hit points to restore to a target.

heal.condition: If the attack was made by more than one minion.

Necrotic Bolt (Group Attack).name: Necrotic Bolt (Group Attack)
Necrotic Bolt (Group Attack).description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 2 necrotic damage.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Grab.name: Grab
Grab.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is &reference[grappled] (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't grab another creature.

Haymaker.name: Haymaker
Haymaker.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 10 (3d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage against a grappled target.

Foundry Note

If the target is grappled, you can add the additional 2d4 damage in the Situational Bonus field when performing the damage roll.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks using [[/item eQwJSguixvR0AsCR]], [[/item qNNRwnuZrp6RuMQG]], or both.

Throw.name: Throw
Throw.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] throws one Medium or smaller creature they are grappling or object they are holding up to 30 feet horizontally. If the thrown target is a creature, they fall &reference[prone] after this throw. If the thrown target would enter the space of a creature or solid object that is no more than one size smaller than it, the thrown target collides with it and stops in the nearest unoccupied space, taking 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. A Large or smaller creature hit by this thrown target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take the same amount of damage and fall prone.

Collision Save.name: Collision Save
Collision Save.condition: A creature that is hit by the thrown creature.

Meat Shield.name: Meat Shield
Meat Shield.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is grappling a target and is hit by a ranged attack made by another creature the brawler can see, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains a +2 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this bonus causes the attack to miss the [[lookup @name lowercase]], it hits the grappled target instead.

utility.condition: When grappling a target and hit by a ranged attack.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Empower Patron.name: Empower Patron
Empower Patron.description: A non-minion creature serves as the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s patron in exchange for the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s protective magic. At the start of the patron's turn, the patron gains temporary hit points equal to twice the number of [[lookup @name lowercase]]s within 60 feet of them who chose them as a patron and can see them.

Exploit Weakness.name: Exploit Weakness
Exploit Weakness.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes or joins an attack that's made with advantage, the attack deals an extra 1 damage per [[lookup @name lowercase]] who made or joined the attack.

Thunder Crack (Group Attack).name: Thunder Crack (Group Attack)
Thunder Crack (Group Attack).description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 thunder damage, and the target can't make opportunity attacks until the start of their next turn.

Thunder Cracked.name: Thunder Cracked
Thunder Cracked.description: You cannot make opportunity attacks until the start of your next turn.

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Lightning Strike (Group Attack).name: Lightning Strike (Group Attack)
Lightning Strike (Group Attack).description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 lightning damage, and if this attack was made by more than one mage, each mage who joined the attack picks one creature within 30 feet of the original target. Each creature picked takes 2 lightning damage for each mage who targeted them; the mage's Exploit Weakness trait does not increase this damage.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Scythe.name: Scythe
Scythe.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Death Bolt.name: Death Bolt
Death Bolt.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) necrotic damage, and the target's weapon attacks deal half damage until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Death Bolt.name: Death Bolt
Death Bolt.description: Your weapon attacks deal half damage until the start of the monster's next turn.

Blackfire Blessing.name: Blackfire Blessing
Blackfire Blessing.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] empowers up to 10 non-minion allies within 30 feet of them. For 1 minute or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, each creature's weapons burn with black fire and deal an extra 2 (1d4) necrotic damage on a hit.

Foundry Note

Affected creatures can have their weapons enchanted by the activity of this item.

Blackfire Blessing.name: Blackfire Blessing
Blackfire Blessing.description: This weapon burns with black fire and deals an extra 2 (1d4) necrotic damage.

Rise, My Minions!.name: Rise, My Minions!
Rise, My Minions!.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses up to three creatures within 30 feet of them who died within the last minute. These creatures return to life with 1 hit point, but they can't regain hit points, and they die after 1 minute.

Life from Death.name: Life from Death
Life from Death.description: When a creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of them fails a death saving throw or dies, the cultist siphons their faltering life energy. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses a creature within 30 feet of themself who isn't unconscious, and that creature regains 14 (4d6) hit points.

heal.condition: When a creature the monster can see within 30 feet fails a death saving throw or dies.

Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
Chain Mail.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Rapier.name: Rapier
Rapier.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can make a dagger attack against the target with advantage.

Dagger.name: Dagger
Dagger.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

Ambusher.name: Ambusher
Ambusher.description: In the first round of combat, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on attack rolls against any surprised creature.

Hit 'Em Where It Hurts.name: Hit 'Em Where It Hurts
Hit 'Em Where It Hurts.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on a weapon attack roll, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage on a hit.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Arcane Staff.name: Arcane Staff
Arcane Staff.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) lightning damage.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Arcane Shield.name: Arcane Shield
Arcane Shield.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is hit by an attack, they magically gain a +5 bonus to AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss. If the attacker is within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the attacker must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 18 (4d8) thunder damage and be pushed 10 feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

save.condition: When the monster is hit by an attack.

Gust of Wind.name: Gust of Wind
Gust of Wind.description:
A 10-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line of strong wind gusts from the wizard for 1 minute. Each creature who starts their turn in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from the wizard. Each creature in that area must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot they move toward the wizard.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames. It has a 50 percent chance to extinguish protected flames like lanterns. The wizard can use a bonus action to change the direction in which the wind blasts from them.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description: The wizard fires magical lightning in a 5-foot-wide, 100-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

materials.value: A bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass

Utility Spells.name: Utility Spells
Utility Spells.description:
In addition to any other spells in this stat block, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

At will: mage hand, prestidigitation

1/day each: clairvoyance, mage armor, see invisibility, sending

Morningstar.name: Morningstar
Morningstar.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if the target is prone.

Foundry Note

You can add the additional 1d8 damage against prone targets as a Situational Bonus when performing the damage roll.

Javelin.name: Javelin
Javelin.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item 1EcG8gAv5D0ji9fM]] or two [[/item mw4hTxtRjyyVstgS]] attacks. They can replace one attack with a [[/item hkefdufJtT2qfdmt]] attack.

Stay Down.name: Stay Down
Stay Down.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] kicks one prone creature within 5 feet of them. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or their speed is reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn.

Stay Down.name: Stay Down
Stay Down.description: Your speed is reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.

Breastplate.name: Breastplate
Breastplate.description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Shield Bash.name: Shield Bash
Shield Bash.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked &reference[prone].

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Spear (Group Attack).name: Spear (Group Attack)
Spear (Group Attack).description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

Overwhelm.name: Overwhelm
Overwhelm.description:
If a Medium or smaller enemy starts their turn within 5 feet of three or more [[lookup @name lowercase]]s who can see them, until the start of the enemy's next turn, the enemy's speed is reduced by 5 feet for each guard within 5 feet of them. If this reduces the enemy's walking speed to 0, they are &reference[restrained] until the start of their next turn.

Foundry Note

You can repeatedly drag and drop the @UUID[.ActiveEffect.LTkKoEW7hJJCYgEq]{Overwhelm} effect from this item onto a target to reduce their movement speed by 5 feet for each minion.

Exploit Weakness.name: Exploit Weakness
Exploit Weakness.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes or joins an attack that's made with advantage, the attack deals an extra 1 damage per [[lookup @name lowercase]] who made or joined the attack.

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Potion of Healing.name: Potion of Healing
Potion of Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 2d4+2 hit points when you drink this potion.

Carpenter's Tools.name: Carpenter's Tools
Carpenter's Tools.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in carpentry.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Uthrak Coat of Arms Shield.name: Uthrak Coat of Arms Shield
Uthrak Coat of Arms Shield.description:
A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

This shield bears the Uthrak coat of arms, a toad rampant.

Millstone of Grinding.name: Millstone of Grinding
Millstone of Grinding.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

This 5-ton, 10-foot-diameter flat stone bears the inscription “All is Grist.”

While the mill is operational, the millstone can pulverize any Small or Tiny mundane object placed in the hole at its center. The object becomes a pinch of magic flour. As an action, a creature can add this flour to water, causing the object to return to its original form.

Sack.name: Sack
Sack.description: A sack can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

Dust of Disappearance.name: Dust of Disappearance
Dust of Disappearance.description:
Wondrous item

Found in a small packet, this powder resembles very fine sand. There is enough of it for one use.

When you use an action to throw the dust into the air, you and each creature and object within 10 feet of you become invisible for 2d4 minutes. The duration is the same for all subjects, and the dust is consumed when its magic takes effect.

If a creature affected by the dust attacks or casts a spell, the invisibility ends for that creature.

Figurine of Wondrous Power (Silver Raven.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power (Silver Raven)
Figurine of Wondrous Power (Silver Raven.description:
Wondrous item

A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.

The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.

Silver Raven. This silver statuette of a raven can become a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.LPdX5YLlwci0NDZx]{Raven} for up to 12 hours. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 2 days have passed. While in raven form, the figurine allows you to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.X8w9EzYLGc4vQ1H2]{Animal Messenger} spell on it at will.

Rations.name: Rations
Rations.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Potion of Greater Healing.name: Potion of Greater Healing
Potion of Greater Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 4d4+4 hit points when you drink this potion.

Hempen Rope (50 ft.).name: Hempen Rope (50 ft.)
Hempen Rope (50 ft.).description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Nine Lives.name: Nine Lives
Nine Lives.description:
Weapon (Longsword), Rare (Requires Attunement)

The black pommel of Baron Uthrak’s longsword is set with nine bloodstone gems: three gray and six red.

You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit with an attack roll using it, the target takes an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.

Bloodstones. The sword has 3 charges left, one for each gray bloodstone.

When you fail a saving throw while holding this sword, you can expend 1 charge to succeed instead (no action required). When you do so, you take 2d6 necrotic damage, which can’t be reduced in any way, and the sword drains some of your blood into one of the remaining gray bloodstones, turning the stone red.

The sword loses this property while it has no charges remaining.

When you deal damage to a Dragon with Nine Lives while the sword has fewer than 9 charges, the sword regains 1 charge and one of the sword's red bloodstones turns gray. Once the sword has regained a charge in this way, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

Gain Bloodstone.name: Gain Bloodstone
Gain Bloodstone.condition: When dealing damage to a Dragon.

Silver Circlet set with a Pearl.name: Silver Circlet set with a Pearl
Silver Circlet set with a Pearl.description: A silver circlet set with a pearl.

Toll Receipts.name: Toll Receipts
Toll Receipts.description: A series of receipts signed by Baron Uthrak detailing 600 gp of "tolls" paid over the last month.

Burnock Mill.name: Burnock Mill
Burnock Mill.text:
Optimized for Five 5th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00004 inline]

Mill Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Duelist's Honor. The characters meet Lady Vigue, a human noble who was defeated and humiliated by Baron Uthrak in a rigged duel before the baron's exile. Vigue offers the characters a +1 shield as a reward for infiltrating Burnock Mill and recovering her stolen sword from Uthrak's hoard (area @UUID[.zneKNe7rzRvTe4ye]{U7}).

Rising Rebellion. Duke Rodrik, the human ruler of lands where Baron Uthrak once led a rebellion, offers the characters 2,000 gp to infiltrate Burnock Mill and capture or kill Uthrak before the baron can incite another uprising.

Toll Concerns. Merchants and caravans have complained to local authorities about the exorbitant bridge toll demanded by Baron Uthrak and his crew. Countess Irna, a human, offers a 2,000 gp reward to the characters if they can stop these unauthorized “tolls.”

Mill Features

Areas U5, U6, and U7 comprise the interior of Burnock Mill. These areas have the following features:

Ceilings. The mill's ceilings are 10 feet high.

Illumination. During the day, bright sunlight fills the mill's second floor (area @UUID[.8d3VxIr8e4NjZ4EG]{U6}) and third floor (area @UUID[.zneKNe7rzRvTe4ye]{U7}). The mill's first floor (area @UUID[.4MqMen8Yd1ZvQsbg]{U5}) has no windows and is dimly lit by lanterns.

Machinery. Toothed shafts and large wooden gears cluster at the center of the mill's first floor (area @UUID[.4MqMen8Yd1ZvQsbg]{U5}) and second floor (area @UUID[.8d3VxIr8e4NjZ4EG]{U6}). If the water wheel is turning, the shafts and gears spin. A creature pushed into the spinning machinery must succeed on a [[/save strength 13]] saving throw or be &reference[restrained] by the machinery. A creature restrained in this way takes [[/damage 3d6 bludgeoning average]] damage at the start of each of their turns as long as the machinery is spinning. As an action, a creature can make a [[/check strength 13]] check, freeing themself or another creature within their reach on a success. The machinery on each floor has AC 15, 40 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Destroying the machinery on one floor stops it on all floors.

Trapdoors. Heavy trapdoors connect each floor of the mill. Opening a trapdoor requires an action. The trapdoors muffle sound, and creatures on an enclosed floor can't hear noise made on others.

Uthrak's Henchmen

Unless otherwise noted, named NPCs are Baron Uthrak's officers. They are loyal to him and fight to the death. Interrogating them yields no information. If no officers are nearby to command the baron's other forces, they surrender or flee when they are clearly losing. Fleeing henchmen try to reach the mill or open the sluice gate (see area @UUID[.jJKgQw5w5no3jXni]{U2}) to alert Baron Uthrak (see @UUID[.jDT78YBLCd6zeyLF#alerting-the-mill]{Alerting the Mill}).

Captured Henchmen. A captured or cornered henchman who isn't an officer offers any knowledge or items they can to save their own life. When questioned, they can provide any of the following pieces of information:

  • A wicked creature lives in the mill pond (area @UUID[.jJKgQw5w5no3jXni]{U2}) and tried to drown a bandit who got too close.
  • Baron Uthrak bullies a bandit named Dogface (see area @UUID[.8d3VxIr8e4NjZ4EG]{U6}) for being soft and showing mercy to the travelers they rob.
  • Gray Walter (see area @UUID[.dJOoK4695R9HIWHv]{U1}) says the millstone at the top of the mill (area @UUID[.zneKNe7rzRvTe4ye]{U7}) is magic, but he hasn't told Baron Uthrak yet.
  • Brother John (see area @UUID[.4MqMen8Yd1ZvQsbg]{U5}) keeps winning money in sparring matches against other bandits. Some say he cheats!

Defeated Characters. If Baron Uthrak's forces defeat the characters, the henchmen disarm them and take them to meet the baron in area U7. The baron searches the captive characters, politely confiscates their weapons and half their coin, then frees them.

New Recruits. A character who approaches one of Uthrak's officers while the mill isn't on alert (see @UUID[.jDT78YBLCd6zeyLF#alerting-the-mill]{Alerting the Mill}) and asks to join the bandits can convince the officer with a successful [[/skill skill=deception/persuasion 17]] check. If convinced, the officer escorts the party to Baron Uthrak on the mill's third floor (area U7). Before allowing the characters to join his forces, the baron tests their loyalty with two requests: that they give him a tribute worth at least 500 gp, and that they seize and bring back the carts of a merchant caravan.

Resting in the Mill

Provided the characters first deal with any enemies in that area, they can safely take short rests in areas @UUID[.dJOoK4695R9HIWHv]{U1} and @UUID[.jJKgQw5w5no3jXni]{U2}. Otherwise, if the characters attempt to rest, there is an [[/r 1d100cs>20]]{80 percent chance} two @UUID[Actor.yC28PFwjA3Prx5Vp]{Human Knaves} and one @UUID[Actor.IlRmliBawWkapeyz] interrupt them halfway through their rest.

Entering the Mill

Truss Bridge (area @UUID[.dJOoK4695R9HIWHv]{U1}) can be approached from either the north or south on the main road. If the characters search for another crossing, they find the mill pond (area @UUID[.jJKgQw5w5no3jXni]{U2}). Burnock Mill is visible from both areas, but the building's limited windows prevent the inhabitants from seeing either area.

The characters can enter the mill through the door or window near the water wheel (area @UUID[.TUIhmIH5xrQI1dEr]{U3}). A character who can climb or fly can enter through the crane bay or the roof near the mill's top floor (area @UUID[.zneKNe7rzRvTe4ye]{U7}). A creature without a climbing speed or climbing equipment can climb the mill's outside wall with a successful [[/skill athletics 15]] check.

Alerting the Mill

Under normal circumstances, the inhabitants of the mill aren't particularly attentive. However, if an enemy escapes to warn Baron Uthrak of intruders or if someone activates the machinery inside the mill, the inhabitants go on high alert.

While the mill is on alert, Barrelhouse Jill (a @UUID[Actor.nB1twTPs4eqf58xf]) and six @UUID[Actor.yLQHIi2aOytHcoVS]{Human Guards} exit the mill's first floor (area @UUID[.4MqMen8Yd1ZvQsbg]{U5}) and patrol clockwise around the outside of the mill. Baron Uthrak sends the two @UUID[Actor.IlRmliBawWkapeyz]{Human Trickshots} on the third floor (area @UUID[.zneKNe7rzRvTe4ye]{U7}) to the roof to fire crossbows at strangers within 100 feet of the mill. While on the steeply slanted roof, the trickshots have half cover from attacks on the ground. A @UUID[Actor.QlEsf9uhy2BP3FF0] readies the loading crane to attack creatures in the crane loading zone (area @UUID[.frZo8PIvMSqhxGP1]{U4}).

Baron Uthrak's Hoard.name: Baron Uthrak's Hoard
Baron Uthrak's Hoard.text:
Baron Uthrak carries his magic sword, @UUID[Item.l8tLsT8jjOoUy7Zd]. The rest of his treasure hoard is contained in an iron chest atop a crate in area U7 of his lair.

The hoard contains the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.gW1zpRVkFdFZZDXK]{Figurine of wondrous power (silver raven)}
  • @UUID[Item.jdFOBcggX5nGrfD4]{2 potions of greater healing}
  • @UUID[Item.LhWKEiOEptwMhx2u]{Shield bearing the Uthrak coat of arms, a toad rampant} (worth 50 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.o4licPp3YkZekthy]{Silver circlet set with a pearl} (worth 150 gp)
  • [[/award 750sp 900gp]]

Unbeknownst to the baron, the mill's grindstone bears an enchantment that allows it to grind ordinary items into flour (see @UUID[Item.THF145OGGd0bbMUl] below). The crate under Baron Uthrak's chest contains ten tiny, labeled packets of flour, each of which turns into an item when added to water. The crate contains the following flour packets:

  • @UUID[Item.k7bHDfAk8bbbZ1I3]{3 50-foot coils of hempen rope}
  • @UUID[Item.H3yHGBh3YixuwhCJ]{3 sets of carpenter's tools}
  • @UUID[Item.kelvZEJ9ijhADILz]{Rope ladder}
  • @UUID[Item.rJQl7dxdo01nIro1]{3 10-pound sacks of wheat} (worth 1 sp each)
  • @UUID[Item.puWDCFtDk6G5LOl2]{Keg of wine} (worth 50 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.4oHzAuzopTGtTJGg]{Gold bracelet} (worth 250 gp)

Truss Bridge.name: Truss Bridge
Truss Bridge.text:
This bridge over the Burnock River has the following features:

  • “A sturdy plank bridge is roofed by a framework of wooden beams.”
  • “Five humans share a meal on the roof, legs dangling.”

Toll Bandits. Flash Maggie (a @UUID[Actor.fxsDiOJVvFsPpoI1] with 77 hit points) guards this bridge alongside Gray Walter (a @UUID[Actor.rEsjeWFon1ISrF9I]) and Walter's sons (three @UUID[Actor.gmWD4dfsMI0XM0fl]{Human Apprentice Mages}). When the characters approach, Flash Maggie drops down to the bridge and demands a toll of half their coin. She sarcastically refers to herself as “your humble servant” and asks “your eminences” to “make a donation.” If the characters refuse to pay or decide to turn back, the bandits attack.

In combat, Maggie grabs lightly armored enemies, uses them to block incoming attacks, then throws them off the bridge. Gray Walter and his sons remain on the scaffolding 10 feet above the bridge, raining down magical attacks while Walter uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.FSMy6VAjDnXY9vWz] spell to push enemies off the bridge.

If defeat seems inevitable, one of the bandits gestures toward the mill and declares, “You may have beaten us, but Baron Uthrak will have his revenge! No one crosses the baron and lives.”

Bridge Beams. Sturdy hooks stick out of the beams on the bridge, allowing a creature to climb the beams without making an ability check.

River. A fast-flowing, 10-foot-deep river runs under the bridge. A creature without a swimming speed who starts their turn in the river must succeed on a [[/save strength 13]] saving throw or be moved 5 feet west.

Treasure. Flash Maggie carries [[/award 120gp]] and @UUID[Item.zfHujiHuX2Vxr75Z]{receipts}, signed by Baron Uthrak, detailing 600 gp of “tolls” paid over the past month.

Mill Pond.name: Mill Pond
Mill Pond.text:
This pond has the following features:

  • “The still, circular pond is blocked on its south side by a wooden sluice gate. On the other side of the gate lies a dry channel.”
  • (Secret) Salty Anne, a @UUID[Actor.P57qJU490TmasjjH], lurks at the bottom of the pond.

Pond and Sluice Gate. The pond is 20 feet deep, and the currently dry channel is 5 feet deep. The sluice gate is a square slab of wood that blocks water from flowing down the channel toward the mill and powering its water wheel. The sluice gate can be operated by pulling on a rope that lifts the wooden slab, sending water racing down the channel. The rope can be tied off to keep the sluice open. Two rounds after the gate is opened, the water wheel begins to turn and the mill's machinery springs to life (see @UUID[.jDT78YBLCd6zeyLF#alerting-the-mill]{Alerting the Mill}).

Salty Anne. Salty Anne, a @UUID[Actor.P57qJU490TmasjjH], has lived in the river for decades. Apprenticed to a sea hag in her youth after her parents made a deal for wealth, Salty Anne was never truly evil, so her disgusted mistress exiled her.

The sea hag apprentice hates Baron Uthrak and his crew for their crimes against travelers, but Salty Anne fears facing the bandits alone. When the characters approach, she hides behind a boulder at the bottom of the pond, thinking them members of Baron Uthrak's crew.

A character observing the pond notices Salty Anne with a successful [[/skill perception 15]] check. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill persuasion 15]] check can coax Salty Anne to the surface and convince her to share her feelings about Baron Uthrak. If the characters tell her they want to fight the baron, Salty Anne agrees to aid them and tells them the mill's grindstone is a powerful magic item (see @UUID[.RCC8yHqkk6hWAfKZ]{Baron Uthrak's Hoard}). She also mentions that opening the gate puts the mill on alert and draws some of the bandits out of the complex to search for intruders. At the GM's discretion, Salty Anne can join the party for further adventures.

Mill Wheel.name: Mill Wheel
Mill Wheel.text:
The wooden wheel attached to the water mill has the following features:

  • “The mill's water wheel is attached to the south wall, and a window lies 6 feet above it. Nearby, a bridge crosses over a wide channel, leading to the mill's entrance.”
  • (If the sluice gate in area @UUID[.jJKgQw5w5no3jXni]{U2} hasn't been opened) “The channel, which looks as though it's meant to contain flowing water, is empty. The wheel sits stationary.”
  • (If the sluice gate in area @UUID[.jJKgQw5w5no3jXni]{U2} has been opened) “Water flows easily beneath the bridge, catching the water wheel. It slowly turns, causing something inside the mill to clank and grind.”

Water Wheel. The wheel, which is 10 feet in diameter and 3 feet wide, is attached to an axle protruding horizontally from the mill's outer wall.

Window. The window above the wheel leads to the mill's second floor (area U6). A character can climb the wheel to reach the window by succeeding on a [[/skill acrobatics 15]] check, made with disadvantage if the water wheel is in motion. On a failed check, a creature tumbles 10 feet down into the channel, taking [[/damage 1d6 bludgeoning average]] damage from the fall if the channel is dry.

Crane Loading Zone.name: Crane Loading Zone
Crane Loading Zone.text:
This cobbled area to the east of the mill has the following features:

  • “A cobbled yard lies east of the mill.”
  • “Nearly 30 feet above the cobbles, a wooden crane juts from a wide window on the third story of the mill. A metal claw dangles from the end of the crane's arm.”
  • “An armored human is visible in the crane window.”

Crane. The crane can be operated from the crane bay on the mill's third floor (area @UUID[.zneKNe7rzRvTe4ye]{U7}) to attack anyone in the loading zone. As an action, the operator can use the crane in one of the following ways:

  • The crane picks up a Large or smaller object in the loading zone not worn or carried by a creature.
  • The crane makes a [[/attack 6]]{melee weapon attack} with a +6 bonus to its attack roll against a creature in the loading zone. On a hit, the target is &reference[grappled] (escape DC 13).
  • The crane's claw rises up to 30 feet (to a maximum of 30 feet above the ground).
  • The crane releases a creature or object it is holding. If the crane has been raised 30 feet, the crane operator can release the target safely into the crane bay on the mill's third floor (area U7) or drop the target into the loading zone.

Sentry. A @UUID[Actor.QlEsf9uhy2BP3FF0] sentry sits in the third-floor crane bay (area U7). If the alarm hasn't been raised (see @UUID[.jDT78YBLCd6zeyLF#alerting-the-mill]{Alerting the Mill}), the sentry reads a book of children's poems entitled Rhymes for Little Ones and pays no attention to anything happening in the crane loading zone. If the alarm has been raised, the sentry watches the crane loading zone for intruders.

First Floor.name: First Floor
First Floor.text:
The water mill's first floor has the following features:

  • “Gears surround wooden beams and pillars throughout the room.”
  • “A ladder leads up to a closed trapdoor on the north side of the ceiling.”
  • (If the mill isn't on alert) “Atop a pair of crates, a leather-clad duelist battles a robed human wielding a scythe. Along the walls, a dozen humans shout encouragement to the combatants.”

Training Exercise. If the mill hasn't been alerted (see @UUID[.jDT78YBLCd6zeyLF#alerting-the-mill]{Alerting the Mill}), Barrelhouse Jill (a @UUID[Actor.nB1twTPs4eqf58xf]) spars with Brother John (a @UUID[Actor.lkNuDDQDWOePxyj3]) in the middle of the room. The combatants stand atop a 5-by-10-foot arena formed by two crates pushed together. Around the crates, six @UUID[Actor.yLQHIi2aOytHcoVS]{Human Guards} cheer for Jill and six @UUID[Actor.dCJvE0jKFoTB0liM]{Human Death Acolytes} pray for John. The characters can sneak into the room and observe the bandits or catch them by surprise with a successful group [[/skill stealth 13]] check.

Although the duel is friendly, both combatants wagered heavily on the outcome. If the characters observe the duel, they notice both fighters suffer minor injuries, but John's wounds magically heal thanks to his Scythe attack. When Jill is reduced to 30 hit points, she admits defeat and pays 100 gp to John.

If combat breaks out with the characters, a single human guard opens the trapdoor to the second floor (area U6) and carries a message to Baron Uthrak. If a character points out to Jill that John was healing during the fight, and if that character succeeds on a [[/skill persuasion 15]] check made as an action, she turns on John and attacks him for his unfair tactics. When John is defeated, she resumes battling the characters.

If the mill is on alert, Brother John and the death cultists attack the characters when they enter.

Treasure. Jill and John each carry a pouch with [[/award 100gp]]. The death cultists and guards have [[/award 120gp]] between them. The crates contain clothing, food, and @UUID[Item.7RNC2RZyVZmTXTgt]{three potions of healing}.

Second Floor.name: Second Floor
Second Floor.text:
This floor has the following features:

  • “Crates and sacks line the walls. A sleeping guard with a black eye lies on a stack of musty sacks, clutching a mop.”
  • “Gears surround a wooden pillar in the middle of the room.”
  • “There are three visible trapdoors: one on the floor on the north side of the room, and two on the ceiling on the south side of the room. Ladders lead up to the two on the ceiling.”
  • “A small window in the south wall overlooks the mill's water wheel.”

Sleeping Guardian. The sleeping guard is named Dogface. He was supposed to be cleaning the room, but Baron Uthrak has bullied him so mercilessly that Dogface has no loyalty to him. The baron's most recent assault was punching Dogface for oversleeping. If the players attack Dogface, he uses the @UUID[Actor.QlEsf9uhy2BP3FF0] stat block. However, if they wake him without attacking him, he asks if they've come to defeat Baron Uthrak. A character who claims they'll defeat Uthrak and succeeds on a [[/skill skill=intimidation/performance 14]] check earns Dogface's loyalty. He describes the mill's defenses and offers to join the party. As an ally, Dogface uses the @UUID[Actor.Obg3YoLxfFfX2vXU] stat block.

Treasure. Most of the sacks contain rotten grain, but Dogface has stashed his treasure in a @UUID[Item.XEXBRBPPu5CbVegw]{clean sack}: 50 gp, 10 rations, and a packet of dust of disappearance. He happily gives his treasure to the party if they let him aid in Baron Uthrak's defeat.

Third Floor.name: Third Floor
Third Floor.text:
This floor has the following features:

  • “Two humans stand at a round millstone, talking in hushed voices. One is armored and carries a whip and a jeweled longsword, and the other wields a morningstar.”
  • “A small contingent of soldiers equipped with axes and other weapons sits by bedrolls in the southeast corner of the room.”
  • “On the east side of the room, a sliding door stands open. A long wooden crane juts through the door.”
  • “On the west side of the room, an iron chest sits atop a crate.”

What you don't understand is that out here, I am the nobles. I am the law, and if the bodies at the bottom of the river could talk, they'd tell you I can enforce it.

— Baron Wigar Uthrak

Uthrak and Company. If the mill hasn't been alerted to the characters (see “Alerting the Mill”), @UUID[Actor.Fw1sWRKtUgQIoGCV] and his lieutenant, Beatrice the Cruel (a @UUID[Actor.yC28PFwjA3Prx5Vp]), eat meat and drink wine at the stone table. Three @UUID[Actor.QlEsf9uhy2BP3FF0]{Human Raiders} are nearby, two polishing their blades while a third stands on sentry duty near the crane bay and reads a book of poetry. Another two @UUID[Actor.QlEsf9uhy2BP3FF0]{Human Raiders} and two @UUID[Actor.IlRmliBawWkapeyz]{Human Trickshots} are asleep in their bedrolls. If combat breaks out, sleeping combatants spend their first turn waking up and collecting their weapons.

If the mill is on alert, Baron Uthrak, Beatrice, and four human raiders (along with survivors from previous battles) are ready for combat while the fifth raider stands at the crane controls. The two human trickshots have been sent to the roof.

In combat, Baron Uthrak and Beatrice kick enemies prone and attack them while they're down. If the mill's machinery has been activated, Baron Uthrak pulls opponents into the millstone with his whip, and, when reduced to 25 hit points or fewer, uses his whip to swing from the crane into the flowing channel 30 feet below. Human raiders try to push intruders out the crane bay door or into the spinning millstone.

Stone Table. Baron Uthrak's table is a 10-foot-diameter @UUID[Item.THF145OGGd0bbMUl] (see @UUID[.RCC8yHqkk6hWAfKZ]{Baron Uthrak's Hoard}) once used to grind grain. It has a 1-foot-wide square hole.

If the mill is put into operation by opening the sluice gate (see “Pond and Sluice Gate” in area @UUID[.jJKgQw5w5no3jXni]{U2}), the millstone begins spinning, sending Uthrak and Beatrice's feast flying. A creature pushed or pulled into the spinning millstone takes [[/damage 3d6 bludgeoning average]] damage, is pushed 10 feet away from the millstone in a random direction, and is knocked &reference[prone].

Crane Bay. The door on the room's east side is open, revealing a 20-foot wide, 10-foot-high opening. Anyone pushed out the door falls 30 feet down into the crane loading zone (area U4). Next to this opening is a 30-foot-long wooden crane, which can be swiveled and retracted using levers at its base. A heavy claw dangles on a rope from the end of the crane.

Roof. A trapdoor leads up to the mill's peaked roof. The roof's slant makes it difficult terrain for creatures without a climbing speed.

Treasure. The iron chest contains Baron Uthrak's treasure hoard, while the crate contains items pulverized by the @UUID[Item.THF145OGGd0bbMUl]. See @UUID[.RCC8yHqkk6hWAfKZ]{Baron Uthrak's Hoard} for more information.

Extra Lives

If you wish, you can tailor Nine Lives' Bloodstones property to your own campaign by changing the creature type that restores its charges from Dragon to Aberration, Celestial, Fey, Fiend, or another type.

Blazing Crossbow.name: Blazing Crossbow
Blazing Crossbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, they are set on fire. While on fire, the target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the end of each of their turns, and the target or another creature who can reach them can use an action to put out the flames. A creature who is already on fire suffers no additional effect from being set on fire in this way again.

On Fire.name: On Fire
On Fire.description: The target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the end of each of their turns, and the target or another creature who can reach them can use an action to put out the flames. A creature who is already on fire suffers no additional effect from being set on fire in this way again.

Infernal Ichor.name: Infernal Ichor
Infernal Ichor.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, their corpse unleashes a spray of burning orange ichor. Each creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 3 fire damage.

Fire Mote.name: Fire Mote
Fire Mote.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shoots an explosive mote of fire at a creature they can see within 100 feet of them. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 7 (2d6) fire damage and, if they are Large or smaller, fall &reference[prone]. All other creatures within 15 feet of the target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 3 (1d6) fire damage.

Area Save.name: Area Save
Area Save.condition: Follow up to the first save.

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Importunity.name: Importunity
Importunity.description: At the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turn, they can grant an infernal blessing to a non-minion ally they can see within 60 feet of them (no action required). The next time that ally makes an attack roll or saving throw before the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn, the ally can add a +1 bonus to the roll. This bonus increases by 1 (maximum bonus of +5) for each [[lookup @name lowercase]] who grants an infernal blessing to the creature.

Infernal Blessing.name: Infernal Blessing
Infernal Blessing.description: You have a +1 bonus to your next attack roll or saving throw.

Brimstone (Group Attack).name: Brimstone (Group Attack)
Brimstone (Group Attack).description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 4 fire damage

True Name.name: True Name
True Name.description:
If a creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hear within 60 feet of them speaks the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s true name aloud, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] loses their damage resistances, damage immunities, and Devilish Charm reaction for 24 hours.

Foundry Note

This feature comes with a passive Effect, toggle it "On" when the monster hears its name to remove damage resistances and immunities.

True Name.name: True Name
True Name.description: The creature's true name has been spoken, they lose their damage resistances, damage immunities, and Devilish Charm reaction for 24 hours.

Searing Grasp (Group Attack).name: Searing Grasp (Group Attack)
Searing Grasp (Group Attack).description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 fire damage. If three or more [[lookup @name lowercase]]s joined the attack, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects that deal fire damage until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Seared.name: Seared
Seared.description: The target has disadvantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects that deal fire damage until the start of the brandbearer's next turn.

Too Hot to Handle.name: Too Hot to Handle
Too Hot to Handle.description:
Whenever an enemy takes fire damage from a non-minion creature, the enemy takes an extra 1 fire damage for each [[lookup @name lowercase]] within 5 feet of them.

Foundry Note

The damage can be configured when you use this item.

damage.condition: An enemy takes fire damage from a non-minion creature within 5 feet.

Hide Armor.name: Hide Armor
Hide Armor.description: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

Infernal Ichor.name: Infernal Ichor
Infernal Ichor.description: When a creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 hit points, the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s corpse unleashes a spray of burning orange ichor. The creature who reduced the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 hit points takes 1 fire damage.

damage.condition: The monster is killed by a creature within 5 feet.

Pincer.name: Pincer
Pincer.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is &reference[grappled] (escape DC 17). While grappled, the target is &reference[restrained]. The demon has six pincers, each of which can grapple a target or wield a weapon.

Sword.name: Sword
Sword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

Javelin.name: Javelin
Javelin.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage.

Tail Spike.name: Tail Spike
Tail Spike.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack

Lethe.name: Lethe
Lethe.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s soul count is 0, they have advantage on attack rolls, disadvantage on saving throws, and their Intelligence score becomes 3 (−4). Additionally, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must use their movement on each of their turns to move as close as possible to the nearest creature they can sense with their soulsight, and then if they are able, they must use their action to attack and attempt to kill that creature. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't act with any other purpose until they add 1 to their soul count.

Lethe.name: Lethe
Lethe.description: When the demon's soul count is 0, they have advantage on attack rolls, disadvantage on saving throws, and Intelligence score becomes 3. Additionally, must use their movement on each of their turns to move as close as possible to the nearest creature they can sense with their soulsight, and then if they are able, they must use their action to attack and attempt to kill that creature. Cannot act with any other purpose until they add 1 to their soul count.

Soul Devourer.name: Soul Devourer
Soul Devourer.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] reduces a creature who isn't a Construct or an Undead to 0 hit points or deals damage to a dying creature, the creature must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] consumes the creature's soul and adds 1 to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s soul count. A creature whose soul is consumed in this way immediately dies, and they can't be restored to life by any means short of a wish spell.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes four attacks using [[/item J1EFY5hyxC1kyD7F]], [[/item 8bKakbzBdHgu0sUj]], [[/item 9ldbvYFYT3TAGTbs]], or a combination of them. They can replace one of these attacks with a [[/item EobokYRriMX5KBPD]] attack. The demon can burn 1 soul to make a fifth attack using Pincer, Sword, or Javelin.

Deep Dive.description:
(Costs 1 soul)

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the Disengage action and gains a burrowing speed equal to their walking speed until the end of their next turn.

Spell Siphon.name: Spell Siphon
Spell Siphon.description: When a creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 60 feet of them casts a spell, the mage reflects some of the spell's magical energy back at the caster. The caster must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 3 (1d6) force damage per level of the triggering spell (minimum 1d6 force damage).

Rain Hellfire.name: Rain Hellfire
Rain Hellfire.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] rains fire down on a point they can see within 60 feet of them. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners, and it ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried.

Unhallowed Ground.name: Unhallowed Ground
Unhallowed Ground.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses a point on the ground that they can see within 60 feet of them. A 20-foot square of glowing, unholy energy appears on the ground centered on that point and lasts for up to 1 minute. Each enemy in that area is vulnerable to fire damage.

Unhallowed Ground.name: Unhallowed Ground
Unhallowed Ground.description: The enemy is vulnerable to fire damage while within the area.

Infernal Teleport.name: Infernal Teleport
Infernal Teleport.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, they must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw or be teleported up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space the mage can see.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, they must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or gain vulnerability to fire and necrotic damage until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack

Grilp's Bite.name: Grilp's Bite
Grilp's Bite.description: The target has vulnerability to fire and necrotic damage until the start of the monster's next turn.

Shifting Camouflage.name: Shifting Camouflage
Shifting Camouflage.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can hide from creatures who are observing them.

Blightblade.name: Blightblade
Blightblade.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

Eye Fire.name: Eye Fire
Eye Fire.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) fire damage.

Battle Ready.name: Battle Ready
Battle Ready.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] and each ally within 60 feet of them who can hear them have advantage on initiative rolls and can't be surprised, provided the [[lookup @name lowercase]] isn't incapacitated.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Hidden Gifts.description: When an ally the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of them takes damage, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically turns that ally &Reference[Invisible]. The ally remains invisible until the end of their next turn or until they attack, deal damage, or force another creature to make a saving throw.

utility.condition: An ally within 30 feet that they can see takes damage.

Ring Mail.description: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

The hex lasts until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Brimstone Dagger.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

Soulsword.name: Soulsword
Soulsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, they can't regain hit points until the start of [[lookup @name]]'s next turn.

Death Skulls.name: Death Skulls
Death Skulls.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage, and [[lookup @name]] can teleport to an unoccupied space he can see within 5 feet of the target.

Infernal Sacrifice.name: Infernal Sacrifice
Infernal Sacrifice.description: When Varrox fails a saving throw, he can call on Hell to succeed instead. When he does, each ally within 60 feet of him takes 5 necrotic damage.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
