Advance and Attack.description: [[lookup @name]] barks orders at one ally within 60 feet of him who can hear him. That ally can use their reaction to move up to their speed and make a weapon attack.

An Army from Blood.name: An Army from Blood
An Army from Blood.description: When a non-minion hobgoblin who [[lookup @name]] can see within 60 feet of him takes damage, [[lookup @name]] magically summons three @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.WB3eVqM7LUx24NtX] who appear in unoccupied spaces nearest to the damaged hobgoblin.

summon.condition: when a non-minion hobgoblin they can see takes damage

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Varrox makes three attacks using [[/item WmQBLIz32ECAlJgu]], [[/item xWlWV0IdLtRaS1Qc]], or both.

Uncanny Leadership.name: Uncanny Leadership
Uncanny Leadership.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses up to six non-minion allies within 60 feet of him who can see or hear him. [[lookup @name]] and each chosen creature gain 10 temporary hit points and can move up to their speed.

affects.special: non-minion allies who can see or hear him

Hellish Transport.name: Hellish Transport
Hellish Transport.description: [[lookup @name]] and each ally within 60 feet of him can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

I Am Fire and Death.name: I Am Fire and Death
I Am Fire and Death.description: Each enemy within 20 feet of [[lookup @name]] must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) fire damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After the explosion, a shroud of black flame covers [[lookup @name]] for 1 minute. For the duration, each time another creature hits [[lookup @name]] with an attack while within 5 feet of him or touches him, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

damage.condition: when attacked within 5 feet

Shroud of Black Flame.name: Shroud of Black Flame
Shroud of Black Flame.description: A shroud of black flame covers Bloodlord Varrox for 1 minute. For the duration, each time another creature hits Bloodlord Varrox with an attack while within 5 feet of him or touches him, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Infernal Ichor.name: Infernal Ichor
Infernal Ichor.description: When a creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] reduces the recruit to 0 hit points, the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s corpse unleashes a spray of burning orange ichor. The creature who reduced the recruit to 0 hit points takes 1 fire damage.

damage.condition: A creature within 5 ft. reduces the monster to 0 hit points.

Tactical Positioning.name: Tactical Positioning
Tactical Positioning.description: When a non-minion ally attacks a creature, that ally gains a +1 bonus to the attack roll for each recruit within 5 feet of the target (maximum bonus of +5).

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Longsword (Group Attack).name: Longsword (Group Attack)
Longsword (Group Attack).description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

Fire Scimitar.name: Fire Scimitar
Fire Scimitar.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

Fiery Leap.name: Fiery Leap
Fiery Leap.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s long jump is up to 30 feet and their high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start. The first time a [[lookup @name lowercase]] lands after a jump on their turn, each creature within 5 feet of them takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

Infernal Ichor.name: Infernal Ichor
Infernal Ichor.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, their corpse unleashes a spray of burning orange ichor. Each creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 5 fire damage.

damage.condition: The monster dies.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item WN68hXOm2UBljCkT]] attacks.

Blaze Sprint.name: Blaze Sprint
Blaze Sprint.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Each creature they come within 5 feet of during this movement must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Infernal Ichor.name: Infernal Ichor
Infernal Ichor.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, their corpse unleashes a spray of burning orange ichor. Each creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 3 fire damage.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Smoke Form.name: Smoke Form
Smoke Form.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] transforms from flesh into a magical gray smoke for 1 minute. Any equipment they are wearing or carrying is also transformed for the duration.

While in smoke form, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains a flying speed equal to their walking speed, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from mundane attacks, and immunity to the grappled and restrained conditions.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can revert to their true form as a bonus action. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] becomes incapacitated or dies, they revert to their true form.

Smoke Form.name: Smoke Form
Smoke Form.description:
While in smoke form, the smokebinder gains a flying speed equal to their walking speed, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from mundane attacks, and immunity to the grappled and restrained conditions.

The smokebinder can revert to their true form as a bonus action. If the smokebinder becomes incapacitated or dies, they revert to their true form.

utility.condition: Smoke Form only.

Toxic Flame.name: Toxic Flame
Toxic Flame.description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on the attack roll, the target is &reference[poisoned] and can't speak until the end of the target's next turn.

Choking Bolt.name: Choking Bolt
Choking Bolt.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) fire damage. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on the attack roll, the target can't speak until the end of the target's next turn.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Restorative Ointment.name: Restorative Ointment
Restorative Ointment.description:
Wondrous item

This glass jar, 3 inches in diameter, contains 1d4 + 1 doses of a thick mixture that smells faintly of aloe. The jar and its contents weigh 1/2 pound.

As an action, one dose of the ointment can be swallowed or applied to the skin. The creature that receives it regains 2d8 + 2 hit points, ceases to be poisoned, and is cured of any disease.

Foundry Note

The 5 charges reflect the maximum number of doses possible. Similarly, the guide price of 600 gp is calculated at 120 gp per dose. Adjust both as required.

heal.condition: The ointment needs to be swallowed or applied to the skin.

Crossbow Bolt.name: Crossbow Bolt
Crossbow Bolt.description: This ammunition is used for all varieties of crossbow and is typically a short metal shaft with a narrow piercing tip.

Battle Master's Compendium.name: Battle Master's Compendium
Battle Master's Compendium.description:
Written by Bloodlord Varrox, Battle Master’s Compendium is a military treatise. Each of its thirteen chapters covers a different skill related to military strategy and tactics. The book’s detailed analysis covers military units, weapons, strategy, rank, discipline, and much more.

When you study a chapter in the book for 1 hour during a short or long rest, you learn interesting military strategies. The first time you make an Intelligence or Charisma check to influence a general, monarch, or other military leader within the next 48 hours, you have advantage on the check.

Study Chapter.name: Study Chapter
Study Chapter.condition: As part of a short or long rest.

Battle Master's Compendium.name: Battle Master's Compendium
Battle Master's Compendium.description: The first time you make an Intelligence or Charisma check to influence a general, monarch, or other military leader within the next 48 hours, you have advantage on the check.

Potion of Poison.name: Potion of Poison
Potion of Poison.description:
This concoction looks, smells, and tastes like a potion of healing or other beneficial potion.

However, it is actually poison masked by illusion magic. An identify spell reveals its true nature.

If you drink it, you take 3d6 poison damage, and you must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. At the start of each of your turns while you are poisoned in this way, you take 3d6 poison damage. At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat the saving throw. On a successful save, the poison damage you take on your subsequent turns decreases by 1d6. The poison ends when the damage decreases to 0.

Foundry Note

To apply the reduced damage from a successful Constitution save, please use the Other Formula (set at 1d6) as required.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Sands of War.name: Sands of War
Sands of War.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This sand table is filled with black volcanic sand. It is 15 feet long, 5 feet wide, and 3 feet tall. While you touch the table, you have advantage on Intelligence (History) checks to recall military lore and on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

When you use an action to speak the table's command phrase — “Prepare for war” in Infernal — the table turns into a 10-inch-tall, 3-inch-wide hourglass that weighs half a pound and is filled with black volcanic sand. You can speak the phrase again as an action to turn the hourglass back into a table, provided the hourglass has enough space to expand.

While you carry the hourglass, you are resistant to fire damage.

Additionally, while you hold the hourglass, you can use a bonus action to flip it and give yourself supernatural tactical insight. For 10 minutes, when you make an attack roll or saving throw, you can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw. Once this bonus action is used, it can’t be used again until the following dawn.

A creature in possession of the hourglass can use an action to smash it on a solid surface. The hourglass is destroyed, and it explodes in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on it. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Sands of War: Attack/Save Bonus.name: Sands of War: Attack/Save Bonus
Sands of War: Attack/Save Bonus.description: For 10 minutes, when you make an attack roll or saving throw, you can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

Ceremonial Dagger with Bloodstone Hilt.name: Ceremonial Dagger with Bloodstone Hilt
Ceremonial Dagger with Bloodstone Hilt.description: This dagger has a bloodstone embedded into it's hilt.

Potion of Healing.name: Potion of Healing
Potion of Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 2d4+2 hit points when you drink this potion.

Smith's Tools.name: Smith's Tools
Smith's Tools.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in smithing.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Arrow.name: Arrow
Arrow.description: Standard ammunition used for bows of all varieties. These mundane arrows are made of smooth wooden shafts with goose feather fletching and hammer metal bodkins.

Chime of Opening.name: Chime of Opening
Chime of Opening.description:
Wondrous item

This hollow metal tube measures about 1 foot long and weighs 1 pound. You can strike it as an action, pointing it at an object within 120 feet of you that can be opened, such as a door, lid, or lock. The chime issues a clear tone, and one lock or latch on the object opens unless the sound can't reach the object. If no locks or latches remain, the object itself opens.

The chime can be used ten times. After the tenth time, it cracks and becomes useless.

utility.condition: The sound must reach the target.

Gathered Herbs.name: Gathered Herbs
Gathered Herbs.description: A bundle of restorative herbs. A character proficient with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.i89okN7GFTWHsvPy]{herbalism kit} can use these herbs to make a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.L887NdWEP5NqHCrQ]{potion of greater healing} during a short or long rest.

Cook's Utensils.name: Cook's Utensils
Cook's Utensils.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in cookery.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Helm of Comprehending Languages.name: Helm of Comprehending Languages
Helm of Comprehending Languages.description:
Wondrous item

While wearing this helm, you can use an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4dSvfvTy2ZIJ3K4k]{Comprehend Languages} spell from it at will.

Manacles.name: Manacles
Manacles.description: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

check.condition: Creature must be Small or Medium.

save.condition: Creature must be Small or Medium.

Camp Firefield.name: Camp Firefield
Camp Firefield.text:
Optimized for Five 6th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00005 inline]

Camp Firefield Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Archdevil's Pupil. A dwarf warlock, Velthor, made a pact with an archdevil, only to later discover his patron is also nurturing another protégé — Bloodlord Varrox. Feeling jealous and betrayed, Velthor approaches the characters. Pretending to be a scholar concerned by the destruction wrought by the hobgoblin's warband, he asks them to disrupt Varrox's operations. Velthor attempts to appeal to the party's sense of justice, but if they ask for a reward, the warlock offers four diamonds (worth 500 gp each).

Hobgoblin Defector. A @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.TqPcWFgx8IBu2JI2] named Kerg defects from Bloodlord Varrox's tyrannical rule, but his family is captured by Bloodlord Varrox and held in the great hall (area C6). Kerg asks for the characters' help rescuing his family.

Scourge of War. Bloodlord Varrox's war campaign causes an unprecedented surge of refugees into nearby towns and cities. A local hobgoblin noble, Lady Yanil, offers the characters 2,500 gp to infiltrate Camp Firefield and put a stop to the army's advance.

Camp Firefield Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of Camp Firefield has the following features:

Gates. Each level of Camp Firefield beyond the first can be reached through a magic gate. The first time a creature moves through a gate, it requires a password, key, or special action to open; a detect magic spell reveals an aura of conjuration around objects that create or open gates. Varrox has left clues for new recruits on how to open these gates. An open gate acts as a two-way portal and remains open for 1 minute upon activation. Any creature peering into an open gate can see the other side as though looking through an open doorway. Once a creature passes through any given gate, they can open that gate in the future by standing within 10 feet of it and activating it with a thought (no action required).

Illumination. Perpetual twilight hangs in the sky, filling outdoor areas with dim light. Campfires provide bright light in a 20-foot radius. The interior of tents and other structures are filled with bright light from hanging lanterns.

Outdoor Areas. Most areas of the camp are outdoors. Grass and dirt cover the ground of these areas.

Spherical Levels. The camp has eight spherical levels, which Varrox and his troops refer to as circles. However, from the perspective of a creature walking on the ground or flying above it, the circle magically appears flat. Every circle is self-contained and wraps around because of its spherical nature.

This adventure has several portals scattered throughout that are initially disabled. You can enable them by using the @UUID[Macro.zcjWY9SOjmNXNcOE] macro, and selecting which portal to activate or deactivate.

Soldiers-at-Arms

Camp Firefield is protected by hardened hobgoblin troops. Unless otherwise noted, they attack intruders and fight to the death.

Captured Troops. If the characters capture one of Varrox's troops, a successful [[/skill skill=intimidation/persuasion 17]] check convinces the hobgoblin to reveal one of the following pieces of information:

  • How to open the gate in the area where the characters are.
  • The existence of the summoning altar in area @UUID[.NjQiirftLh6iUEac]{C7}.
  • The location of Varrox in area @UUID[.y3EBqWuSKjJWyqgE]{C8}.

Defeated Characters. Varrox is willing to deal with defeated characters who beg for their lives and have magic items, particularly weapons and armor, to offer in exchange. His soldiers attempt to keep defeated intruders alive, bind the prisoners in manacles, and drag them to Varrox for judgment in the camp's war room (area @UUID[.y3EBqWuSKjJWyqgE]{C8}).

Resting in Camp Firefield

Once the characters clear the enemies from an area of the camp, they can take a short rest there without interruption. If they take a long rest, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>80]]{20 percent chance} that eight @UUID[Actor.gH1DBfitnFYlKtH8]{Hobgoblin Troopers} find them halfway through their rest.

Entering Camp Firefield

By all outward appearances, Varrox's lair is a general's military tent. Made of goatskin leather, it measures 10 feet wide on each side. The walls are 9 feet tall, rising to a peak of 12 feet in the middle. Varrox typically pitches the tent on an elevation facing a settlement, and a squad of eight @UUID[Actor.gH1DBfitnFYlKtH8]{Hobgoblin Troopers} led by a @UUID[Actor.W4BXXPtkwSs99AUA] stand guard outside the tent. The characters can sneak by them unnoticed with a successful group [[/skill stealth 14]] check.

Enchanted Entrance. The tent-flap entrance to Camp Firefield is enchanted. When a creature opens the flap, they are instantly teleported to the nowhere gate (area @UUID[.SrKd0UeKwNynoOhN]{C1}).

War Room (Eighth Circle).name: War Room (Eighth Circle)
War Room (Eighth Circle).text:
This area is an enclosed chamber with a 10-foot-high ceiling. It has following features:

  • “Resplendent in plate armor, Bloodlord Varrox stands over a military sand table.”
  • “Another six hobgoblins stand at Varrox's side, hanging on his every word.”
  • “Three wood chests lie beneath the table.”

Hobgoblins. @UUID[Actor.k6bXMeV6PtCHeDNw] stands with four @UUID[Actor.gH1DBfitnFYlKtH8]{Hobgoblin Troopers}, a @UUID[Actor.sH8GrM6knKTN4fri], and a @UUID[Actor.LXtsMsWrvWLGDSJz]. Furious the characters have made it into his inner sanctum on their own, Varrox attacks. He fights until reduced to 20 hit points, then attempts to flee through all the levels of the camp.

Treasure. The chests contain Varrox's treasure. See @UUID[.AWIxsAl5kRMdLHtP]{Varrox's Hoard} for more information.

Varrox's Death.name: Varrox's Death
Varrox's Death.text:
The magic tent that creates Camp Firefield is tied to Varrox's life force. If he dies, no creatures can enter the camp. When no creatures remain in the camp, the demiplane and all objects still within it are destroyed.

Bloodlord Varrox Rides Again!

If the characters managed to dispatch Bloodlord Varrox, the hobgoblin could easily return with the help of his infernal patrons to take revenge on the heroes who killed him. When Bloodlord Varrox returns from death, he can be more powerful than his previous incarnation, choosing from or inspired by one of the following options:

  • Varrox returns with 168 hit points and a Strength of 24 (+7). Because of his new Strength score, he makes Strength (Athletics) checks with a +10 bonus and makes Soulsword and Death Skulls attacks with a +10 bonus to attack rolls and a +7 bonus to damage rolls.
  • Varrox returns as a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.QOq5VQMmELTyV5ZY].
  • Varrox returns as a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.7lxhADmwu4CIw9mN].

Varrox's Hoard.name: Varrox's Hoard
Varrox's Hoard.text:
Varrox's hoard is full of the spoils of war from conquered lands. He keeps it in chests in his war room (area @UUID[.y3EBqWuSKjJWyqgE]{C8}).

The hoard contains the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.J8BNL8n83MMKcoEk] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.dF1O34syXVB9aqy0]{Chime of opening}
  • @UUID[Item.7ClFpH9M4h9A84Eu]{Jar of restorative ointment}
  • @UUID[Item.cqj1uEGJj6vD6TkY]{2 potions of healing}
  • @UUID[Item.HCn8fVCoo1vLfgp5]{Potion of poison}
  • @UUID[Item.Dzm1vgJQ3167re8k] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.2EuLWoDd1NGlNan6]{Plate armor}
  • @UUID[Item.GByZCRYad9D0Nx2N]{5 casks of wine} (worth 50 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.OPNu6Ii5HLlYpgFb]{Ceremonial dagger with a bloodstone in the hilt} (worth 500 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.gBt4sENP0KmITjI9]{War mask painted with gold} (worth 750 gp)
  • [[/award 210sp 170gp]]

Nowhere Gate (First Circle).name: Nowhere Gate (First Circle)
Nowhere Gate (First Circle).text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Under a twilight sky, a vast, desolate plain stretches as far as the eye can see.”
  • (Secret) This circle of the camp is connected to the Seven Cities of Hell and occasionally watched by cruel devils who enjoy making others suffer.
  • (Secret) The ways to leave this area are hidden, but a clue is written in the dirt.

Infernal Connection. A creature who succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 18]] check knows this desolate wasteland is exactly like those in the Seven Cities of Hell, and this circle of the camp is connected to that plane's infernal power.

Hidden Gates. The character with the highest [[/skill perception passive format=long]] notices Infernal words written in the dirt. A character who can read Infernal can read the words, which say “Who acts in stillness finds the way.” If all nearby creatures choose to remain as still as possible, two gates appear on the plane within 30 feet of the first creature to stop moving. One gate leads out of Camp Firefield, the other leads to the second circle (area @UUID[.HVKxwywTD4PDdfoI]).

Devil Notary. If the characters can't find the gates after being on this plane for 10 minutes, Mixlax (a @UUID[Actor.53TZXMnX2fa1RLkV]) appears and offers them a deal. In exchange for sending a character to the second circle, the devil gets to curse the target for the duration of their stay at the camp. Mixlax tells characters interested in the deal that “you must choose to brave the camp without either Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.” Any character who accepts the deal must choose an ability, then they're immediately teleported — without other party members — to the entrance gate in the green route (area @UUID[.HVKxwywTD4PDdfoI]{C2}). This character is cursed, giving them disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability for the duration of their stay in Camp Firefield. The curse ends 3 days after the character leaves the camp, and can't be removed through any other means short of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell.

Treasure. Any character who has a [[/skill perception 15 passive format=long]] notices a skeletal finger poking out of the dirt near where they entered this area. The finger is connected to a buried skeleton wearing rusted armor and a @UUID[Item.oefGXK7SiBBDDj9K]. A character can unearth the skeleton with 5 minutes of work. Multiple characters working together reduce the time proportionally.

Green Route (Second Circle).name: Green Route (Second Circle)
Green Route (Second Circle).text:
This area has the following features:

  • “The entrance gate opens into a dirt footpath that cuts through a field of 10-foot-tall grass and leads under a 20-foot-high arch of braided plants.”
  • (Secret) Twelve grilps lurk in the tall grass.
  • (Secret) The braided plants mark the location of the gate to the barracks (area @UUID[.UM68pabb858LsLIM]{C3}).

Grass. The grass is difficult terrain.

Grilps. A creature who succeeds on a [[/skill perception 18]] check notices the twelve @UUID[Actor.Obmo1fzlr605D4Hs]{Grilps} in the grass. A creature who succeeds on this check by 5 or more notices one of the grilps has a collar with a polished malachite on her neck.

A character who speaks Goblin or Infernal who succeeds on a [[/skill intimidation 16]] check convinces the grilps to come forward without a fight. The collared grilp, Oki, speaks for the group. She explains that the characters need her stone to open the portal. A follow-up successful [[/skill skill=deception/intimidation 12]] check convinces Oki to hand the collar over. If the characters can't convince her to give them the collar, the grilps attack.

If the characters don't notice the grilps, Oki activates the portal and goes to warn the hobgoblins in the barracks (area @UUID[.UM68pabb858LsLIM]{C3}) of intruders. When she passes through the portal, the stone falls off her neck onto the path.

Hidden Gate. When the malachite on Oki's neck comes within 5 feet of the arch, the gate to the barracks (area @UUID[.UM68pabb858LsLIM]{C3}) opens. If a creature is carrying the malachite as they pass through the portal, the stone disappears from their possession and falls on the ground in front of the portal.

Barracks (Third Circle).name: Barracks (Third Circle)
Barracks (Third Circle).text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Dozens of 5-foot-tall leather tents stand in neat rings around a raging bonfire.”
  • (Secret) The bonfire marks the location of the gate to the fourth circle (area C4).
  • (Secret) Not all the tents are occupied, as some of Varrox's forces are always scouting, securing, and invading new lands.

Soldiers. The camp contains two @UUID[Actor.gH1DBfitnFYlKtH8]{Hobgoblin Troopers}, two @UUID[Actor.0P4NsDwqjsONfO9y]{Hobgoblin Incendiarists}, a @UUID[Actor.sH8GrM6knKTN4fri], a @UUID[Actor.LXtsMsWrvWLGDSJz], and twenty @UUID[Actor.ovbBtPIFhbzA4hfQ]{Hobgoblin Recruits}. If Oki (see area @UUID[.HVKxwywTD4PDdfoI]{C2}) didn't alert them to the characters' presence, the troopers and incendiarists patrol the camp while the rest of the hobgoblins sleep. The characters can sneak through the camp unnoticed with a successful group [[/skill stealth 15]] check. If the patrol notices intruders, they shout, waking the other hobgoblins and attacking.

If Oki the grilp alerted the hobgoblins to trouble, the camp is awake. The incendiarists and war mage stand by the bonfire, while Oki, the recruits, the troopers, and the firerunner stand near the entrance gate, ready to attack.

Bonfire Gate. A creature who touches the bonfire for the first time on a turn or starts their turn touching it takes [[/damage 2d6 fire average]] damage. The bonfire can't be extinguished by mundane means. An engraved stone circle surrounds the bonfire with a slot shaped like a five-sided star, and an Infernal inscription on it reads, “Light the way ahead.”

A character who studies the fire as an action and succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 15]] check, or who studies the fire for 1 minute (no check required), notices a red-hot brass pentagram in the bonfire. Placing this pentagram in the slot on the stone ring turns the flames of the bonfire into a magic gate that leads to the armory (area @UUID[.lN0d6cn0oLP43qFr]{C4}). While the bonfire is an active gate, it doesn't deal fire damage.

Treasure. Each tent contains three bedrolls and three spare uniforms. If the characters take 10 minutes to search the tents, they also find a @UUID[Item.S7waxFzIC5bBD8Ku] and [[/award 132cp 76sp 17gp]].

You can configure whether the large group of hobgoblins are asleep, or has been alerted and are in formation in anticipation of an attack, by using the @UUID[Macro.0zY3YK2kJJXKgpk1] macro. You can also use this Macro to remove the Sleeping condition from all the hobgoblins if the player characters get spotted by a patrol.

Armory (Fourth Circle).name: Armory (Fourth Circle)
Armory (Fourth Circle).text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Fire crackles in a stone forge. Next to it stands a stack of crates and a wide tent.”
  • “The 12-foot-tall tent's entrance flaps are pulled back, revealing wooden shelves filled with weapons.”
  • “A hobgoblin smith stands at the forge, a sword pendant hanging from her belt. Several other hobgoblins move about the tent, taking inventory.”
  • (Secret) The secret to opening the gate to the fifth circle (area @UUID[.ynHC8IL93QsLP6Ri]{C5}) hangs on the blacksmith's belt.

Hobgoblins. Narine, a @UUID[Actor.0P4NsDwqjsONfO9y], is the blacksmith for Camp Firefield. The sword pendant on her belt is inscribed with a Goblin phrase that reads, “Forge ahead.” These words are a key to opening the gate to the field hospital (area C5). A hidden creature can grab the pendant from her belt unnoticed with a successful [[/skill sleightofhand 16]] check.

A @UUID[Actor.W4BXXPtkwSs99AUA] oversees two @UUID[Actor.gH1DBfitnFYlKtH8]{Hobgoblin Troopers} taking inventory in the tent.

The characters can sneak around this area unnoticed with a successful group [[/skill stealth 14]] check.

Hidden Gate. If a creature holds Narine's pendant and says “Forge ahead” aloud in Common, Goblin, or Infernal, the backside of the forge becomes a magic gate that leads to the field hospital (area @UUID[.ynHC8IL93QsLP6Ri]{C5}). If a creature is carrying the pendant as they pass through the portal, it disappears from their possession and falls on the ground in front of the portal.

Treasure. The crates contain broken weapons in need of repair and ten sets of @UUID[Item.tLmnbdtJMT17OkUD]{manacles with keys}. The armory holds fifty of every suit of light and medium armor and martial weapon in the core rules, as well as @UUID[Item.ITb30sWStd5yufL7]{fifty shields}, a @UUID[Item.cMPpWiw466jQVLOJ]{thousand arrows}, and a @UUID[Item.8eQ24SZSLfg9BHWi]{thousand crossbow bolts}. Narine carries a set of @UUID[Item.ad2u3y50Lmd6QhKE]{smith's tools}.

Field Hospital (Fifth Circle).name: Field Hospital (Fifth Circle)
Field Hospital (Fifth Circle).text:
This area has the following features:

  • “A long, 12-foot-high tent stands next to a small, well-tended garden.”
  • “Injured hobgoblins lie on cots in the tent as others dress their wounds.”
  • (Secret) The garden contains the gate to the great hall (area @UUID[.W77Z9ttxTYe9nyyv]{C6}).

Hobgoblins. Six wounded @UUID[Actor.gH1DBfitnFYlKtH8]{Hobgoblin Troopers}, each with 9 hit points remaining, lie on cots in the tent. These wounded soldiers avoid combat and surrender if threatened. A @UUID[Actor.LXtsMsWrvWLGDSJz] and eight @UUID[Actor.7qq7fybKzwAGTjEG]{Hobgoblin Brandbearers} tend to the wounded. The characters can sneak around outside the tent without the hobgoblins noticing them with a successful group [[/skill stealth 12]] check.

Garden Gate. The garden contains neat rows of medical plants and herbs growing around a ring of mushrooms. At the center lies a mortar and pestle set containing red and purple pulp. The mortar bears an Infernal inscription that reads, “The fiend's fruit opens the path.” A creature who examines the mortar and pestle and succeeds on a [[/tool tool=alchemist/herb 15]] recognizes that devil's blossom, a rare medicinal herb, was recently ground up into the pulp with these tools.

A creature can identify devil's blossom in the garden with a successful [[/skill nature 15]] check. If the creature already identified the flower pulp, they automatically succeed on this check. If a character fails this check, they still find the flower, but it takes them so long that the war mage in the tent comes out to the garden, notices the characters, and orders an attack.

When a creature grinds up a fresh flower using the mortar and pestle, a magic gate to the sixth circle (area C6) opens in the mushroom ring. If a creature is carrying the mortar and pestle as they pass through the portal, these disappear from their possession and fall on the ground in front of the portal.

Treasure. Any character who has an herbalism kit and is proficient with it can gather enough @UUID[Item.gc9KdXonegrOpms4]{herbs} in the garden to make one @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.L887NdWEP5NqHCrQ]{potion of greater healing}. They can craft this potion during a short or long rest.

Great Hall (Sixth Circle).name: Great Hall (Sixth Circle)
Great Hall (Sixth Circle).text:
The great hall is where Varrox's troops rest and relax. It has a 20-foot-high ceiling. Climbing the walls of the great hall without climbing equipment requires a successful [[/skill athletics 15]] check. This area has the following features:

  • “A long mead hall with open doors and a roaring fire within erupts with sounds of hobgoblins making merry.”
  • “Inside, hobgoblins sit at long tables devouring food and drinking mead. At the room's center, a group of hobgoblin cooks turn a boar on a spit over a fire.”
  • “Shelves on the walls hold food, herbs, spices, and kegs of mead.”
  • “Opposite the doors, an enormous painting of Bloodlord Varrox hangs on the wall. Above his visage, a balcony extends across the room, empty except for a statue of a hobgoblin with an open mouth.”
  • (Secret) A secret door behind the painting hides a staircase that leads up to the balcony.
  • (Secret) The statue on the balcony can activate the magic gate to the seventh circle (area @UUID[.NjQiirftLh6iUEac]{C7}).

Hobgoblins. Thirty @UUID[Actor.ovbBtPIFhbzA4hfQ]{Hobgoblin Recruits}, three @UUID[Actor.0P4NsDwqjsONfO9y]{Hobgoblin Incendiarists}, and one @UUID[Actor.W4BXXPtkwSs99AUA] are feasting in the hall. The recruits drank too much and are poisoned as a result. The characters have advantage on Charisma checks made to influence poisoned recruits.

Cookfire. The cookfire's flames are 5 feet high. If a creature touches the fire for the first time on a turn or starts their turn touching it, they take [[/damage 2d6 fire average]] damage.

Secret Door. A character notices the outline of the secret door behind Varrox's painting with a successful [[/skill investigation 15]] check. A character can use this door to access the balcony.

Statue Gate. An inscription in Goblin on the balcony statue reads, “Keep your fellow soldiers fed!” When a piece of food is placed in the statue's mouth, the statue becomes a magic gate to the seventh circle (area C7).

Treasure. The shelves hold @UUID[Item.U2vk8KShPdK1R9wZ]{ten barrels of mead}, worth 50 gp each, and @UUID[Item.jTQNrRSUH3n9chyl]{six sets of cook's utensils}.

Summoning Altar (Seventh Circle).name: Summoning Altar (Seventh Circle)
Summoning Altar (Seventh Circle).text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Three hooded hobgoblins chant at a massive stone altar before an obsidian arch.”
  • “Six armed hobgoblins stand back and watch the proceedings.”
  • “The altar area is encircled by pillars carved with scenes of hobgoblin and devil soldiers conquering other armies.”
  • (Secret) The obsidian archway is the magic gate leading to the eighth circle (area @UUID[.NjQiirftLh6iUEac]{C7}).
  • (Secret) A hobgoblin smokebinder hides behind the archway.

Hobgoblins. Six @UUID[Actor.gH1DBfitnFYlKtH8]{Hobgoblin Troopers} and a hidden @UUID[Actor.yV6nNPrDPlaVe5Jv] guard three @UUID[Actor.LXtsMsWrvWLGDSJz]{Hobgoblin War Mages} as they perform a summoning ritual. If all the mages die, become &reference[incapacitated apply=false], or move outside the circle of pillars, the summoning fails. Otherwise, at the start of the fourth round after the characters arrive, a @UUID[Actor.ApAFM8655T26KGOM] appears on the altar. A character who observes the ritual and succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 18]] check knows the hobgoblins are performing a ritual to summon a slaughter demon.

Any character who has a [[/skill perception 17 passive format=long]] spots the hidden smokebinder.

Pillars. A creature who examines the pillars and succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 13]] check finds an image that looks like the arch in this area with hobgoblins kneeling before it (see “Hidden Gate”).

Hidden Gate. If a creature uses an action to kneel before the arch, a magic gate opens that connects to the eighth circle (area @UUID[.y3EBqWuSKjJWyqgE]{C8}).

Shifting Library.name: Shifting Library
Shifting Library.caption: An incorporeal undead lair for 7th-level characters

drawings.Five Oozes Guard the Decanter and Attack: Five Oozes Guard the Decanter and Attack if Opened
drawings.50% Chance Hellhounds Pour Through and A: 50% Chance Hellhounds Pour Through and Attack from a Successful Hell Portal
drawings.A Magic Ward Keeps This Room Silenced: A Magic Ward Keeps This Room Silenced
drawings.The Office Door is Locked with No Visibl: The Office Door is Locked with No Visible Keyhole
drawings.Upon Death, Kiona triggers Mutual Destru: Upon Death, Kiona triggers Mutual Destruction

Energy Siphon.name: Energy Siphon
Energy Siphon.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of [[lookup @name]]'s next turn. [[lookup @name]] gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt by this attack.

Corrupting Phasing.name: Corrupting Phasing
Corrupting Phasing.description: [[lookup @name]] can move through other creatures and objects. [[lookup @name]] takes [[/damage 1d10 force average]] damage if she ends her turn inside an object. A creature takes 9 (2d8) necrotic damage the first time [[lookup @name]] passes through them on a turn.

Incorporeal Empowerment.name: Incorporeal Empowerment
Incorporeal Empowerment.description: Each incorporeal Undead within 120 feet of [[lookup @name]] ignores difficult terrain.

Spiritual Sacrifice.name: Spiritual Sacrifice
Spiritual Sacrifice.description: When [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw, she can lose 15 hit points and choose to succeed instead.

utility.condition: When Kiona fails a saving throw.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes two [[/item VP9EGi9yD45hUOqF]] attacks.

Rise from Death.name: Rise from Death
Rise from Death.description:
[[lookup @name]] conjures three @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.kM5t2O4qCuzJ1zkU]{Shadows}, two @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.QF2UAJTEJee41EIf]{Specters}, or one @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.Wo1ID8gjUFse24YQ] under her control. Each summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of [[lookup @name]] and acts immediately after her turn on the same initiative count.

Foundry Note

This item has 1 summon activity with 3 profiles for the three types of summons. To summon all six creatures, repeat the activity three times while only consuming the single limited use once.

Path of Pain.name: Path of Pain
Path of Pain.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses one other incorporeal Undead within 120 feet of her who can see her. That Undead can move up to their speed.

Death's Breath.name: Death's Breath
Death's Breath.description: When a creature within 5 feet of [[lookup @name]] hits her with an attack, she breathes a toxin at the creature. The creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] until the end of their next turn.

save.condition: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with an attack.

Restrain Them!.name: Restrain Them!
Restrain Them!.description: A 20-foot-radius sphere of spectral arms emerges from a point [[lookup @name]] can see within 120 feet of her. Each enemy in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be &reference[restrained] until the end of [[lookup @name]]'s next turn.

Ruinous March.name: Ruinous March
Ruinous March.description: [[lookup @name]] and each ally within 60 feet of her can move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Vitality Drain.name: Vitality Drain
Vitality Drain.description: [[lookup @name]] and each ally within 60 feet of her can make a melee attack (no action required). A creature hit by one of these attacks gains a level of exhaustion.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
[[lookup @name]] has three villain actions. She can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. She can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

[[/item VlOgNb9OuWFhuPtS]]

[[/item HmoQqhYB3F7YGC1Z]]

[[/item iNEIpvtXOfWpGcy3]]

Necrotic Drain.name: Necrotic Drain
Necrotic Drain.description:
Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage, or 13 (3d6 + 3) necrotic damage if the target can't see the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Foundry Note

For ease of use, this item will roll an additional d6 if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has either of the &reference[hiding] or &reference[invisible apply=false] conditions enabled.

Into the Light.name: Into the Light
Into the Light.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports inside a light source they can see within 15 feet of them that is emitting bright or dim light. While inside the light source, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the light source.

If the light source is extinguished by any means other than the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Steal Light action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is forced out, appears in an unoccupied space of their choice within 5 feet of the light source, and is &reference[paralyzed] until the end of their next turn.

Steal Light.name: Steal Light
Steal Light.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cause the light they are inside to erupt in a burst of brilliant radiance. Each creature within 15 feet of the light source must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 (4d6) radiant damage and loses any darkvision they have for 1 minute.

On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't lose their darkvision. After this, the light source extinguishes and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] appears in an unoccupied space of their choice within 5 feet of the light source.

Steal Light.name: Steal Light
Steal Light.description: You have lost any darkvision you may have had.

Life Drain (Group Attack).name: Life Drain (Group Attack)
Life Drain (Group Attack).description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 necrotic damage.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed if they end their turn inside an object.

Terrifying.name: Terrifying
Terrifying.description:
If an enemy starts their turn within 5 feet of three or more [[lookup @name lowercase]]s, the enemy must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[frightened] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]s until the start of their next turn. The DC for this saving throw equals 10 plus the number of [[lookup @name lowercase]]s within 5 feet of the enemy. On a successful save, the enemy is immune to the [[lookup @item.name]] trait of all [[lookup @name lowercase]]s for the next 24 hours.

Foundry Note

The saving throw DC of this item can be configured when using this item.

save.condition: When an enemy starts its turn within 5 feet of three or more of this monster

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Hellish Bite.name: Hellish Bite
Hellish Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage.

Hardened by Flame.name: Hardened by Flame
Hardened by Flame.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to fire damage, they take no damage. Instead, their skin darkens and hardens, and their AC increases to 18 until the end of their next turn.

Stealthy Hunter.name: Stealthy Hunter
Stealthy Hunter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track other creatures and on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide from creatures who are unaware of their presence.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales flame in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (3d6 + 4) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who isn't a [[lookup @name lowercase]] who fails the saving throw is lit on fire for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn), or until the target or another creature who can reach them uses an action to extinguish the flames. A creature who is on fire at the start of their turn takes 7 (2d6) fire damage. If a creature who is already on fire is set on fire again on a subsequent turn, the damage isn't cumulative, but the duration of the fire resets to 1 minute.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description: You are burning; you take [[/damage 2d6 fire average]] damage at the start of each of your turns.

Tug of War.name: Tug of War
Tug of War.description: When an enemy within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with a melee attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can make a Hellish Bite attack against that enemy. If the attack hits, the enemy is also &reference[grappled] (escape DC 12), and if the triggering attack was a weapon attack, the weapon used in the triggering attack can't be used to make any more attacks while the target is grappled. The grapple ends if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks a different target with Hellish Bite.

utility.condition: when an enemy within 5 feet hits you with a melee attack

Pseudopod.name: Pseudopod
Pseudopod.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature who isn't a Construct or an Undead, they must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] melds into the target's body.

While inside a creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside that host.

If the host creature takes 5 damage or more on a single turn from a source other than the ooze, the ooze must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or exit the host, entering the nearest unoccupied space of the ooze's choice. A cure ailment power, protection from poison spell, or lesser restoration spell cast on the host also forces the ooze out. By spending 5 feet of their movement, the ooze can voluntarily leave the host's body.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from a pool of blood.

Crimson Feast.name: Crimson Feast
Crimson Feast.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] consumes their host creature's bodily fluids. The host must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the host takes 5 (2d4) necrotic damage and is &reference[poisoned] until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the host takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned.

Decaying Touch.name: Decaying Touch
Decaying Touch.description:
Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (2d6) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or spend 1 Hit Die without any benefit. If the target has no Hit Dice to spend, they drop to 0 hit points instead.

If a Humanoid dies within 1 minute of being hit by this attack, their spirit rises as a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.QF2UAJTEJee41EIf] under the GM's control in an unoccupied space nearest to where that Humanoid died.

Raise Specter.name: Raise Specter
Raise Specter.condition: If a humanoid dies within 1 minute of this attack.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Decaying Touch.name: Decaying Touch
Decaying Touch.description: If you die during the next minute after being hit by the Specter, your spirit rises as a Specter under the GM's control in an unoccupied space nearest to where you died.

Corrupting Phasing.name: Corrupting Phasing
Corrupting Phasing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The specter takes [[/damage 1d10 force average]] damage if they end their turn inside an object. A creature takes 2 (1d4) necrotic damage the first time a [[lookup @name lowercase]] passes through them on a turn.

Hidden Movement.name: Hidden Movement
Hidden Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] turns &reference[invisible] and then moves up to their speed. At the end of this movement, the invisibility ends.

Agonizing Touch.name: Agonizing Touch
Agonizing Touch.description:
Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (4d6) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[dazed] (save ends at end of turn). Each time a target dazed in this way fails a saving throw to end the condition, their hit point maximum is halved. This effect is cumulative, and the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

If a Humanoid dies within 1 minute of being hit by this attack, their spirit rises as a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.QF2UAJTEJee41EIf] under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control in an unoccupied space nearest to where that Humanoid died.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Agonizing Touch.name: Agonizing Touch
Agonizing Touch.description: You are dazed. You can repeat the [[/save wisdom 14]] saving throw at the end of each of your turns. Each time you fail this saving throw, your hit point maximum is halved. This effect is cumulative, and the reduction lasts until you finish a short or long rest.

Agonizing Phasing.name: Agonizing Phasing
Agonizing Phasing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage 1d10 force average]] damage if they end their turn inside an object. A creature takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage the first time a [[lookup @name lowercase]] passes through them on a turn.

Throes of Oblivion.name: Throes of Oblivion
Throes of Oblivion.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, they collapse inward, creating a burst of painful psychic energy. Each creature within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name]] must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Denied Vitality.name: Denied Vitality
Denied Vitality.description: When a creature who the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of them regains hit points, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can attempt to sap the life energy restoring the creature. The creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or only regain half the number of hit points they otherwise would regain.

save.condition: When a creature that the monster can see within 30 feet of them regains hit points.

Psychic Enervation.name: Psychic Enervation
Psychic Enervation.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall &reference[prone] and be &reference[frightened] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While frightened in this way, the target can't stand up.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Visual Guide to Cursed Magic Items.name: Visual Guide to Cursed Magic Items
Visual Guide to Cursed Magic Items.description: An illustrated tome depicting and detailing cursed magic items.

Necromancy Spellbook.name: Necromancy Spellbook
Necromancy Spellbook.description: A spellbook containing necromancy spells, such as @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oyE5nVppa5mde5gT]{animate dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pO4zGe5LmFIYqJiL]{bestow curse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pybg5MNc3lkerH4Y]{blight}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7e3QXF10hLNDEdr6]{false life}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ODhLKBxLnvvLOnw1]{ray of enfeeblement}.

Soul Lamp.name: Soul Lamp
Soul Lamp.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

Swirling soul energy fills the glass globe of this lantern.

The lantern has 6 charges. As an action, you can speak the lantern’s command word and expend 1 charge to summon a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.QF2UAJTEJee41EIf] residing within the lantern. The specter appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. They know and can speak any language you know, obey your verbal commands, and act immediately after you in the initiative order. The specter is destroyed after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 hit points. The lamp can only have one specter summoned at a time.

The lantern regains 1 charge when a creature who isn't a Construct or Undead dies within 20 feet of the lantern, allowing the lamp to draw their soul into it.

Absorb Soul.name: Absorb Soul
Absorb Soul.condition: When a creature dies within 20 feet of the lantern.

Spell Scroll: Speak with Dead.name: Spell Scroll: Speak with Dead
Spell Scroll: Speak with Dead.description:
3rd Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be undead. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

Ritual Instructions for Undead Creation.name: Ritual Instructions for Undead Creation
Ritual Instructions for Undead Creation.description: This tome contains detailed instructions for ritually creating a lich, mummy, vampire, or other Undead creautre.

Staff of the Python.name: Staff of the Python
Staff of the Python.description:
(Requires attunement by a cleric, druid, or warlock)

You can use an action to speak this staff's command word and throw the staff on the ground within 10 feet of you. The staff becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.NpvwE1feOHyEqAbP]{Giant Constrictor Snake} under your control and acts on its own initiative count. By using a bonus action to speak the command word again, you return the staff to its normal form in a space formerly occupied by the snake.

On your turn, you can mentally command the snake if it is within 60 feet of you and you aren't incapacitated. You decide what action the snake takes and where it moves during its next turn, or you can issue it a general command, such as to attack your enemies or guard a location.

If the snake is reduced to 0 hit points, it dies and reverts to its staff form. The staff then shatters and is destroyed. If the snake reverts to staff form before losing all its hit points, it regains all of them.

Sapphire Studded Longsword.name: Sapphire Studded Longsword
Sapphire Studded Longsword.description:
A lengthy straight blade designed for slashing foes, the longsword is a highly versatile weapon that may also be wielded with two hands for more punishing strikes.

This longsword has sapphires studded along the entire length of it's hilt.

Pouch of Ruby Dust.name: Pouch of Ruby Dust
Pouch of Ruby Dust.description: A small pouch filled with ruby dust.

Wand of Magic Detection.name: Wand of Magic Detection
Wand of Magic Detection.description: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{Detect Magic} spell from it. The wand regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Kiona's Notes.name: Kiona's Notes
Kiona's Notes.description:
Kiona has filled nearly thirty books with notes and secrets about the Codex Mortis. If you spend 80 hours studying Kiona's notes, you gain the following benefits:

  • You have advantage on Intelligence checks to recall or understand lore about necromancy and the Codex Mortis.
  • You have advantage on death saving throws.
  • When you cast a necromancy spell, the gold piece cost of the spell's material components is halved.

Kiona's Notes.name: Kiona's Notes
Kiona's Notes.description: You have advantage on Intelligence checks to recall or understand lore about necromancy and the Codex Mortis. You have advantage on death saving throws. When you cast a necromancy spell, the gold piece cost of the spell's material components is halved.

Flask of Holy Water.name: Flask of Holy Water
Flask of Holy Water.description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged Attack against a target creature, treating the holy water as an Improvised Weapon. If the target is a fiend or Undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage. A Cleric or Paladin may create holy water by performing a Special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

attack.condition: Target must be a fiend or undead.

Spell Scroll: Raise Dead.name: Spell Scroll: Raise Dead
Spell Scroll: Raise Dead.description:
5th Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

You return a dead creature you touch to life, provided that it has been dead no longer than 10 days. If the creature's soul is both willing and at liberty to rejoin the body, the creature returns to life with 1 hit point.

This spell also neutralizes any poisons and cures nonmagical diseases that affected the creature at the time it died. This spell doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, or similar effects; if these aren't first removed prior to casting the spell, they take effect when the creature returns to life. The spell can't return an undead creature to life.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time the target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.

Spell Scroll: Bestow Curse.name: Spell Scroll: Bestow Curse
Spell Scroll: Bestow Curse.description:
3rd Level &Reference[Spell Scroll], Requires Concentration

You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. When you cast this spell, choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

  • Choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
  • While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
  • While cursed, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing.
  • While the target is cursed, your attacks and spells deal an extra 1d8 necrotic damage to the target.

A remove curse spell ends this effect. At the DM's option, you may choose an alternative curse effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The DM has final say on such a curse's effect.

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

Potion of Necrotic Resistance.name: Potion of Necrotic Resistance
Potion of Necrotic Resistance.description:
The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Necrotic type damage for 1 hour.

For other potions of resistance, roll on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.JzLOE4IxcmxjLLuz]{Potion of Resistance} table.

Onyx Staff set with Black Sapphires.name: Onyx Staff set with Black Sapphires
Onyx Staff set with Black Sapphires.description: A staff made out of onyx and set with black sapphires.

Ornate Golden Reliquary.name: Ornate Golden Reliquary
Ornate Golden Reliquary.description: An ornate reliquary made out of gold.

Ritual Instructions for Hell Portal.name: Ritual Instructions for Hell Portal
Ritual Instructions for Hell Portal.description:
This tome details a ritual that opens a portal to the Seven Cities of hell; alongside an annotation indicating that a special place within the library has already been prepared.

This ritual must be performed over the course of an hour without interruption, and the final step requires killing an &reference[incapacitated] creature who isn't a Construct or Undead.

Kiona's Spellbook.name: Kiona's Spellbook
Kiona's Spellbook.description: The spellbook Kiona used when she was still alive; it contains the following spells: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7p9IuWrSWFgfyQo2]{Alarm}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.bnjXlk13ZRJuf5d0]{Floating Disk}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.82jM6qD9axLJsTrH]{Illusory Script}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.B0pnIcc52O6G8hi8]{Longstrider}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7v06rdmUakoTk1LQ]{Magic Mouth}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ap4dmtshjEbwU3Ts]{Rope Trick}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.zMAWdyc8UVb37BK4]{Suggestion}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.UJJu9c2UvCzVljiP]{Web}.

Spell Scroll: Dimension Door.name: Spell Scroll: Dimension Door
Spell Scroll: Dimension Door.description:
4th Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

You teleport yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle, 300 feet."

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell.

If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 force damage, and the spell fails to teleport you.

Shifting Library.name: Shifting Library
Shifting Library.text:
Optimized for Five 7th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00006 inline]

Library Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Ancestral Curse. A prominent half-elf noble, Banara Starweaver, is the latest inheritor of an ancestral curse. Her trusted sages have tracked down a rare incantation to finally free Banara and her descendants from the curse, but the incantation is inscribed on a scroll in the Shifting Library's scroll room (area @UUID[.aOZqlYFTvPu8QXJ5]{K6}). Banara offers the characters 3,000 gp to recover the scroll.

Missing Mages. Just before their disappearance, human arcanists Brada and Micus wrote a controversial thesis on the nature of death, based on recorded fragments from the Codex Mortis. They left behind a note hinting that they seek to verify their thesis at the tome's last known location — the Shifting Library. In exchange for bringing back the arcanists or proof of their demise, the mages of Brada and Micus's order offer ten spell scrolls of the characters' choice. Each scroll must contain a wizard spell of 4th level or lower that requires no costly material components.

Spectral Librarian. A @UUID[Actor.hrVw12w0NP9V85be] has been spotted stealing tomes from a university library, and the characters are offered 3,000 gp to stop the thefts. When confronted, the undead vanishes, leaving behind an unstable portal to the Shifting Library.

Library Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of the Shifting Library has the following features:

Academic Luxury. The library's floors and walls are made of glittering, white-veined black marble inlaid with brass.

Ceilings. The library's ceilings are 10 feet high.

Chill of the Grave. The chill of the grave permeates the library. When a creature who isn't Undead takes a short or long rest within the library, they must succeed on a [[/save constitution 12]] saving throw to gain the benefits of that rest. A creature automatically succeeds on this saving throw if they are wearing cold weather gear or are resistant or immune to cold damage.

Illumination. Gas lamps on wrought iron stands are placed at regular intervals, filling each area of the library with dim light.

Private Collection. The library is a demiplane under Kiona's control. If a character carries a book out of the library, the book crumbles to dust then reappears on the shelf it was taken from. At the GM's discretion, supernatural tomes kept in the library aren't subject to this effect.

Librarians

When the Codex Mortis shattered Kiona's soul, pieces of her essence became separate phantoms whom Kiona dubbed librarians. Each librarian resembles Kiona, a half-orc sage, at a different point in her life between the ages of twenty and forty. Their attire varies between adventuring gear, academic dress, high society formalwear, and casual slacks and tunics. The Dread Lord surrounds herself with these spectral undead, who gather and catalog fragments of lore about the Codex Mortis.

The librarians ignore intruders who leave them be. If a creature speaks to or otherwise disturbs the librarians, or if the librarians notice a creature attempting to damage or take take anything from the library or touch any of the books, the librarians attack. If a creature attacks a librarian, any nearby librarians rush to their ally's defense. The librarians take advantage of their incorporeal nature to move through the bookshelves to attack then disappear.

Once they start fighting, the librarians battle until destroyed. Interrogating them yields no information. When a librarian is destroyed in the library, they leave behind a glowing blue ectoplasm.

Resting in the Library

Provided the characters first deal with any enemies in an area, they can take a short or long rest in any area without incident.

Entering the Library

There are two ways to enter the Shifting Library.

In the Shadows. The librarians frequently move in and out of the Mundane World, searching for new lore to add to Kiona's collection. A librarian can use an action to leave the Shifting Library and arrive at a destination they know of in the Mundane World, or vice versa. When they travel in this way from the Mundane World, a librarian leaves a shadowy rift in the space they left, which lasts for 30 seconds. A creature who enters this rift arrives in the library's entryway (area @UUID[.HfJLowGbJKa3ULFT]{K1}).

Kiona's Trap. If the characters have knowledge about the Codex Mortis that Kiona desires, the Dread Lord lays a magical trap in the form of a cursed tome or scroll. When a creature reads the text, they must make a [[/save charisma 20]] saving throw. On a failed save, the creature teleports directly to Kiona's study (area @UUID[.g7xrRr4VR5TK5rR9]{K8}), leaving the cursed text behind. On a successful save, the creature knows that the text was attempting to transport them somewhere and they can choose to fail the saving throw instead.

Kiona's Office.name: Kiona's Office
Kiona's Office.text:
The iron door to this room is locked and has no visible keyhole. A plaque on the door reads, “The blood of a being half in this world and half in another can open the door to knowledge.” A character who is proficient in Arcana or Religion knows that spectral Undead are often said to have one foot in the world of the living and another in the world of the dead.

If a spectral Undead touches the door, or if a creature coats part of their body in a librarian's ectoplasm (see @UUID[.AzxPDiSnbYHDYmIG#librarians]{Librarians}) then touches the door, the door unlocks. The iron door has AC 19, 27 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

This room has the following features:

  • “A spectral half-orc hovers over an iron desk, upon which a magic lantern swirls with unnatural blue light. Her face is furrowed with desperation as she examines the tomes and notes strewn across the desk.”
  • “Glass cases on the walls display jeweled rods, staffs, and wands, interspersed with small metal shelves filled with books.”
  • (Secret) The desk is warded against magic hostile to Kiona.

Kiona. If the characters reached the library of their own volition, @UUID[Actor.0JagcPO08RoCne5t] asks why they disturb her research. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=deception/persuasion 15]] check convinces Kiona they have information to share about the Codex Mortis. If Kiona's teleportation trap (see @UUID[.AzxPDiSnbYHDYmIG#entering-the-library]{Entering the Library}) brought the characters there, she asks what they know about the Codex Mortis.

If a character offers information about the codex's whereabouts and can either prove the information's veracity or succeed on a [[/skill skill=deception/persuasion 17]] check, Kiona gives the characters one item from her hoard as thanks before using an action to open a portal to a destination in the Mundane World of the characters' choosing. If the characters fail to prove their usefulness to Kiona, she attacks. Any remaining spectral Undead in the library hasten to the Dread Lord's side. Undead on the ground floor join combat immediately, while Undead on the upper floor appear in the office at the start of the third round of combat.

Kiona fights until reduced to 30 hit points or fewer, then she begs the characters for mercy. She opens a portal to the Mundane World and tells the characters they can take anything from her hoard, except her books. If the characters take her books, Kiona fights to the death.

Warded Desk. When a creature Kiona can see who isn't Undead casts a spell within 60 feet of her desk, the spellcaster must succeed on an [[/skill arcana]] check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level or take [[/damage 1d4 psychic average]] damage per level of the spell. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8]{dispel magic} spell cast on the desk ends the effect.

Treasure. The display cases, desk, and bookshelves contain Kiona's treasure hoard (see @UUID[.KSaxx0gR7RH0szye]{Kiona's Hoard}). The books in this room can be removed from the library without them disappearing. In addition, the characters find a key to the Hell gate (area @UUID[.CZeCbRlkJXKgVElB]{K5}).

Mutual Destruction.name: Mutual Destruction
Mutual Destruction.text:
If Kiona is destroyed, the following occurs:

  • Each book in the library immediately fades—except for those from Kiona's office (area @UUID[.g7xrRr4VR5TK5rR9]{K8}), which contain her personal notes—returning to the place the librarians stole it from.
  • A 10-foot-diameter portal immediately opens on both levels of the bookstacks. The one-way portals lead to the location the characters were when they entered the library; creatures can only use the portals to leave the library, not return to it.
  • After 1 hour, the library breaks apart as its walls and floors fade into the void. Any creature still in the library 1 minute after it begins to break apart takes [[/damage 3d10 psychic average]] damage and is teleported to a random location in the Mundane World (chosen by the GM).

Kiona's Hoard.name: Kiona's Hoard
Kiona's Hoard.text:
Kiona's hoard is contained in her office (area @UUID[.g7xrRr4VR5TK5rR9]{K8}). The hoard contains the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.4jqQe3KrDc1aiZei] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.FBKvxPv4DcLQXSM1]

  • @UUID[Item.PJa02dKo3QCtZ0vw] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.UZnItsk27CzzpnlN]
  • @UUID[Item.HksLhRWj8e80SDYk]{Jasper wand} (worth 25 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.3B9C4WG9EJU3UldK]{2 smooth black onyx stones} (worth 100 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.Hb9jDy8io0w9IkYS]{2 longswords with sapphire-studded hilts} (worth 150 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.eaL1OkNOiQuidart] (worth 200 gp)

  • @UUID[Item.jaKB1PRMX2TrG7Gh] (worth 500 gp)

  • @UUID[Item.ducQbB9cbIBfYi28]{Onyx staff set with black sapphires} (worth 750 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.hKUBmi6dQUnRvZMO] (worth 1,000 gp)
  • Velvet pouch containing [[/award 9cp 41sp 135gp]]

Shifting Library Areas.name: Shifting Library Areas
Shifting Library Areas.text:
The following areas are keyed to the Shifting Library Map.

@UUID[.6YgZAgo7DP1GYfrA]{K2. Foyer}
