Entryway.name: Entryway
Entryway.text:
This room is brightly lit by candles. It has the following features:

  • “Hundreds of blue-flamed candles in wall niches flood the room with light.”
  • “Against the north wall, two overstuffed leather chairs sit alongside a sideboard holding a decanter of bloodred wine and several bottles of liquor.”
  • (Secret) Five blood-borne oozes lurk at the bottom of the wine decanter.

Oozes. Kiona captured five @UUID[Actor.P0DvwMhQRu0DKQDY]{Blood-Borne Oozes}, who she now keeps as guardians in the decanter. The oozes attack any creature who opens the decanter and fight to the death. A character who examines the glassware without removing the lid can tell there are creatures inside with a successful [[/skill skill=arcana/investigation 14]] check.

Lighting. The candles' blue flames are illusions that produce no heat. A candle can be carried throughout the library, but it disappears if a creature removes it from the demiplane. Each candle sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

Door Out. The door that leads outside can't be opened. When a creature touches the door, they hear Kiona's voice in their mind say, “Only the void lies beyond.”

Treasure. The sideboard contains @UUID[Item.ysVxWQQjX5U1aKX5]{eight bottles of spirits} (worth 6 gp each).

Foyer.name: Foyer
Foyer.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “A large, rectangular table made of dark wood occupies an empty balcony. On one corner of the table sits a silver service bell and a conical lamp.”
  • “Behind the desk, a wrought iron rail overlooks the library's ground floor.”

For Whom the Bell Tolls. If the characters ring the service bell or linger for more than 5 minutes around the table, the four @UUID[Actor.5raDxLzNFk1BWMkl]{Lightthieves} from the ground floor bookstacks (area @UUID[.jLTqyr9DATPJyXoR]{K3}) arrive and attack. If the characters ring the bell more than once, the librarians from the upper floor bookstacks (area @UUID[.jLTqyr9DATPJyXoR]{K3}) also attack.

Bookstacks.name: Bookstacks
Bookstacks.text:
Both levels of the library contain bookstacks arranged on three walls. These areas have the following features:

  • “Gas lamps attached to the balcony's support pillars dimly illuminate rows of bookshelves.”
  • (If the characters haven't already provoked the librarians and engaged them in combat) “Spectral figures move between the stacks, replacing and removing books.”
  • (Secret) If the characters didn't attract their attention in area @UUID[.6YgZAgo7DP1GYfrA]{K2}, four lightthieves hide in the lamps on the bookstacks' ground floor.

Lightthieves. Four @UUID[Actor.5raDxLzNFk1BWMkl]{Lightthieves} escaped the Hell gate (area @UUID[.CZeCbRlkJXKgVElB]{K5}) and now infest the bookstacks. They make their homes in the lamps mounted on the ground floor. These fiends ignore Kiona and the librarians, instead ambushing and feeding on any creature carrying light sources who isn't Undead. If combat against a lightthief lasts more than 3 rounds, or if the characters damage the library during combat, the librarians on the same level as the battle join the fray, attacking the characters.

Librarians. Each floor of the bookstacks is haunted by a group of librarians made up of a @UUID[Actor.hrVw12w0NP9V85be], a @UUID[Actor.R8ZuoFAU5W9FMTYs], and five @UUID[Actor.Af4lRLRSNQBvOZwq]{Shades}. The librarians pore endlessly through books while roaming the stacks, hoping to glean new information about the Codex Mortis to share with Kiona. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill insight 14]] check can tell that disturbing the librarians' work or touching the books will be met with violence.

If combat against the librarians on one level of the library lasts more than 2 rounds, the librarians from the other level arrive at the start of the third round to aid their allies.

Gas Lamps. On both levels, each support pillar holds a gas lamp 5 feet above the floor. A lamp fixture has AC 11, 4 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. When a fixture is broken, it releases flammable gas in a 15-foot radius around it that lasts for 1 minute. A creature who takes fire damage while in the area of the gas takes an extra [[/damage 1d10 fire]] damage.

Books. Most of the books in the library are about necromancy. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill sleightofhand 16]] check can remove a book from a shelf without the librarians noticing. The characters can find books with any of the following information:

  • A @UUID[Item.gHiDSMBP8DFvvf2z]{ritual that opens a portal} to the Seven Cities of Hell; annotations indicate a special place in the library has been magically prepared for the ritual (this is the Hell gate in area @UUID[.CZeCbRlkJXKgVElB]{K5})
  • @UUID[Item.5ZyNaVMSG90nJJvL]{Detailed instructions} for ritually creating a lich, mummy, vampire, or other Undead creature
  • A @UUID[Item.4gyEzPvutK2a1M20]{spellbook} containing necromancy spells such as animate dead, bestow curse, blight, false life, or ray of enfeeblement
  • @UUID[Item.4c7OIVi94fPRar5j]{A visual guide to cursed magic items}

Ground Floor Desks.name: Ground Floor Desks
Ground Floor Desks.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “A large table and several writing desks are littered with open books.”
  • “Scattered notes are strewn about, written primarily in Common, but with smatterings of Infernal and Orc.”

Notes. The books and papers contain notes on the Codex Mortis and other necromantic lore. When a librarian finds important information in a tome, they bring it here for Kiona to collect. A character who spends 1 minute looking at the notes and makes an [[/skill investigation]] check, made with advantage if they can read Infernal or Orc, learns the following cumulative information based on the result:

9 or Lower. A half-orc sage named Kiona Duemois has been studying necromancy related to the Codex Mortis here. The codex is a powerful book that can reanimate the dead.

10—14. Kiona was killed in an accident attempting to decipher the Codex Mortis. The ritual shattered her soul, turned her into an undead creature, and created the librarians and the library. Kiona lost the Codex Mortis after the accident. The codex allows its wielder to command certain Undead.

15—19. Kiona searches for the Codex Mortis so she can raise an army of spectral undead and enhance the power of her current form. She sends the librarians out to the Mundane World to steal rare texts related to the Codex Mortis and store them in the library, where the librarians then pore over the pages for any clue about the infamous codex. The character also finds a hidden spell scroll (see “Treasure”).

20 or Higher. Kiona has begun sending her librarians into other worlds for books. The first place she has dared to send them is the Seven Cities of Hell. In the hands of a powerful mage, the codex can be used to restore the forms of destroyed vampires and liches imprisoned in the Seven Cities.

The first time a character makes a check to search these notes, they notice any librarians in the ground floor bookstacks (area K3) watching them closely. Additional characters can make another check to search the notes, but as soon as they do, these librarians attack.

Treasure. In addition to the notes, the first character who succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 15]] check to look through the lore finds a spell scroll of @UUID[Item.5LhWOQdLze1xacAs]{speak with dead} tucked within the stacks of paper.

Hell Gate.name: Hell Gate
Hell Gate.text:
A red velvet rope bars the door to this room. Hanging from the rope is a small placard with “DO NOT ENTER” printed in polite-but-firm slab serif type.

The door to this room is locked. A character can pick the lock with a successful [[/tool thief 20]] check or break the door open with a successful [[/check strength 12]] check. The key to this door is in Kiona's office (area @UUID[.g7xrRr4VR5TK5rR9]{K8}). The door has AC 15, 18 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Damaging the door draws the attention of the librarians from both levels of the library's bookstacks (area @UUID[.jLTqyr9DATPJyXoR]{K3}). Picking the lock and opening the door also attracts their attention unless the character succeeds on a [[/skill stealth 12]] check.

This room has the following features:

  • “The room reeks of decaying flesh with a hint of acrid woodsmoke.”
  • “The wall opposite the entrance is burned black and engraved with softly glowing red runes.”
  • “In the center of the floor lie the shriveled corpses of two bearded humans in mage robes. Their faces are frozen in expressions of horror.”

Corpses. To activate the Hell gate in this room, Kiona sacrificed Brada and Micus, two mages who dared to enter the library and touch the Dread Lord's books while searching for the location of the Codex Mortis. The bodies have no wounds, and a character who examines the bodies and succeeds on a [[/skill skill=arcana/medicine 13]] check knows the mages were killed by necrotic damage.

Infernal Runes. A creature who can read Infernal or who examines the runes and succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 17]] check knows that the runes are part of a ritual used to open a gate to the Seven Cities of Hell. As an action, a creature who can reach the runes can mar them with a weapon or tool, making it impossible to perform the ritual in this room until the runes are restored. If the runes are marred, each creature in this room must make a [[/save dexterity 15]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 4d10 force average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Hellgate. Kiona has used this gate twice. The ritual to reopen the gate is located in the bookstacks (see “Books” in area K3). To open the gate, a character must perform the ritual for one uninterrupted hour in this room. The ritual's final step requires killing an &reference[incapacitated apply=false] creature who isn't a Construct or Undead.

If the ritual is successful, the wall opposite the door becomes a swirling orange portal leading to the Seven Cities that lasts for 1 hour. The exact location the portal leads to is up to the GM's discretion. When the portal opens, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>50]]{50 percent chance} that four hellhounds come through it, attacking any creatures they come across and fighting to the death.

Scroll Room.name: Scroll Room
Scroll Room.text:
This room has the following features:

  • “Dozens of hive-like shelves cover the walls of this chamber, each stuffed with ancient, loose scroll cases. Some of the cases are sealed with wax or clay.”
  • “Two bearded, shadowy figures wearing mage robes silently arrange the scroll cases on the shelves, dripping spectral dust behind them.”
  • (Secret) A magic ward keeps this room silent.

Wraiths. The two @UUID[Actor.hrVw12w0NP9V85be]{Wraiths} in this room are Brada and Micus, adventurers sacrificed to open the Hell gate (see “Corpses” in area @UUID[.CZeCbRlkJXKgVElB]{K5}). Unlike the librarians, they don't resemble Kiona. They attack when they notice intruders, fighting to the death.

Silence Ward. To prevent the librarians from accidentally casting spells by reading scrolls aloud, Kiona warded this room with a permanent @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5VhqFROQYjr1P9lp] spell. If a character who has a [[/skill perception 18 passive format=long]] listens at the door or opens it, they notice no sound comes from the room. A creature inside this room is immune to thunder damage, deafened, and can't cast spells that include a verbal component. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] spell cast on the room ends the effect.

Treasure. Most of the scrolls contain personal accounts of necromancers doing grim research. A character who spends 2 minutes searching the scrolls finds a @UUID[Item.WIi1kmeTsmIpMoWc]{diamond} (worth 300 gp) and three spell scrolls: @UUID[Item.YkDgQz48ewf61mEL]{bestow curse}, @UUID[Item.oBoGNLEz8FxdBgAr]{dimension door}, and @UUID[Item.5LhWOQdLze1xacAs]{speak with dead}.

Storage.name: Storage
Storage.text:
The door to this area is held shut by stacks of books. A character who succeeds on a [[/check strength 11]] check forces the door open. If a character fails this check, the librarians in the ground floor bookstacks (area @UUID[.jLTqyr9DATPJyXoR]{K3}) attack.

This room has no light sources and the characters only notice the following features if they have a light or another way to see in the dark:

  • “Every area of this room is piled with books, filling it with a musty old-book smell.”
  • (Secret) Kiona's old spellbook is hidden among the tomes.

Treasure. Most of these books — biographies of mages, arcane history, and similar academic fare — have been deemed worthless to Kiona's hunt. However, a character who searches the piles of books for 10 minutes and succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 14]] check finds the @UUID[Item.kROFdyNVE0PuV5jX]{spellbook} Kiona used when she was alive. It contains the following spells: alarm, detect magic, floating disk, identify, illusory script, locate object, longstrider, magic mouth, rope trick, suggestion, and web. A @UUID[Item.2Eqck8gTRMbTxBFe]{small vial of rare ink} (worth 150 gp) is tucked into a space carved into the leather-bound book's back cover.

Pseudopod.name: Pseudopod
Pseudopod.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature who isn't a Construct or an Undead, they must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] melds into the target's body.

While inside a creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside that host.

If the host creature takes 5 damage or more on a single turn from a source other than the ooze, the ooze must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or exit the host, entering the nearest unoccupied space of the ooze's choice. A cure ailment power, protection from poison spell, or lesser restoration spell cast on the host also forces the ooze out. By spending 5 feet of their movement, the ooze can voluntarily leave the host's body.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from a pool of blood.

Crimson Feast.name: Crimson Feast
Crimson Feast.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] consumes their host creature's bodily fluids. The host must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the host takes 5 (2d4) necrotic damage and is &reference[poisoned] until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the host takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Lady Emer uses [[/item uq40LmOn6LDP73v5]] or makes three attacks using [[/item R8hijeM2CcABQDrS]], [[/item Y65Ac9xI0arOT9My]] or [[/item AalA0I5s21BKLY69]], if available.

Snake Bite.name: Snake Bite
Snake Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (5d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] until the end of Emer's next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target can't take reactions.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Longbow.name: Longbow
Longbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

Stone Sacrifice.name: Stone Sacrifice
Stone Sacrifice.description: When Lady Emer fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead by ending the effects of her Stone Gaze on a creature of her choice within 300 feet of her.

utility.condition: When failing a saving throw.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
Lady Emer has three villain actions. She can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. She can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

Pinning Shot.name: Pinning Shot
Pinning Shot.description: Lady Emer makes three [[/item 6SZYmVtrqYZq922u]] attacks against a creature touching the ground within 150 feet of her. If at least two of those attacks hit, the target is &reference[restrained] by arrows pinning their limbs to the ground. A creature restrained in this way or another creature who can reach them can use an action to pull out the arrows and end the condition.

Envenomed Stone.name: Envenomed Stone
Envenomed Stone.description: Lady Emer utters an ancient hex. Each creature within 60 feet of her who is being turned to stone by her Stone Gaze must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Mesmerizing Eyes.name: Mesmerizing Eyes
Mesmerizing Eyes.description: The glowing eyes of Emer's snakes gaze at one creature Emer can see within 60 feet of her. If the target can see Emer, they must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[charmed] until the start of the target's next turn. A target charmed in this way must immediately use their reaction, if available, to move up to their speed in a direction of Emer's choice.

Blinding Mucus.name: Blinding Mucus
Blinding Mucus.description: When a creature Lady Emer can see within 5 feet of her hits her with a melee attack, Lady Emer spits venom at their eyes. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 7 (2d6) acid damage and be &Reference[blinded] until the start of their next turn.

save.condition: When a creature within 5 feet hits with an attack.

I See You!.name: I See You!
I See You!.description: Lady Emer uses [[/item ValU1fezQdixczCp]] against each enemy she can see within 60 feet of her.

Medusa's Evolution.name: Medusa's Evolution
Medusa's Evolution.description: Lady Emer grows wings from her back, gaining a flying speed of 40 feet, then she moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks. After 1 minute, the wings crumble to dust and her flying speed is lost.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description: You have a flying speed of 40 feet for 1 minute.

Stone Puppets.name: Stone Puppets
Stone Puppets.description: Lady Emer mentally manipulates the stone in each creature who is being turned to stone by her Stone Gaze. Lady Emer and each of those creatures move up to their speed then make a weapon attack against a creature of Lady Emer's choice (no action required).

affects.special: Each creature being turned to stone by Stone Gaze.

Stone Gaze.name: Stone Gaze
Stone Gaze.description:
Emer fires beams of energy from her eyes at up to three creatures she can see within 60 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or begin turning to stone (save ends at end of turn). While turning to stone, a creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet and they have disadvantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws.

If a creature who is turning to stone is targeted by this action again and fails their save, their speed is reduced by another 10 feet and they are &Reference[dazed apply=false] until the effect ends.

If a creature who is turning to stone and dazed in this way is targeted by this action again and fails their save, they are &Reference[petrified] and can no longer make saving throws to end the effects of Stone Gaze. The petrification lasts until the creature is restored by Emer's Stone Sacrifice trait, a cure ailment power of 4th order or higher, a greater restoration spell, or a similar supernatural effect.

Foundry Note

This item contains two effects that can be applied to keep track of the stage of petrification. The second builds on top of the first, meaning any target at the second stage of petrification should have two effects. Once a creature reaches full petrification, simply use the regular Petrified condition.

Turning to Stone (Stage I).name: Turning to Stone (Stage I)
Turning to Stone (Stage I).description: While turning to stone, a creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet and they have disadvantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws.

Turning to Stone (Stage II).name: Turning to Stone (Stage II)
Turning to Stone (Stage II).description: A creature who is turning to stone is targeted by this action again and fails their save, their speed is reduced by another 10 feet and they are dazed until the effect ends.

Stinger.name: Stinger
Stinger.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). A cure ailment power or a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell ends this effect on a target.

save.condition: follow-up if the target is hit

Stinger.name: Stinger
Stinger.description: You take 2d6 acid damage at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is Large or smaller, they are &reference[grappled] (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is &reference[restrained] and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't bite another target.

Stubborn Rage.name: Stubborn Rage
Stubborn Rage.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to the frightened and stunned conditions while they have fewer than half their hit points or are within 60 feet of another [[lookup @name lowercase]] they can hear or see.

Foundry Note

This feature contains an effect that can be toggled on to grant the [[lookup @name]] immunities to the two conditions.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item kheJ60WGjbydTzXt]] attack and one [[/item .bF2IyDC 7KYgjGHor]] attack. They can replace one attack with a use of [[/item QY5xvP9v5SRXe9n7]].

Tail Sweep.name: Tail Sweep
Tail Sweep.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] swipes their tail in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or take 14 (2d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Scintillating.name: Scintillating
Scintillating.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't benefit from being &reference[invisible apply=false].

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item iQekNmLXcdbzgel2]] attacks, and they can use [[/item 5HsWlq0jsHTjx0E8]] or [[/item 6047lfg9G0oyoV0Y]], if available.

Frosted Reflection.name: Frosted Reflection
Frosted Reflection.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] reflects the appearance of a specific Medium or Small creature they've seen within the last week. This appearance is illusory and imperfect, showing a frostbitten version of the creature. The illusion lasts until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes thunder damage, uses this action again, or is incapacitated. For the duration, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] additionally knows any languages that creature knows.

It Stares Back.name: It Stares Back
It Stares Back.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] imposes fragility on a creature within 60 feet of them who is reflected by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Frosted Reflection. If the target can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is &reference[frightened] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn), or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] stops reflecting them. While frightened in this way, whenever the target takes damage, they take an extra 11 (2d10) psychic damage. On a successful save, the target isn't frightened, and they are immune to the It Stares Back of all cruxes for 24 hours.

It Stares Back.name: It Stares Back
It Stares Back.description: You are frightened of the monster. While frightened in this way, whenever you take damage, you take an extra 11 (2d10) psychic damage. You can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Immunity: It Stares Back.name: Immunity: It Stares Back
Immunity: It Stares Back.description: You are immune to the monster's It Stares Back feature for the next 24 hours.

Convocation of Ice.name: Convocation of Ice
Convocation of Ice.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] imbues the power of ice in themself or another Elemental they can see within 30 feet of them, granting one of the following effects of that Elemental's choice:

  • Frigid Sheen: The Elemental gains a mirror sheen that reflects damage for 1 minute. When the Elemental is hit with an attack by a creature they can see within 30 feet of them, the Elemental can use a reaction to reflect the attack. The Elemental is unaffected by the attack, and the attacker must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the attack's damage and effects are reflected back at the attacker as if the attack originated from the Elemental, turning the attacker into the target. On a successful save, the attacker takes half as much damage, but suffers no other effect.

  • Frost Squall: Frost swirls around the Elemental for 1 minute. For the duration, each non-Elemental creature who starts their turn within 15 feet of the Elemental has their speed reduced to 15 feet unless it is already lower until the end of their turn, and the first time they willingly move before the start of their next turn, they take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

Convocation of Ice: Frigid Sheen.name: Convocation of Ice: Frigid Sheen
Convocation of Ice: Frigid Sheen.description: The Elemental gains a mirror sheen that reflects damage for 1 minute. When the Elemental is hit with an attack by a creature they can see within 30 feet of them, the Elemental can use a reaction to reflect the attack. The Elemental is unaffected by the attack, and the attacker must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the attack's damage and effects are reflected back at the attacker as if the attack originated from the Elemental, turning the attacker into the target. On a successful save, the attacker takes half as much damage, but suffers no other effect.

Convocation of Ice: Frost Squall.name: Convocation of Ice: Frost Squall
Convocation of Ice: Frost Squall.description: Frost swirls around the Elemental for 1 minute. For the duration, each non-Elemental creature who starts their turn within 15 feet of the Elemental has their speed reduced to 15 feet unless it is already lower until the end of their turn, and the first time they willingly move before the start of their next turn, they take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

Rimeglass Touch.name: Rimeglass Touch
Rimeglass Touch.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) cold damage, and the target can't see or hear creatures other than themself and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] until the start of the crux's next turn.

(True Form only)

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from a natural crystal formation.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item VzKjQC8K0xFMTu07]] attacks.

Crystalline Shatter.name: Crystalline Shatter
Crystalline Shatter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shatters their hardened outer layer, returning to their true form and sending crystal shrapnel in all directions. Each creature within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Gem jellies are immune to this damage.

Harden.name: Harden
Harden.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] transforms into a psionically hardened crystalline form or back into their true form. While in crystalline form, the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s AC increases to 20, their speed becomes 0, they can't make Pseudopod attacks, they have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and they gain vulnerability to thunder damage.

Foundry Note

This monster comes with a passive togglable effect to switch to and from its Crystalline Form.

Crystalline Form.name: Crystalline Form
Crystalline Form.description: While in crystalline form, the monster's AC increases to 20, their speed becomes 0, they can't make Pseudopod attacks, they have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and they gain vulnerability to thunder damage.

Reactive Shatter.name: Reactive Shatter
Reactive Shatter.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes thunder damage, they use [[/item ZtVzUNUDymzXc910]].

utility.condition: When taking thunder damage.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

Alchemical Ingredients.name: Alchemical Ingredients
Alchemical Ingredients.description: After the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, a creature can make a DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check using an herbalism kit and the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s gullet, destroying the gullet in the process. On a success, the creature creates three doses of a salve. One dose of this salve can be applied to a petrified creature as an action, and 1 minute after the salve is applied, the petrified condition ends for that creature.

Toxic Ichor.name: Toxic Ichor
Toxic Ichor.description: A creature who deals piercing or slashing damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while within 5 feet of them takes 2 (1d4) poison damage.

damage.condition: when dealt piercing or slashing damage

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item DAf0EFOTRyAmPKuX]] and makes one [[/item EQ5yW1FYkY2pRcTB]] attack or uses [[/item PMgwbi5bnXQ1DaZQ]], if available.

Petrifying Eye Beams.name: Petrifying Eye Beams
Petrifying Eye Beams.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one or two creatures they can see within 30 feet of them. Each target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[restrained] as they magically begin to turn to stone. Until the end of the restrained creature's next turn, they or an ally within 5 feet of them can use an action to cut the encroaching stone from the restrained creature's body using a weapon that deals slashing damage. When they do, the restrained creature takes [[/damage 2d12 slashing average]] damage, which can't be reduced in any way, and they are no longer restrained.

A creature restrained in this way must repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn. On a successful save, the effect ends. On a failed save, this creature is petrified until freed by a cure ailment power of 4th order or higher, a greater restoration spell, or a similar supernatural effect.

Poison Fumes.name: Poison Fumes
Poison Fumes.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales poisonous fumes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in this area must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (4d4) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage ona successful one.

Poison Splash.name: Poison Splash
Poison Splash.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes piercing or slashing damage, their wound spews poison. Each creature within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

save.condition: when the monster takes piercing or slashing damage

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

Steady.name: Steady
Steady.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on ability checks and saving throws against being knocked prone.

Swoop.name: Swoop
Swoop.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] flies more than 20 feet in a straight line toward their target and then hits them with a Claw attack on the same turn, the target is &reference[grappled] (escape DC 14). While the target is grappled in this way, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Beak attacks against the target but can't make Claw attacks. Grappling a Medium or smaller creature imposes no penalty on the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s speed.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item 1g0Em94t7RueXVWx]] attack, and they can make one [[/item 8Or9A7pAzkb4pBwD]] attack, use [[/item QfmHr1STI5zFp7D5]], or use [[/item baTgFSgDMLtKbeiM]].

Buffet.name: Buffet
Buffet.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] beats their wings in mighty gusts of wind. Each creature not grappled by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] within a 30-foot cone originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make a DC 14 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage, is pushed 5 feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and is knocked &reference[prone].

Piercing Cry.name: Piercing Cry
Piercing Cry.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] lets out an earsplitting screech. Each enemy within 60 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] who can hear them must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[frightened] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for them, they are immune to the [[lookup @item.name]] of all [[lookup @name lowercase]]s for the next 24 hours.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move the target 5 feet in any direction.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

Deadly Leap.name: Deadly Leap
Deadly Leap.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s long jump is up to 30 feet and their high jump is 15 feet, with or without a running start. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] leaps at least 20 feet toward a target and then hits them with a Bite or Claw attack, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked &reference[prone].

Keen Sight and Smell.name: Keen Sight and Smell
Keen Sight and Smell.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item XOZdnhZUw6XlKsx0]] and one [[/item jlUmgkowTsqxbqIo]] attack.

Bear Hug.name: Bear Hug
Bear Hug.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] attempts to grab and crush a creature they can see within 5 feet of them. The target must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) bludgeoning damage and is &reference[grappled apply=false] (escape DC 15). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not grappled. Until this grapple ends, the target is &reference[restrained apply=false] and takes 5 (1d10) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of their turns. The grapple ends if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] on another target or makes a Claw attack against another target.

Bear Hug: Grappled.name: Bear Hug: Grappled
Bear Hug: Grappled.description: You are grappled. While grappled, you are restrained, and you take [[/damage 1d10 bludgeoning average]] at the start of each of your turns.

Hulking Rush.name: Hulking Rush
Hulking Rush.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage, they can move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

utility.condition: When the monster takes damage.

Disguise Kit.name: Disguise Kit
Disguise Kit.description: This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a visual disguise.

Mason's Tools.name: Mason's Tools
Mason's Tools.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in masonry.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Owlbear Feather Quill & Inkpot Set.name: Owlbear Feather Quill & Inkpot Set
Owlbear Feather Quill & Inkpot Set.description: A set of twelve quills made from Owlbear feathers and an assortment of inkpots with black, gold, green, and purple ink.

Thieves' Tools.name: Thieves' Tools
Thieves' Tools.description: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

Crossbow Bolt.name: Crossbow Bolt
Crossbow Bolt.description: This ammunition is used for all varieties of crossbow and is typically a short metal shaft with a narrow piercing tip.

Griffon Egg.name: Griffon Egg
Griffon Egg.description: This 3-foot-diameter, 4-foot-high egg weighs 200 pounds. After [[/r 1d6]] weeks, a Medium baby griffon noncombatant hatches from the egg. After 1 year, the creature becomes a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.2TWhmFl9Iv8PE5Z8]. The GM can advance or slow this timeline to suit the campaign's pacing.

Alchemist's Fire.name: Alchemist's Fire
Alchemist's Fire.description: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

Forgery Kit.name: Forgery Kit
Forgery Kit.description: This small box contains a variety of papers and parchments, pens and inks, seals and sealing wax, gold and silver leaf, and other supplies necessary to create convincing forgeries of physical documents. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a physical forgery of a document.

Bag of Beans.name: Bag of Beans
Bag of Beans.description:
Inside this heavy cloth bag are [[/r 3d4 #Bag of Beans contents]] dry beans. The bag weighs 1/2 pound plus 1/4 pound for each bean it contains.

If you dump the bag's contents out on the ground, they explode in a 10-foot radius, extending from the beans. Each creature in the area, including you, must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d4 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

If you remove a bean from the bag, plant it in dirt or sand, and then water it, the bean produces an effect 1 minute later from the ground where it was planted. The GM can choose an effect from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.4ryVFV5LPHPzRKxl]{Bag of Beans} table, determine it randomly, or create an effect.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.4ryVFV5LPHPzRKxl rollable]

Potion of Gaseous Form.name: Potion of Gaseous Form
Potion of Gaseous Form.description:
This potion's container seems to hold fog that moves and pours like water.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2IWiZAJtOGDoKjiz]{Gaseous Form} spell for 1 hour (no concentration required) or until you end the effect as a bonus action.

Heavy Ebony Crossbow with Gold Filigree.name: Heavy Ebony Crossbow with Gold Filigree
Heavy Ebony Crossbow with Gold Filigree.description:
A large crossbow mounted on a sturdy block of wood which is loaded using a hand crank and fires thick steel bolts with deadly acceleration that punches through armor and flesh.

This crossbow is made from sturdy ebony wood and decorated with gold filigree.

Lyre.name: Lyre
Lyre.description:
A lyre to evoke awe, wonder, or fear in your audience.

If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus. Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

Ball Bearings.name: Ball Bearings
Ball Bearings.description: As an action, you can spill these 1,000 tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level area 10 feet square. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.

Winged Boots.name: Winged Boots
Winged Boots.description:
Wondrous item, (requires attunement)

While you wear these boots, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can use the boots to fly for up to 4 hours, all at once or in several shorter flights, each one using a minimum of 1 minute from the duration. If you are flying when the duration expires, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land.

The boots regain 2 hours of flying capability for every 12 hours they aren't in use.

Viol.name: Viol
Viol.description:
A viol to evoke awe, wonder, or fear in your audience.

If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus. Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

Dust of Disappearance.name: Dust of Disappearance
Dust of Disappearance.description:
Wondrous item

Found in a small packet, this powder resembles very fine sand. There is enough of it for one use.

When you use an action to throw the dust into the air, you and each creature and object within 10 feet of you become invisible for 2d4 minutes. The duration is the same for all subjects, and the dust is consumed when its magic takes effect.

If a creature affected by the dust attacks or casts a spell, the invisibility ends for that creature.

Ring of Mind Shielding.name: Ring of Mind Shielding
Ring of Mind Shielding.description:
Ring (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this ring, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.

You can use an action to cause the ring to become invisible until you use another action to make it visible, until you remove the ring, or until you die.

If you die while wearing the ring, your soul enters it, unless it already houses a soul. You can remain in the ring or depart for the afterlife. As long as your soul is in the ring, you can telepathically communicate with any creature wearing it. A wearer can't prevent this telepathic communication.

Poisoner's Kit.name: Poisoner's Kit
Poisoner's Kit.description: A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft or use poisons.

Potion of Poison.name: Potion of Poison
Potion of Poison.description:
This concoction looks, smells, and tastes like a potion of healing or other beneficial potion.

However, it is actually poison masked by illusion magic. An identify spell reveals its true nature.

If you drink it, you take 3d6 poison damage, and you must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. At the start of each of your turns while you are poisoned in this way, you take 3d6 poison damage. At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat the saving throw. On a successful save, the poison damage you take on your subsequent turns decreases by 1d6. The poison ends when the damage decreases to 0.

Foundry Note

To apply the reduced damage from a successful Constitution save, please use the Other Formula (set at 1d6) as required.

Basilisk Collar.name: Basilisk Collar
Basilisk Collar.description: A dragon-scale collar meant to be put around the neck of a basilisk.

Wand of Restoration.name: Wand of Restoration
Wand of Restoration.description:
Wand, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This wand has 6 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 2 of its charges to cast the lesser restoration spell from it, or 4 charges to cast the greater restoration spell from it.

The wand regains 1d4 + 2 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand’s last charge, roll a [[/r d20]]. On a roll of 1, the wand crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

Potion of Heroism.name: Potion of Heroism
Potion of Heroism.description:
This blue potion bubbles and steams as if boiling.

For 1 hour after drinking it, you gain 10 temporary hit points that last for 1 hour. For the same duration, you are under the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8dzaICjGy6mTUaUr]{Bless} spell (no concentration required)

Foundry Note

The Other Formula button can be used to roll the bonus 1d4 received from Bless.

Caltrops.name: Caltrops
Caltrops.description: As an action, you can spread a single bag of caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.

Crystal Decanter & Goblet Set.name: Crystal Decanter & Goblet Set
Crystal Decanter & Goblet Set.description: A set consisting of a crystal decanter and six crystal goblets.

Cloud Fang Keep.name: Cloud Fang Keep
Cloud Fang Keep.text:
Optimized for Five 8th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00007 inline]

Keep Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Art Collector. Alira Zoransk, an eccentric gnome art collector, wishes to possess a full set of crystal instruments crafted by a renowned gnomish artisan. She lacks only one, an ornate crystal flute stored in a display case in Lady Emer's grand salon (area @UUID[.qmf3RqAMs07hGBAm]{E4}). Alira offers the characters 5,000 gp to collect the flute.

Blight Cure. Tahir Zuljali, a human druid, seeks to halt a blight killing a nearby forest. They ask the characters to retrieve a rare plant called the petrified tear, which can save the forest—but this plant only grows in a medusa's stone garden. The druid hopes the characters can find a specimen in Cloud Fang Keep's garden (area @UUID[.w2PeGosFjNOTrSQw]{E5}).

Dreamwalker's Plea. A hobgoblin adventurer, Varnes Dwell, appears to the characters in their dreams. He begs the characters for rescue, as his physical body lies petrified within Cloud Fang Keep's garden (area @UUID[.w2PeGosFjNOTrSQw]{E5}).

Keep Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of Cloud Fang Keep has the following features:

Ceilings. The stone ceilings are 60 feet high. The ceilings in each chamber have been patched up, but the halls still have holes that allow snow into the keep.

Doors. Lady Emer has removed all the keep's interior doors and replaced them with heavy velvet curtains that muffle sound. Stone doors lead into the entrance hall (area @UUID[.xq5hcTZRMuuR9Tod]{E1}) from outside, and every area adjoining the stone garden (area @UUID[.w2PeGosFjNOTrSQw]{E5}) has stone doors leading to it. Doors and doorways are 10 feet high.

Illumination. Low-burning lanterns fill the halls with dim light. Chandeliers enchanted with permanent @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.CAxSzHWizrafT033] spells provide colorful dim light in each chamber.

Walls. Climbing the walls of the keep without equipment requires a successful [[/skill athletics 14]] check. If the check fails by 5 or more, the wall crumbles when the creature is halfway to their destination and they fall.

Guardians

Lady Emer cares for several creatures who serve as her guards and pets. They are trained to attack intruders and to alert her to invited guests.

Defeated Guardians. Unless otherwise noted, if the keep's guardians are clearly losing a battle to intruders, they flee to warn Lady Emer in the library (area @UUID[.xLQFyJB06EpvdqGU]{E6}). If she has been warned of intruders, Lady Emer moves to the stone garden (area @UUID[.w2PeGosFjNOTrSQw]{E5}) and sends the guardians who warned her to patrol the perimeter of the keep.

Defeated Characters. Lady Emer's guardians try to keep defeated characters alive and bring them to Lady Emer, who petrifies her prisoners and displays them in the stone garden (area E5).

Resting in Cloud Fang Keep

Once an area is clear of enemies, the characters can take a short rest there uninterrupted. If the characters take a long rest in the lair while Lady Emer is alive, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>50]]{50 percent chance} she finds them 1 hour into the long rest.

Entering Cloud Fang Keep

Perched atop Frigid Summit, Cloud Fang Keep is 23,421 feet above sea level. The area outside the lair is a high altitude and extreme cold environment. You can find rules for these adventure environments in the game's core rules.

The crumbling castle's stone double doors are flanked by two trained @UUID[Actor.mxFy5n1YfSOcBYjE]{Owlbears} disguised as statues thanks to an illusion created by the castle. If the characters observe the castle from a distance for at least 5 minutes before entering, they notice that another four owlbears patrol the castle's perimeter, while four @UUID[Actor.UH4dEEInp5AKVnSS]{Griffons} patrol the skies and occasionally visit a nest atop the ruined tower.

As the party approaches the castle, characters who succeed on a [[/skill perception 15]] check notice the owlbear statues twitching and breathing; otherwise, they are &reference[surprise]{surprised} when the owlbears attack. When the characters come within 30 feet of the owlbears, the owlbears attack and the statue illusion ends. At the start of the second round of combat, the four owlbears on patrol join the fray. A @UUID[Actor.0ABqZTorYS1zAcqU] emerges from the first two owlbears to die.

At the start of the fourth round of combat, a griffon from the roost (area @UUID[.vCtbbfIltBcyM8gJ]{E2}) swoops down and joins the fray. The griffon tries to capture a character and bring them back to the roost.

The owlbear statues have the Secret disposition and cannot be interacted with by players. You can use the @UUID[Macro.c4LKyfasVo84TpfB] macro to toggle their illusion on or off, which will change their visuals and their disposition.

Owlbears make spectacular guardians, and they're always a good topic of conversation for guests. Everyone wants to know how I trained them, what their names are, and if they do tricks. Well, they don't, and they smell atrocious. You probably would too if your diet consisted mainly of monster hunters and thieves.

— Lady Emer

Blood-Borne Oozes

For convenience, the blood-borne oozes simply emerge from the owlbears when they die. However, for more unpredictability, you can have each ooze make a [[/save constitution]] saving throw whenever an owlbear takes 5 or more damage, per their Pseudopod attack.

Lady Emer's Hoard.name: Lady Emer's Hoard
Lady Emer's Hoard.text:
Lady Emer's grand salon (area @UUID[.qmf3RqAMs07hGBAm]{E4}) contains the bulk of her assassination trophies, and the griffon roost (area @UUID[.vCtbbfIltBcyM8gJ]{E2}) holds a @UUID[Item.7jnEfBYS1SAa25gV]. The hoard includes the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.CSotbrzNJMMrcUxC]
  • @UUID[Item.WavOu66eP4kPWo9K]{Pair of winged boots}
  • @UUID[Item.argvhNMsl1aci2BB]
  • @UUID[Item.fPktaemW3HHVoIgf] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.aV156ktyCij1SQZZ]
  • @UUID[Item.IkucnwgT4dKWyKXf]
  • @UUID[Item.g6RNLPeeONHuQZbe]
  • @UUID[Item.dJqIYVKLMOPipxN4]{2 Potions of Poison}
  • @UUID[Item.6LqfUipQnRHAx788]{5 bottles of serpent venom}
  • @UUID[Item.K8Xyf31CXNEKxZ3E]{Lyre} (worth 30 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.YfcUeIX6L6VRL8oV]{2 viols} (worth 30 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.D7W1CkrOW9HP1cJz] (worth 350 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.Jy9l9W2WVFECfX7B] (worth 1,500 gp)
