Cloud Fang Keep Areas.name: Cloud Fang Keep Areas
Cloud Fang Keep Areas.text:
The following areas are keyed to the Cloud Fang Keep Map.

@UUID[.xq5hcTZRMuuR9Tod]{E1. Entrance Hall}

@UUID[.vCtbbfIltBcyM8gJ]{E2. Griffon Roost}

@UUID[.z9D7JwHHxGgg1XJD]{E3. Storage Room}

@UUID[.qmf3RqAMs07hGBAm]{E4. Grand Salon}

@UUID[.w2PeGosFjNOTrSQw]{E5. Stone Garden}

@UUID[.xLQFyJB06EpvdqGU]{E6. Library}

@UUID[.xnAQdAseAjj4nfZi]{E7. Parlor}

Entrance Hall.name: Entrance Hall
Entrance Hall.text:
The chandelier in this hall glows brighter than the others, filling the chamber with bright light. The entrance hall has the following features:

  • “Moldy, faded tapestries decorate this welcome hall that smells of animal musk.”
  • “A pile of animal bones and refuse sits in the northeast corner of the room. It is clearly the source of the odor.”
  • (Secret) Blood-borne oozes hide in the refuse pile.
  • (Secret) The tapestries hide crumbling walls and are covered in toxic mold.

Moldy Tapestries. A character who examines a tapestry and succeeds on a [[/skill nature 17]] check discovers it is covered in flemgot, a mind-altering mold that weakens Humanoids who inhale it. Each Humanoid who spends longer than 1 minute in this room must succeed on a [[/save constitution 16]] saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. While poisoned in this way, they have vulnerability to poison damage and have disadvantage on saving throws made to avoid or end the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition on themself. A creature who succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effects of flemgot for 24 hours.

Owlbear Nest. The refuse pile is a nest for the owlbears who patrol. Made of bones, feathers, and pieces of destroyed leather armor, it is filled with bloody bones, rusty blades, and hidden treasure (see below).

A creature who succeeds on a [[/skill perception 16]] check before touching the nest notices the three @UUID[Actor.0ABqZTorYS1zAcqU]{Blood-Borne Oozes} hiding inside it. The oozes ambush any creature who investigates the nest, but otherwise remain there. They owe no loyalty to Lady Emer and don't warn her of intruders.

Treasure. A creature who searches the owlbear nest and succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 12]] check find a @UUID[Item.9vlzHlgeCaBsa4cA]{silver necklace} (worth 15 gp) and @UUID[Item.7iFsT3oMvPloWX56]{ten crossbow bolts}.

If a Humanoid fails their saving throw against the moldy tapestries' poison, you can select their token and use the @UUID[Macro.dBqpmFTHhKgc7vKQ] macro to apply the effect. This will last for 1 hour and automates the poison vulnerability.

Griffon Roost.name: Griffon Roost
Griffon Roost.text:
Spiral stairs lead 120 feet to the top of this tower where the griffons roost. On the top floor, the tower's walls and ceiling have been removed, exposing it to the outside. As the characters make their way upstairs, they can hear the griffons move and squawk around overhead.

The roost has the following features:

  • “The stairs emerge into the middle of a gigantic nest made of wet branches and filled with bones and feathers. The walls and ceiling are gone, exposing the nest to the sky.”
  • “Two enormous griffons sit in the nest, tearing apart a stag carcass as they devour chunks of its flesh.”
  • “A gray-speckled egg as wide as a wagon wheel sits on the west edge of the nest.”
  • (Secret) More griffons are in the sky, returning from a hunt.
  • (Secret) The wyvern lounging in the central courtyard can be spotted by a creature on the northeast edge of the nest.

Nest. The nest is difficult terrain for non-griffon creatures.

Griffons. A family of four @UUID[Actor.UH4dEEInp5AKVnSS]{Griffons} patrol the castle and serve as Lady Emer's mounts and guardians. Two griffons are in the nest when the characters arrive. Another two in the sky return to the nest at the start of the second round of combat. Only one griffon arrives as reinforcements if the characters have already defeated a griffon (see @UUID[.c8kTxT70Y8l7u2L4#entering-cloud-fang-keep]{Entering Cloud Fang Keep}).

If the characters outnumber the griffons, the griffons try to pick up and drop foes to the ground or use Buffet to push them off the tower. While foes remain in the nest, the griffons ignore foes outside the nest. If the griffons outnumber the characters, they engage in melee, hoping to kill the intruders quickly and devour their bodies.

The griffons fight to the death to defend their nest and don't pursue enemies who retreat inside the castle.

Wyvern Below. A creature who looks over the side of the nest and into the stone garden (area @UUID[.w2PeGosFjNOTrSQw]{E5}) can see the @UUID[Actor.NEyFqOAwIqj6qeuY] lounging on the pillar.

Treasure. The 200-pound egg is a @UUID[Item.7jnEfBYS1SAa25gV] (see @UUID[.oHJO5wmxdDPpSPfS]). A creature who spends at least 5 minutes picking through the bones in the nest finds a @UUID[Item.P1xba3jAdBIx841K]{bag of ball bearings}, a @UUID[Item.mFaVKhaqm0hn4yqq]{bag of caltrops}, and a flask of @UUID[Item.8FD6PdGvKyhJWG0p]{alchemist's fire} wrapped in leather.

Storage Room.name: Storage Room
Storage Room.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Porcelain dust fills the air, and the room smells faintly of garlic and dust.”
  • “Crates stand in neat stacks along the east wall while broken statuary lies in piles across the floor.”
  • (Secret) Lady Emer's basilisks sleep amid the rubble on the west wall.
  • (Secret) Rubble hides a trapped glyph on the ground in the south doorway.

Rubble-Strewn Floor. The rubble is difficult terrain for creatures who walk on four or fewer legs. (The basilisks have eight legs.)

Basilisks. Blinkers and Blunders are Lady Emer's prized pet @UUID[Actor.SZNes7lsJHR9EoCW]{Basilisks}. Each wears a @UUID[Item.e7uiqQqFLGEElhi2]{dragon-scale collar} with a gold name tag. A creature who has a [[/skill perception 17 passive format=long]] notices the basilisks sleeping among the rubble and spots their shiny collars. If the characters succeed on a group [[/skill stealth 12]] check, they can sneak through the room without waking the basilisks. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill sleightofhand 17]] check can remove a basilisk's collar without waking the creature.

Trapped Glyph. The rubble-covered glyph is a trap created by the illusionist who lived in the keep. Lady Emer and her guardians know about the trap and only use the north entrance to the room. A creature who succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 17]] check notices the glyph on the ground. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the glyph's aura of illusion magic.

When a creature passes over the glyph, it erupts with magical energy. Each creature within 10 feet of the room's south entrance sees an illusion of what they fear most and must succeed on a [[/save wisdom 17]] saving throw or be &reference[frightened] for 1 minute or until that creature takes damage. While frightened by this magic, a creature must scream loudly (which wakes the basilisks) and run in a clockwise circuit around the lair (from area @UUID[.z9D7JwHHxGgg1XJD]{E3} to @UUID[.qmf3RqAMs07hGBAm]{E4} to @UUID[.xLQFyJB06EpvdqGU]{E6}, and so on), moving their full speed and taking the Dash action each turn. Once the glyph triggers, it can't trigger again for 24 hours.

If the glyph loses its magic, it can no longer trigger and the frightened condition ends for all creatures affected by the trap. Treat the glyph as a 4th-level spell for the purpose of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] or similar effects. A creature can make a [[/tool thief 17]] check to scratch out the glyph. On a successful check, the glyph loses its magic; otherwise, the trap triggers.

Treasure. The crates contain a pouch containing [[/award 200gp]] and enough food and water to sustain a Medium creature for 90 days. The basilisk collars are worth 150 gp each.

Grand Salon.name: Grand Salon
Grand Salon.text:
This area has a 30-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “Shimmering lights from three chandeliers illuminate a stained-glass ceiling that depicts suns, moons, and planets. The reflections of the chandelier and stained glass gleam on a polished marble floor with a wide space for dancing.”
  • “The chamber's northwest corner holds comfortable couches and a side table with decorative ashtrays.”
  • “The northeast corner is set with four wooden chairs next to a harpsichord. Musical instruments sit on each chair.”
  • “Two glass-and-marble display cases filled with glittering treasures stand against the south wall.”
  • (Secret) The ceiling can create a mesmerizing illusion when a creature tampers with the display cases.

Display Case Trap. Lady Emer uses the keep's trapped display cases to keep her treasures safe. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals auras of illusion magic on the display cases, the chandeliers, and the ceiling.

The cases are locked, and Lady Emer carries a key. A display case's glass top has AC 13, 9 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. A creature can pick the lock with a successful [[/tool thief 18]] check. If this check fails or if a display's glass is broken, the trap triggers.

When the trap triggers, the chandeliers put on a brilliant light display as the stained-glass images dance enthrallingly for 1 minute. For the duration, when a creature who can see the floor or ceiling starts their turn, they must succeed on a [[/save wisdom 17]] saving throw or take [[/damage 2d6 psychic average]] damage and be &reference[incapacitated] until the start of their next turn.

Treat the trap as a 4th-level spell for the purpose of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] or similar effects. Destroying all three chandeliers ends the effect early. Each 10-foot-diameter chandelier has AC 13, 25 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. When a chandelier is destroyed, it falls to the ground. Each creature beneath a chandelier when it falls must make a [[/save dexterity 13]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 10d6 bludgeoning average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Treasure. The items in the room and its display cases are Lady Emer's hoard. See @UUID[.oHJO5wmxdDPpSPfS]{Lady Emer's Hoard} for more information.

Stone Garden.name: Stone Garden
Stone Garden.text:
The stone garden is an outdoor courtyard at the center of the keep. It has the following features:

  • “Fragrant flowers and herbs decorate the six statues standing in this courtyard. These verdant splashes of life fail to conceal the terror depicted on each stone face.”
  • “At the center of the garden, towering above the statues, an enormous marble pedestal encased in flowering vines rises 40 feet into the air.”
  • (Secret) Atop the pedestal sits a wyvern.
  • (Secret) If Lady Emer has been warned about intruders (see “Guardians”), she hides atop the pedestal.

Wyvern. A @UUID[Actor.NEyFqOAwIqj6qeuY] surveys the garden. Hot-tempered and bored, her only entertainment is poisoning trespassers moments before Lady Emer or her basilisks petrify them. The wyvern waits for intruders to near the center of the courtyard then attacks, making ample use of her Bite and Stinger attacks. She enjoys flying up to the pedestal with grappled creatures and flinging them off using Tail Sweep, then picking them up after they hit the ground with another Bite attack.

Lady Emer. If @UUID[Actor.7huHZbEOWf09dTMy] is here, she views the characters as a threat. She attacks from atop the pedestal, using the height to her advantage. Until her death, her arrogance makes her believe she can beat any opponent.

Poisonous Plants. Characters who succeed on a [[/skill nature 15]] check know the plants in this garden thrive at high altitudes and many are poisonous. A character who is proficient with alchemist's supplies, herbalism kits, or poisoner's kits knows which plants are most useful for alchemical purposes and can spend 10 minutes gathering blossoms to make one dose of each of the following poisons: assassin's blood, malice, and oil of taggit. That character can then spend 1 hour during a short or long rest to create a dose of one of those poisons.

Statues. The statues in the garden are petrified adventurers who came to the castle seeking treasure or the death of Lady Emer. Each is a retainer who can serve the characters if freed:

  • Alia Sylf: A @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.lPZ13jTTNwfSr1eq]
  • Gorith Tork: An @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.E1K6lk2NChtHdo4f]
  • Kaxor: A @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.XaiozHlbBILtWvFx]
  • Septima Vinculum: A @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.QNaPfj3W9WUhLpUV]
  • Varnes Dwell: A @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.TqPcWFgx8IBu2JI2]
  • Worjo: A @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.2VtxWRrcgKgMYJc2]

Climbable Vines. The sturdy vines growing on the pedestal can be climbed without an ability check.

Treasure. Lady Emer carries a key to the display cases in the grand salon (area E4).

Wow. Was I really petrified? How long? Honestly, it wasn't that bad. I didn't even know time was passing. It's like I blinked. I was fighting Emer — I thought I was winning by the way — and now you're here rescuing me. Wild. Just wild. Oh, my captain is going to be so pissed.

— Alia Sylf

Medium Minotaur

The minotaur devestator originally appeared in Flee, Mortals! The MCDM Monster Book. In that book, the retainer is Large. However, Worjo, the minotaur devestator in Lady Emer's lair, is Medium.

Library.name: Library
Library.text:
The library has the following features:

  • “Warm light illuminates walls lined with shelf after shelf of books. On the west side of the room, a desk sits piled high with assorted papers, an inkpot, a penknife, and dozens of quills. A bed stands in the southeast corner.”
  • (If Lady Emer is here) “Coiled over the desk in a pose of frustration, a medusa exasperatedly crosses out something with a quill and breaks its nib. Without missing a beat, one of the snakes that comprises her hair places another freshly inked quill in her hand.”

Lady Emer. How @UUID[Actor.7huHZbEOWf09dTMy] handles the characters depends on how they enter the library. If they arrive with weapons drawn, screaming in fear due to the storage room's trap (area @UUID[.z9D7JwHHxGgg1XJD]{E3}), or covered in her guardians' blood, she attacks, moving into the stone garden (area @UUID[.w2PeGosFjNOTrSQw]{E5}) where she can maneuver freely and fuel her Stone Sacrifice trait with the garden statues.

If the characters arrive in a friendly manner, Lady Emer takes the opportunity to chat. A notoriously deadly and vain assassin, Lady Emer prefers conversations that are short, exciting, and flattering. She is quick to turn her Stone Gaze on anyone who bores or insults her.

If a character praises Lady Emer's skill as an assassin, extols a love of literature, or claims to know secrets that could help the medusa ascend to godhood, they can make a [[/skill skill=deception/persuasion 19]] check. On a success, Lady Emer invites the characters to stay for a party. If they agree, she leads them to the grand salon (area @UUID[.qmf3RqAMs07hGBAm]{E4}), where she plays the harpsichord for them and encourages them to dance. If the characters don't play along, Lady Emer attacks. If the characters do as she asks, Lady Emer thanks them for their time and conversation, then asks them to leave so she can rest. At your discretion, characters who are particularly engaged receive an item from her hoard (see @UUID[.oHJO5wmxdDPpSPfS]{Lady Emer's Hoard}) as a gift and are invited for a return visit.

Books. Lady Emer's books consist mainly of tomes about religious and magical lore.

Treasure. Lady Emer's desk holds hundreds of poorly written poems, twelve owlbear-feather quills, twelve griffon-feather quills, and inkpots with black, gold, green, and purple ink. The @UUID[Item.44JJeRWEkpRxJ7fX]{set of quills and inks} is worth 50 gp. The desk drawers contain a @UUID[Item.0XXnXoZaSEDPpE0A]{disguise kit}, a @UUID[Item.8ShqqxA4oZz4BBxP]{forgery kit}, a set of @UUID[Item.1JC92E7e3m6TLs1s]{mason's tools}, a @UUID[Item.bc7K5FunYyJkvfDG]{poisoner's kit}, a set of @UUID[Item.6OoOPTUH0PgdKASW]{thieves' tools}, and a pouch containing [[/award 3130gp]]. Lady Emer carries a key to the display cases in the grand salon (area @UUID[.qmf3RqAMs07hGBAm]{E4}).

Lair Actions

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.77dPCAPcBsW5GLwd inline]

Parlor.name: Parlor
Parlor.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Overstuffed armchairs sit among side tables set with vases holding roses.”
  • “An empty crystal decanter, matching goblets, and bottles of wine sit on a buffet table against the south wall.”
  • “Beneath a hole in the keep's ceiling, a pile of snow lies against the east wall.”
  • (Secret) The snow pile is enchanted to animate and attack intruders.

Living Snow. Illusion magic in the keep's walls has seeped into the pile of snow. A creature who has a [[/skill perception 18 passive format=long]] notices the snow shifting unnaturally. When a Humanoid touches the snow, it reforms into a duplicate of that Humanoid. The duplicate uses the same statistics as the Humanoid, except it is a Construct. The duplicate has mundane copies of the Humanoid's equipment and is hostile to the Humanoid and their allies. The duplicate attacks, fighting until destroyed. When the duplicate is destroyed, its body and equipment melt into a puddle of water. There is only enough snow to form one duplicate.

If combat breaks out in the parlor while @UUID[Actor.7huHZbEOWf09dTMy] is in the library (area @UUID[.xLQFyJB06EpvdqGU]{E6}), she arrives at the start of the third round of combat.

Treasure. The parlor holds @UUID[Item.KKwkrxzrPocPyw8g]{four porcelain vases} (worth 20 gp each), a @UUID[Item.uEbwEUCeJ2xXDj1E]{crystal decanter and six crystal goblets} (worth 50 gp as a set), and @UUID[Item.yBKQAw6pwvhoVIrN]{six bottles of aged fine wine} (worth 20 gp each).

Too Much Work!

If living snow creating a duplicate would involve too much work, you can have the snow form another creature instead, such as a @UUID[Actor.PZMEtZqRLTrjf8Y8] or a @UUID[Actor.SSptGOKLFbpCVVQM].

Molten Enclave.name: Molten Enclave
Molten Enclave.caption: A fire giant lair for 9th-level characters

drawings.The Lava Pool Teleporter to the Hoard Ca: The Lava Pool Teleporter to the Hoard Can Only be Used with Aastrika's Crown
drawings.50% Chance a Fire Giant Red Fist Interru: 50% Chance a Fire Giant Red Fist Interrupts any Long Rest

Unarmed Strike (Group Attack).name: Unarmed Strike (Group Attack)
Unarmed Strike (Group Attack).description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 3 bludgeoning damage plus 3 fire damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall &Reference[prone]. The DC for this saving throw equals 12 + the number of troopers who joined the group attack.

Foundry Note

An increase to the save DC can be configured when you use this item.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Molten Flesh.name: Molten Flesh
Molten Flesh.description: The first time a creature other than a fire giant touches the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or hits them with a melee attack on a turn, that creature takes 7 damage.

Rock (Group Attack).name: Rock (Group Attack)
Rock (Group Attack).description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 6 bludgeoning damage.

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While motionless, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is indistinguishable from a statue.

Stone Flesh.name: Stone Flesh
Stone Flesh.description: When a creature attacks the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with a melee weapon that isn't adamantine and rolls a 1 on the d20 for that attack, that weapon is destroyed if it is mundane. If that weapon is supernatural, it loses all supernatural properties for 1 hour.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item h35eGCcShfhO1Eo2]] attacks. They can replace one attack with a [[/item 7MIWai7nGCX6tVMf]] attack.

Forked Knives.name: Forked Knives
Forked Knives.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature on the ground, they are knocked &reference[prone] and &reference[restrained] as they are pinned by the knife. The target or a creature who can reach the knife can use an action to make a [[/check athletics 18]] check to try to dislodge the knife, freeing the pinned target and ending the restrained condition on a success.

Resonate Rune.name: Resonate Rune
Resonate Rune.description: When the giant is hit by a melee attack, each creature within 10 feet of them must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the giant.

save.condition: When the monster is hit by a melee attack.

Rune-Signed Blade.name: Rune-Signed Blade
Rune-Signed Blade.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, each time they are hit by this attack, their movement speed is reduced by a cumulative 10 feet (to a minimum speed of 5 feet) until they regain at least 1 hit point.

Foundry Note

Foundry does not support cumulative effects, a flat -10 penalty to movement speed is applied instead.

Rune-Signed Blade.name: Rune-Signed Blade
Rune-Signed Blade.description: The creature's movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until they regain at least 1 hit point.

Unarmed Strike.name: Unarmed Strike
Unarmed Strike.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the same creature is hit twice with this attack on a turn, they are &reference[blinded] until the end of their next turn.

Heat and Pressure.name: Heat and Pressure
Heat and Pressure.description: When an enemy moves out of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s reach, the enemy must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or gain a level of &Reference[exhaustion apply=false]. Creatures with resistance or immunity to fire damage are immune to this effect.

save.condition: when an enemy moves out of this monster's reach

Molten Flesh.name: Molten Flesh
Molten Flesh.description: The first time a creature other than a fire giant touches the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or hits them with a melee attack on a turn, that creature takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item RNkQJCXUTP6vW5GQ]] attacks.

Hurl Flame.name: Hurl Flame
Hurl Flame.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 180 ft., one target. Hit: 34 (8d6 + 6) fire damage.

Guardian Block.name: Guardian Block
Guardian Block.description: When an enemy within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits a creature other than the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with an attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] halves the damage dealt by that attack. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] then makes an [[/item RNkQJCXUTP6vW5GQ]] against the attacker.

Unarmed Strike.name: Unarmed Strike
Unarmed Strike.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, they are outlined in red light until the start of [[lookup @name]]'s next turn, and for the duration, attack rolls against them have advantage.

Outlined In Red.name: Outlined In Red
Outlined In Red.description: The creature is outlined in red until the start of the monster's next turn. For the duration, attack rolls against them have advantage.

Battle Tranquility.name: Battle Tranquility
Battle Tranquility.description: When Aastrika fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead. When she does so, she can't use [[/item 8V5aeUn9r7RBT9ja]] until the end of her next turn.

utility.condition: When Aastrika fails a saving throw.

Molten Flesh.name: Molten Flesh
Molten Flesh.description: The first time a creature other than a fire giant touches [[lookup @name]] or hits her with a melee attack on a turn, that creature takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

Hurl Flame.name: Hurl Flame
Hurl Flame.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 180 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) fire damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] takes the Disengage action and makes up to three attacks using [[/item OhC9cqFJxMoc0DXm]], [[/item BqwWeKCYG7NyeM5C]], or both.

Lava Pillar.name: Lava Pillar
Lava Pillar.description: [[lookup @name]] causes a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot-high cylinder of lava to erupt from the ground at a point she can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 (11d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Sweltering Heat.name: Sweltering Heat
Sweltering Heat.description: [[lookup @name]]'s inner flame pulses harshly. Each creature within 20 feet of her who doesn't have resistance or immunity to fire damage must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or gain a level of &reference[exhaustion apply=false].

Power of Flame.name: Power of Flame
Power of Flame.description: When another fire giant [[lookup @name]] can see within 60 feet of her misses with a weapon attack, [[lookup @name]] causes flame to trail from the attacker. The attacker rolls damage for the attack as if they had hit, and the target takes half that amount as fire damage instead of taking the full amount of normal damage.

utility.condition: A fire giant within range misses with a weapon attack.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
[[lookup @name]] has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

[[/item zEkKBJIOUtJ94yoN]]

[[/item Mka19xlCqA8FYuNi]]

[[/item JlQpnUey5BL80Yjc]]

Forward!.name: Forward!
Forward!.description: [[lookup @name]] and up to three creatures she can see can move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks and make one melee attack each.

The Manifold Self.name: The Manifold Self
The Manifold Self.description: [[lookup @name]] disappears in a flash of light and teleports, reappearing in an unoccupied space she can see within 30 feet of her. At the same time, five @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.dDSN7y1khcafxs3d]{Fire Giant Troopers} appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the space she teleported from. The troopers act immediately after this villain action is taken and on the same initiative count in subsequent rounds.

This. Ends. Now.name: This. Ends. Now
This. Ends. Now.description:
[[lookup @name]] and each willing fire giant within 60 feet of her unleashes a burst of heat. Each creature within 10 feet of [[lookup @name]] or one of these fire giants must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Foundry Note

Use scaling to select number of fire giants, including [[lookup @name]].

Molten Flesh.name: Molten Flesh
Molten Flesh.description: The first time a creature other than a fire giant touches the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or hits them with a melee attack on a turn, that creature takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

Healing Heat.name: Healing Heat
Healing Heat.description:
When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets a fire giant with an attack, spell, or other supernatural effect that deals fire damage, that target instead regains a number of hit points equal to the damage that would be dealt. The target can choose to be hit by this attack or fail their saving throw against this effect.

Foundry Note

When dealing damage in this way, the GM can turn the damage into healing in the Damage Tray that appears in the damage roll in the chat log.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes two attacks using [[/item n9qpouMx6Pvb6Lye]], [[/item LtEHCYWEpCQclcSa]], or both. They can replace one attack with a use of [[/item nrYWqnsFW5muqyqK]].

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, the target must choose between being knocked &reference[prone] or pushed 10 feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Living Blaze.name: Living Blaze
Living Blaze.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 180 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) fire damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can ricochet the flame toward another target within 5 feet of the first. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes another spell attack roll against the second target with disadvantage, dealing the same damage on a hit.

Flamelash.name: Flamelash
Flamelash.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] extends a whiplike flame to strike a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 20 (4d6 + 6) fire damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves the target up to 10 feet horizontally.

Travel by Fire.name: Travel by Fire
Travel by Fire.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses two willing creatures they can see within 30 feet of them. Each target takes 14 (4d6) fire damage damage and teleports, swapping places with the other target.

Hellish Bite.name: Hellish Bite
Hellish Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage.

Hardened by Flame.name: Hardened by Flame
Hardened by Flame.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to fire damage, they take no damage. Instead, their skin darkens and hardens, and their AC increases to 18 until the end of their next turn.

Stealthy Hunter.name: Stealthy Hunter
Stealthy Hunter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track other creatures and on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide from creatures who are unaware of their presence.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales flame in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (3d6 + 4) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who isn't a [[lookup @name lowercase]] who fails the saving throw is lit on fire for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn), or until the target or another creature who can reach them uses an action to extinguish the flames. A creature who is on fire at the start of their turn takes 7 (2d6) fire damage. If a creature who is already on fire is set on fire again on a subsequent turn, the damage isn't cumulative, but the duration of the fire resets to 1 minute.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description: You are burning; you take [[/damage 2d6 fire average]] damage at the start of each of your turns.

Tug of War.name: Tug of War
Tug of War.description: When an enemy within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with a melee attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can make a Hellish Bite attack against that enemy. If the attack hits, the enemy is also &reference[grappled] (escape DC 12), and if the triggering attack was a weapon attack, the weapon used in the triggering attack can't be used to make any more attacks while the target is grappled. The grapple ends if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks a different target with Hellish Bite.

utility.condition: when an enemy within 5 feet hits you with a melee attack

Monument of Molten Blades.name: Monument of Molten Blades
Monument of Molten Blades.description:
This 8-foot-tall sculpture of a giant's hand holding a volcanic glass orb is constructed from weapons, armor, holy symbols, jewelry, and an assortment of other metal objects taken from now-dead adventurers who dared challenge the Sunlight Legion. A miniature castle made of slagged weapons is suspended in the glass orb. The Sunlight Legion forged this sculpture, which weighs 1,200 pounds, as a monument to their triumph over all foes.

You can give this monument to a Giant, who in exchange will perform one favor for you. This favor can be life-threatening to the Giant, but the GM decides just how much the Giant is willing to do in exchange for the monument.

Restorative Ointment.name: Restorative Ointment
Restorative Ointment.description:
Wondrous item

This glass jar, 3 inches in diameter, contains 1d4 + 1 doses of a thick mixture that smells faintly of aloe. The jar and its contents weigh 1/2 pound.

As an action, one dose of the ointment can be swallowed or applied to the skin. The creature that receives it regains 2d8 + 2 hit points, ceases to be poisoned, and is cured of any disease.

Foundry Note

The 5 charges reflect the maximum number of doses possible. Similarly, the guide price of 600 gp is calculated at 120 gp per dose. Adjust both as required.

heal.condition: The ointment needs to be swallowed or applied to the skin.

Wrapped Giant Eagle Talon.name: Wrapped Giant Eagle Talon
Wrapped Giant Eagle Talon.description: A giant eagle talon wrapped in cloth. It is enchanted with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MK6gpQMeDFo0cP9f]{Continual Flame} spell.

Aastrika's Crown.name: Aastrika's Crown
Aastrika's Crown.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

Aastrika's crown is a relic Aastrika took from her previous commander after killing him. It has been infused with a shred of her power, and it magically resizes to fit its attuned wearer.

Blend with the Blaze. As an action, you can touch a Small or larger mundane flame. When you do, you take no damage from the fire, and you know the location of every Small or larger flame within 10 miles of you. As part of the action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of another flame you detect. This property can be used twice, and the crown regains all expended uses daily at dawn.

Fire Resistance. You have resistance to fire damage while wearing this crown.

Magma Transport. You know the location of all lava pools in the Molten Enclave. While you are within 10 feet of one of these lava pools, you can use an action to teleport yourself and up to one willing creature within 10 feet of you to an unoccupied space within 10 feet of any other lava pool in the lair.

Flame Tongue Greatsword.name: Flame Tongue Greatsword
Flame Tongue Greatsword.description:
(Requires attunement)

You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.

Fist-Sized Spinel.name: Fist-Sized Spinel
Fist-Sized Spinel.description: A spinel gemstone the size of a clenched fist.

Ornamental Longsword.name: Ornamental Longsword
Ornamental Longsword.description:
A lengthy straight blade designed for slashing foes, the longsword is a highly versatile weapon that may also be wielded with two hands for more punishing strikes.

This longsword is finely crafted, the pommel of which contains a topaz set in gold.

Efreeti Bottle.name: Efreeti Bottle
Efreeti Bottle.description:
Wondrous item

This painted brass bottle weighs 1 pound. When you use an action to remove the stopper, a cloud of thick smoke flows out of the bottle. At the end of your turn, the smoke disappears with a flash of harmless fire, and an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.LTomFUTBrkRi0Pj5]{Efreeti} appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

The first time the bottle is opened, the GM rolls to determine what happens from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.yZMFNfocj5qyVuOC]{Efreeti Bottle} table.

Bead of Force.name: Bead of Force
Bead of Force.description:
Wondrous item

This small black sphere measures 3/4 of an inch in diameter and weighs an ounce. Typically, 1d4 + 4 Beads of Force are found together.

You can use an action to throw the bead up to 60 feet. The bead explodes on impact and is destroyed. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of where the bead landed must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 5d4 force damage. A sphere of transparent force then encloses the area for 1 minute. Any creature that failed the save and is completely within the area is trapped inside this sphere. Creatures that succeeded on the save, or are partially within the area, are pushed away from the center of the sphere until they are no longer inside it. Only breathable air can pass through the sphere's wall. No attack or other effect can.

An enclosed creature can use its action to push against the sphere's wall, moving the sphere up to half the creature's walking speed. The sphere can be picked up, and its magic causes it to weigh only 1 pound, regardless of the weight of creatures inside.

Silver Dragon's Head Flute.name: Silver Dragon's Head Flute
Silver Dragon's Head Flute.description: A silver flute engraved with scales, the bell of which resembles a dragon’s head, with yellow diamonds for eyes.

Palm-Sized Rose Quartz.name: Palm-Sized Rose Quartz
Palm-Sized Rose Quartz.description: A palm-sized chunk of rose quartz carved to look like a blazing bonfire.

Potion of Fire Giant Strength.name: Potion of Fire Giant Strength
Potion of Fire Giant Strength.description:
This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 25 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

Carved Ruby Eye.name: Carved Ruby Eye
Carved Ruby Eye.description: A ruby carved to look like an eye.

Feather Token Whip.name: Feather Token Whip
Feather Token Whip.description:
Wondrous item

This tiny object looks like a feather. Different types of feather tokens exist, each with a different single-use effect. The GM chooses the kind of token or determines it randomly from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.OEdr086W61t1DRJo]{Feather Token} table.

Whip. You can use an action to throw the token to a point within 10 feet of you. The token disappears, and a floating whip takes its place. You can then use a bonus action to make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of the whip, with an attack bonus of +9. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 + 5 force damage.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can direct the whip to fly up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 10 feet of it. The whip disappears after 1 hour, when you use an action to dismiss it, or when you are incapacitated or die.

attack.condition: A bonus action is used to control the whip.

Golden Brooch with Platinum Star.name: Golden Brooch with Platinum Star
Golden Brooch with Platinum Star.description: A golden brooch with a platinum star on it, the symbol of a long-lost knightly order.

Elemental Gem of Fire.name: Elemental Gem of Fire
Elemental Gem of Fire.description:
Wondrous item

This red corundum contains a mote of elemental energy. When you use an action to break the gem, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8SMQl75HLjhuSeau]{Fire Elemental} is summoned as if you had cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1LkZvINag7KqBmDR]{Conjure Elemental} spell, and the gem's magic is lost.

Molten Enclave.name: Molten Enclave
Molten Enclave.text:
Optimized for Five 9th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00008 inline]

Enclave Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Fire Oracle. Milosh Lunaris, a dwarf oracle who sees the future in flames, asks the characters to recover a piece of coal from the Molten Enclave's forge (area @UUID[.b3txTP0ttARVlFgK]{Z5}). The oracle claims the coal will help them witness a possible future calamity. They offer the characters a belt of dwarvenkind in exchange for the coal.

Giant Rivalry. Unable to raise arms against the Sunlight Legion without risking a political disaster, the fire giant Princess Karith asks for the characters to drive Zenith Aastrika and her followers away from the Molten Enclave. Karith plans to gain the same enlightenment Aastrika found there. The princess rewards the party with a ring of resistance (fire) if they succeed in the task.

Rumbling Mountain. Ever since the Sunlight Legion moved into Roaring Peak, the volcano has become increasingly active, threatening to erupt and devastate the surrounding area. Local leaders offer the characters 5,000 gp to travel into the Molten Enclave and find a way to calm the mountain. Zenith Aastrika's constant communing with the Crater of the Core (area @UUID[.KsTA7bfBNq74yYdL]{Z9}) has caused the disruption.

Enclave Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of the Molten Enclave has the following features:

Ceilings. Corridors and rooms have arched ceilings at least 25 feet high.

High Heat. Creatures who don't have access to drinkable water must succeed on a [[/save constitution 10]] saving throw at the end of each hour they spend in the enclave or gain 1 level of exhaustion. Creatures in medium or heavy armor or heavy clothing have disadvantage on this saving throw, and creatures who have resistance or immunity to fire damage succeed automatically.

Illumination. Veins of molten rock in the walls fill each area with dim light.

Iron Portcullises. Many passages in the lair are closed off by iron portcullises operated with heavy winches. Medium or smaller creatures can squeeze through these gates with a successful [[/skill acrobatics 13]] check. Small creatures have advantage on this check, and Tiny creatures succeed automatically.

Lava Pool. Bubbling pools of lava dot the lair. Each sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The Sunlight Legion can also use the pools to teleport around the lair (see @UUID[.WPSLlYQrqUmInu7m#sunlight-legion-giants]{Sunlight Legion Giants}). Creatures who touch the lava for the first time on a turn or who end their turn in it take [[/damage 6d10 fire average]] damage.

Noisy. The noises of bubbling lava, smithing, and fire giants training and talking fill the enclave. Creatures in one area don't hear combat or cries for help in another area.

Size. Everything in the lair is sized for Huge creatures, except for magic items, which adjust to the size of their bearer.

Winches. Gates and traps in the lair are operated by gigantic winches. A creature can turn a winch as an action by making a [[/check strength 24]] check. On a success, the winch turns. On a failure, the winch doesn't turn, but the creature can choose to gain 1 level of exhaustion and succeed instead. Large creatures have advantage on this check, and Huge and Gargantuan creatures automatically succeed on this check.

Sunlight Legion Giants

The Sunlight Legion fire giants in this lair fight with military discipline, immediately attacking any intruders they notice. A fire giant who is losing a battle retreats further into the lair and seeks reinforcements. If cornered, they fight to the death.

Magma Transport. Giants blessed by Zenith Aastrika can teleport through the lava pools in the lair. A fire giant touching one of these pools can use an action to teleport to an unoccupied space within 10 feet of any other lava pool in the lair. A character who eavesdrops on the giants and succeeds on a [[/skill perception 18]] check overhears one of them mention the Zenith's secret sanctum (area @UUID[.GgnKkKD7bh2KhJGv]{Z10}), which can only be accessed via lava pool.

Defeat. If the characters are defeated but put up a respectable fight, the Sunlight Legion captures them, takes their equipment, and brings them before Aastrika in the Crater of the Core (area @UUID[.KsTA7bfBNq74yYdL]{Z9}). She offers the characters a choice: If one of them willingly sacrifices themself to the Core, the remaining characters are free to leave with their equipment, provided they never return.

Resting in the Enclave

The characters can safely take a short rest in any area, provided they deal with any enemies in the area. If the characters try to take a long rest, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>50]]{50 percent chance} a @UUID[Actor.bfWVYKI388DkKUb7] interrupts them halfway through their rest.

Entering the Enclave

The Molten Enclave sits in the deepest labyrinthine tunnels beneath Roaring Peak. The fire giants find their way by following wall carvings of a rising sun over a mountain peak. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill history 17]] check identifies the symbol as the emblem of the Sunlight Legion and can plot a course to the lair using the symbols. Alternatively, a character who succeeds on a [[/skill survival 15]] check can follow the gigantic sooty footprints back to the lair.

If all the characters fail their ability check to find the lair's entrance, they still make it to the lair but spend extra time searching in the sweltering tunnels. Each character must succeed on a [[/save constitution 15]] saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion. Characters who have resistance or immunity to fire damage succeed automatically.

When the characters find the lair, they arrive at the entrance stairs (area @UUID[.3k7REOoIv7HwcA7U]{Z1}).

Barracks.name: Barracks
Barracks.text:
The fire giants take shifts sleeping in the barracks. Its two rooms each have the following features:

  • “Two rows of gigantic stone slabs line the walls of this room, four on each side, each covered with a leather blanket.”
  • “A fire giant lays in each bed, chest rising and falling.”
  • “Three beds have leather pouches the size of halflings hanging at the end.”

Beds. A character can climb up onto a bed and reach its pouch with a successful [[/skill athletics 15]] check.

Sleeping Giants. If the giants haven't been made aware of intruders, each room has eight beds with sleeping occupants, for a total of fifteen @UUID[Actor.AEV7H7AAcGGrkIjz]{Fire Giant Troopers} and one @UUID[Actor.bfWVYKI388DkKUb7]. Characters sneaking through a room must succeed on a group [[/skill stealth 10]] check or wake the sleeping giants in that room.

Treasure. Each sack (three in each barracks for a total of six) contains 50 pounds of dried meat and one of the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.qmqT93LugsDNKzMl]
  • @UUID[Item.6KgtfSCrz6x41G6q]{Cloth-wrapped giant eagle talon} (a Tiny object) enchanted with a continual flame spell
  • @UUID[Item.ibpIK5HozJlS9bLW] (worth 25 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.DYxnybi6mzoho2qX] (worth 70 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.sPx0KQlhsKnY8FAz]{Golden brooch with a platinum star on it}—the symbol of a long-lost knightly order (worth 100 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.ECAjOgBllj3Esjcs] (worth 200 gp)

Crater of the Core.name: Crater of the Core
Crater of the Core.text:
The double iron doors into this area can be easily opened or closed by a Huge or Gargantuan creature. Smaller creatures can open the doors if they work together and have a combined Strength score of 50 or higher. If four or more Large, Medium, or Small creatures work together but their combined Strength score is lower than 50, they open the door after 1 minute of work, but each creature gains one level of exhaustion.

The angled ceiling of this room rises to a height of 60 feet, and the whole room is brightly lit. The Crater of the Core has the following features:

  • “Intense heat radiates from an enormous magma crater at the east end of the room.”
  • “Four massive support pillars rise to the ceiling. The hollow base of each pillar holds a brazier that billows with black smoke.”
  • “Seven fire giants, one wearing an obsidian crown and standing taller than the rest, meditate in the room.”
  • (Secret) The entry corridor's ceiling contains a 20-foot-cube stone block suspended by chains.

The Core. The great pool of lava at the east of the chamber — the Core — is where Zenith Aastrika first found enlightenment, and, as such, is a sacred site to the Sunlight Legion. A fire giant touching the Core at the start of their turn regains 20 hit points; other creatures who touch the Core for the first time on a turn or end their turn in it take [[/damage 8d10 fire average]] damage.

Braziers. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the braziers' auras of conjuration magic. When combat begins, smoke magically fills the area within 10 feet of each pillar. Each round on initiative count 20, the smoke's radius increases by 5 feet. The affected area is lightly obscured, and creatures are &reference[blinded] while in that area unless they have resistance or immunity to fire damage. As an action, a creature can douse a brazier within reach with 1 gallon of water, ending the effect on that brazier. If a brazier is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] spell or any effect that deals cold damage, this also ends that brazier's effect.

Inhabitants. @UUID[Actor.fY3CsGamuNCvWlu1] is accompanied by a @UUID[Actor.hK2WYuSbhS9BizdV] and five @UUID[Actor.AEV7H7AAcGGrkIjz]{Fire Giant Troopers}. When the giants notice intruders in this sacred place, they attack. Zenith Aastrika fights to the death, and when she falls, the other giants flee.

Stone Block Trap. A winch near the Core lowers or raises the stone block when turned. When the trap triggers, the stone block in the ceiling falls. Each creature in the block's path when it falls must make a [[/save dexterity 15]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 10d10 bludgeoning average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The block can be climbed with a successful [[/skill athletics 17]] check.

Treasure. Aastrika wears @UUID[Item.6OaEgfZlaULd7IIy] (see @UUID[.HO1zgl4yzC6kgItq]).

The braziers found near the core can be activated with the @UUID[Macro.Y4Jww4eaTf68z0mr] macro. On initiative count 20, you can use the macro again to increase their radius by 5 feet.

I didn't find enlightenment atop some peaceful mountain high in the clouds or while sitting with my eyes closed in a serene field of high grass. I earned it in the hottest fires the earth produces. Would you like to feel that enlightenment for yourself?

— Zenith Aastrika

Secret Sanctum.name: Secret Sanctum
Secret Sanctum.text:
This chamber's ceiling rises to a height of 80 feet. The characters can access the sanctum by using Aastrika's crown (see area @UUID[.KsTA7bfBNq74yYdL]{Z9}) to teleport via lava pool. The sanctum has the following features:

  • “Six 20-foot-high shelves carved into the walls of this chamber hold massive stone tablets.”
  • “To the north, a small chamber holds a pile of precious metals, plundered goods, and coin.”

Shelves. Creatures can climb the shelves with a successful [[/skill athletics 15]] check. The eighty-seven tablets on the shelves contain a record of the Sunlight Legion's history, carved in Giant. It is incredibly thorough, containing not only their story, but also records of all their dead, their missions, their laws, and their treatises. Each tablet weighs 25 pounds.

Treasure. The north chamber in this area contains Zenith Aastrika's hoard. See @UUID[.HO1zgl4yzC6kgItq] for more information.

Zenith Aastrika's Hoard.name: Zenith Aastrika's Hoard
Zenith Aastrika's Hoard.text:
The plunder of dozens of conquests lies hidden in a secret chamber of the Molten Enclave. Additionally, the @UUID[Item.16ol2cHiieer4fsn] (see below) can be found in the forge (area @UUID[.b3txTP0ttARVlFgK]{Z5}).

The hoard contains the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.6OaEgfZlaULd7IIy] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.ML9AXhmEWZ9yl2Tp]
  • @UUID[Item.DyNT9PNDmss0BL5c]
  • @UUID[Item.NI5MK04VMg32L4bU]{6 beads of force}
  • @UUID[Item.wmmRgCg6Yn7UMYKt]
  • @UUID[Item.bgp0PmkuBkgxgZTV]{Potion of Fire Giant Strength}
  • @UUID[Item.UoEYkEurmNm3I2Wb]{Palm-sized rose quartz} carved to look like a blazing bonfire (worth 150 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.Gcm9ztSM1RaGjEfx]{4 bars of silver weighing 40 pounds each} (worth 200 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.cgAdSrecEH7zHk3V]{Ruby carved to look like an eye} (worth 250 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.On8ElhHlUNwtzQrE]{Silver flute engraved with scales}, the bell of which resembles a dragon's head, with yellow diamonds for eyes (worth 600 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.FhQDti8RvHRSRYB1]{Finely crafted ornamental longsword}, the pommel of which contains a topaz set in gold (worth 800 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.7VN1fZyfTEEJZ6if]{1 bar of gold weighing 20 pounds} (worth 1,000 gp)
  • [[/award 25872cp 1589sp 876gp]]

Giant Followers

If you are using Strongholds & Followers, the monument of molten blades can be integrated into a stronghold. While you have the monument, you gain a Giant of the GM's choice as a special ally at the end of each season. This monument can grant a maximum number of Giant allies equal to your stronghold level. If the monument is lost or destroyed, these allies depart at the end of the season unless it has been recovered before then.

Molten Enclave Areas.text:

Entrance Stairs.name: Entrance Stairs
Entrance Stairs.text:
The entrance has the following features:

  • “The natural magma tubes give way to worked stone stairs, each no less than 3 feet high. The steps narrow as they lead down toward a towering portcullis of wrought iron.”
  • “A gigantic winch is set into the ground next to the portcullis.”

See @UUID[.WPSLlYQrqUmInu7m#enclave-features]{Molten Enclave Features} for details on operating this area's portcullis and winch.

Trapped Atrium.name: Trapped Atrium
Trapped Atrium.text:
This room's domed ceiling rises to a height of 40 feet at its peak. The atrium has the following features:

  • “Two 25-foot-tall statues with rubies for eyes flank the lava pool. The west statue depicts a fire giant in a battle stance with their fists up. The east one depicts a fire giant with their hands clasped in prayer.”
  • (Secret) The ceiling contains two 20-foot-cube stone blocks suspended by chains, ready to crush unwary thieves.

Statues. Characters who examine the statues and succeed on a [[/skill perception 20]] check notice the statues' arms are hinged at the shoulder. The statues can be climbed with a successful [[/skill athletics 15]] check, but if a character doesn't take care to avoid the statue's arms while climbing, they place additional weight on an arm, which tips the arm and triggers the stone block trap. The climbing character must succeed on a [[/save strength 16]] saving throw or fall 20 feet off the arm and land prone on the ground in the path of the stone block trap, taking [[/damage 2d6 bludgeoning average]] damage from the fall (along with damage from the trap as detailed below).

Stone Block Trap. When a statue arm triggers this trap, the stone blocks in the ceiling fall. Each creature in the blocks' path, including any creature who just fell off a statue, must make a [[/save dexterity 16]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 10d10 bludgeoning average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Winches down the east and west corridors can be turned to raise the blocks again. Each block can be climbed with a successful [[/skill athletics 17]] check. If the stone blocks fall, the @UUID[Actor.bfWVYKI388DkKUb7] from the dining hall (area Z6) arrives 1 minute later to investigate. When the firegiant arrives, they operate the winch to lift the stone block.

Treasure. Characters who are proficient with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.YfBwELTgPFHmQdHh]{jeweler's tools} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.woWZ1sO5IUVGzo58]{thieves' tools} can pry the statues' ruby eyes out. There are @UUID[Item.8xgska1h6RUiKzCB]{four rubies} total (worth 300 gp each).

The Crucible.name: The Crucible
The Crucible.text:
This multitiered room has a pyramidal ceiling that rises to a height of 50 feet at its peak. The Crucible has the following features:

  • “In the center of this room, an iron railing surrounds a 20-foot-deep fighting pit. Stairs lead into the pit.”
  • “Seven enormous spectators around the pit's perimeter cheer a duel between two bruised, grunting fire giants below.”

Stairs. The stairs in this chamber are difficult terrain for Medium or smaller creatures.

Fire Giants. Two @UUID[Actor.bfWVYKI388DkKUb7]{Fire Giant Red Fists} (each with 80 hit points remaining) are dueling in the pit, while six @UUID[Actor.AEV7H7AAcGGrkIjz]{Fire Giant Troopers} watch from the raised section, and a @UUID[Actor.hK2WYuSbhS9BizdV] stands by the north stairs, ready to spring into action if a combatant is seriously injured. Unless these giants have been warned about intruders, they don't notice when the characters arrive. If the characters succeed on a group [[/skill stealth 19]] check and don't operate the winches in the area, they can sneak through this area unnoticed.

Gym.name: Gym
Gym.text:
The gym has the following features:

  • “Huge stone benches line the walls in between racks of enormous barbell weights.”
  • “A burn-marked leather sandbag hangs from the ceiling, a slow trickle of sand escaping a burst seam.”

Treasure. Climbing the 10-foot-high stone benches requires a successful [[/skill athletics 15]] check. A jar containing six doses of @UUID[Item.5ZRCnVGq85rhGDHL] sits on one of the benches.

Forge.name: Forge
Forge.text:
The forge has the following features:

  • “Thanks to the magma forge that dominates the west wall, the air in this room is thick with sulfur and painful to breathe.”
  • “At one of the anvils in the middle of the room, a fire giant pounds on an enormous iron door, while a stone giant with obsidian skin supervises the work.”
  • “A storage area to the north contains stacks of metal ingots, a mound of charcoal with a Giant-sized shovel, and a statue of an iron hand clutching an orb of volcanic glass.”

Toxic Forge. The forge fills this area with toxic fumes. When a creature who isn't a fire giant or stone giant starts their turn in this area, they must succeed on a [[/save constitution 15]] saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] until the start of their next turn. A creature who succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the forge's toxic fumes for 24 hours.

If the forge takes 30 cold damage, or is doused with 50 gallons of water in 1 minute or less, the toxic air clears 1 minute later.

Smiths. Hurga, a @UUID[Actor.bfWVYKI388DkKUb7] and blacksmith's apprentice, pounds the metal door into shape. Ostios, a @UUID[Actor.RubClZkm8RcUJ52L] and master smith who Aastrika hired to teach her smiths, oversees Hurga's work. Unless these giants have been warned about intruders, they don't notice when the characters arrive. If the characters succeed on a group [[/skill stealth 16]] check, they can sneak through this area unnoticed.

Treasure. The storage area contains @UUID[Item.61juu0XnxqzIY88y]{twenty-five steel ingots} (worth 50 gp each) and @UUID[Item.ZVzDAFgSvECbUfBH]{fifty iron ingots} (worth 25 gp each), each of which weighs 50 pounds. The hand sculpture is a @UUID[Item.16ol2cHiieer4fsn] (see @UUID[.HO1zgl4yzC6kgItq] for more information).

Dining Hall.name: Dining Hall
Dining Hall.text:
This room's arched ceiling rises to a height of 40 feet at its peak. The dining hall has the following features:

  • “A mural of fire giants traveling a vast desert adorns the carved walls of this chamber.”
  • “Two gigantic stone banquet tables run the length of the chamber, accompanied by chairs.”
  • “Two fire giants sit at a table sharing a meal and chatting quietly. A dog made of flame and ash patiently begs for scraps at their heels.”

Gigantic Tables. The tables are 10 feet high and can be climbed with a successful [[/skill athletics 15]] check.

Inhabitants. A @UUID[Actor.hK2WYuSbhS9BizdV], a @UUID[Actor.bfWVYKI388DkKUb7], and a @UUID[Actor.ltYxXgZLtwrzrmQN] are eating a meal, but quietly enough that they immediately notice characters who aren't trying to stay hidden.

Storage Area.name: Storage Area
Storage Area.text:
The storage area has the following features:

  • “Crates and barrels line the walls of this storeroom, and leather sacks contain a variety of provisions.”
  • “Two skinned giant lizard carcasses hang in the northeast corner of the room, their meat drying over a stone brazier of smoldering rocks.”

Provisions. This room contains 2,000 pounds of grains, dried meat, water, wine, beer, and other provisions. The combined food can sustain a Medium or Small creature for 500 days.

Death Chant.name: Death Chant
Death Chant.description: When an enemy succeeds on a death saving throw while within 30 feet of three or more [[lookup @name lowercase]] who aren't incapacitated, the success instead counts as a failure, and if the roll was a 20, the enemy doesn't regain hit points.

Exploit Weakness.name: Exploit Weakness
Exploit Weakness.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes or joins an attack that's made with advantage, the attack deals an extra 1 damage per [[lookup @name lowercase]] who made or joined the attack.

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Transfer Life (Group Attack).name: Transfer Life (Group Attack)
Transfer Life (Group Attack).description:
Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 necrotic damage, and if this attack was made by more than one [[lookup @name lowercase]], a creature of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]s' choice within 30 feet of them regains 1 hit point per [[lookup @name lowercase]] who joined this group attack.

Foundry Note

You can use the Heal activity to decide how many hit points to restore to a target.

heal.condition: If the attack was made by more than one minion.

Necrotic Bolt (Group Attack).name: Necrotic Bolt (Group Attack)
Necrotic Bolt (Group Attack).description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 2 necrotic damage.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Signature Attack (Dark Essence).name: Signature Attack (Dark Essence)
Signature Attack (Dark Essence).description: Melee or ranged spell attack: +3 plus PB to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) necrotic damage. This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when the [[lookup @name lowercase]] reaches 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

Heavy Crossbow.name: Heavy Crossbow
Heavy Crossbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

Bayonet.name: Bayonet
Bayonet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Point Blank Shooting.name: Point Blank Shooting
Point Blank Shooting.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits a creature within 30 feet of them with a ranged weapon attack, they deal an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage. Additionally, being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose disadvantage on the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s ranged attack rolls.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Ricochet Bolt.name: Ricochet Bolt
Ricochet Bolt.description: The trickshot uses a special ricocheting bolt to make one [[/item U2wpLj3SjWK0Zqda]] attack against a target within 100 feet of them, then a second Heavy Crossbow attack against a different target within 30 feet of the first target.

Arcane Staff.name: Arcane Staff
Arcane Staff.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) lightning damage.

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

utility.condition: The monster makes an attack

Arcane Shield.name: Arcane Shield
Arcane Shield.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is hit by an attack, they magically gain a +5 bonus to AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss. If the attacker is within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the attacker must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 18 (4d8) thunder damage and be pushed 10 feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

save.condition: When the monster is hit by an attack.

Gust of Wind.name: Gust of Wind
Gust of Wind.description:
A 10-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line of strong wind gusts from the wizard for 1 minute. Each creature who starts their turn in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from the wizard. Each creature in that area must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot they move toward the wizard.

Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Incorporeal Cloud.name: Incorporeal Cloud
Incorporeal Cloud.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The haunt takes 5 (1d10) force damage if they end their turn inside an object.

As part of this bonus action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hurl the object up to 30 feet in any direction or use it as a ranged weapon to attack one creature within 30 feet of the object. The object has a +8 bonus to hit and deals 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage on a hit. The GM might rule that a specific object deals piercing or slashing damage based on its form.

Piscine Transformation.name: Piscine Transformation
Piscine Transformation.description:
3rd-Order Power

[[lookup @name]] targets a Humanoid they can see within 60 feet of them with a pulse of transformational energy. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or undergo one of the following transformations of [[lookup @name]]'s choice:

Head. The target's head transforms into the head of a fish, proportionately sized for their body. They can't speak.

Legs. The target's legs become fins. Their walking speed is reduced to 10 feet (unless their walking speed is slower), and they gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.

Torso. The target's torso becomes the body of a fish with gills. They can only breathe water and can hold their breath for 1 hour. If the target isn't underwater when this transformation takes effect, they begin suffocating.

This transformation lasts until the target is affected by a cure ailment power of 4th order or higher or a greater restoration spell. A target who suffers all three transformations at once is permanently transformed into a hybrid fishlike creature and can only be returned to their original form by a wish spell or similar magic.

Piscine Transformation (Torso).name: Piscine Transformation (Torso)
Piscine Transformation (Torso).description: Your torso becomes the body of a fish with gills. You can only breathe water and can hold your breath for 1 hour. If you are not underwater when this transformation takes effect, you begin suffocating.

Slime Storm.description: [[lookup @name]] unleashes a cloud of transformative slime. Each creature within 60 feet of [[lookup @name]] who isn't an olothec or a slime servant must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 45 (10d8) piercing damage and is &reference[blinded] until the end of their next turn as their eyes temporarily turn into insectoid feelers. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

Devolving Tentacle.name: Devolving Tentacle
Devolving Tentacle.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) piercing damage. The first time a creature is hit with this attack on a turn, they must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be injected with a degenerative psionic slime (save ends at end of turn). While slimed, each time the creature makes an attack roll or an ability check, they must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the d20 roll. At the end of a slimed creature's turn, the size of the subtracted die increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on, to a maximum of d12. The cure ailment power or lesser restoration spell also ends this effect.

Foundry Note

This feature has two effects that can be applied to targets. One will subtract from attack rolls and ability checks, and the second one, @UUID[.ActiveEffect.G9Vl7g091RSPgZxy]{Slime Stacks}, can be dropped onto the target's character sheet repeatedly to increase the die size.

Degenerative Psionic Slime.description: The creature is injected with a degenerative psionic slime (save ends at end of turn). While slimed, each time the creature makes an attack roll or an ability check, they must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the d20 roll. At the end of a slimed creature's turn, the size of the subtracted die increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on, to a maximum of d12. Necklace of Fireballs.name: Necklace of Fireballs
Necklace of Fireballs.description:
Wondrous item

This necklace has 1d6 + 3 beads hanging from it. You can use an action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the bead detonates as a 3rd-level @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0]{Fireball} spell (save DC 15).

You can hurl multiple beads, or even the whole necklace, as one action. When you do so, increase the level of the fireball by 1 for each bead beyond the first.

Silk Dressing Gown with Gold Trim.description: A silk dressing gown with cloth-of-gold trim.

Foresight Weapon.name: Foresight Weapon
Foresight Weapon.description:
Weapon (Any), Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

This weapon's haft is engraved with sigils of divination. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In combat, the weapon imparts subtle hints of the future to you, letting you predict a foe's defensive movements when you initially engage them. The first time you attack each creature during an encounter with this weapon, you have advantage on the attack roll. If that attack hits, maximize your weapon damage dice against the target.

Additionally, when you miss with an attack using this weapon, you can use your reaction to shift the flow of causality and turn the miss into a hit. Once you use this reaction, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

An arrow of slaying is a magic weapon meant to slay a particular kind of creature. Some are more focused than others; for example, there are both arrows of dragon slaying and arrows of blue dragon slaying. If a creature belonging to the type, race, or group associated with an arrow of slaying takes damage from the arrow, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one.
Once an arrow of slaying deals its extra damage to a creature, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

Ivory Octopus Statue with Gold Filigree.description: An ivory statue of an octopus with gold filigree decorating it.
