Entrance Foyer.name: Entrance Foyer
Entrance Foyer.text:
When a creature enters ECAS, they step out through a portal in a silver picture frame on the north wall. This space has a 30-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “Wood-paneled walls lined with tall vases of orange lilies and pink aconites end at a pair of large double doors with a motto carved above them in Infernal.”
  • (If a character can read Infernal) “The motto reads, ‘Better the devil you know.’”
  • “A plush carpet leads to a smartly dressed devil standing beside a desk in front of the doors.”

Portal. The portal in the foyer links back to whichever portal the creature last used to reach ECAS. If the creature didn't arrive at ECAS via the usual method, this portal brings them to a connected portal of their choice that they have seen before, or to a random portal of the GM's choice if the creature hasn't seen another portal connected to ECAS.

Flowers. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill history 17]] check knows the floral selection is a warning, symbolizing a need for caution amid a background of contempt and hatred.

Signing In. Orecic (a @UUID[Actor.2ulibli6eeZo6uDa]) greets guests, answers questions, and makes sure visitors sign the ancient visitors' book — which soul-mines any creature who writes in it (see @UUID[.t9s3WhjK4DavGLDN#soul-mining]{Soul Mining}). A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the book's aura of divination magic.

Orecic insists the characters sign in, but a character can convince the devil the group doesn't need to sign in with a successful [[/skill intimidation 17]] check. Characters who pretend to sign the book must succeed on a [[/skill deception 17]] check to fool Orecic. If combat breaks out in this room, the four @UUID[Actor.2ulibli6eeZo6uDa]{Devil Legates} from reception (area @UUID[.Fhr4C6wrBf1eiTWF]{I2}) investigate.

The visitors' book is enchanted so that non-Devil creatures can't read its contents, but a creature who can read Infernal and succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 22]] check can read the names of past visitors who signed in. If the book is removed from ECAS, it bursts into flame and is destroyed.

Reception.name: Reception
Reception.text:
This room has a 30-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “The delicious scent of fresh tea and pastries wafts from a full buffet spread across two tables.”
  • “Two devils stand behind a large desk at the south end of the room.”
  • “Another four armored devils armed with long pikes stand at attention, overlooking the orderly chamber.”

Buffet. The buffet's food and drinks are of the finest quality. A creature who consumes anything from the buffet gains 10 temporary hit points and is soul-mined (see @UUID[.t9s3WhjK4DavGLDN#soul-mining]{Soul Mining}).

Reception Devils. Anyahx (a @UUID[Actor.jrV7IWChOR9zlR61]) has a particular talent for administration and a brutal adherence to regulations. If the characters enter the room peacefully, she demands they wait in this area until a devil is free to speak with them. After 5 minutes, she introduces them to Thrubwell. If the characters are rude to Anyahx, she vindictively makes them wait longer.

Thrubwell (a @UUID[Actor.DUcZPQHhMWik1yJM]) stands behind the desk, following Anyahx's directives. Once assigned to the characters, he leads them to one of the consulting chambers (area @UUID[.nBXaqFXL43BBZlfK]{I3}) for a consultation. If either Anyahx or Thrubwell think the characters are going to cause trouble, Thrubwell instead escorts them straight to the guard station (area @UUID[.NdZoJsy7FvxmIpXl]{I5}) and into an ambush with the other devils there. Characters who succeed on a [[/skill insight 18]] check sense the devil is leading them into a trap.

Guards. Four @UUID[Actor.2ulibli6eeZo6uDa]{Devil Legates} stand at attention near the reception desk. The characters can sneak past the guards into the backroom corridor with a successful group [[/skill stealth 17]] check.

Consulting Chambers.name: Consulting Chambers
Consulting Chambers.text:
Each consulting chamber is a private, soundproof space the ECAS devils use to make deals with clients. This area has the following features:

  • “This cozy stone room holds a conference table next to a smaller desk.”
  • (If Thrubwell is with the characters) “Thrubwell sits at the far side of the table and motions for you to sit as well.”
  • (Secret) A magic ward in the room compels non-Devil creatures to tell the truth.
  • (Secret) An archivist in the Vault of Leverage (area @UUID[.hYOpaSWHOUVGib9X]{I11}) uses a permanent @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL] spell to observe the chamber.

Let's Make a Deal. If Thrubwell is with the characters, he explains that wards in the room ensure clients tell the truth so conversations can be frank. He then informs them that by attending a meeting with the devils of ECAS, the characters must promise to keep what they learn in this room private. If the characters don't agree to the terms or if they don't fail their saving throw against the chamber's zone of truth (see “Zone of Truth Effect”), he politely asks them to leave. If they do agree to the terms, Thrubwell goes on to offer a list of what ECAS can offer, including but not limited to the following goods or services (which you should modify as you see fit):

  • The true name of a devil the party can use during a summoning
  • A specific magic item of very rare or lesser rarity
  • The assassination of a mortal who isn't a client or employee of ECAS
  • An endowment of art, coins, gems, or other treasure worth up to 50,000 gp
  • A piece of lost, hidden, or forbidden information or lore

Thrubwell explains that ECAS would want a similar service or goods from the characters in exchange. For instance, if the characters ask for a magic item, the devil might ask them to assassinate a mortal, to recover a shipping manifesto at the bottom of the sea, to find proof of a monarch's rumored extramarital affair, or to pay up to 50,000 gp for the item.

If requested, Thrubwell leaves the room to give the party space for private discussion. If the characters don't ultimately make a deal, he asks them to leave ECAS.

Zone of Truth Effect. Each consulting chamber is under a magical effect. Whenever a non-Devil creature enters one of these chambers, they must succeed on a [[/save charisma 17]] saving throw (which they can choose to fail) or be unable to speak a deliberate lie while they remain in the room. The creature is aware of the effect on them and can be evasive or avoid answering questions. Any Devils in the room know if a creature succeeds on their saving throw against the effect.

Being Watched. The archivist watching the characters through a permanent @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{clairvoyance} spell listens in on their conversations and records salient information about the characters.

Soul Mining. If the characters spend at least 5 minutes in one of these chambers, they are soul-mined (see @UUID[.t9s3WhjK4DavGLDN#soul-mining]{Soul Mining}).

Treasure. Thrubwell's desk contains pens, inks, a @UUID[Item.yQhomymgmQ14imQ7]{potion of clairvoyance}, a @UUID[Item.XoBc7JZwj20aAYrw]{partner's key} (see @UUID[.t9s3WhjK4DavGLDN#ecas-features]{ECAS Features}), and a @UUID[Item.e3N2hcsVRtLTmTbg]{sack of salted human eyeballs} he snacks on in private.

Backroom Corridor.name: Backroom Corridor
Backroom Corridor.text: This corridor contains shelves stacked with tins of coffee, fruits, ink made from humanoid blood, pens, and other miscellany. If the characters consume any of the food, they are soul-mined (see @UUID[.t9s3WhjK4DavGLDN#soul-mining]{Soul Mining}).

Guard Station.name: Guard Station
Guard Station.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “At the south end of the room, a studious devil works at a desk that sits atop a 15-foot-tall platform framed by thick red curtains.”
  • “Two armored guards stand at the bottom of the stairs that lead up to the desk.”

Devils. Aemilios (a @UUID[Actor.jrV7IWChOR9zlR61]) writes an hourly report for Lazivos in a ciphered script, while two @UUID[Actor.2ulibli6eeZo6uDa]{Devil Legates} stand guard. Aemilios politely asks the party to wait a moment while they write up a description of the party. The devil then offers a sincere apology for the delay before ordering the guards to attack. If combat breaks out before Aemilios orders the guards to attack, the devil takes no part in the first two rounds of combat, preferring to finish their report.

Treasure. The desk drawer contains a @UUID[Item.h2yiVtOCmyBhGOXu]{feather token (whip)}. Aemilios carries a @UUID[Item.XoBc7JZwj20aAYrw]{partner's key} (see @UUID[.t9s3WhjK4DavGLDN#ecas-features]{ECAS Features}) and wears a @UUID[Item.L1lAJqHZCQFCZ0Y2]{necklace of gilded finger bones} (worth 250 gp).

Staircase.name: Staircase
Staircase.text:
This chamber is 100 feet tall and houses a staircase that connects each level of the lair. The three levels are 50 feet apart.

Security. A patrol of two @UUID[Actor.jrV7IWChOR9zlR61]{Devil Jurists} moves between the levels. The characters can avoid them with a successful group [[/skill stealth 17]] check. If alerted by the sounds of conflict at the guard station (area @UUID[.NdZoJsy7FvxmIpXl]{I5}), the devils lie in wait above the door on the third level.

Information Retrieval Corridor.name: Information Retrieval Corridor
Information Retrieval Corridor.text:
The corridor has the following features:

  • “Three devils stand guard before a heavy metal door at the end of this long corridor.”
  • “Faint racking sobs emanate from behind the door.”
  • “Bloodstained spikes protrude from the ceiling.”
  • “A large lever protrudes from the north wall.”
  • (Secret) The lever activates a trap.

Guards. A @UUID[Actor.jrV7IWChOR9zlR61] and two @UUID[Actor.2ulibli6eeZo6uDa]{Devil Legates} guard the door to the holding cells (area @UUID[.1dy7NgLSnS0W2QMi]{I8}). When they notice intruders, the legates attack. The jurist hangs back near the lever and flips it once all the characters enter the room.

Reversed Gravity Trap. Creatures can use an action to pull down the lever on the north wall. When the lever is flipped, gravity reverses for each non-Devil creature in the room. Each non-Devil creature on the ground must succeed on a [[/save strength 17]] saving throw or take [[/damage 1d6 bludgeoning & 2d10 piercing average]] damage, and be &reference[restrained] as they fall up into the ceiling spikes. A creature restrained in this way takes [[/damage 2d10 piercing average]] damage at the start of each of their turns. A creature who isn't restrained can pull a restrained creature within their reach free with a successful [[/skill athletics 17]] check made as an action. A creature can turn off the trap by pulling the lever back up as an action, freeing any creatures restrained by the reversed gravity, who then fall 15 feet to the floor, taking [[/damage 1d6 bludgeoning average]] damage and landing &reference[prone].

Agonizing Touch.name: Agonizing Touch
Agonizing Touch.description:
Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (4d6) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[dazed] (save ends at end of turn). Each time a target dazed in this way fails a saving throw to end the condition, their hit point maximum is halved. This effect is cumulative, and the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

If a Humanoid dies within 1 minute of being hit by this attack, their spirit rises as a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.QF2UAJTEJee41EIf] under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control in an unoccupied space nearest to where that Humanoid died.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Agonizing Touch.name: Agonizing Touch
Agonizing Touch.description: You are dazed. You can repeat the [[/save wisdom 14]] saving throw at the end of each of your turns. Each time you fail this saving throw, your hit point maximum is halved. This effect is cumulative, and the reduction lasts until you finish a short or long rest.

Agonizing Phasing.name: Agonizing Phasing
Agonizing Phasing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage 1d10 force average]] damage if they end their turn inside an object. A creature takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage the first time a [[lookup @name lowercase]] passes through them on a turn.

Throes of Oblivion.name: Throes of Oblivion
Throes of Oblivion.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, they collapse inward, creating a burst of painful psychic energy. Each creature within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name]] must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Denied Vitality.name: Denied Vitality
Denied Vitality.description: When a creature who the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of them regains hit points, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can attempt to sap the life energy restoring the creature. The creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or only regain half the number of hit points they otherwise would regain.

save.condition: When a creature that the monster can see within 30 feet of them regains hit points.

Psychic Enervation.name: Psychic Enervation
Psychic Enervation.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall &reference[prone] and be &reference[frightened] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While frightened in this way, the target can't stand up.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Life Drain (Group Attack).name: Life Drain (Group Attack)
Life Drain (Group Attack).description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 necrotic damage.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed if they end their turn inside an object.

Terrifying.name: Terrifying
Terrifying.description:
If an enemy starts their turn within 5 feet of three or more [[lookup @name lowercase]]s, the enemy must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[frightened] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]s until the start of their next turn. The DC for this saving throw equals 10 plus the number of [[lookup @name lowercase]]s within 5 feet of the enemy. On a successful save, the enemy is immune to the [[lookup @item.name]] trait of all [[lookup @name lowercase]]s for the next 24 hours.

Foundry Note

The saving throw DC of this item can be configured when using this item.

save.condition: When an enemy starts its turn within 5 feet of three or more of this monster

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Choking Grasp.name: Choking Grasp
Choking Grasp.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and &reference[grappled] (escape DC 14). While grappled in this way, the target is &reference[restrained] and the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s speed isn't halved by the grapple.

Breathless Aura.name: Breathless Aura
Breathless Aura.description: Enemies within 30 feet of the koptourok can't speak, and if they are a creature who needs to breathe, they also have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.

Wings of Breath.name: Wings of Breath
Wings of Breath.description: The koptourok gains a flying speed equal to their walking speed if they have at least one enemy within 30 feet of them. If the koptourok starts their turn in the air and doesn't have a flying speed, they fall.

Wings of Breath.name: Wings of Breath
Wings of Breath.description: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed if at least one enemy is within 30 feet of you.

Thunderous Deflation.name: Thunderous Deflation
Thunderous Deflation.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 30 hit points or fewer, they unleash a shrieking wail. Each creature within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 16 (3d10) thunder damage and is &reference[deafened] until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't deafened. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] then releases all creatures they are grappling and flies up to their speed.

save.condition: When the monster drops to 30 hit points or fewer.

Last Gasp.name: Last Gasp
Last Gasp.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] attempts to steal the breath from each creature they are grappling. Each target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains temporary hit points equal to 5 times the number of creatures who failed their save.

Foundry Note

The Heal activity on this item can be used to configure the amount of temporary hit points the [[lookup @name lowercase]] should gain by selecting the number of creatures.

affects.special: Each creature the monster is grappling.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item XBnHczoRobxg2zAs]] attacks.

Dream Claw.name: Dream Claw
Dream Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage. If a target is hit by this attack more than once on a turn, they must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target falls &reference[unconscious] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn), until the target takes damage, or until another creature who can reach the target uses their action to wake them. Creatures who can't be supernaturally put to sleep automatically succeed on this saving throw.

save.condition: Follow-up to a second attack.

Supernatural Resistance.name: Supernatural Resistance
Supernatural Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item leZEOiAm8CzFbHNo]] attacks.

Vicious Visions.name: Vicious Visions
Vicious Visions.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] releases magic dream dust in a 60-foot cone. Each creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[charmed] for 1 minute or until they deal damage to another creature. While charmed, the creature sees all allies as enemies and all enemies as allies.

Tiny Time.name: Tiny Time
Tiny Time.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically shrinks down to a height of 1inch, becoming Tiny along with any items they wear or carry. While Tiny, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and they can use a bonus action to enter the head of an unconscious Humanoid they can reach or to grow back to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s normal size. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s game statistics otherwise remain the same.

While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is inside a Humanoid's head, that Humanoid is considered haunted by the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the head. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can speak telepathically to the haunted Humanoid, but the Humanoid is unaware of the source of this telepathic speech. The haunted Humanoid can't gain any benefit from rest unless the [[lookup @name lowercase]] allows it, and when the Humanoid attempts to sleep, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can fill the Humanoid's mind with nightmarish visions.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is expelled from the head and grows back to their normal size if the haunted Humanoid is affected by a dispel evil and good spell or similar supernatural effects, or if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses to exit the head as a bonus action.

Tiny.name: Tiny
Tiny.description: You are Tiny and have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

Essence of Shadowkeep.name: Essence of Shadowkeep
Essence of Shadowkeep.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement by an Illrigger, Paladin, or Warlock of Evil Alignment)

The Essence of Shadowkeep is a sentient fragment of the hellish influence permeating Shadowkeep, which takes the form of black mist. As an action, you can inhale the essence and attune to it instantly. You can exhale the essence as an action, ending your attunement to it.

While attuned to the essence, your eyes turn red and you gain the following benefits:

  • You are resistant to necrotic damage.
  • Your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.
  • When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can regain hit points equal to the damage dealt. Once you regain hit points in this way, you can't do so again until the next dusk.
  • You know about effects created by the Devil's Influence in Shadowkeep.

Sentience. The Essence of Shadowkeep is a sentient, lawful evil item with an Intelligence of 14, a Wisdom of 15, and a Charisma of 18. When a creature isn't attuned to it, the essence has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet and can speak and understand Common. When a creature is attuned to it, the essence can sense everything its wielder senses and can only communicate telepathically with its wielder.

Personality. Egotistical and domineering, the Essence of Shadowkeep is an ambitious force that craves action. The essence encourages its wielder to be decisive, choose action over words, and awe enemies with displays of might. If the wielder ignores the essence’s advice three times in a row, a conflict between it and the wielder arises at the next sunset.

Armor (Shield), Rare (Requires Attunement)

While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC.

Additionally, you can use an action to transform yourself and everything you wear and carry into a shadowy cloud for 10 minutes. The effect ends if you drop to 0 hit points or use an action to end it.

While in this form, your only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. You can enter and occupy the space of another creature. When you end your turn in another creature’s space, that creature takes 6d8 necrotic damage. You have resistance to mundane damage, and you have advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. You can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though you treat liquids as if they were solid surfaces. You can’t fall and remain hovering in the air even when stunned or otherwise incapacitated.

While in the form of a shadowy cloud, you can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects you were carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. You can’t attack, cast spells, or manifest powers.

Once you use the shield to transform into a shadowy cloud, that property can’t be used again until the following dusk.

Shadowkeep.name: Shadowkeep
Shadowkeep.text:
Optimized for Five 13th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00015 inline]

Shadowkeep Origins

Rhodar was gifted Shadowkeep after sacrificing the fiery heart of the dragon Wyraxain to an archdevil. We've left the archdevil unnamed so you can use one that fits your campaign setting. If you need an archdevil, we suggest using Infernal Chancellor Lazivos or a member of the Court of Seven Cities from Kingdoms & Warfare.

Shadowkeep Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Cursed Carriage. An alarming number of villagers have been disappearing at night, and multiple witnesses claim the victims were lured into a carriage driven by a headless coachman. After the characters hear these tales, the same coach approaches them on the road at night. Boarding or following it leads them to Shadowkeep.

Dragon's Grudge. Vizfrilkat, a descendant of Wyraxain, seeks revenge for their ancestor, but the magic of Shadowkeep prevents the dragon from entering the region. Vizfrilkat promises the characters a +3 weapon of their choice in exchange for putting down Rhodar once and for all.

Missing Mercenaries. Renowned local adventurers Zendra and Ravlen (see areas @UUID[.ZPKrktTNuodGp65p]{V1} and @UUID[.XiQYfUGebzWeKhHM]{V3}) went into Shadowkeep and never returned. Mundila Wulf, the human mayor of a nearby town, is concerned about their disappearance, as the duo has been protecting the region from monsters for a long time. Mundila offers the characters a +3 shield if they can find out what happened to the adventurers.

Shadowkeep Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of Shadowkeep has the following features:

Built for Vampires. Shadowkeep was created around the vampiric traits of climbing and flying; certain locations and traps are purpose-built as obstacles for creatures without those speeds.

Ceilings. The ceilings are 30 feet high, aside from those in the underground tunnels and the mausoleum (area @UUID[.Mz2VEcJizrlEHPeI]{V8}), which are 10 feet high.

Devil's Influence. Rhodar named the infernal power infusing Shadowkeep “the Devil's Influence.” This power causes unexplainable magical events inside the fortress. Only a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell or permanently destroying Rhodar can remove the Devil's Influence from Shadowkeep.

Illumination. The Devil's Influence manifests accursed black clouds, shrouding the summit of Drachen's Peak from the sun. In addition, Shadowkeep's interior and exterior walls exude eerie bloodred light, filling all areas with dim light.

Pipe Organ. The pipe organ in the occult sanctum (area @UUID[.VJNyP6bVpZb4iRCV]{V6}) plays ominous gothic music throughout the fortress due to the Devil's Influence. A creature who isn't Undead inside Shadowkeep has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

Secret Doors and Trapdoors. Each Undead knows the location of the secret doors and trapdoors in Shadowkeep. A creature who has a [[/skill perception 20 passive format=long]] spots the outline of these secret entrances, as does a creature who searches the area and succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 20]] check.

Walls. A creature without a climbing speed or climbing equipment can climb Shadowkeep's walls with a successful [[/skill athletics 17]] check.

Shadowkeep's Undead

Shadowkeep's vampires and other corporeal undead are seasoned warriors. If they are losing a fight, they retreat to find reinforcements before leading a counterattack against their enemies. When cornered, these undead fight until destroyed.

Spectral undead haunt the mausoleum, using their Incorporeal Movement trait to ambush creatures who foolishly disturb their resting place. These undead fight until destroyed.

Captured Undead. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=deception/intimidation 16]] check convinces a captured or cornered undead to give up one of the following pieces of information:

  • The location of traps in the ichor path (area @UUID[.6KdYHdJFtTaSpxYo]{V4}).
  • The nature of the organ trap in the occult sanctum (area @UUID[.VJNyP6bVpZb4iRCV]{V6}).
  • The location of one of the secret passages connecting area @UUID[.nNVI5JGo6sD0ha0J]{V5} to @UUID[.Mz2VEcJizrlEHPeI]{V8}, area @UUID[.XiQYfUGebzWeKhHM]{V3} to @UUID[.Mz2VEcJizrlEHPeI]{V8}, or area @UUID[.VJNyP6bVpZb4iRCV]{V6} to @UUID[.sR1qWWcYnUiPwfMC]{V7}.
  • The knowledge that Rhodar already knows the characters are in Shadowkeep.

Unconscious Creatures. If a creature who isn't Undead is reduced to 0 hit points, nearby spectral undead and vampires prioritize killing that creature and raising them to undeath.

Rhodar. The Devil's Influence bound Rhodar's essence to the surrounding region. The vampire lord is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of Shadowkeep and knows the distance and direction to each creature. He can communicate telepathically with any creature he can sense in this way. Rhodar baits, taunts, or tempts the characters — possibly without revealing he knows they're in Shadowkeep — but allows them to explore without coordinating his servants to attack them. If the heroes can overcome his forces, Rhodar deems them worthy of replacing his servants as his new vampire lieutenants.

Rhodar confronts the characters at the time and place of his choosing (see “Confrontation with Rhodar” below).

While we drink blood, specters, wraiths, and other dead creatures without form feed on a different lifeforce. Some say it is energy drawn from the souls of the living these ghosts pass through. Other sages take a more tangible approach, claiming the spirits siphon the warmth needed to survive from the bodies of mortals. Whatever the case, these undead have no interest in feeding on vampires, and therefore make perfect companions.

— Count Rhodar von Glauer

Confrontation with Rhodar

The final confrontation with Rhodar is designed to be epic and cinematic. Consider using Rhodar's communications with the characters as they explore Shadowkeep to increase their disdain for him before the encounter. Once the characters defeat all the vampires and vampire spawn in Shadowkeep — or if they try to leave the mountain before doing so — the GM can begin the confrontation with @UUID[Actor.saJzilrk4WCmIz39]. The following events precede the battle:

  • The Devil's Influence extinguishes the red light shed by the walls, plunging Shadowkeep into darkness.
  • The angelic face on the pipe organ in the occult sanctum (area @UUID[.VJNyP6bVpZb4iRCV]{V6}) weeps bloody tears as the instrument plays frantic, dreadful music.
  • Rhodar appears at a location of the GM's choice and initiates combat with the characters. The war room (area @UUID[.XiQYfUGebzWeKhHM]{V3}), the vault (area @UUID[.nNVI5JGo6sD0ha0J]{V5}), and the occult sanctum (area @UUID[.VJNyP6bVpZb4iRCV]{V6}) are excellent locations for this showdown.

Resting in Shadowkeep

Provided the characters first deal with any enemies in that area, they can take a short or long rest in areas @UUID[.nNVI5JGo6sD0ha0J]{V5} and @UUID[.Mz2VEcJizrlEHPeI]{V8}. Otherwise, if the characters attempt to rest, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>50]]{50 percent chance} three @UUID[Actor.t0bsaNZ3UJ3xIniJ] interrupt them halfway through their rest.

Entering Shadowkeep

Shadowkeep rests 27,666 feet above sea level atop the snow-tipped summit of Drachen's Peak, hidden by black clouds. When a creature pierces the thick shroud, they reach the top of the mountain (area @UUID[.ZPKrktTNuodGp65p]{V1}).

Mausoleum.name: Mausoleum
Mausoleum.text:
Rhodar built this mausoleum to hold the remains of those forced to pay the Red Tax. It connects to the mountain's summit (area @UUID[.ZPKrktTNuodGp65p]{V1}) via a pair of black oak doors warded by the Devil's Influence (see “Black Oak Doors” in area @UUID[.ZPKrktTNuodGp65p]{V1}). The mausoleum has no light sources. The characters only notice the following features if they have a light or another way to see in darkness:

  • “A stone sarcophagus, etched with a scene of horrified humans, sits at the center of the mausoleum.”
  • “A black marble statue portrays Rhodar von Glauer drinking blood from the neck of a human man. Across the room, a white marble sculpture depicts Rhodar biting the wrist of a human woman.”
  • “Three shadowy figures drift back and forth through the walls.”
  • (Secret) A secret door (see @UUID[.AAv3jgUt1vU8GW9W#shadowkeep-features]{Shadowkeep Features}) behind the black statue reveals a tunnel to the vault (area @UUID[.nNVI5JGo6sD0ha0J]{V5}), and a secret door behind the white statue reveals a tunnel to the war room (area @UUID[.XiQYfUGebzWeKhHM]{V3}).

Shadowy Figures. The three shadowy figures are @UUID[Actor.1VeBeZd3asAFXJ6p]{Wraiths} who paid Rhodar's Red Tax.

Sarcophagus. As an action, a creature can open the sarcophagus to reveal a 10-foot-deep hole. The bottom of the hole is filled with the bones of the victims of the Red Tax.

Treasure. A @UUID[Item.X2eC16wKFVqjQRyc]{mace of disruption} lies among the bones in the sarcophagus.

Count Rhodar's Hoard.name: Count Rhodar's Hoard
Count Rhodar's Hoard.text:
Count Rhodar von Glauer's treasure hoard is in his vault (area @UUID[.nNVI5JGo6sD0ha0J]{V5}). Rhodar accumulated this hoard over centuries of ruling and taxing the people of his land. Each coin in the hoard is stamped with the profile of the vampire lord.

The hoard contains the following items:

  • @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.items.Item.w3AOLX49pNsWHu0W]

Sanguinus

Sanguinus, the sword of Count Rhodar von Glauer, is made from the blood of his enemies. Only he can wield the weapon, and if he is destroyed, the weapon is also destroyed.

Drachen's Peak Summit.name: Drachen's Peak Summit
Drachen's Peak Summit.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Snow falls like ash from pitch-black clouds, adorning a large three-spire keep that emanates an ominous red glow.”
  • “The frozen corpse of an elf warrior lies on the ground. From the body drifts an elderly voice singing a children's lullaby: ‘Hush little beet, now don't you cry, granny's gonna make you into a pie…’”
  • “On Shadowkeep's south wall is a closed crimson door with a pentagram emblazed on its center.”
  • “West of Shadowkeep stands an obsidian structure inscribed with infernal markings. The edifice's entrance is marked by a pair of glossy black oak doors engraved with the phrase, ‘Those who pay the Red Tax may enter.’”
  • (Secret) When entered, the crimson door alerts the vampires in Shadowkeep of intruders.

Putrid Agnes. The @UUID[Actor.e61YpqA3BbgARS2H] Putrid Agnes sings from inside the head of Ravlen, a deceased elf warrior, using her Tiny Time action. Ravlen came to Shadowkeep because of the hag's whispers, but he froze to death outside the fortress. Agnes's song is part of a ritual that extracts the elf's essence from his body.

If the characters approach the corpse, Agnes crawls out of the elf's head. As she joyfully greets them, the hag magically grows from Tiny to Medium size, taking the form of a grandmotherly human. Her curly white hair is shaded by a brown bonnet, and she wears a yellow dress embroidered with patches depicting smiling beets. She doesn't hide that she's evil but also doesn't directly harm the characters.

Agnes is excited to see the adventurers venture into Shadowkeep, as the vampires allow her to extract the essences of their victims. She tells the characters a human warrior entered the fortress alone just hours ago and they're probably in need of rescue. The hag is referring to Zendra in the war room (area @UUID[.XiQYfUGebzWeKhHM]{V3}). To tempt the characters into Shadowkeep, Agnes is willing to either tell them which items are in the treasure hoard (see @UUID[.z6FB87hEiONYSoMT]), or to put them under the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20] spell, showing them any creature in the fortress except Rhodar.

If the characters attack, Agnes flees, claiming she'll return to extract their souls.

Crimson Door. A detect magic spell reveals that the door leading to Glauer Hall (area @UUID[.U9Wal6JtZDS9SdIx]{V2}) radiates an aura of divination magic. If a character moves within 10 feet of the crimson door, the Devil's Influence throws the door wide open. When a character moves over the door's threshold, the Devil's Influence alerts each vampire in Shadowkeep of intruders, and those vampires can't be surprised for 24 hours. A character who teleports across the threshold doesn't trigger this effect. A character who examines the door and succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 16]] check knows that crossing the crimson door's threshold alerts the vampires. A character who succeeds on this check by 5 or more knows that teleportation bypasses this alert. A character who casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH] spell on the door has advantage on this check.

Black Oak Doors. These doors lead into the mausoleum (area @UUID[.Mz2VEcJizrlEHPeI]{V8}) but are locked by the Devil's Influence. If a creature who isn't Undead moves within 10 feet of the doors, the Devil's Influence emits a melodic voice that asks, “Who is willing to pay the Red Tax?” If a character indicates they are willing, or if they attempt to damage or force open the doors, the Devil's Influence marks that creature with a blood splatter and the doors open. The blood splatter leaves an indelible stain that can't be washed or removed except by a cure ailment power of 4th order or higher, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk] spell, or a similar effect. In combat, vampires prioritize attacking and killing a creature marked by the blood splatter.

A creature who succeeds on a [[/tool thief 20]] check to pick the lock, or who has the bone key from Rhodar's sanctum (area @UUID[.sR1qWWcYnUiPwfMC]{V7}), can open the door without triggering the blood splatter effect.

Hush little beet, now don't you cry,
Granny's gonna make you into a pie.
If that pie is tasting sour,
Granny's gonna add some boney powder.
If that powder is too dry,
Granny's gonna make somebody die.

Putrid Agnes

Glauer Hall.name: Glauer Hall
Glauer Hall.text:
Glauer Hall connects to the mountain's summit via a door that is warded by the Devil's Influence (see “Crimson Door” in area @UUID[.ZPKrktTNuodGp65p]{V1}). This area has the following features:

  • “Hanging from a pillar in the center of the hall, an oil painting depicts a handsome knight atop Drachen's Peak. He carves the heart from a red-scaled dragon, while a devilish silhouette overlooks the scene.”
  • (Secret) Four vampire spawn hide in the ceiling's shadows.

Vampire Spawn. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill perception 17]] check notices the four @UUID[Actor.t0bsaNZ3UJ3xIniJ] on the ceiling. The spawn are on guard duty and alert. They attack once all characters enter Glauer Hall, trying to drag one character up to the ceiling to feed on, before dropping them in favor of a new victim.

Treasure. There is a hidden compartment behind the oil painting. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 16]] check notices a gap in the pillar behind the painting. Inside the compartment is a vial of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.e3XQygrXkzNvkDGF] with paint sufficient to cover 10 square feet of a surface.

War Room.name: War Room
War Room.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Atop a 15-foot-tall dais in the middle of the room, two nobles stand around a table having a hushed conversation.”
  • “Ten lavish coffins rest against the perimeter of the room. On the south wall, one coffin is adorned with raven sculptures and fixtures.”
  • (Secret) The raven coffin is backless and serves as a secret door (see @UUID[.AAv3jgUt1vU8GW9W#shadowkeep-features]{Shadowkeep Features}), revealing an earthen tunnel to area @UUID[.Mz2VEcJizrlEHPeI]{V8}.
  • (Secret) The southwest coffin contains a koptourok.
  • (Secret) A terrified human hides in the southeast coffin.

Undead Enemies. Famsa (a @UUID[Actor.m3lhlC4vYgUDhvQ2]) and her advisor Merric (a @UUID[Actor.t0bsaNZ3UJ3xIniJ]) stand at the table analyzing a regional map while debating military strategies to reclaim eastern Rhöl. A @UUID[Actor.DbHknvV8XWBLivBu] that Rhodar found in the caves of Drachen's Peak hides in the southwest coffin. If the characters disturb this coffin, open the secret door, or fight the vampires, the koptourok attacks.

Zendra. The southeast coffin contains Zendra, a terrified @UUID[Actor.fzqe9cDal8MwY1HK] who came to Shadowkeep seeking her adventuring partner, Ravlen (see area V1). She managed to sneak into this area and has been hiding ever since. If the characters find her, she throws herself at their mercy, offering to aid them in the fight against Rhodar if they help her escape.

Coffins. The two coffins closest to the door to Glauer Hall (area @UUID[.U9Wal6JtZDS9SdIx]{V2}) are the resting places of Famsa and Azon (see area @UUID[.VJNyP6bVpZb4iRCV]{V6}).

Ichor Path.name: Ichor Path
Ichor Path.text:
This area was constructed to guard Rhodar's treasure hoard and has the following features:

  • “A pool of stinking black liquid covers the room's floor. White marble stepping stones protrude from the bubbling ichor.”
  • (Secret) Four stepping stones are affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pB7XVYwdGNcUG935] spell (see “Glyphs of Warding”).

Black Liquid. The pool is 10 feet deep. A character who is proficient with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.SztwZhbhZeCqyAes]{alchemist's supplies} or who succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 17]] check recognizes the liquid as devil ichor — a corrosive substance extracted from a devil's organs. A creature who enters the black liquid for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there takes [[/damage 4d10 acid average]] damage.

If a creature who isn't Undead attempts to fly over the liquid, they must succeed on a [[/save dexterity 17]] saving throw or be dragged to the bottom of the pool by a hand of ichor.

Glyphs of Warding. The map indicates which stepping stones are inscribed with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pB7XVYwdGNcUG935] spell. Each glyph triggers a different spell when a creature who isn't Undead touches the stone. Starting with the stone closest to the door to Glauer Hall (area @UUID[.U9Wal6JtZDS9SdIx]{V2}) and continuing counterclockwise, the triggered spells are @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.tMH6Ivn4GmE1naMj] (6th level), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0] (3rd level), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe] (4th level), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.HBHbOGKNVVprSlwn] (6th level). Each spell has a save DC of 17.

Vault.name: Vault
Vault.text:
The iron door to this area is locked from the ichor path (area V4) side. A creature who succeeds on a [[/tool thief 20]] check picks the lock, or a creature who succeeds on a [[/check strength 20]] check forces the door open. The bone key in Rhodar's sanctum (area @UUID[.sR1qWWcYnUiPwfMC]{V7}) unlocks this door. The door has AC 19, 50 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

The vault has the following features:

  • “Statues and antique relics surround a mound of coins.”
  • “Above the coins, wisps of shadow twist and stretch around each other.”
  • (Secret) A loose floor tile hides a trapdoor (see @UUID[.AAv3jgUt1vU8GW9W#shadowkeep-features]{Shadowkeep Features}) to a tunnel to the mausoleum (area @UUID[.Mz2VEcJizrlEHPeI]{V8}).

Essence of Shadowkeep. The wisps of shadow are the @UUID[Item.b91iSNdxEkRZX8d4] (see @UUID[.z6FB87hEiONYSoMT]). When the characters approach the hoard, the essence speaks in a harsh whisper, asking to be inhaled by an ambitious warrior who wishes to use their might to further their goals.

Treasure. The vault contains Count Rhodar's treasure hoard. See @UUID[.z6FB87hEiONYSoMT] for more information.

Occult Sanctum.name: Occult Sanctum
Occult Sanctum.text:
Vampires use this unholy temple to perform occult rituals. This area has the following features:

  • “Four black-robed figures chant in unison around a burning pentagram with a candle at its center. An audience of spectral figures watches from nearby pews.”
  • “A pipe organ, made of bones and bearing the symbol of an angel's face, plays gothic music of its own accord.”
  • (Secret) The center of the pentagram hides a trapdoor (see @UUID[.AAv3jgUt1vU8GW9W#shadowkeep-features]{Shadowkeep Features}) to a tunnel to Rhodar's sanctum (area @UUID[.sR1qWWcYnUiPwfMC]{V7}).

Ritual. Azon (a @UUID[Actor.m3lhlC4vYgUDhvQ2]) and three @UUID[Actor.y7SUM0QP2XR8emHU]{Wights} perform an occult ritual in the center of the room as ten @UUID[Actor.DOORzWwiNfQpIMQ3]{Shades} watch from the pews. The ritualists pray in Infernal, beseeching aid from the Seven Cities of Hell to deliver them fresh victims. If Azon knows the characters are in Shadowkeep, the prayer mentions them by name. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 17]] check recognizes the sacrificial ritual, which summons a devil, and how to disrupt it. The ritual can be ended by casting a successful @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] spell on the pentagram, or by defeating Azon and the wights before the last shade is destroyed. If the ritual is not ended before the shades are destroyed, a @UUID[Actor.jcHS1rJuPsYMJ8TN] appears in an unoccupied space in the pentagram and fights intruders to the death while defending Rhodar's remaining Undead.

Pipe Organ. If a creature who isn't Undead starts their turn within 10 feet of the pipe organ, the angel's face weeps bloody tears while uttering “Save yourself while you can” in Celestial. The creature must succeed on a [[/save wisdom 15]] saving throw or be &reference[frightened] of the organ for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for them, the creature is immune to the organ's effects for 24 hours.

Rhodar's Sanctum.name: Rhodar's Sanctum
Rhodar's Sanctum.text:
This room has no light sources. The characters only notice the following features if they have a way to see in magical darkness:

  • “The petrified corpse of a faceless angel rests in the middle of the room.”
  • (Secret) If Rhodar was defeated in combat (see the @UUID[.AAv3jgUt1vU8GW9W#confrontation-with-rhodar]{Confrontation with Rhodar} section), he retreats here.

Darkness. The Devil's Influence shrouds this area with magical darkness. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and mundane light can't illuminate it. If any of the darkness's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Petrified Corpse. The petrified angel corpse is Rhodar's resting place. The corpse is hinged and can be opened like a coffin. Dousing the corpse with a @UUID[Item.UZnItsk27CzzpnlN]{flask of holy water} destroys it. It has AC 17, 100 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

If Rhodar has been reduced to 0 hit points within the last hour, he's in his resting place.

Bone Key. Rhodar keeps a bone key inside the petrified corpse. The key unlocks the doors to the mausoleum (area @UUID[.Mz2VEcJizrlEHPeI]{V8}) and the vault (area @UUID[.nNVI5JGo6sD0ha0J]{V5}).

Scintillating.name: Scintillating
Scintillating.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't benefit from being &reference[invisible apply=false].

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item iQekNmLXcdbzgel2]] attacks, and they can use [[/item 5HsWlq0jsHTjx0E8]] or [[/item 6047lfg9G0oyoV0Y]], if available.

Frosted Reflection.name: Frosted Reflection
Frosted Reflection.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] reflects the appearance of a specific Medium or Small creature they've seen within the last week. This appearance is illusory and imperfect, showing a frostbitten version of the creature. The illusion lasts until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes thunder damage, uses this action again, or is incapacitated. For the duration, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] additionally knows any languages that creature knows.

It Stares Back.name: It Stares Back
It Stares Back.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] imposes fragility on a creature within 60 feet of them who is reflected by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Frosted Reflection. If the target can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is &reference[frightened] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn), or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] stops reflecting them. While frightened in this way, whenever the target takes damage, they take an extra 11 (2d10) psychic damage. On a successful save, the target isn't frightened, and they are immune to the It Stares Back of all cruxes for 24 hours.

It Stares Back.name: It Stares Back
It Stares Back.description: You are frightened of the monster. While frightened in this way, whenever you take damage, you take an extra 11 (2d10) psychic damage. You can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Immunity: It Stares Back.name: Immunity: It Stares Back
Immunity: It Stares Back.description: You are immune to the monster's It Stares Back feature for the next 24 hours.

Convocation of Ice.name: Convocation of Ice
Convocation of Ice.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] imbues the power of ice in themself or another Elemental they can see within 30 feet of them, granting one of the following effects of that Elemental's choice:

  • Frigid Sheen: The Elemental gains a mirror sheen that reflects damage for 1 minute. When the Elemental is hit with an attack by a creature they can see within 30 feet of them, the Elemental can use a reaction to reflect the attack. The Elemental is unaffected by the attack, and the attacker must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the attack's damage and effects are reflected back at the attacker as if the attack originated from the Elemental, turning the attacker into the target. On a successful save, the attacker takes half as much damage, but suffers no other effect.

  • Frost Squall: Frost swirls around the Elemental for 1 minute. For the duration, each non-Elemental creature who starts their turn within 15 feet of the Elemental has their speed reduced to 15 feet unless it is already lower until the end of their turn, and the first time they willingly move before the start of their next turn, they take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

Convocation of Ice: Frigid Sheen.name: Convocation of Ice: Frigid Sheen
Convocation of Ice: Frigid Sheen.description: The Elemental gains a mirror sheen that reflects damage for 1 minute. When the Elemental is hit with an attack by a creature they can see within 30 feet of them, the Elemental can use a reaction to reflect the attack. The Elemental is unaffected by the attack, and the attacker must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the attack's damage and effects are reflected back at the attacker as if the attack originated from the Elemental, turning the attacker into the target. On a successful save, the attacker takes half as much damage, but suffers no other effect.

Convocation of Ice: Frost Squall.name: Convocation of Ice: Frost Squall
Convocation of Ice: Frost Squall.description: Frost swirls around the Elemental for 1 minute. For the duration, each non-Elemental creature who starts their turn within 15 feet of the Elemental has their speed reduced to 15 feet unless it is already lower until the end of their turn, and the first time they willingly move before the start of their next turn, they take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

Rimeglass Touch.name: Rimeglass Touch
Rimeglass Touch.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) cold damage, and the target can't see or hear creatures other than themself and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] until the start of the crux's next turn.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of their next turn.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage, and [[lookup @name]] can move the target up to 15 feet horizontally.

Frosted Resistance.name: Frosted Resistance
Frosted Resistance.description: When [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw, they can succeed instead. When they do, their speed is halved and they can't take the Disengage action until the end of their next turn.

utility.condition: When they fail a saving throw.

Hoarfrost.name: Hoarfrost
Hoarfrost.description: Cold damage dealt by [[lookup @name]] ignores damage resistance.

Ice Walk.name: Ice Walk
Ice Walk.description: [[lookup @name]] can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost them extra movement.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes one [[/item acVqObD4VJv8b2wX]] attack and two [[/item a8XrN7ugBKpUMbih]] attacks.

Numbing Breath.name: Numbing Breath
Numbing Breath.description: [[lookup @name]] exhales a freezing blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 42 (12d6) cold damage and is &reference[restrained] until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't restrained.

Icy Grip.name: Icy Grip
Icy Grip.description: [[lookup @name]] encases a creature they can see within 60 feet of them in ice. The target must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 (4d10) cold damage and is &reference[restrained]. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't restrained. A creature can use an action to break themself or another creature they can reach out of the ice, ending the restrained condition.

Withering Frost.name: Withering Frost
Withering Frost.description: When a creature within 5 feet of [[lookup @name]] hits them with an attack, [[lookup @name]] releases a burst of cold energy. Each creature within 5 feet of the monster must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

save.condition: When a creature within 5 feet of the monster hits it with an attack.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
[[lookup @name]] has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

[[/item SAhR9LkF0yRCHcyB]]

[[/item jr1ouc0jzoUMS4mt]]

[[/item 89Q7DRRXNk8qkZKR]]

Raging Blizzard.name: Raging Blizzard
Raging Blizzard.description: [[lookup @name]] beats their wings, and frigid winds and hail swirl around them. Each creature within 120 feet of them must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage, is pushed 60 feet directly away from [[lookup @name]], and is knocked &reference[prone]. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked prone.

Royal Defense.name: Royal Defense
Royal Defense.description: [[lookup @name]] calls the faithful soul of a spectral guard to fight at their side. The guard uses the @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.S43Dm9FsYquFqpCY]{Frost Giant Wind Sprinter} stat block, but they are an Undead instead of a Giant. The guard acts immediately after [[lookup @name]] and follows the monster's verbal commands. While the guard is within 60 feet of [[lookup @name]], [[lookup @name]] gains resistance to all damage. If [[lookup @name]] dies, the guard is destroyed.

Frost Cataclysm.name: Frost Cataclysm
Frost Cataclysm.description: [[lookup @name]] releases a pulse of frigid energy followed by a shock wave of force in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on them. Each enemy in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Immediately after, each enemy in that area must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

Agonizing Touch.name: Agonizing Touch
Agonizing Touch.description:
Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (4d6) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[dazed] (save ends at end of turn). Each time a target dazed in this way fails a saving throw to end the condition, their hit point maximum is halved. This effect is cumulative, and the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

If a Humanoid dies within 1 minute of being hit by this attack, their spirit rises as a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.QF2UAJTEJee41EIf] under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control in an unoccupied space nearest to where that Humanoid died.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Agonizing Touch.name: Agonizing Touch
Agonizing Touch.description: You are dazed. You can repeat the [[/save wisdom 14]] saving throw at the end of each of your turns. Each time you fail this saving throw, your hit point maximum is halved. This effect is cumulative, and the reduction lasts until you finish a short or long rest.

Agonizing Phasing.name: Agonizing Phasing
Agonizing Phasing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage 1d10 force average]] damage if they end their turn inside an object. A creature takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage the first time a [[lookup @name lowercase]] passes through them on a turn.

Throes of Oblivion.name: Throes of Oblivion
Throes of Oblivion.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, they collapse inward, creating a burst of painful psychic energy. Each creature within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name]] must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Denied Vitality.name: Denied Vitality
Denied Vitality.description: When a creature who the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of them regains hit points, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can attempt to sap the life energy restoring the creature. The creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or only regain half the number of hit points they otherwise would regain.

save.condition: When a creature that the monster can see within 30 feet of them regains hit points.

Psychic Enervation.name: Psychic Enervation
Psychic Enervation.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall &reference[prone] and be &reference[frightened] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While frightened in this way, the target can't stand up.

save.condition: Follow-up to the attack.

Signature Attack (Longsword).name: Signature Attack (Longsword)
Signature Attack (Longsword).description: Melee Attack: +3 plus PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 plus PB slashing damage. Beginning at 7th level, the deathguard can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

Fist.name: Fist
Fist.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, they are &reference[grappled] (escape DC 14). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has two fists, each of which can grapple one target.

Negative Nerves.name: Negative Nerves
Negative Nerves.description: Whenever a creature deals 7 damage or less to the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes no damage instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item y8G42f5ZU9B67SMU]] attacks.

Toxic Exhalation.name: Toxic Exhalation
Toxic Exhalation.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] spews toxic vomit in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Shove Away.name: Shove Away
Shove Away.description: When a Huge or smaller creature within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits them with a melee attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] pushes the creature up to 10 feet away.

utility.condition: When a creature within 10 feet of the monster hits them with a melee attack

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is not a Construct, an Elemental, or a Plant, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. If this attack reduces the target to 0 hit points, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains twice as many hit points as they otherwise would with this attack.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

Sluggish.name: Sluggish
Sluggish.description: For 1 hour after sleep or another period of unconsciousness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s speed is halved and they can't use Multiattack.

Sluggish.name: Sluggish
Sluggish.description: Your speed is halved for 1 hour after sleep or other period of unconsciousness.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item AKAfu1KQGWqikzKW]] attack and two [[/item 2OfrZjyOJrJG8eNr]] attacks.

Relentless Hunger.name: Relentless Hunger
Relentless Hunger.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is reduced to 0 hit points by any damage other than acid or fire damage, they don't die or fall unconscious, and can continue moving and taking actions as usual. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] only dies if they end their turn with 0 hit points, if acid or fire damage reduces them to 0 hit points, or if they take acid or fire damage while they have 0 hit points.

Crash Through.name: Crash Through
Crash Through.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to their speed in a straight line, smashing through mundane obstacles in their path. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can enter the spaces of Large or smaller creatures during this movement, forcing those creatures to make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage and falls &reference[prone]. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone.

During this move, mundane objects that aren't worn or carried by a creature take 14 (4d6) damage when the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters their space. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves into the space of a Large or larger object and this damage doesn't destroy it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s movement stops and they are &reference[stunned] until the end of their next turn.

Spiteful Retort.name: Spiteful Retort
Spiteful Retort.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is reduced to 0 hit points and doesn't die, they can make a [[/item AKAfu1KQGWqikzKW]] attack against a creature within 5 feet of them.

utility.condition: When the monster is reduced to 0 hit points.

Wind Sweep (Group Attack).name: Wind Sweep (Group Attack)
Wind Sweep (Group Attack).description: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 slashing damage, and if this attack was made by more than one [[lookup @name lowercase]] against a Large or smaller creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]]s can move that creature up to 5 feet horizontally for each [[lookup @name lowercase]] that joined the attack.

Minion.name: Minion
Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

Dragon Slayer Longsword.name: Dragon Slayer Longsword
Dragon Slayer Longsword.description:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a dragon with this weapon, the dragon takes an extra 3d6 damage of the weapon's type. For the purpose of this weapon, "dragon" refers to any creature with the dragon type, including dragon turtles and wyverns.

Marvelous Pigments.name: Marvelous Pigments
Marvelous Pigments.description:
Typically found in [[/r 1d4]] pots inside a fine wooden box with a brush (weighing 1 pound in total), these pigments allow you to create three-dimensional objects by painting them in two dimensions. The paint flows from the brush to form the desired object as you concentrate on its image.

Each pot of paint is sufficient to cover 1,000 square feet of a surface, which lets you create inanimate objects or terrain features—such as a door, a pit, flowers, trees, cells, rooms, or weapons—that are up to 10,000 cubic feet. It takes 10 minutes to cover 100 square feet.

When you complete the painting, the object or terrain feature depicted becomes a real, nonmagical object. Thus, painting a door on a wall creates an actual door that can be opened to whatever is beyond. Painting a pit on a floor creates a real pit, and its depth counts against the total area of objects you create.

Nothing created by the pigments can have a value greater than 25 gp. If you paint an object of greater value (such as a diamond or a pile of gold), the object looks authentic, but close inspection reveals it is made from paste, bone, or some other worthless material.

If you paint a form of energy such as fire or lightning, the energy appears but dissipates as soon as you complete the painting, doing no harm to anything.

Dragon Statue carved from Ice.name: Dragon Statue carved from Ice
Dragon Statue carved from Ice.description: A dragon statue carved from ice that never melts, dusted with diamond dust.

Potion of Clairvoyance.name: Potion of Clairvoyance
Potion of Clairvoyance.description:
An eyeball bobs in this yellowish liquid but vanishes when the potion is opened.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{Clairvoyance} spell.

Oil of Etherealness.name: Oil of Etherealness
Oil of Etherealness.description:
Beads of this cloudy gray oil form on the outside of its container and quickly evaporate.

The oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN]{Etherealness} spell for 1 hour.

utility.condition: Medium or smaller creature. Takes 10 minutes to apply.

Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals.name: Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals
Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals.description:
Wondrous item

While this bowl is filled with water, you can use an action to speak the bowl's command word and summon a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.namJz755U1EhvEJa]{Water Elemental}, as if you had cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1LkZvINag7KqBmDR]{Conjure Elemental} spell. The bowl can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

The bowl is about 1 foot in diameter and half as deep. It weighs 3 pounds and holds about 3 gallons.

utility.condition: Command word.

Potion of Cloud Giant Strength.name: Potion of Cloud Giant Strength
Potion of Cloud Giant Strength.description:
This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 27 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

Oil of Sharpness.name: Oil of Sharpness
Oil of Sharpness.description:
This clear, gelatinous oil sparkles with tiny, ultrathin silver shards.

The oil can coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to 5 pieces of slashing or piercing ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

Potion of Flying.name: Potion of Flying
Potion of Flying.description:
This potion's clear liquid floats at the top of its container and has cloudy white impurities drifting in it.

When you drink this potion, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 1 hour and can hover. If you're in the air when the potion wears off, you fall unless you have some other means of staying aloft.

Draconic Visage.name: Draconic Visage
Draconic Visage.description:
(Requires Attunement)

This mask bears the visage of a fearsome white-scaled dragon. When you finish a long rest, you can change the color of the mask’s scales to another color on the Draconic Visage Color table.

When you wear the mask, your body becomes covered in dragon scales, granting you a +1 bonus to AC and resistance to the damage type associated with the mask’s color. You can speak and understand Draconic, and you have advantage on Charisma checks made to influence dragons.

Additionally, when you wear the mask and deal damage to a creature, you can deal an extra 3d10 damage of the type associated with the mask’s color. The mask can deal extra damage in this way three times and regains all expended uses daily at dawn.

Draconic Visage Color
ColorDamage Type
BlackAcid
BlueLightning
GreenPoison
RedFire
WhiteCold
Foundry Note

Use the "Change Mask Color" activity to enchant the Draconic Visage in order to gain the specific resistances and special damage actions for each dragon color.
