Black Dragon's Acid.condition: When you deal damage to a creature while wearing this mask.

Blue Dragon's Lightning.name: Blue Dragon's Lightning
Blue Dragon's Lightning.condition: When you deal damage to a creature while wearing this mask.

Red Dragon's Fire.name: Red Dragon's Fire
Red Dragon's Fire.condition: When you deal damage to a creature while wearing this mask.

White Dragon's Frost.name: White Dragon's Frost
White Dragon's Frost.condition: When you deal damage to a creature while wearing this mask.

Green Dragon's Poison.name: Green Dragon's Poison
Green Dragon's Poison.condition: When you deal damage to a creature while wearing this mask.

Black Dragon's Scales.name: Black Dragon's Scales
Black Dragon's Scales.description: While you wear this mask, you gain resistance to acid damage and have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class. Additionally, you can speak and understand Draconic, and you have advantage on Charisma checks made to influence dragons.

Red Dragon's Scales.name: Red Dragon's Scales
Red Dragon's Scales.description: While you wear this mask, you gain resistance to fire damage and have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class. Additionally, you can speak and understand Draconic, and you have advantage on Charisma checks made to influence dragons.

Blue Dragon's Scales.name: Blue Dragon's Scales
Blue Dragon's Scales.description: While you wear this mask, you gain resistance to lightning damage and have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class. Additionally, you can speak and understand Draconic, and you have advantage on Charisma checks made to influence dragons.

White Dragon's Scales.name: White Dragon's Scales
White Dragon's Scales.description: While you wear this mask, you gain resistance to acid damage and have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class. Additionally, you can speak and understand Draconic, and you have advantage on Charisma checks made to influence dragons.

Green Dragon's Scales.name: Green Dragon's Scales
Green Dragon's Scales.description: While you wear this mask, you gain resistance to poison damage and have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class. Additionally, you can speak and understand Draconic, and you have advantage on Charisma checks made to influence dragons.

Bead of Force.name: Bead of Force
Bead of Force.description:
Wondrous item

This small black sphere measures 3/4 of an inch in diameter and weighs an ounce. Typically, 1d4 + 4 Beads of Force are found together.

You can use an action to throw the bead up to 60 feet. The bead explodes on impact and is destroyed. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of where the bead landed must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 5d4 force damage. A sphere of transparent force then encloses the area for 1 minute. Any creature that failed the save and is completely within the area is trapped inside this sphere. Creatures that succeeded on the save, or are partially within the area, are pushed away from the center of the sphere until they are no longer inside it. Only breathable air can pass through the sphere's wall. No attack or other effect can.

An enclosed creature can use its action to push against the sphere's wall, moving the sphere up to half the creature's walking speed. The sphere can be picked up, and its magic causes it to weigh only 1 pound, regardless of the weight of creatures inside.

Crog's Guide to Disarming Magic Traps.name: Crog's Guide to Disarming Magic Traps
Crog's Guide to Disarming Magic Traps.description:
This book describes various mundane techniques and theories related to foiling magic traps. If you spend 48 hours studying this book, you learn how to overcome certain types of magic traps with your thieves’ tools.

If a trap’s magic can be dispelled or suppressed by a dispel magic spell, you can make a Dexterity check using thieves’ tools to achieve the same result. The DC of the Dexterity check is equal to 5 + the DC required to dispel or suppress the trap with dispel magic (minimum DC 18). On a failed check, the trap triggers.

Durixaviinox's Rest.name: Durixaviinox's Rest
Durixaviinox's Rest.text:
Optimized for Five 14th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00016 inline]

Durixaviinox's Rest Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Creeping Death. Durixaviinox's increasing activity has made the region around the dragon's lair all but uninhabitable, blanketing it with biting frost, constant blizzards, and deadly avalanches. Brynmor Stonedancer, matriarch of a nearby dwarf settlement, asks the characters to stop the dragon before the cold reaches their homes within the mountain. If the characters put down the dragon, Brynmor rewards them with a hammer of thunderbolts.

Draconic Wraiths. Spectral dragons are terrorizing the region surrounding Durixaviinox's Rest, causing chaos and panic. Those who know Draconic say the spirits lament the demise of their lost city and herald the return of the Ruined Providence. Local leaders offer the characters @UUID[Item.WTARU3qpHO35W9Du]{twenty magnificent diamonds} (worth 5,000 gp each) for delving into Durixaviinox's Rest and obtaining the dragon's head.

Rival Cult. A cult dedicated to one of Durixaviinox's draconic rivals (either Qazyldrath or Yserthrax) seeks the characters' assistance to make sure the Ruined Providence never rises again. The cultists claim that a war among the dragons would devastate the Mundane World.

Durixaviinox's Rest Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of Durixaviinox's Rest has the following features:

Ceilings. Ceilings are 70 feet high.

Extreme Cold. At the end of each hour a creature spends in the lair, they must succeed on a [[/save constitution 15]] saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion. Creatures who are wearing cold weather clothing or who have resistance or immunity to cold damage automatically succeed on this save.

Frigid Lakes. The lakes are 50 feet deep. When a creature starts their turn in a lake, they take [[/damage 4d6 cold average]] damage. Cold weather clothing that is wet grants its wearer no benefit against extreme cold until the clothing is removed and dried by a fire or other heat source for 1 hour.

Icy Surfaces. Every surface is covered in ice. A creature who moves more than half their speed while climbing or walking on the ice must succeed on a [[/skill acrobatics 15]] check or fall &reference[prone] at the end of their movement. A creature who can ignore the effects of difficult terrain composed of ice succeeds automatically. A creature without climbing equipment must succeed on a [[/skill athletics 22]] check to climb the walls. Creatures who live in the lair are used to the icy surfaces, and can move normally over them without needing to make an ability check.

Illumination. There are no light sources.

Magic Traps and Portal. The lair contains three magic traps (one in area W1 and two in area @UUID[.rPiH5GR6xzviTcwt]{W2}) and a portal (in area @UUID[.wclzVzpntJvu6KZU]{W4}). Treat the traps and the portal as 6th-level spells for the purpose of dispel magic and similar effects. A dispelled trap becomes mundane and is disarmed, and a dispelled portal closes.

Durixaviinox's Guardians

Durixaviinox's few guardians are undead and elementals who attack intruders and fight to the death.

Resting in Durixaviinox's Rest

After dealing with any enemies in an area, the characters can take a short rest there without interruption. If the characters take a long rest while @UUID[Actor.AdZ3Ci4t3WPh8mxh] is alive and in the lair, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>70]]{30 percent chance} he finds them [[/r 1d6]] hours into the rest.

Entering Durixaviinox's Rest

A creature must succeed on a [[/skill survival 20]] check to find the mountain cave that leads to Durixaviinox's Rest. On a failed check, the creature can't find the cave and can't try again for 24 hours. Each day the characters spend searching the mountains for the lair entrance, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>70]]{30 percent chance} that [[/r 1d4 + 2]] @UUID[Actor.PH9mgoye1a1TUWnN]{Trolls} who have immunity to cold damage find the party and attack.

Once the characters find the cave, they must move through a 20-foot-wide, 40-foot-tall tunnel for 6 miles as it twists and turns, descending into the earth. This tunnel ends at the top of the chasm (area @UUID[.ZrkW2mJfkPYy8yOG]{W1}).

Durixaviinox's Rest Areas.name: Durixaviinox's Rest Areas
Durixaviinox's Rest Areas.text:
The following areas are keyed to the Durixaviinox's Rest Map.

@UUID[.ZrkW2mJfkPYy8yOG]{W1. Chasm}

@UUID[.rPiH5GR6xzviTcwt]{W2. Guard Room}

@UUID[.4eIpKuG2UWTx5T2g]{W3. Memory Hall}

@UUID[.wclzVzpntJvu6KZU]{W4. Frigid Lake}

@UUID[.flNOv3dZlw170ZWu]{W5. Throne Room}

Chasm.name: Chasm
Chasm.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “The tunnel ends at a shaft that descends into darkness.”
  • “Jagged rocks and ice create treacherous handholds and footholds.”
  • (Secret) A magic glyph inscribed on the shaft's walls triggers a trap.

Trapped Shaft. This 200-foot-tall shaft descends to the guard room (area @UUID[.rPiH5GR6xzviTcwt]{W2}). The glyph is placed halfway down the shaft. Characters who succeed on a [[/skill investigation 18]] check notice the faint outline of the glyph. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the glyph's aura of evocation magic.

A creature can attempt to chip away the ice encasing the rune and scratch it out by making a [[/tool thief 20]] check or any sharp weapon or tool. On a success, the trap deactivates; otherwise, it triggers.

When a creature who isn't Durixaviinox passes the shaft's halfway point, all the ice explodes from its walls and the glyph disappears. Each creature inside the shaft or within 5 feet of its top must make a [[/save dexterity 18]] saving throw. A creature climbing the chasm wall has disadvantage on the saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 8d10 piercing average]] damage and falls to the floor of the guard room (area W2), taking [[/damage 1d6 bludgeoning average]] damage per 10 feet fallen and landing &reference[prone] (see “Ice and Bone Spikes” in area @UUID[.rPiH5GR6xzviTcwt]{W2}). On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall.

If all the ice is removed from the shaft's walls, creatures without climbing equipment can climb the shaft with a successful [[/skill athletics 15]] check, instead of the check normally required (see @UUID[.JKB9Y9j2MunpJ8Mu#durixaviinoxs-rest-features]{Durixaviinox's Rest Features}).

Guard Room.name: Guard Room
Guard Room.text:
The guard room's ceiling is only 25 feet high. This area has the following features:

  • “Long ice spikes and frozen bones protrude from the floor, walls, and ceiling of this chamber.”
  • “The corpses of six giants lie on the floor of this chamber, their flesh preserved in frost.”
  • (Secret) The corpses are giant zombies.
  • (Secret) Two wraiths wait in the ice, ready to attack.

Undead. When a character passes through the center of the chamber or disturbs a corpse, the six @UUID[Actor.P2EzhGvqnAVcSVOS]{Giant Zombies} and the two @UUID[Actor.EBNN1Z5UpK6nmKJy]{Wraiths} attack. Four zombies shove intruders into spikes, knock them &reference[prone], or &reference[grappled]{grapple} characters and pull them away from their allies, while the other two zombies and the wraiths target characters who are prone or who have the lowest AC. The giants have advantage on Strength checks made to grapple and shove Medium or smaller characters. They also use their Shove Away reaction to push creatures into the spikes.

Ice and Bone Spikes. A creature who falls prone in this chamber or who is pushed against the wall or ceiling takes [[/damage 2d10 piercing & 2d10 cold average]] damage.

The spikes protruding from the walls make them easier to climb. A creature only needs to succeed on a [[/skill athletics 12]] check to climb the wall without climbing equipment.

Memory Hall.name: Memory Hall
Memory Hall.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Snow covers the floor of this chamber.”
  • “Frozen corpses and rusted, worthless objects are stuck to the walls behind a thick layer of ice. Their orderly arrangement suggests someone has neatly curated the grotesque display.”
  • “Two massive ice-covered pillars flank the room's east exit and extend from floor to ceiling. The pillars are carved with images of dragons creating art, music, poetry, and spells.”
  • (Secret) The room contains three traps designed to kill intruders.
  • (Secret) Galithor, a wight, is imprisoned in the ice on the chamber's west wall.

Snow-Covered Floor. A 1-foot-deep layer of snow covers the chamber's icy floor, making it difficult terrain for Medium or smaller creatures. Dealing 5 or more fire damage to a 5-foot square of snow melts it.

Freezing Runes Trap. A 5-foot-wide band of Draconic runes is carved into the floor beneath the snow. The band starts 10 feet away from the north wall and extends to 10 feet away from the south wall. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the runes' aura of evocation magic.

A creature who removes the snow from the runes can see how far the runes extend but must succeed on a [[/skill sleightofhand 15]] check or activate the trap.

When a creature who isn't Durixaviinox walks, flies, or otherwise crosses over the runes, the trap triggers. The triggering creature must make a [[/save constitution 18]] saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 6d8 cold average]] damage and is &reference[restrained] by ice. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't restrained. While restrained by ice, a creature takes [[/damage 3d8 cold average]] damage at the start of each of their turns. The ice has AC 17, 27 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage. When the ice is reduced to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to the restrained creature, and they are no longer restrained.

Spear Trap. Characters who examine the ceiling and succeed on a [[/skill investigation 18]] check notice that 2-inch-diameter holes dot the stone on the other side of the ice.

A thin tripwire made from the strong web of a fey spider runs north to south across the room at a height of 6 inches, buried in the snow. A creature who moves the snow around the tripwire must succeed on a [[/skill sleightofhand 15]] check or activate the trap.

If the snow is cleared, a creature must succeed on a [[/skill investigation 20]] check to notice the wire. Once the wire is noticed, it is easily avoided. A creature who cuts the wire must succeed on a [[/tool thief 20]] check or trigger the trap.

When the trap triggers, spears break through the ice and rain down from the ceiling, attacking each creature in the room on initiative count 20 for 1 minute. Each time the trap attacks, make a [[/attack formula="10"]] ranged attack roll against each creature in the room. On a hit, a spear deals [[/damage 2d12 piercing average]] damage.

Freezing Wind Trap. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the pillars' auras of evocation magic. Creatures who examine the pillars and succeed on a [[/skill arcana 22]] check realize the dragon images are cleverly shaped arcane runes that trigger a trap when a creature who isn't Durixaviinox passes between the pillars. A creature can knock over one of the pillars and disarm the trap with a successful [[/skill athletics 20]] check. On a failed check, the trap triggers.

When the trap triggers, a blast of freezing wind rushes out from the pillars toward the west side of the room. The creature who triggered the trap and each creature in the chamber must make a [[/save strength 18]] saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 6d8 cold average]] damage, is knocked &reference[prone], and is blown directly backward until they reach the chamber's west wall (which may trigger other traps in the room). On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage, isn't knocked prone, and isn't moved.

Monument to Death. Characters who succeed on a [[/skill history 15]] check know the chamber's icy walls contain artifacts and people of Vexinoth. Durixaviinox created this grim display as a monument to a happier time in his life.

Galithor, a @UUID[Actor.JRBW8m8jn9KMcMSp], is &reference[incapacitated] and &reference[restrained] by the ice on the walls. Creatures who examine the walls and succeed on a [[/skill perception 18]] check notice Galithor's eyes darting around the room and following creatures. A creature who can see Galithor and succeeds on a [[/skill insight 22]] check senses he means the characters no harm and is pleading with his eyes to be freed.

A creature wielding a bludgeoning weapon, piercing weapon, or artisan's tools that include an awl, a hammer, a pick, or similar item, can free Galithor from the ice as an action. In thanks for his freedom, Galithor tells the characters about the freezing runes trap and offers to help them battle Durixaviinox. He doesn't know about the other traps because no intruder has ever made it beyond the first.

Galithor has been trapped so long, he doesn't remember much about his life before Durixaviinox sealed him in the wall. He knows that he was a mighty warrior who protected the dragons of Vexinoth and that Durixaviinox is no longer the noble dragon he was.

Frigid Lake.name: Frigid Lake
Frigid Lake.text:
The portal in this chamber fills the area above the surface of the lake with dim light. This area has the following features:

  • “A 10-foot-diameter circle of blue energy hums on the north wall. It emits a thin but steady stream of water that sends ripples across the lake dominating the east of the room.”
  • (Secret) The energy circle is a portal connected to the elemental plane of Quintessence.
  • (Secret) Two cruxes of frost hide at the edge of the water near the west entrance.

Portal. A creature who succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 16]] check knows this portal is connected to Quintessence and is one-way — it only allows travel from the elemental plane, not to it. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the portal's aura of conjuration magic.

If combat occurs in this area while the portal is open, ten air sparks with immunity to cold damage emerge through the portal on initiative count 0 for 3 rounds. The sparks use their Wind Sweep attack to hurl intruders into the frigid lake (see @UUID[.JKB9Y9j2MunpJ8Mu#durixaviinoxs-rest-features]{Durixaviinox's Rest Features}).

If the characters close the portal (see @UUID[.JKB9Y9j2MunpJ8Mu#durixaviinoxs-rest-features]{Durixaviinox's Rest Features}), Durixaviinox notices when the water stops moving in the throne room (area @UUID[.flNOv3dZlw170ZWu]{W5}) and hides.

Cruxes of Frost. A creature who succeeds on a [[/skill perception 16]] check notices two @UUID[Actor.00K09OcUVyiDVoBk]{Cruxes of Frost} in the water. The cruxes leap onto shore and attack as soon as they notice the characters.

Underwater Opening. A 20-foot-diameter opening at the base of the west wall leads to Durixaviinox's throne (area @UUID[.flNOv3dZlw170ZWu]{W5}).

Throne Room.name: Throne Room
Throne Room.text:
My rule was glorious, and the dragons, giants, and others who I protected lived prosperous lives. Those that remain — the dead that walk — don't remember the time that was. They are mindless drones. The lucky ones died ages ago and stayed dead.

Durixaviinox

The throne room has the following features:

  • “The entire floor of this chamber is an ice-covered lake. A 20-foot-diameter hole in the ice reveals the frigid, dark water below.”
  • “Glittering treasure sparks against the walls of this chamber, covered in a layer of pale-blue ice.”
  • “A cracked marble throne fit for a being larger than a Giant stands against the south wall.”
  • (If Durixaviinox is here and the characters didn't close the portal in area @UUID[.wclzVzpntJvu6KZU]{W4}) “An immense white-scaled dragon sits on the throne.”
  • (Secret) If the characters turned off the portal in area @UUID[.wclzVzpntJvu6KZU]{W4} and Durixaviinox is here, he clings to the ceiling.
  • (Secret) Some of the lake ice is too thin to support the weight of Medium or larger creatures.

The Ruined Providence. The great dragon @UUID[Actor.AdZ3Ci4t3WPh8mxh] attacks the intruders when he notices them. If he is clinging to the ceiling, the characters don't notice him when they enter the chamber unless they succeed on a [[/skill perception 20]] check. During battle, Durixaviinox uses his Claw attack to move creatures onto areas of thin ice.

Thin Ice. The map of this lair shows the areas of thin ice. Durixaviinox knows where these patches are. Other creatures can try to spot the thin ice by using an action to make a [[/skill nature 20]] check. On a success, the creature identifies all the patches of thin ice in the room.

When a Medium or larger creature moves onto a patch of thin ice, the patch is destroyed, and any creatures on the patch fall into the frigid water below (see @UUID[.JKB9Y9j2MunpJ8Mu#durixaviinoxs-rest-features]{Durixaviinox's Rest Features}).

Treasure. The treasure frozen to the walls is Durixaviinox's hoard. It takes one creature 30 hours to chip free all the treasure from the hoard. Multiple creatures working together reduce the time proportionally. Dealing 500 fire damage to the ice melts it and reveals the treasure. See @UUID[.NtvmCAPJ18ODgVdi] for more information.

Lair Actions

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.ycXbfmjdjwfx5puZ inline]

My breath carries the sorrow of thousands of dead dragons. Their despair will freeze the heart of my sister and make brittle anything else that stands in the way of my revenge for those lost.

Durixaviinox

Durixaviinox's Hoard.name: Durixaviinox's Hoard
Durixaviinox's Hoard.text:
Durixaviinox salvaged much of his wealth from Vexinoth after it was destroyed. He keeps his hoard frozen to the wall in his throne room (area @UUID[.flNOv3dZlw170ZWu]{W5}).

The hoard contains the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.Om8d9kL2CSzKfwBP]
  • @UUID[Item.bPqkQUzprwRUOjRB] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.3LgFweK7xocXSWn0]
  • @UUID[Item.jF79XgJwTByoPbOQ]
  • @UUID[Item.CMZp6fE8hHvs8WhW]
  • @UUID[Item.R1CskP85l6NpqAsn]
  • @UUID[Item.aVXFKgHB3iu0bGsH]
  • @UUID[Item.7c0TQDFt3iksGZim]{3 Pots of Marvelous Pigments}
  • @UUID[Item.Ch2IQPXS9NmfuVds]{Vial of Oil of Etherealness}
  • @UUID[Item.a6ntZetVtv2jp28P]{Vial of Oil of Sharpness}
  • @UUID[Item.wjhgPjDwEPyHolzb]{Copy of Crog's Guide to Disarming Magic Traps} (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.RJOB2LEw4zAeMWSn]{50 Blue Zircons} (worth 10 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.EvqMKQI00fV8XlAy]{10 Pearls} (worth 100 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.gRliIPApDTyLboVa]{2 Gold Chalices} (worth 500 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.7HTrFCyiI193pQ0L]{1 Diamond} (worth 1,000 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.9tFHjFIz22FsLLSW]{Dragon statue carved from ice that never melts, dusted with diamond dust} (worth 1,000 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.TpDEmpvM4ubKRvfe]{1 Ruby} (worth 1,000 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.6ywUdIvTcZ6xZBwh]{1 Sapphire} (worth 1,000 gp)
  • [[/award 45021sp 15243gp 1386pp]]

@Embed[Item.wjhgPjDwEPyHolzb inline]

Most thieves hear the words “magic trap” then turn around and head back to their guilds empty-handed. With my simple sixteen-step technique, you'll be filling up every sack you have with every treasure a wizard's tower has to offer.

Crog's Guide to Disarming Magic Traps

Tendrils.name: Tendrils
Tendrils.description: Melee Power Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 22 (4d10) psychic damage. If the target is charmed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains hit points equal to half the psychic damage dealt.

Psionic Shroud.name: Psionic Shroud
Psionic Shroud.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to divination spells and to any effect that would sense their emotions or read their thoughts.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item YiFq7AqsiN26vIjn]] attacks and uses [[/item w05aNhFXjOMGYPIR]], if available.

Dream Spores.name: Dream Spores
Dream Spores.description:
5th-Order Power

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] releases a cloud of psionic spores. Each creature within 60 feet of them must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence saving throw or be &reference[charmed] by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, a creature must use their movement during their turn to move within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] by the safest available route.

A creature charmed in this way can repeat the saving throw whenever they take damage, ending the effect on themself on a success.

Rouse Dreamer.name: Rouse Dreamer
Rouse Dreamer.description: When a creature makes an attack against the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses a creature charmed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] within the attack's range, and the charmed creature becomes the target of the attack instead.

utility.condition: When a creature makes an attack against the monster.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, they are &reference[grappled] (escape DC 15). Moving while grappling a Medium or smaller creature doesn't halve the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s speed. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one target grappled in this way at a time.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature who is grappled by the [[lookup @name lowercase]], incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by a number equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains hit points equal to that number. The reduction lasts until reversed by a cure ailment power of 4th order or higher, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk] spell, or a similar supernatural effect. The target dies if this attack reduces their hit point maximum to 0. A Humanoid slain in this way rises the following midnight as a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.TPw4fXfNQz1ymtoA] under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control.

Radiant Aversion.name: Radiant Aversion
Radiant Aversion.description: Each time the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes radiant damage, they take an extra 10 radiant damage.

Inhuman Speed.name: Inhuman Speed
Inhuman Speed.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to their speed.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item cKQYdzDKQrxIJVcg]] attacks. They can replace one attack with a [[/item eeubtfOgb8N9vcs5]] attack.

Gain Ferocity.name: Gain Ferocity
Gain Ferocity.condition: The companion isn't incapacitated at the start of their and their caregiver's turn

Shared Afterimage.name: Shared Afterimage
Shared Afterimage.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and their caregiver are within 30 feet of each other and one of them is hit by an attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] reveals that both they and their caregiver are past visual imprints. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] and the caregiver each appear in an unoccupied space they can see within 30 feet of their imprints, the attack misses, then the imprints disappear. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't use this reaction if the attacker relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if they can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.

utility.condition: The lightbender or its caregiver are hit by an attack

Tail Whip.name: Tail Whip
Tail Whip.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a signature attack. On a hit, the attack deals an extra [[lookup @prof]] radiant damage to the target, and a different creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses within 15 feet of them takes [[/damage activity=FIkdlcWRkRYbomoI]] damage.

Avoidance.name: Avoidance
Avoidance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a saving throw to take only half damage, they instead take no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from a normal statue.

Fiend Between.name: Fiend Between
Fiend Between.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn't have a walking speed and can't benefit from any bonus to their speed.

Supernatural Resistance.name: Supernatural Resistance
Supernatural Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item MrKIt9QvvJ8vk5D9]] attacks and uses [[/item WxcjhjQuIAIxPyVL]], if available.

Slip Away.name: Slip Away
Slip Away.description: When a creature within 60 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets them with an attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is no longer a valid target for the triggering attack, the attacker must choose a new target or the attack misses.

utility.condition: When targeted by an attack.

Infuse Sadness.name: Infuse Sadness
Infuse Sadness.description: Each enemy the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of them must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be overwhelmed with grief for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While a creature is overwhelmed, attacks against them are made with advantage.

Overwhelmed With Grief.name: Overwhelmed With Grief
Overwhelmed With Grief.description: You are overwhelmed with grief for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While overwhelmed, attacks against you are made with advantage.

Grief-Eater.name: Grief-Eater
Grief-Eater.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20 ft., one creature. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) psychic damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

Grief-Eater.name: Grief-Eater
Grief-Eater.description: Your speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

Slip Between.name: Slip Between
Slip Between.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

Breathless Rend.name: Breathless Rend
Breathless Rend.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 22 (4d10) psychic damage.

Flowing Form.name: Flowing Form
Flowing Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can enter an enemy's space and stop there, and they can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Gasping Aura.name: Gasping Aura
Gasping Aura.description: While within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]], creatures who need to breathe can't take reactions or speak.

Breathstealer's Shimmer.name: Breathstealer's Shimmer
Breathstealer's Shimmer.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] becomes &reference[invisible] then takes the &reference[Hide] action. This invisibility ends if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack or uses Convocation of Breath.

Convocation of Breath.name: Convocation of Breath
Convocation of Breath.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] imbues the power of breath in themself or another Elemental they can see within 30 feet of them, granting one of the following effects of that Elemental's choice:

  • Hide in Breath. The Elemental tries to hide inside the body of a creature within 10 feet of them who isn't a Construct, an Elemental, an Ooze, or an Undead. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or the Elemental retreats inside the target until the start of the Elemental's next turn. While inside the target, the Elemental can't take actions and has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the target.

  • Toxic Breath. The Elemental exudes a noxious aura 10 feet in every direction for 1 minute or until dispersed by a moderate or stronger wind. That area is lightly obscured, and each creature who needs to breathe who starts their turn in that area must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] until the end of their next turn.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item ghUPgkpleWDfb8F4]] attacks.

Corona.name: Corona
Corona.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds bright sunlight in a 120-foot radius and dim light for another 120 feet.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item TyijW56EM0ERh6rh]] attacks. They can replace one attack with a use of [[/item mkPXAKXntcCXpvBt]] or [[/item 6cuZujXbX9q43T9x]], if available.

Heavenly Collapse.name: Heavenly Collapse
Heavenly Collapse.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shines harsh light on an enemy they can see within 60 feet of them. Each ally of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] within 5 feet of the target regains 20 hit points, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or lose any damage resistances they have and be &reference[blinded] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

Heavenly Collapse.name: Heavenly Collapse
Heavenly Collapse.description: You lose any damage resistances and are blinded. You can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Rejuvenating Flare.name: Rejuvenating Flare
Rejuvenating Flare.description: One ally the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of them is bathed in rejuvenating light. The ally regains 27 (5d10) hit points, and if they are &reference[charmed apply=false], &reference[dazed apply=false], &reference[frightened apply=false], or &reference[poisoned apply=false], those conditions end for them.

Convocation of Sunlight.name: Convocation of Sunlight
Convocation of Sunlight.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] imbues the power of sunlight in themself or another Elemental they can see within 30 feet of them, granting one of the following effects of that Elemental's choice:

  • Healing Radiance. The Elemental regains 30 hit points. Until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn, the Elemental refracts shimmering light, and creatures within 10 feet of them who aren't Elementals are &reference[blinded].

  • Protective Light. Four brilliant motes orbit the Elemental for 1 minute. When the Elemental deals damage to a creature with an attack, the Elemental can extinguish one mote (no action required) to deal an extra 14 (4d6) radiant damage to that creature.

Convocation of Sunlight: Healing Radianc.name: Convocation of Sunlight: Healing Radiance
Convocation of Sunlight: Healing Radianc.description: Until the end of the sunlight nexus's next turn, the Elemental refracts shimmering light, and creatures within 10 feet of them who aren't Elementals are Blinded.

Convocation of Sunlight: Protective Ligh.name: Convocation of Sunlight: Protective Light
Convocation of Sunlight: Protective Ligh.description: Four brilliant motes orbit the Elemental for 1 minute. When the Elemental deals damage to a creature with an attack, the Elemental can extinguish one mote (no action required) to deal an extra 14 (4d6) radiant damage to that creature.

Solar Arc.name: Solar Arc
Solar Arc.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) radiant damage.

Supernatural Resistance.name: Supernatural Resistance
Supernatural Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The stag makes three [[/item N8AQP7fgonKDltYn]] or [[/item VSrf484GKMrqnt95]] attacks.

Lightburst.name: Lightburst
Lightburst.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) radiant damage, and the target is outlined in a golden light, giving attack rolls against them advantage until the start of the stag's next turn.

Lightburst.name: Lightburst
Lightburst.description: You are outlined in a golden light. Attack rolls against you have advantage until the start of the monster's next turn.

Starcall.name: Starcall
Starcall.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] calls down a magical shower of stars on an area that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide within 120 feet of the stag. Each enemy in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each other willing creature in that area regains 15 hit points.

The stars then create a 10-foot-high wall of opaque radiant light in that area. Each creature in the wall's space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is incapacitated or dies. Any enemy who enters the wall of light for the first time on a turn must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Starlight Infusion.name: Starlight Infusion
Starlight Infusion.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] infuses radiant energy into a willing creature they can see within 60 feet of them. That creature deals an extra 5 radiant damage with weapon attacks until the start of the stag's next turn.

Starlight Infusion.name: Starlight Infusion
Starlight Infusion.description: You deal an extra 5 radiant damage with weapon attacks until the end of the monster's next turn.

Nature's Ward.name: Nature's Ward
Nature's Ward.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or a creature they can see within 30 feet of them takes damage, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically creates a protective barrier around that creature. The barrier reduces that damage to the protected creature by 20, then vanishes.

utility.condition: When the monster or a creature they can see within 30 feet take damage.

Ram.name: Ram
Ram.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) piercing damage.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they are &reference[grappled] (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the bog body can't make a Slam attack against another target.

Acidic Blood.name: Acidic Blood
Acidic Blood.description: A creature who deals piercing or slashing damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while within 5 feet of them takes 3 (1d6) acid damage.

Sling Mud.name: Sling Mud
Sling Mud.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

Submerge.name: Submerge
Submerge.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is in swampy terrain, they can submerge themself beneath the water and mud. While submerged, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is &reference[heavilyobscured].

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is grappling a target when they submerge, the target submerges with them. While submerged, the target is heavily obscured, &reference[restrained], and unable to breathe, and takes 4 (1d8) acid damage at the start of each of their turns.

A bog body can resurface as a bonus action. When they do so, a target they have grappled also resurfaces.

Foundry Note

Apply the "Submerged with the Bog" effect to targets grappled while Submerging. You can toggle the monster's "Submerged" effect to describe whether it is currently beneath the swampy terrain.

Submerged with the Bog.name: Submerged with the Bog
Submerged with the Bog.description: While submerged, the target is heavily obscured, restrained, and unable to breathe, and takes 4 (1d8) acid damage at the start of each of their turns.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a light source or is wearing or holding alight source, that light is extinguished.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage, and [[lookup @name]] can move the target up to 15 feet horizontally.

Consume Shadow.name: Consume Shadow
Consume Shadow.description: When [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw, they can succeed instead. When they do, any areas of magical darkness in the lair are dispelled, and they can't use Enshroud or Thwart Healing until the end of their next turn.

utility.condition: When they fail a saving throw.

Shadow Strength.name: Shadow Strength
Shadow Strength.description: Acid and necrotic damage dealt by [[lookup @name]] ignore damage resistance.

Enshroud.name: Enshroud
Enshroud.description: Shadows cling to one creature [[lookup @name]] can see within 120 feet of them. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be &reference[blinded] and vulnerable to necrotic damage until the start of [[lookup @name]]'s next turn.

Enshrouded.name: Enshrouded
Enshrouded.description: Until the start of the monster's next turn, you are blinded and have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

Thwart Healing.name: Thwart Healing
Thwart Healing.description: When a creature within 60 feet of [[lookup @name]] regains hit points, [[lookup @name]] forces them to make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature regains half the number of hit points instead.

save.condition: When a creature within 60 feet regains hit points.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes one [[/item pLRL3CcN7uVuzkDl]] attack and two [[/item Ve4G4EcSpj85FKm3]] attacks.

Vacuous Breath.name: Vacuous Breath
Vacuous Breath.description:
[[lookup @name]] exhales dark energy in a line that is 90 feet long and 20 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) acid damage plus 24 (7d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally, that area is filled with magical darkness for 1minute. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and no light except a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.BP3GCwa66IAw1yTG]{Daylight} spell or a light-creating spell of 5th level or higher can illuminate it.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
[[lookup @name]] has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

[[/item 7M18u7WI6bA6Quc8]]

[[/item n2O8IC4HKAFpCb8i]]

[[/item IkukGbutd6EaXxW3]]

Burning Globs.name: Burning Globs
Burning Globs.description: [[lookup @name]] spits acid globules at each enemy they can see within 90 feet of them. Each target must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or have a globule attached to their body. A creature attached to a globule takes 14 (4d6) acid damage at the start of their turns. A creature can use an action to remove a globule from themself or a creature they can reach.

Acid Glob Damage.name: Acid Glob Damage
Acid Glob Damage.condition: At the start of a creature's turn.

Burning Glob.name: Burning Glob
Burning Glob.description: A glob of burning acid is covering you, causing you to take 14 (4d6) acid damage at the start of each of your turns. A creature can use an action to remove a glob from themself or a creature that they can reach.

Shadow Form.name: Shadow Form
Shadow Form.description: [[lookup @name]] becomes semi-incorporeal, gaining resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the end of their next turn. [[lookup @name]] then teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space that they can see.

Shadow Form.name: Shadow Form
Shadow Form.description: The monster has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the end of its next turn.

Sinking Gloom.name: Sinking Gloom
Sinking Gloom.description: [[lookup @name]] summons sticky black acid centered on a point they can see on the ground within 120 feet of them, creating a 5-foot-deep, 20-foot-radius pool. The pool is difficult terrain and lasts for 1 minute. An enemy who starts their turn in the pool takes 24 (7d6) acid damage and must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be &reference[restrained] until the start of their next turn. An enemy who starts their turn flying within 30 feet of the pool must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be pulled down by living acid, landing in the nearest unoccupied space of their choice within the pool, take 24 (7d6) acid damage, and be &reference[restrained] until the start of their next turn.

Acid Pool: Start of Turn Damage.name: Acid Pool: Start of Turn Damage
Acid Pool: Start of Turn Damage.condition: An enemy starts their turn in the pool.

Acid Pool: Pull Flying Creature.name: Acid Pool: Pull Flying Creature
Acid Pool: Pull Flying Creature.condition: A flying enemy starts their turn within 30 feet of the pool.

Restraining Tendril.name: Restraining Tendril
Restraining Tendril.description: When a creature enters this room, they must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or be &reference[restrained] by a tendril (save ends at end of turn). A restrained creature takes [[/damage]] damage at the start of each of their turns. Each tendril can restrain one creature.

Acidic Absorption.name: Acidic Absorption
Acidic Absorption.description: If a creature deals acid damage to a tendril, the tendril takes no damage and instead regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, they are &reference[grappled] (escape DC 18). While grappled in this way, the target is &reference[restrained]. Moving while grappling a Medium or smaller creature doesn't halve the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s speed. A [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one target grappled in this way at a time.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature who is grappled by the [[lookup @name lowercase]], incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by a number equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains hit points equal to that number. The reduction lasts until reversed by a cure ailment power of 4th order or higher, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk] spell, or a similar supernatural effect. The target dies if this attack reduces their hit point maximum to 0. A Humanoid slain in this way rises the following midnight as a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.TPw4fXfNQz1ymtoA] under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control.

Radiant Aversion.name: Radiant Aversion
Radiant Aversion.description: Each time the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes radiant damage, they take an extra 10 radiant damage.

Resting Place.name: Resting Place
Resting Place.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 0 hit points and is not in sunlight, running water, or their resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports to their resting place. While in their resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is stable. After spending 1 hour in their resting place with 0 hit points, they regain 1hit point.

Turn Resistance.name: Turn Resistance
Turn Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item 8fYbHoUo1cEvbVDs]] attacks and, if possible, a [[/item b1hbVDYui2BnmdtY]] attack.

Exsanguinating Mist.name: Exsanguinating Mist
Exsanguinating Mist.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]], along with anything they are wearing or carrying, turns into a cloud of blood-sucking mist. When they do, they release any creature they were grappling, and if the vampire was grappled or restrained, that effect ends for them. Then the [[lookup @name lowercase]] flies up to twice their speed to an unoccupied space. During this move, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores difficult terrain, doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and can move through creatures and objects. Each creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] passes through must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. At the end of this movement, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] transforms back into their previous form.

Run, My Child.name: Run, My Child
Run, My Child.description: When an ally the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see takes damage, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can command the ally to move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

utility.condition: When an ally the monster can see takes damage.

Inhuman Agility.name: Inhuman Agility
Inhuman Agility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Beguile.name: Beguile
Beguile.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one creature they can see within 30 feet of them and who can see them. The target must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target uses their reaction, if available, to move up to their speed to a location chosen by the [[lookup @name lowercase]], then either makes a melee attack against a target of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice or falls &reference[prone] ([[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice).

Creatures who can't be charmed automatically succeed on this saving throw, and creatures who have advantage on saving throws against being charmed make this saving throw with advantage.

Utility Spells.name: Utility Spells
Utility Spells.description:
In addition to any other spells in this stat block, the vampire can cast the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

At will: charm person, detect thoughts, disguise self, sending

1/day each: clairvoyance, geas

Decaying Touch.name: Decaying Touch
Decaying Touch.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, or if the target is a corpse or Undead, the damage increases to 36 (8d8). Additionally, for the next 24 hours, the target is marked for death. A creature who drops to 0 hit points while marked for death immediately fails one death saving throw. This effect isn't cumulative.

Marked for Death.name: Marked for Death
Marked for Death.description: For the next 24 hours, the target is marked for death. A creature who drops to 0 hit points while marked for death immediately fails one death saving throw. This effect isn't cumulative.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

Hypnotic Beam.name: Hypnotic Beam
Hypnotic Beam.description: One of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s eyes shoots a magic ray at a creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 60 feet of them. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or use their reaction, if available, to move as far as their speed allows toward the [[lookup @name lowercase]], avoiding obviously dangerous ground.

Radiant Puff.name: Radiant Puff
Radiant Puff.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is hit with an attack, they release a cloud of spores. Each creature within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[blinded] until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

save.condition: When the monster is hit with an attack.

Ring with Smooth Obsidian & Black Diamon.name: Ring with Smooth Obsidian & Black Diamonds
Ring with Smooth Obsidian & Black Diamon.description: Ring inlaid with smooth obsidian surrounded by black diamonds.

Oil of Sharpness.name: Oil of Sharpness
Oil of Sharpness.description:
This clear, gelatinous oil sparkles with tiny, ultrathin silver shards.

The oil can coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to 5 pieces of slashing or piercing ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

Marble Statue of a Weeping Human.name: Marble Statue of a Weeping Human
Marble Statue of a Weeping Human.description: Marble statue of a weeping human with black opal eyes.

Cloak of the Bat.name: Cloak of the Bat
Cloak of the Bat.description:
Wondrous item, (requires attunement)

While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. In an area of dim light or darkness, you can grip the edges of the cloak with both hands and use it to fly at a speed of 40 feet. If you ever fail to grip the cloak's edges while flying in this way, or if you are no longer in dim light or darkness, you lose this flying speed.

While wearing the cloak in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use your action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{Polymorph} on yourself, transforming into a bat. While you are in the form of the bat, you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.

The cloak can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Gold Serpentine Cup.name: Gold Serpentine Cup
Gold Serpentine Cup.description: Gold cup with serpentine handles, embedded with emeralds.

Sun Blade.name: Sun Blade
Sun Blade.description:
(Requires attunement)

This item appears to be a longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. If you are proficient with shortswords or longswords, you are proficient with the Sun Blade.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

The sword's luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. While the blade persists, you can use an action to expand or reduce its radius of bright and dim light by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.

Sun Eater Staff.name: Sun Eater Staff
Sun Eater Staff.description:
(Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

This lengthy staff of black wood has veins of black opal and obsidian running through it, and it feels cool to the touch. This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

The staff has 10 charges and regains 1d6 + 4 charges daily at midnight.

Spells. While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4H6YgYdKgnX6ZQ8M]{acid arrow} (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pybg5MNc3lkerH4Y]{blight} (4 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{darkness} (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{fog cloud} (1 charge), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.o9ZCvuD2B1OTcubb]{wall of force} (5 charges).

Consume Light. You can expend 1 charge as an action to extinguish any light sources of your choice that you can see within 120 feet of you.

Fire Immunity. When you take fire damage while holding the staff, you can expend 1 charge as a reaction. You gain immunity to fire damage until the start of your next turn, including against the triggering effect.

Fire Immunity.name: Fire Immunity
Fire Immunity.condition: When you take fire damage while holding the staff.

Heavenkiller Chronicles.name: Heavenkiller Chronicles
Heavenkiller Chronicles.description:
Spicule’s vast tome contains secrets concerning celestials and how to use them to fuel dark magic. You must spend 50 hours studying this tome to gain the following benefits:

  • You have advantage on Intelligence checks to determine the vulnerabilities and weaknesses of Celestials.

  • You deal an extra 9 (2d8) damage to Celestials when you hit them with an attack.

  • You know how to harvest parts of Celestials and use them to fuel dark magic. You can harvest a heart, eye, or other useful organ from a Celestial’s corpse with a successful DC 16 Wisdom (Survival) check. You can use a harvested Celestial organ in place of one material component that would normally be consumed by the spell, up to a cost of 2,500 gp.

Potion of Clairvoyance.name: Potion of Clairvoyance
Potion of Clairvoyance.description:
An eyeball bobs in this yellowish liquid but vanishes when the potion is opened.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{Clairvoyance} spell.

Potion of Gaseous Form.name: Potion of Gaseous Form
Potion of Gaseous Form.description:
This potion's container seems to hold fog that moves and pours like water.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2IWiZAJtOGDoKjiz]{Gaseous Form} spell for 1 hour (no concentration required) or until you end the effect as a bonus action.

Dragon-Horn Comb.name: Dragon-Horn Comb
Dragon-Horn Comb.description: A dragon-horn comb engraved with gothic imagery and veined with black tourmaline.

Draconic Porcelain Vase.name: Draconic Porcelain Vase
Draconic Porcelain Vase.description: A porcelain vase adorned with stylized draconic art.

Dagger of Venom.name: Dagger of Venom
Dagger of Venom.description:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

You can use an action to cause thick, black poison to coat the blade. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 2d10 poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The dagger can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Potion of Flying.name: Potion of Flying
Potion of Flying.description:
This potion's clear liquid floats at the top of its container and has cloudy white impurities drifting in it.

When you drink this potion, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 1 hour and can hover. If you're in the air when the potion wears off, you fall unless you have some other means of staying aloft.

Coronal Hollow.name: Coronal Hollow
Coronal Hollow.text:
Optimized for Five 15th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00017 inline]

Coronal Hollow Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Dying Sun. Sages have discovered that the sun's light is growing dimmer over time, and the process is accelerating. The scholars made a breakthrough discovery linking an acid lake — the entrance to the Coronal Hollow — with this phenomenon. They ask the characters to venture into the lake and investigate.

Frozen Flame. A sacred torch that burned for centuries in the temple of a sun deity has extinguished mysteriously. Ancient scriptures point to the Coronal Hollow as the only place where the flame will reignite. The sun priests ask the characters to carry the relic there to reignite it. If the characters return with a lit torch, the priests give them a talisman of pure good.

Luminous Exodus. The characters encounter Emanael, a dying angel who escaped the Coronal Hollow and is being consumed by shadow. Moments before dying, Emanael tells the characters that celestials and other creatures of light are being captured across the timescape and brought to the Coronal Hollow for wicked experiments.

Coronal Hollow Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of the Coronal Hollow has the following features:

Ceilings. Ceilings in the Coronal Hollow are 120 feet high.

Illumination. Damp darkness saturates the Coronal Hollow, which has no light sources.

Noxious Vents. Slits in the obsidian walls spew acid at intruders. A character who starts their turn within 5 feet of a wall has a [[/r 1d100cs>50]]{50 percent chance} of taking [[/damage 2d8 acid average]] damage. These vents hiss loudly when they erupt, drowning out other noises, so creatures in an area can't hear creatures outside that area.

Wyrm Servitors

The creatures who serve Qazyldrath are all violent and malicious, no matter the extent of their sentience or intelligence. Most of them are fanatically devoted to the ancient dragon, believing the wyrm is an apocalyptic, immortal force. The cultists (see area @UUID[.6IH18YIrQEZktqjT]{B5}) and the sunlight nexus (see area @UUID[.U2hDEo73zbFEoLSt]{B4}) retreat and seek reinforcements from other areas if they're losing a fight. Otherwise, they all fight intruders to the death.

Captured Servitors. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=deception/intimidation/persuasion 18]] check can convince a captured cultist (see area @UUID[.6IH18YIrQEZktqjT]{B5}) or sunlight nexus (see area @UUID[.U2hDEo73zbFEoLSt]{B4}) to reveal one of the following cryptic pieces of information:

  • “What a glorious day it is for Qazyldrath indeed, that two creatures of light have been caught.” (see areas B5 and B6)
  • “Qazyldrath's treasure is past the writhing darkness.” (see area @UUID[.mtXgMXQHtRnJGTWb]{B6})
  • “Beware the statue in the place where treasure gleams.” (see area @UUID[.Z1Ft0it2T8xqnmNo]{B7})

Obscured. A servitor has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to remain hidden.

Light-Hungry. A servitor has advantage on the first attack roll they make on their turn against a creature carrying a light source.

Resting in the Coronal Hollow

The characters can take a short rest without incident in the test bed (area @UUID[.6IH18YIrQEZktqjT]{B5}) and the light-harvesting depths (area @UUID[.mtXgMXQHtRnJGTWb]{B6}) once those areas are cleared of enemies. If the characters attempt to take a long rest in those areas, or rest elsewhere in the Coronal Hollow, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>50]]{50 percent chance} one @UUID[Actor.w3ae8qMaBE1CevHH] cultist finds them halfway through their rest. If the vampire isn't defeated in three rounds of combat, [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Actor.1roxIZcptKEz5dqi] arrive during the vampire's turn on the fourth round.

Entering the Coronal Hollow

The entrance to the Coronal Hollow demiplane lies beneath a lake of acid in a deep cave in the Mundane World. The lake is 150 feet deep. A creature who enters the lake for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there must make a [[/save constitution 16]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 4d6 acid average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At the bottom of the lake lies a 10-foot-diameter portal that shimmers glittery black. When a creature other than Qazyldrath swims through the portal, they enter area @UUID[.XB4Wiig2LLPCzPw0]{B1} and the portal remains open. When Qazyldrath swims through this portal, they are transported directly to their chamber (area @UUID[.W6nOezPdtb6UajZf]{B8}) and the portal closes. Qazyldrath can reopen the portal from their chamber (area @UUID[.W6nOezPdtb6UajZf]{B8}) by concentrating on the portal for 1 minute, as if concentrating on a spell.

Coronal Hollow Areas.text:
The following areas are keyed to the Coronal Hollow Map.

@UUID[.XB4Wiig2LLPCzPw0]{B1. Pressure Tunnel}

@UUID[.F3h7RwYm8HoyFO6s]{B2. Abyssal Swamp}

@UUID[.7ancMtvnISUNTfyd]{B3. Cove of Nightmares}

@UUID[.U2hDEo73zbFEoLSt]{B4. Abnegation Chamber}

Pressure Tunnel.name: Pressure Tunnel
Pressure Tunnel.text:
The portal opens to a 10-foot-high tunnel that deters unwanted visits with small corrosive gas geysers. It has the following features:

  • “The humid, dark tunnel winds down into the distance, with frothing, ovular slits exposed in the cold stone.”
  • “Tremors vibrate up and down the tunnel's length, like a shiver down a spine, and a small shriek in the distance is either a hissing release or a scream.”

Corrosive Vents. The vents spew acid in short, irregular bursts. Each creature who traverses the tunnel must make a [[/save dexterity 19]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 4d8 acid average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature can't see in the tunnel due to darkness or another reason, they make this saving throw with disadvantage.

Abyssal Swamp.name: Abyssal Swamp
Abyssal Swamp.text:
The tunnel opens into a sprawling, unnatural swamp — a pool of extraplanar, acidic liquid — in which Qazyldrath submerges themself to communicate with the mortal agents who serve them. It has the following features:

  • “An expanse of black liquid forms an unnatural swamp that seeps up this cavern's walls—thicker than water, but thinner than muck. Ripples occasionally disrupt the viscous surface.”
  • “Obsidian, plant-shaped formations stick out of the liquid.”
  • “Drifting silently over the swamp are four 6-foot-tall mushrooms with long, prehensile eyestalks that dangle from their cap. Like jellyfish, they waft aimlessly, their black-and-brown caps like dancing swirls of ichor.”
  • “Two paths on the opposite side of the room rise from the swamp—one leading northwest, one leading northeast.”
  • (Secret) Six bog bodies lurk in the pool.
  • (Secret) The swamp can act as a scrying pool.

Swamp Water. The swamp water is 30 feet deep. A creature takes [[/damage 1d6 acid average]] damage when they enter the water for the first time on a turn or start their turn there. The acid damage increases by 3 (1d6) each consecutive turn spent in the water, to a maximum of 70 (20d6) acid damage.

The swamp doesn't count as obviously dangerous ground for the purposes of the rot angel's Hypnotic Beam.

Servants of Death. Four @UUID[Actor.x3Z91Z9ZeILZEJAI]{Rot Angels} hover over the swamp. They serve Qazyldrath, who they believe is an apocalyptic god of death, and they attack any creature who disturbs them or the swamp. If the rot angels engage in combat, six @UUID[Actor.PqQtzJRiZMrhz2Sm]{Empowered Bog Bodies} emerge from the swamp at the start of the second round of combat.

Branching Paths. The northwest path leads to the cove of nightmares (area @UUID[.7ancMtvnISUNTfyd]{B3}), while the northeast path leads to the abnegation chamber (area @UUID[.U2hDEo73zbFEoLSt]{B4}). A creature who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=perception/survival 15]] check to inspect both paths determines that the left path is eerily silent and dark, while the right path has a faint light, as well as signs of glass scraping against stone.

Scrying Swamp. A creature who can cast spells and who is submerged at least 10 feet deep in the swamp water senses that the swamp is connecting to their mind. While submerged, a creature who can cast spells can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20] spell, even if they can't normally, on a creature in the Mundane World without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. This spell uses the creature's spellcasting ability, but due to the swamp's strength, the target has a -10 penalty to their saving throw instead of the spell's normal modifiers. While scrying on a target, the creature can also cast a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.GtGjNjPBgUHxGYAD] spell on that target, even if they can't normally, without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. Once a creature uses the pool to cast a scrying or sending spell, that creature can't cast that spell in this way again for 24 hours.

Cove of Nightmares.name: Cove of Nightmares
Cove of Nightmares.text:
This small cavern's walls are made of smooth obsidian, making it difficult to locate an exit in the dark. The cove has the following features:

  • “The natural cavern wall gives way to smooth, deep obsidian that is too much like a mirror, refracting your silhouettes onto other walls endlessly into the dark.”
  • (Secret) Two deep dreamers hover 30 feet off the ground.
  • (Secret) There is a path to the light-harvesting depths (area @UUID[.mtXgMXQHtRnJGTWb]{B6}) and Qazyldrath's lair (area B8) to the north, as well as a secret door to the test bed (area @UUID[.6IH18YIrQEZktqjT]{B5}) to the southwest.

Deep Dreamers and Dark Dreams. The cultists in the test bed (area @UUID[.6IH18YIrQEZktqjT]{B5}) use two @UUID[Actor.0PsPFXPG2KVMpHWG]{Deep Dreamers} as guards. Since the cultists are vampires and don't sleep—and thus don't dream — the deep dreamers have no interest in them. The deep dreamers use their spores to share their apocalyptic dreams, pulling any creatures in the cove into visions of a beautiful end. Each creature who enters the cavern witnesses the glorious death of the sun, the birth of a new dark world, and themself as a creature of shadow, happy and sated in the dark world.

A creature affected by the spores must succeed on a [[/save intelligence 17]] saving throw or be pulled deeper into the reverie and be &reference[dazed] while they remain in the cove. The deep dreamers don't initiate combat, happy to sup on dreams unless attacked. If the deep dreamers are killed, the spores immediately lose their effectiveness and all their effects end.

Secret Test Bed. The door to the test bed (area @UUID[.6IH18YIrQEZktqjT]{B5}) is spotted by a creature who has a [[/skill perception 22 passive format=long]]. A creature who searches for a secret door finds it with a successful [[/skill investigation 20]] check.

Abnegation Chamber.name: Abnegation Chamber
Abnegation Chamber.text:
Content Warning: Suffocation

The essence of mist manipulates the breath of their enemies. If you or any of your players find descriptions of suffocation upsetting, you may want to avoid using the elemental or reflavor their abilities.

This cavern chamber, where Qazyldrath's cultists operate, is a natural pseudo-laboratory. It has the following features:

  • “Light emanates from one of the chamber's occupants, an angelic creature of stained glass and sunlight who is in hushed conversation with the silhouette of a cloaked humanoid formed of mist and chill.”
  • “Tables, desks, and other furniture litter what is otherwise a natural cavern. The furniture is covered in notes, diagrams, and drawings.”
  • “The brilliant angelic being holds a thick black tome bound with three leather straps.”

God-Loathing Elementals. The cavern's two occupants are Spicule (a @UUID[Actor.ExoRxP1Q0VnN7FUg]) and Brume (an @UUID[Actor.BY0ZIf5yZUGigeqn]). These elementals serve Qazyldrath as powerful cult leaders. Spicule loathes deities of light, and though she believes Qazyldrath is no god, she's confident the ancient dragon will slaughter light deities while bringing about the apocalypse. Meanwhile, Brume — a creation of malice and violence — serves as a vicious extension of the dragon's will, enacting cruelty gleefully in their name if it means he can kill the very gods who bound him to this form.

Spicule and Brume are willing to explain their beliefs if given the chance to talk, and they're glad to stop or delay the adventurers from getting to the light-harvesting depths (area @UUID[.mtXgMXQHtRnJGTWb]{B6}). The cult leaders are cold, condescending, derisive toward divinity, and scornful of clerics or paladins. They are quick to attack if the characters attempt to wrap up the conversation.

Laboratory. A creature who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=investigation/perception 18]] check notices diagrams of angels bound by black ropes, with arcane runes that hint at “draining power and light.” They also observe that makeshift shelves hold jars of hearts, eyes, and other body parts of various creatures, while severed wings are tucked under a table. The drawings hint at the empyrean stag being drained in the next room (area B6), while the organs were harvested in the test bed (area @UUID[.6IH18YIrQEZktqjT]{B5}).

Tome. Spicule's tome, named the @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.items.Item.1AWtqdsJd5w0cW1T], contains the culmination of many years of researching celestials (see @UUID[.alrtExwWauIK2jwM]).

Test Bed.name: Test Bed
Test Bed.text:
Content Warning: Body Horror

In area B5 of this lair, cultists cut apart a captured lightbender as part of a profane ritual. If you wish to limit body horror in your game, instead of the cultists cutting up the lightbender, they chant and perform a magic ritual that causes the captive's life to fade.

This cavern's giant obsidian slab serves as a harvesting table for Qazyldrath's cultists to dissect and defile creatures of light for profane rituals. It has the following features:

  • “Three cloaked figures surround an obsidian slab where a massive lion-like creature lies restrained, heavily injured and struggling to breathe.”
  • “A cloaked figure cuts a deep gouge in the prisoner's chest.”

Cultists. Eritha (a @UUID[Actor.w3ae8qMaBE1CevHH]) and two @UUID[Actor.1roxIZcptKEz5dqi] cultists are harvesting the heart of a @UUID[Actor.35mtkUPB1VoEUpma] for use in profane rituals to create darkness. The vampire spawn attack the characters immediately. Eritha doesn't engage in combat and continues cutting open the lightbender until the characters damage her. If the vampire isn't interrupted, she kills the lightbender at the end of her second turn after the characters notice her.

Restraints. The lightbender is held by five restraints that prevent them from teleporting. Each restraint has AC 17, 25 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

Lightbender. If freed, the lightbender aids the characters in the fight against Qazyldrath. The lightbender can stay with the party or leave to find a new caregiver at your discretion.

Many wish to witness the day I swallow the sun with darkness, but none are as eager as vampires. They are more faithful to me than to their own sires, for I offer what even the gods deny—a world where vampires can move about freely.

Qazyldrath

Light-Harvesting Depths.name: Light-Harvesting Depths
Light-Harvesting Depths.text:
Divine creatures imprisoned in the light-harvesting depths are drained of their divinity, which is then used to empower Qazyldrath. This area has the following features:

  • “The floor, walls, and ceiling writhe as tendrils of black ichor shift unnaturally toward slivers of light.”
  • “A single mournful bay pierces the quiet sounds of movement. A gleaming stag, their horns radiating dimming light, fights against the tendril restraining them, their light steadily dimming.”
  • (Secret) Two tendrils hide the way to the treasure hoard (area @UUID[.Z1Ft0it2T8xqnmNo]{B7}).

Tendrils. Twelve tendrils in this room block creatures outside this chamber from seeing into it and vice versa. Each tendril has AC 20, 40 hit points, and immunity to acid, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. In addition, if a creature deals acid damage to a tendril, the tendril takes no damage and instead regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

When a creature enters this room, they must succeed on a [[/save dexterity 17]] saving throw or be &reference[restrained] by a tendril (save ends at end of turn). A restrained creature takes [[/damage 3d10 necrotic average]] damage at the start of each of their turns. Each tendril can restrain one creature.

A creature who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=arcana/religion 18]] check can tell the tendrils drain the life and light out of celestials to empower Qazyldrath.

Stag. The @UUID[Actor.MyGgJdj7ECa07nSu] was stolen from a forest by Qazyldrath's servants. If the stag isn't freed within 1 minute of the characters noticing them, the stag dies and Qazyldrath is empowered (see area @UUID[.W6nOezPdtb6UajZf]{B8}). If Spicule and Brume successfully delayed the characters, you can decide that it takes less time for the stag to die.

Even if the stag is freed, they are in no condition to aid the characters in combat against the dragon. Once freed, the stag uses their Starcall action to damage any remaining tendrils and restore 15 hit points to the characters. The stag also explains that the tendrils are a way for Qazyldrath to empower themself.

Treasure Hoard. Two tendrils on the east wall hide the way to the treasure hoard (area @UUID[.Z1Ft0it2T8xqnmNo]{B7}). The opening is revealed if the tendrils are destroyed. A creature who has a [[/skill perception 22 passive format=long]], or who searches for a secret door and succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 20]] check, notices the path to the hoard.

Treasure Hoard.name: Treasure Hoard
Treasure Hoard.text:
This cavern is where Qazyldrath amasses their treasures, whether mundane, arcane, or otherworldly. It has the following features:

  • “Three crumbling statues with expressions of despair stand on display, along with other fine art pieces and relics. A mountain of coins dominates the far end of the cavern.”
  • “A black wooden staff with veins of obsidian and black opal lies on a pedestal.”
  • (Secret) Two of the statues are disguised lacunas.

Lacunas. Two @UUID[Actor.9kylsX0yofivMvP6]{Lacunas} stand near the door, disguised as crumbling statues. The lacunas feed off the latent loneliness of Qazyldrath's remote demiplane, as well as the violence the ancient dragon commits against the Mundane World. As creatures who loathe joy, the lacunas attack immediately if the characters find joy in the mountainous treasure hoard.

Treasure. This cavern contains Qazyldrath's treasure hoard. See @UUID[.alrtExwWauIK2jwM] for more information.

Qazyldrath's Chamber.name: Qazyldrath's Chamber
Qazyldrath's Chamber.text:
Qazyldrath resides in the darkest depths of the demiplane, biding their time, drinking in light and divinity, and growing in power. The lair has the following features:

  • “Dark acid pools and hissing geysers churn in the deepest pits of the expansive cavern, filling the gaping opening with eerie whistles.”
  • “A single glowing eye opens in the dark, fixating on you from across the shadowy expanse. The darkness swells around the massive draconic silhouette as Qazyldrath rises.”
  • (If the empyrean stag in area @UUID[.mtXgMXQHtRnJGTWb]{B6} was drained of divinity) “A shimmering gold glow radiates from the ancient dragon, divinity wrenched from a celestial—then as you watch, the radiance rots to black holiness.”

Qazyldrath. If @UUID[Actor.TlkJ4uzPWNX9I2FV] notices the intruders, they immediately attack, flying 60 feet into the air to begin combat. If the empyrean stag in the light-harvesting depths (area @UUID[.mtXgMXQHtRnJGTWb]{B6}) was drained of divinity, Qazyldrath begins combat with 100 temporary hit points. Qazyldrath uses their Claw attack to push creatures into the pools or against the walls.

Acid Pools. Each acid pool is 50 feet deep. When a creature enters an acid pool for the first time on a turn or starts their turn in one, they take [[/damage 3d12 acid average]] damage.

Treasure. If Qazyldrath is killed and a creature succeeds on a [[/skill skill=medicine/survival 18]] check to inspect the dragon's corpse, the creature finds a @UUID[Item.RklUe3PA3FUVxjmz] embedded in Qazyldrath's chest.
