Mindwipe.name: Mindwipe
Mindwipe.description:
A Humanoid &reference[grappled] by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters the Humanoid's body. While inside a Humanoid, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside the Humanoid, and the only action the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can take is to leave the body, exiting in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body.

When a Humanoid ends their turn with the [[lookup @name lowercase]] inside of them, they must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 10 necrotic damage. If the Humanoid is reduced to 0 hit points, they die and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes over the body, which regains hit points equal to the Humanoid's hit point maximum. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] retains their Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, their understanding of Deep Speech and Undercommon, and their telepathy. They otherwise adopt the target's statistics and can take the actions the creature could take. They know everything the creature knew, including spells, class features, traits, and languages. If the body is reduced to 0 hit points after the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes control, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must leave it.

A creature wielding a sharp tool or weapon within reach of a Humanoid host or body with a [[lookup @name lowercase]] inside can use an action to attempt to remove the [[lookup @name lowercase]] , making an attack roll against the Humanoid's AC if the host is unwilling. On a hit, the creature deals 11 (2d10) slashing damage to the host and must make a [[/check 15 wis med]] check. On a successful check, the creature cuts the [[lookup @name lowercase]] out of the host. On a failed check, if this slashing damage reduced the host to 0 hit points, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] kills the host; otherwise, there is no effect.

Foundry Note

The Hostile Takeover effect from the Inhabiting Parasite activity can be used to modify a target's statistics to transfer over the mindkiller's mental scores and languages.

Memory Thief.description:
4th-Order Power

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] psionically plunders the mind of a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target must make a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 33 (6d10) psychic damage, and until they finish a long rest or die, their proficiency bonus is cumulatively lowered by 1 and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains a cumulative +2 bonus to damage rolls. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and doesn't have their proficiency bonus reduced.

A creature whose proficiency bonus drops to 0 can't form new thoughts or speak, and they have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

The changes wrought by this power fail to hold up to physical inspection. A creature can use an action to inspect the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s appearance and make a DC 17 Intelligence (Investigation) check, noticing the image is a projection on a success.

Aberrant Ground.name: Aberrant Ground
Aberrant Ground.description:
The ground in a 10-foot radius around the mouther is doughlike difficult terrain.

Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

Gibbering.name: Gibbering
Gibbering.description:
The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during its turn.

On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The gibbering mouther makes one bite attack and, if it can, uses its Blinding Spittle.

Bites.name: Bites
Bites.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (5d6) piercing damage.

If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is killed by this damage, it is absorbed into the mouther.

Blinding Spittle.name: Blinding Spittle
Blinding Spittle.description:
The mouther spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact.

Each creature within 5 feet of the flash must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mouther's next turn.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) poison damage.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage, and [[lookup @name]] can move the target up to 15 feet horizontally.

Corruption.name: Corruption
Corruption.description:
Poison damage dealt by [[lookup @name]] ignores damage resistance and treats damage immunity as damage resistance.

Whenever [[lookup @name]] deals poison damage to a creature who isn't a Construct or an Undead, that creature must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be corrupted (save ends at end of turn). The corruption lasts until cured by a cure ailment power, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell, or similar supernatural effect.

While corrupted, a creature takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage at the start of each of their turns as their mind and body are ravaged by reality-warping anomalies. If a creature dies while corrupted, their body melts into a gruesome puddle, becoming a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.uhKi9cqcfAHwm8h0]{Gibbering Mouther} under [[lookup @name]]'s control.

Corruption.name: Corruption
Corruption.description:
You are corrupted by Yserthrax's magic. The corruption lasts until cured by a cure ailment power, Lesser Restoration spell, or similar supernatural effect. While corrupted, you take 14 (4d6) psychic damage at the start of each of your turns as your mind and body are ravaged by reality-warping anomalies.

You can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Withering Resistance.name: Withering Resistance
Withering Resistance.description: When [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw, they can take 16 (3d10) necrotic damage and succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes one [[/item yLFaYx1XPKdNGlgA]] attack and two [[/item DUks40ym5J0BHNRK]] attacks.

Corrupting Breath.name: Corrupting Breath
Corrupting Breath.description: [[lookup @name]] exhales poison in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 56 (16d6) poison damage and is &reference[poisoned] until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned.

Spatial Alternation.name: Spatial Alternation
Spatial Alternation.description: [[lookup @name]] bats their wings erratically, releasing foul energy that warps space around them. Each creature within 60 feet of them must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or be teleported up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space [[lookup @name]] can see.

Elder Scream.name: Elder Scream
Elder Scream.description: [[lookup @name]] unleashes an eldritch scream, piercing the mind of each enemy they can see within 120 feet of her. Each target must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw, taking 77 (14d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Summon Monoliths.name: Summon Monoliths
Summon Monoliths.description:
[[lookup @name]] conjures three monoliths of otherworldly green crystal, which grow out of the ground centered on three points they can see within 500 feet of them. Each monolith is a 10-foot-radius, 60-foot-high cylinder with AC 19, 100 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. The monoliths don't block [[lookup @name]]'s vision.

Each creature within 10 feet of a monolith other than [[lookup @name]] is vulnerable to psychic damage. When a monolith is destroyed, each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
[[lookup @name]] has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

[[/item 9N0P482EIz2nAJxb]]

[[/item o1UzjVrUE5GNziZt]]

[[/item KoVV1eBz8Y40y5xm]]

Ulcerate.name: Ulcerate
Ulcerate.description: [[lookup @name]] magically aggravates a creature they can see within 60 feet of them who is corrupted by their Corruption trait. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[dazed] until the end of their next turn.

Eldritch Disruption.name: Eldritch Disruption
Eldritch Disruption.description: When a creature [[lookup @name]] can see within 60 feet of them hits them with an attack or succeeds on a saving throw, [[lookup @name]] conjures a reality-warping anomaly around them. The creature must choose to either take 10 (3d6) psychic damage or to reroll the attack or saving throw and use the new result.

damage.condition: When a creature hits the monster with an attack or succeeds on a saving throw.

Map Case.name: Map Case
Map Case.description: This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up sheets of paper or five rolled-up sheets of parchment.

Potion of Gaseous Form.name: Potion of Gaseous Form
Potion of Gaseous Form.description:
This potion's container seems to hold fog that moves and pours like water.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2IWiZAJtOGDoKjiz]{Gaseous Form} spell for 1 hour (no concentration required) or until you end the effect as a bonus action.

Crystal Ball.name: Crystal Ball
Crystal Ball.description:
Wondrous item (Requires Attunement)

The typical Crystal Ball, a very rare item, is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20]{Scrying} spell (save DC 17) with it.

Bag of Eyes.name: Bag of Eyes
Bag of Eyes.description:
(Requires Attunement)

This lumpy green leather sack contains five eyeballs of varying colors. You can use your action to place an eyeball on a surface and utter the command word, causing the eyeball to meld into the surface and become &reference[invisible apply=false] for the next 24 hours. The eyeball has normal vision and darkvision out to 60 feet and can look in every direction. You can have up to five eyeballs active at once.

As an action, you can see through an active eyeball that is on the same plane of existence as you. During this time, you see as if you were in its space, gaining the benefits of the eyeball’s darkvision, but you are blind with regard to your own senses. Switching your vision between eyeballs requires an action. Returning to your own senses doesn’t require an action.

After an eyeball has been active for 24 hours, it vanishes from the surface where it was placed. If the eyeball and the bag of eyes are on the same plane of existence, the eyeball returns to the bag. Otherwise, the eyeball is lost.

Robe of Eyes.name: Robe of Eyes
Robe of Eyes.description:
Wondrous item, (requires attunement)

This robe is adorned with eyelike patterns. While you wear the robe, you gain the following benefits:

  • The robe lets you see in all directions, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
  • You have darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
  • You can see invisible creatures and objects, as well as see into the Ethereal Plane, out to a range of 120 feet.

The eyes on the robe can't be closed or averted. Although you can close or avert your own eyes, you are never considered to be doing so while wearing this robe.

A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Bnn9Nzajixvow9xi]{Light} spell cast on the robe or a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.BP3GCwa66IAw1yTG]{Daylight} spell cast within 5 feet of the robe causes you to be blinded for 1 minute. At the end of each of your turns, you can make a Constitution saving throw (DC 11 for light or DC 15 for daylight), ending the blindness on a success.

Save vs. Light.name: Save vs. Light
Save vs. Light.condition: A Light spell is cast on the robe

Save vs. Daylight.name: Save vs. Daylight
Save vs. Daylight.condition: A Daylight spell is cast within 5 feet of the robe

Spellbook.name: Spellbook
Spellbook.description: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

Potion of Flying.name: Potion of Flying
Potion of Flying.description:
This potion's clear liquid floats at the top of its container and has cloudy white impurities drifting in it.

When you drink this potion, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 1 hour and can hover. If you're in the air when the potion wears off, you fall unless you have some other means of staying aloft.

Spyglass.name: Spyglass
Spyglass.description: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

Antitoxin.name: Antitoxin
Antitoxin.description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

Spell Scroll: Scrying.name: Spell Scroll: Scrying
Spell Scroll: Scrying.description:
5th Level &Reference[Spell Scroll], Requires Concentration

You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

Knowledge Save Modifier
Secondhand (you have heard of the target) +5
Firsthand (you have met the target) +0
Familiar (you know the target well) -5
Connection Save Modifier
Likeness or picture -2
Possession or garment -4
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like -10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the Duration. A creature that can see Invisile Objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

Potion of Superior Healing.name: Potion of Superior Healing
Potion of Superior Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 8d4+8 hit points when you drink this potion.

Oil of Sharpness.name: Oil of Sharpness
Oil of Sharpness.description:
This clear, gelatinous oil sparkles with tiny, ultrathin silver shards.

The oil can coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to 5 pieces of slashing or piercing ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

Potion of Clairvoyance.name: Potion of Clairvoyance
Potion of Clairvoyance.description:
An eyeball bobs in this yellowish liquid but vanishes when the potion is opened.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{Clairvoyance} spell.

Potion of Invisibility.name: Potion of Invisibility
Potion of Invisibility.description:
This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid.

When you drink it, you become invisible for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is invisible with you. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

Potion of Supreme Healing.name: Potion of Supreme Healing
Potion of Supreme Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 10d4+20 hit points when you drink this potion.

Illuminated Maps.name: Illuminated Maps
Illuminated Maps.description: Illuminated maps of ancient kingdoms with Yserthrax’s marginalia concerning the kingdoms’ rulers

Yserthrax’s Corruption Poison Recipe.name: Yserthrax’s Corruption Poison Recipe
Yserthrax’s Corruption Poison Recipe.description:
Injury Poison

This one-page recipe is written in Undercommon on a piece of bloodstained vellum. If you are proficient with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.SztwZhbhZeCqyAes]{alchemist’s supplies} or a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.il2GNi8C0DvGLL9P]{poisoner’s kit}, you can make a dose of this poison with raw materials worth 750 gp and 1 hour of uninterrupted work.

A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[poisoned apply=false] for 1 minute. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns to end the poisoned condition. While poisoned in this way, the creature takes 10 (3d6) force damage at the start of each of their turns.

Scrying Focus.name: Scrying Focus
Scrying Focus.description: While in Yserthrax's lair, Yserthrax or a creature who can manifest psionic powers can use this focus to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20]{scrying} spell (save DC 21).

Eyes of the Mountain.name: Eyes of the Mountain
Eyes of the Mountain.text:
Optimized for Five 16th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00018 inline]

Eyes of the Mountain Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Tyrant's Power. The human despot Lady Aranac and her army have recently gained unique psionic powers. Eoghan Kadel, an elf and the head of a rebel cell fighting against Aranac, discovers that the source of the power is tied to Yserthrax. The rebel leader asks the characters to venture into the Eyes of the Mountain to kill the dragon and break this connection.

Voiceless Informant. The characters are approached by Faynex, a voiceless talker who believes the synlirii working for Yserthrax will be killed by the dragon once they outlive their usefulness. Faynex offers to lead the characters to the Eyes of the Mountain if they promise to stop the dragon. If the characters deliver on the promise, Faynex gives them a rod of lordly might as thanks.

Watcher in the Dark. Spellcasters across the Mundane World believe they are being watched whenever they cast divination spells. Uzma Nazari, a renowned orc seer, traces the arcane anomaly to the Eyes of the Mountain. She sends a letter summoning the characters to her home to ask for their help — but before they arrive, Uzma mysteriously disappears, and the only leads she leaves behind are her notes and a cryptic map to the lair. Yserthrax has already consumed the seer and is enacting a ritual to tap into every divination spell cast in the timescape to glean knowledge for the elder evils.

Eyes of the Mountain Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of the Eyes of the Mountain has the following features:

Ceilings. The ceilings on the first and third levels are 45 feet high. The ceilings on the second level are 90 feet high. See “Organic Structures” for more information about the ceilings.

Doors. The doors are made of stone and unlocked.

Illumination. There are no light sources in the lair.

Organic Structures. The walls and ceilings contain petrified organic structures (such as arteries, veins, and synapses) which allow them to be climbed. However, the lingering corruption that Yserthrax spreads wherever she goes gives the walls a false life, causing these structures to occasionally pulse and quiver. A creature can climb the interior walls and ceilings with a successful [[/skill athletics 17]] check.

Synlirii

Most of the synlirii in the Eyes of the Mountain obey Yserthrax's commands but feel no true loyalty to the dragon and won't risk their own lives to save hers.

Unless instructed otherwise, the synlirii avoid contact with intruders, preferring instead to remain hidden and observe. If they are discovered, voiceless talkers with the guise power take on the appearance of one of the intruders in hopes of confusing them long enough to escape. If a fight becomes inevitable, the voiceless talkers instruct any hulking brains and mindkillers within range of their telepathy to engage the intruders and fight to the death while the voiceless talkers flee. All synlirii fight to the death if forced into combat.

Entering the Eyes of the Mountain

Discovering the location of Yserthrax's lair requires research or an extensive search of the mountain range where it lies. Once the characters know how to find the lair, however, the gigantic face protruding from a cliff isn't difficult to notice.

The petrified overmind's maw is open and level with the bottom of the cliff face, making it possible for characters to walk into the tentacle pits (area @UUID[.eTLaSYPXOqdu6Wrl]{N1}). A character who succeeds on a [[/skill survival 15]] check notices a lack of recent footprints or other signs of passage through this main entrance.

Illusory Eye. The overmind's 30-foot-diameter central eye is visible 75 feet above the main entrance. In reality, Yserthrax had the petrified eye removed long ago and projected a psionic illusion in its place. Characters who can fly or who succeed on a [[/skill athletics 15]] check to climb can reach the illusory eye. A character who reaches the eye and succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 21]] check recognizes the illusion for what it is. Passing through the illusory eye leads characters into Yserthrax's bedchamber (area @UUID[.bjSu3Q1GyyPtNfsc]{N5}).

Draconic Aberrations

Just like Yserthrax is a dragon with eldritch power, you can give the voiceless talkers and other aberrations in this dungeon draconic features. You can implement the following changes to any Aberration stat block in the lair to surprise characters who have faced voiceless talkers and their creations before and show that spending time around a powerful dragon like Yserthrax can magically warp nearby creatures: @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.lHnij85ly4oNkvWd]

Eyes of the Mountain Areas.name: Eyes of the Mountain Areas
Eyes of the Mountain Areas.text:
The following areas are keyed to the Eyes of the Mountain Levels 1 and 2 Map and the Eyes of the Mountain Level 3 Map.

@UUID[.eTLaSYPXOqdu6Wrl]{N1. Tentacle Pits}

@UUID[.iCuPQpnrPvYuISgC]{N2. Hall of Records}

@UUID[.BNDBAuEXOct9KGBl]{N3. Barracks}

@UUID[.BjUYx6DgFuJRrGW4]{N4. Audience Chamber}

@UUID[.bjSu3Q1GyyPtNfsc]{N5. Yserthrax's Bedchamber}

@UUID[.tIzeNKwYOLGTQ9xr]{N6. Scrying Room}

@UUID[.BVlKBgc8bPGsG2lC]{N7. Shrine to the Elder Evils}

@UUID[.PISGyFKjcYNHpjx2]{N8a-N8e. Empty Eye Chambers}

@UUID[.3L4QYgkM7npkLltH]{N8f. Hoard Chamber}

Tentacle Pits.name: Tentacle Pits
Tentacle Pits.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Seven circular pits dot the floor, the largest situated in the center of the chamber.”
  • “A distant echoing mumble sounds throughout the chamber, as if a far-off chorus all speak different words at the same time.”
  • (If the characters approach quietly and have not engaged in combat in area @UUID[.BjUYx6DgFuJRrGW4]{N4}) “Floating silently on either side of the large central pit are two boneless cephalopod-like creatures.”
  • (Secret) The large central pit contains four gibbering mouthers.

Pits. The seven pits are the overmind's hollowed out tentacles. The six smaller pits are 90 feet deep, and the central pit is 120 feet deep.

Voiceless Talkers. When the characters approach, two @UUID[Actor.WYkpPTcesjkwtqfk]{Voiceless Talkers} are attempting to make sense of the babbling of the four @UUID[Actor.XiTmptCNBpa57OOJ]{Gibbering Mouthers} in the central pit. If the voiceless talkers hear combat elsewhere in the lair, or if the characters are particularly loud when they approach this area, the voiceless talkers hide at the bottom of two different smaller pits and take random humanoid forms using the guise power. If the characters notice them in the pits, the voiceless talkers pretend they are captives of Yserthrax and ask for help escaping. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill insight 18]] check can tell the voiceless talkers are lying. If the characters oblige, the voiceless talkers exit the lair and reenter through the illusory eye into Yserthrax's bedchamber (area N5) to warn Yserthrax of intruders, then they retreat to the scrying room (area @UUID[.tIzeNKwYOLGTQ9xr]{N6}).

Gibbering Mouthers. The gibbering mouthers in the central pit are victims of Yserthrax's corruption and fully under her control. They attack any creature who descends at least 60 feet into the pit who isn't Yserthrax or a voiceless talker. They don't leave the pit unless instructed to do so by Yserthrax.

Hall of Records.name: Hall of Records
Hall of Records.text:
Yserthrax records every bit of intelligence she and the synlirii obtain through their spying and stores it in this room, which has the following features:

  • “Floor-to-ceiling shelves line the walls, all filled to bursting with sheaves, rolls, and scraps of parchment.”
  • “Two cephalopod-like creatures stand at opposite ends of the room searching the shelves and occasionally pulling down pieces of parchment.”
  • “A 30-foot-diameter hole in the ceiling leads to another chamber in the level above.”

Intelligence Reports. Every piece of parchment in this chamber contains information Yserthrax or the synlirii have gathered through their spying. Everything is written in Undercommon. At your discretion, a character who can read Undercommon and who spends 1 hour sifting through them can make a [[/skill investigation 18]] check. On a success, they find a previously unknown and helpful piece of information about your campaign world.

Voiceless Talkers. Two @UUID[Actor.OGs8hpp6avYs4hXB]{Voiceless Talker Artillerists} are poring over reports when the characters enter. They attack intruders. If one of the artillerists is defeated, the other flees to the barracks (area @UUID[.BNDBAuEXOct9KGBl]{N3}).

Hole in the Ceiling. This opening leads to the scrying room (area @UUID[.tIzeNKwYOLGTQ9xr]{N6}).

Barracks.name: Barracks
Barracks.text:
The synlirii use this chamber as their quarters. It has the following features:

  • “A 20-foot-long, 10-foot-tall, 10-foot-wide glass tank stands against the east wall. The tank is two-thirds full of hazy goo. Six shapes float idly in the viscous liquid.”
  • “Next to the glass tank sits a wooden chest with iron bands.”
  • “Four alcoves line the north wall of this chamber, and another four line the south wall. A tall cylindrical glass pod stands in each alcove.”
  • (If one of the voiceless talker artillerists in area @UUID[.iCuPQpnrPvYuISgC]{N2 }fled here) “All eight pods are empty. In the center of the room stands the creature from the records room, flanked by two horrifying humanoid-shaped creatures with gray skin, four thick arms, and large pulsing brains in place of heads.”
  • (If both voiceless talker artillerists were defeated in area @UUID[.iCuPQpnrPvYuISgC]{N2}) “Six of the pods are empty. The remaining two pods contain horrifying humanoid-shaped creatures with gray skin, four thick arms, and large pulsing brains in place of heads.”
  • (Secret) One of the hulking brains has the key to the room's chest around their neck.

Pods. The lair's voiceless talkers, voiceless talker artillerists, and hulking brains use these pods to rest.

Hulking Brains. If the two @UUID[Actor.AL0p8dnWr5WBZKbX]{Hulking Brains} have been alerted to intruders by a @UUID[Actor.OGs8hpp6avYs4hXB] from the hall of records (area @UUID[.iCuPQpnrPvYuISgC]{N2}), they immediately attack the characters. Otherwise, the hulking brains are unconscious in their pods. The party can move about the chamber without alerting the hulking brains with a successful group [[/skill stealth 12]] check. On a failure, the hulking brains wake up and attack, fighting to the death.

Mindkillers. Inside the tank on the east wall are six @UUID[Actor.IDrLcIgdjGwIHlYw]{Mindkillers}. They only attack if the tank is disturbed or they sense combat in the room. Otherwise, they remain dormant in their tank.

Treasure. The chest is locked and can be opened using the key hanging from one of the hulking brain's necks. Alternatively, a character can unlock it with a successful [[/tool thief 16]] check. Six of @UUID[Item.hCDEqPkxt8Ww6M14]{Yserthrax's discarded scales} (worth 500 gp each) are inside the chest.

Audience Chamber.name: Audience Chamber
Audience Chamber.text:
A curved ramp leads from the first level of the lair directly into this area. This area has a 60-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “Eldritch symbols are carved all over the floor, ceiling, and walls of this chamber.”
  • “The southwest corner of the chamber is dominated by a dais that rises 15 feet above the floor. A hulking dragon atop the platform stares into a large crystal sphere. The dragon's body is bloated with strange growths, and her wings are covered in hundreds of emerald eyes that blink in waves.”
  • (Secret) A psionic illusion conceals a 30-foot-wide archway in the south wall leading to Yserthrax's bedchamber.

Yserthrax the Many-Eyed. The dragon on the dais is @UUID[Actor.mOeZu4nG5KpxOEGe]. Her paranoia combined with her All-Seeing lair action make it nearly impossible to surprise her. She is unlikely to have any interest in negotiating with the characters, preferring instead to either kill them, or, if she believes they possess valuable information, subdue them and instruct the mindkillers in the barracks (area @UUID[.BNDBAuEXOct9KGBl]{N3}) to use their Mindwipe action to extract the information.

In combat, Yserthrax takes flight immediately and attempts to wear the characters down from as far away as possible. Any characters who die while affected by her corruption turn into gibbering mouthers and are sent to the tentacle pits (area @UUID[.eTLaSYPXOqdu6Wrl]{N1}), where voiceless talkers are assigned to gather whatever information they can glean from the new mouthers' gibbering.

If defeat seems inevitable or if she needs more space, Yserthrax moves through the hidden archway in the south wall into her bedchamber (area @UUID[.bjSu3Q1GyyPtNfsc]{N5}). From there she can exit the lair through the illusory central eye.

Crystal Sphere. If Yserthrax is aware of the characters when they enter this area, she has been using the sphere to observe their progress. Characters who have a [[/skill perception 15 passive format=long]] notice themselves in the sphere when they first arrive in this chamber. If Yserthrax is unaware of the characters, she is using the sphere to spy on someone else — their identity is up to the GM, but options include a powerful NPC ally of the characters or the ruler of a nearby kingdom.

Concealed Archway. A character within 5 feet of the archway can use an action to make a [[/skill investigation 21]] check. On a success, they identify the illusion. If the characters witness Yserthrax exit through the illusion, they identify it without needing to make a check.

Treasure. The crystal sphere Yserthrax uses to observe her lair is a @UUID[Item.9SmHw4F3tQS2r3y3].

Lair Actions

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.SBWnU2Ppr0alUIQF inline]

Yserthrax's Bedchamber.name: Yserthrax's Bedchamber
Yserthrax's Bedchamber.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Eldritch symbols are carved all over the floor, ceiling, and walls of this chamber.”
  • “To the west, green stone eyes form an enormous pile.”
  • “A semicircular alcove bulges outward in the center of the south wall.”
  • “A 30-foot-diameter hole in the ceiling leads to another chamber in the level above.”
  • (Secret) A 30-foot-wide archway in the north wall leads to the audience chamber (area N4). The archway is concealed with a psionic illusion that makes the wall appear whole.
  • (Secret) The alcove is where the overmind's central eye used to be before Yserthrax had it removed. The back of the alcove is open to the outside, but is covered by a psionic illusion that makes it look like solid stone.
  • (Secret) Passing through the hole in the ceiling triggers explosive runes.

Alcove. Any creature who stands within the alcove is able to see through the illusion without needing to make an ability check.

Hole in the Ceiling. This opening leads to the shrine to the elder evils (area @UUID[.BVlKBgc8bPGsG2lC]{N7}). Any creature other than Yserthrax who passes through the opening triggers explosive runes (as with a 9th-level @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pB7XVYwdGNcUG935] spell). The triggering glyph can be detected by a successful [[/skill investigation 21]] check. Each creature within 20 feet of the opening when the glyph is activated must make a [[/save dexterity 21]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 11d8 poison average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If the glyph is triggered by the characters while @UUID[Actor.mOeZu4nG5KpxOEGe] is in the audience chamber (area @UUID[.BjUYx6DgFuJRrGW4]{N4}), she rushes into this chamber and attacks.

Concealed Archway. A character within 5 feet of the archway can use an action to make a [[/skill investigation 21]] check. On a success, they identify the illusion. If the characters entered this chamber through the audience chamber (area @UUID[.BjUYx6DgFuJRrGW4]{N4}), they are already aware of the archway.

Treasure. Many of the green stone eyes are worthless, but the pile includes @UUID[Item.fPRx9GQA26jG0l60]{two hundred fifty green tiger's eye gems} (worth 10 gp each). A character who spends 1 hour searching through the pile and succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 15]] check gathers all the gems. A character who succeeds on this check by 3 or more also finds six of @UUID[Item.hCDEqPkxt8Ww6M14]{Yserthrax's discarded scales} (worth 500 gp each).

Scrying Room.name: Scrying Room
Scrying Room.text:
Yserthrax and the synlirii use this chamber for their spying efforts. The chamber has the following features:

  • “A large mirror, a gem-encrusted ewer and basin, a 3-foot-tall rough quartz, and a glass orb filled with swirling green smoke are displayed around the perimeter of this chamber.”
  • “A large wooden wardrobe stands against the west wall.”
  • (If the characters weren't tricked by the voiceless talkers in area @UUID[.eTLaSYPXOqdu6Wrl]{N1}) “Two cephalopod-like creatures stand in front of the mirror, both staring at it intently.”
  • (Secret) If the characters were tricked by the voiceless talkers in humanoid form in area N1, four voiceless talkers are here instead of two, and they immediately attack.

Voiceless Talkers. Unless the voiceless talkers from the tentacle pits (area @UUID[.eTLaSYPXOqdu6Wrl]{N1}) tricked the characters and alerted the others in this room, a @UUID[Actor.WYkpPTcesjkwtqfk] and a @UUID[Actor.OGs8hpp6avYs4hXB] are currently scrying using one of the mirrors in the room. They are engrossed in their spell, and characters who succeed on a [[/skill stealth 12]] check can approach them unnoticed. They don't notice combat in other areas of the lair.

If the two @UUID[Actor.WYkpPTcesjkwtqfk]{Voiceless Talkers} from the tentacle pits (area @UUID[.eTLaSYPXOqdu6Wrl]{N1}) made it to this room, they join the other two here, and all four attack on sight.

Scrying Foci. The objects strewn around the room are all foci for @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20] spells. While these items are within the lair, Yserthrax or any creature who can manifest a psionic power can use one to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20] spell (save DC 21) without expending a spell slot.

Wardrobe. The wardrobe contains an eclectic collection of trinkets that belonged to various targets of Yserthrax's spying. She and the synlirii use them as physical connections to enhance their scrying spells. The wardrobe also contains two spell scrolls (see “Treasure”).

Treasure. The @UUID[Item.zpnW2ktYbjNQvqSm]{scrying foci} around the room are finely wrought and worth 1,000 gp each. The trinkets in the wardrobe are worthless to anyone but Yserthrax and their original owners, but there are two spell scrolls of @UUID[Item.YuF9n2y5ToNXOqm4]{scrying} at the bottom of the wardrobe.

Shrine to the Elder Evils.name: Shrine to the Elder Evils
Shrine to the Elder Evils.text:
Accessible only through Yserthrax's private chambers, this area serves as a place of worship to the elder evils that bind her. It has the following features:

  • “Horrible murals cover the walls of this chamber, depicting creatures out of the darkest nightmares, all with far too many eyes that seem to shift and squirm at the edges of your vision.”
  • “In the center of the room, an emerald basin filled with a black liquid sits atop an obsidian altar. Every few seconds, a drop of this substance falls from the ceiling above the altar into the basin—but no matter how long you observe this process, the basin never seems to get any fuller.”
  • (Secret) Six of the eyes depicted in the murals are buttons.

Mural and Eyes. The creatures depicted on the walls represent the elder evils who empower and bind Yserthrax. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=investigation/perception 18]] check finds the six buttons hidden among the eyes on the mural.

When pressed, each button opens an opaque portal in the wall next to each eye. The portals each lead to a different chamber carved out of the overmind's petrified floating eyes, which are strewn throughout the mountain surrounding the overmind's main body (areas @UUID[.PISGyFKjcYNHpjx2]{N8a-f}). The portals remain open until the button is pressed a second time.

To turn a portal on or off, you can use the @UUID[Macro.iUpk6t37ei1P68S5] macro included with this module. You will be given a choice to select which portal to turn on or off, which will disable or enable the scene regions and the lighting.

Emerald Basin. This basin is consecrated to the elder evils, and the substance that fills it is their essence. The basin can't be removed from the altar. If a creature touches the substance, they must succeed on a [[/save wisdom 25]] saving throw or be cursed. While cursed, a creature can't willingly sleep or benefit from a long rest, and whenever they close their eyes, they see nightmarish creatures. The cure ailment power, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl] spell, or similar supernatural effect removes the curse.

Empty Eye Chambers.name: Empty Eye Chambers
Empty Eye Chambers.text:
These five chambers are decoy hoard chambers. They are all identical and have the following features:

  • “An enormous pile of oxidized green copper pieces fills this spherical room.”
  • (Secret) The copper pieces have been enchanted by Yserthrax.

Bait Coins. Each of these five chambers holds [[/award 50000cp]]. The copper pieces are all enchanted by Yserthrax, and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals that each coin radiates an aura of divination. A creature carrying at least one of these coins automatically fails Wisdom saving throws against a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20] spell cast by Yserthrax. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] spell ends the enchantment on one chamber's worth of coins.

Hoard Chamber.name: Hoard Chamber
Hoard Chamber.text:
A vast sea of coins and other treasures fills this room.

Treasure. Yserthrax's hoard is located in this room. See @UUID[.9z59y9YU3uYVkwOB] for more information.

Yserthrax's Hoard.name: Yserthrax's Hoard
Yserthrax's Hoard.text:
The bulk of Yserthrax's hoard is secured in one of the petrified overmind eyes (area @UUID[.3L4QYgkM7npkLltH]{N8f}) that surrounds the primary lair, accessible through the hidden portals in the shrine to the elder evils (area @UUID[.BVlKBgc8bPGsG2lC]{N7}).

The hoard contains the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.Cxc0WwexXGcoMrZs] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.EyxtYqDWeHGPCmTP]
  • @UUID[Item.nPTZlYNclnJ3IuUC]{Wooden box} containing a potion of clairvoyance, a potion of flying, a potion of gaseous form, a potion of invisibility, a potion of superior healing, and a potion of supreme healing
  • @UUID[Item.hVhENHDOtI1AlObR]{Vial of Oil of Sharpness}
  • @UUID[Item.UujY0VFcapEvOa3t]{10 Vials of Antitoxin} (worth 50 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.wWM47FEyGx0h0XUm] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.D3V6DBvh4mjN2qxY]{250 Zircons} (worth 10 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.IOY2BJU8DlSHMQAY]{10 Blank Spellbooks} (worth 50 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.zjQ3J3h2IHLP8hpV]{Collection of damaged scrying foci} (worth 1,000 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.TFL58k58TxIqFM3E]{3 Spyglasses} (worth 1,000 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.3k9h4Hw8ZyocZuI9]{Map case containing illuminated maps of ancient kingdoms} with Yserthrax's marginalia concerning the kingdoms' rulers (worth 10,000 gp)
  • [[/award 26480sp 14852gp 1001pp]]

Avoidance.name: Avoidance
Avoidance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a saving throw to take only half damage, they instead take no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits them with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked &reference[prone]. If the target is prone, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can make one Bite attack against them as a bonus action.

Hypnotic Mane.name: Hypnotic Mane
Hypnotic Mane.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] discharges the light absorbed in their mane into a brilliant, mesmerizing display. Each creature within 15 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be &reference[charmed] by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, a creature is &reference[incapacitated] and has a speed of 0. If a creature charmed in this way takes damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of their stupor, the condition ends for that creature.

Afterimage.name: Afterimage
Afterimage.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is hit by an attack, they can reveal that the attacker is attacking a past visual imprint of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] appears in an unoccupied space they can see within 30 feet of their imprint, the attack misses, then the imprint disappears. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't use this reaction if the attacker relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if they can perceive illusions as false, aswith truesight.

Bite.name: Bite

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) thunder damage, and the target is knocked &reference[prone].

Static Shield.name: Static Shield
Static Shield.description: Your sight, blindsight, and truesight are reduced to 30 feet.

Storm of the Gods.name: Storm of the Gods
Storm of the Gods.description: Lightning and thunder damage dealt by [[lookup @name]] ignore damage resistance.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack

On a failed save, a creature takes 66 (12d10) lightning damage and has disadvantage on saving throws until the end of [[lookup @name]]'s next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

Fulminating Breath.name: Fulminating Breath

Lightning Discharge.name: Lightning Discharge

Voice of Negation.name: Voice of Negation
Voice of Negation.description: When a creature [[lookup @name]] can see within 60 feet of them uses an action or bonus action to cast a spell, [[lookup @name]] speaks an arcane word, forcing the creature to make a DC 23 saving throw using their spellcasting ability. On a failed save, the target takes 16 (3d10) thunder damage and is unable to cast spells until the end of their turn, but the spell slot is not expended and the creature's action is not lost.

save.condition: When a creature within 60 feet uses an action or bonus action to cast a spell.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
[[lookup @name]] has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

Voice of Reverence.name: Voice of Reverence
Voice of Reverence.description: [[lookup @name]] speaks an ancient word of authority into the mind of each creature of their choice within 60 feet of him. Each target must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or fall &reference[prone]. A creature who falls prone in this way takes 22 (4d10) thunder damage if they stand up before the end of [[lookup @name]]'s next turn.

damage.condition: When a creature knocked prone by this ability stands up.

Voice of Ages.name: Voice of Ages
Voice of Ages.description: [[lookup @name]] recites an ancient lament that reverberates in nearby souls. Each enemy within 60 feet of [[lookup @name]] who can hear him must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 44 (8d10) psychic damage, falls &reference[prone], and is unable to stand up for 1 minute as they weep uncontrollably (save ends at end of turn). On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

Voice of Ages.name: Voice of Ages
Voice of Ages.description: For the next minute, you weep uncontrollably and cannot stand up. You can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Fulguration.name: Fulguration
Fulguration.description:
[[lookup @name]] sheds his physical form to become a being of lightning until the end of his next turn. While in this form, [[lookup @name]] gains the following benefits:

  • They are resistant to all damage.

  • They can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

  • Their movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

  • They can move through any creature's space, and when they move into a creature's space for the first time on a turn, that creature takes 16 (3d10) lightning damage.

Collision Damage.name: Collision Damage
Collision Damage.condition: When moving into a creature's space.

The monster gains the following benefits:

  • They are resistant to all damage.

  • They can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

  • Their movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

  • They can move through any creature's space, and when they moves into a creature's space for the first time on a turn, that creature takes 16 (3d10) lightning damage.

Molten Flesh.name: Molten Flesh
Molten Flesh.description: The first time a creature other than a fire giant touches the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or hits them with a melee attack on a turn, that creature takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

Healing Heat.name: Healing Heat
Healing Heat.description:
When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets a fire giant with an attack, spell, or other supernatural effect that deals fire damage, that target instead regains a number of hit points equal to the damage that would be dealt. The target can choose to be hit by this attack or fail their saving throw against this effect.

Foundry Note

When dealing damage in this way, the GM can turn the damage into healing in the Damage Tray that appears in the damage roll in the chat log.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes two attacks using [[/item n9qpouMx6Pvb6Lye]], [[/item LtEHCYWEpCQclcSa]], or both. They can replace one attack with a use of [[/item nrYWqnsFW5muqyqK]].

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, the target must choose between being knocked &reference[prone] or pushed 10 feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Living Blaze.name: Living Blaze
Living Blaze.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 180 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) fire damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can ricochet the flame toward another target within 5 feet of the first. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes another spell attack roll against the second target with disadvantage, dealing the same damage on a hit.

Flamelash.name: Flamelash
Flamelash.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] extends a whiplike flame to strike a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 20 (4d6 + 6) fire damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves the target up to 10 feet horizontally.

Travel by Fire.name: Travel by Fire
Travel by Fire.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses two willing creatures they can see within 30 feet of them. Each target takes 14 (4d6) fire damage damage and teleports, swapping places with the other target.

Unarmed Strike.name: Unarmed Strike
Unarmed Strike.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the same creature is hit twice with this attack on a turn, they are &reference[blinded] until the end of their next turn.

Heat and Pressure.name: Heat and Pressure
Heat and Pressure.description: When an enemy moves out of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s reach, the enemy must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or gain a level of &Reference[exhaustion apply=false]. Creatures with resistance or immunity to fire damage are immune to this effect.

Hurl Flame.name: Hurl Flame
Hurl Flame.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 180 ft., one target. Hit: 34 (8d6 + 6) fire damage.

Guardian Block.name: Guardian Block
Guardian Block.description: When an enemy within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits a creature other than the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with an attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] halves the damage dealt by that attack. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] then makes an [[/item RNkQJCXUTP6vW5GQ]] against the attacker.

Maw.name: Maw
Maw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, they must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed (as if by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Swallow action).

Multiple Tongues.name: Multiple Tongues
Multiple Tongues.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has three tongues, each of which can be targeted with attacks (AC 20, immunity to psychic damage) while that tongue is grappling a creature. When a tongue takes 35 damage or more in a single turn, that tongue is destroyed, releasing any target it was grappling. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't use a destroyed tongue with their Multiattack or Tongue Grab action until they finish a long rest. Damaging or destroying a tongue deals no damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Slowed, Not Stopped.name: Slowed, Not Stopped
Slowed, Not Stopped.description: When the kingfissure worm fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead. When they do, their speed and the reach of their Tongue Grab attack are each reduced by a cumulative 10 feet until they finish a long rest. The kingfissure worm's speed and reach can't be reduced below 5 feet in this way.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through solid rock at half their burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in their wake.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can make a number of [[/item 4qLvHWRJJKGn9KGV]] attacks equal to the number of tongues they currently have. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can replace any number of those attacks with a use of [[/item qpcjSOLu6xKchN2S]].

Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) acid damage, and the creature is &reference[grappled] (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't use this tongue against another target.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls a Huge or smaller grappled creature into their maw and swallows them. A swallowed creature is no longer grappled, but they are &reference[blinded] and &reference[restrained], have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and take 28 (8d6) acid damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside them, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution check at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of whom fall prone in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of them. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, a swallowed creature can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

damage.condition: start of each your turns

Tongue Sweep.name: Tongue Sweep
Tongue Sweep.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] violently swings a creature they have grappled. The grappled creature takes 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage, and each enemy within 10 feet of the grappled creature must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage.

Tongue Recall.name: Tongue Recall
Tongue Recall.description: When one of the kingfissure worm's tongues takes damage that doesn't immediately destroy it, the kingfissure worm can release any target that tongue is grappling and recall the tongue back inside their body. That tongue can't be targeted until the kingfissure worm uses it to grapple a creature again.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.
