Open the Earth.name: Open the Earth
Open the Earth.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] writhes, sending tremors through the ground and opening a 20-foot-wide, 100-foot-long, 40-foot-deep fissure in the ground, originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature falls into the fissure, taking 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage from the fall and landing &reference[prone]. On a successful save, a creature flees to the closest unoccupied space outside the fissure's area.

Earth Breach.name: Earth Breach
Earth Breach.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] burrows up to half their speed and then bursts through the surface, breaching the ground in a 10-foot-radius circle. Huge and smaller creatures within that area must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed (as if by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Swallow action).

Better Out Than In.name: Better Out Than In
Better Out Than In.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] projectile vomits the contents of their stomach in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, creatures who were swallowed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] are regurgitated, taking [[/damage 6d6 bludgeoning average]] damage and landing prone in an unoccupied space of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice within that area.

Potion of Superior Healing.name: Potion of Superior Healing
Potion of Superior Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 8d4+8 hit points when you drink this potion.

Silver Chalice Set.name: Silver Chalice Set
Silver Chalice Set.description: A silver chalice set with star rose quartz.

Box of Jade Animals.name: Box of Jade Animals
Box of Jade Animals.description: A box of jade animals, all of which have been extinct for centuries.

Efreeti Bottle.name: Efreeti Bottle
Efreeti Bottle.description:
Wondrous item

This painted brass bottle weighs 1 pound. When you use an action to remove the stopper, a cloud of thick smoke flows out of the bottle. At the end of your turn, the smoke disappears with a flash of harmless fire, and an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.LTomFUTBrkRi0Pj5]{Efreeti} appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

The first time the bottle is opened, the GM rolls to determine what happens from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.yZMFNfocj5qyVuOC]{Efreeti Bottle} table.

Breastplate with Royal Crest.name: Breastplate with Royal Crest
Breastplate with Royal Crest.description:
This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

This breastplate bears the royal crest of a lost kingdom.

Stylized Amber Figurine.name: Stylized Amber Figurine
Stylized Amber Figurine.description: A stylized amber figurine of a humanoid creature.

Staff of Thunder and Lightning.name: Staff of Thunder and Lightning
Staff of Thunder and Lightning.description:
(Requires attunement)

This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. It also has the following additional properties. When one of these properties is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lightning. When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can cause the target to take an extra [[/damage 2d6 lightning]] damage.

Thunder. When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can cause the staff to emit a crack of thunder, audible out to 300 feet. The target you hit must succeed on a [[/save dc=17 con]] saving throw or become &Reference[stunned] until the end of your next turn.

Lightning Strike. You can use an action to cause a bolt of lightning to leap from the staff's tip in a line that is 5 feet wide and 120 feet long. Each creature in that line must make a [[/save dc=17 dex]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 9d6 lightning]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Thunderclap. You can use an action to cause the staff to issue a deafening thunderclap, audible out to 600 feet. Each creature within 60 feet of you (not including you) must make a [[/save dc=17 con]] saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 2d6 thunder]] damage and becomes &Reference[deafened] for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't deafened.

Thunder and Lightning. You can use an action to use the Lightning Strike and Thunderclap properties at the same time. Doing so doesn't expend the daily use of those properties, only the use of this one.

Oil of Sharpness.name: Oil of Sharpness
Oil of Sharpness.description:
This clear, gelatinous oil sparkles with tiny, ultrathin silver shards.

The oil can coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to 5 pieces of slashing or piercing ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

Star Map of Creation.name: Star Map of Creation
Star Map of Creation.description:
This scroll displays what the night sky looked like at the creation of the Mundane World. If you have proficiency with the Arcana or Nature skill, you can spend 1 minute holding and studying the map and search it for an omen about the results of a specific course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The GM chooses from the following possible outcomes:

  • Good Omen

  • Bad Omen

  • Mixed Omen that has both good and bad results.

  • No Omen for a result that isn't especially good or bad.

The omen doesn’t take into account any possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the loss or gain of equipment or a companion.

If the map is used two or more times in 24 hours, there is a cumulative [[/r 1d100]]{25 percent chance} for each reading after the first that you get a random reading. The GM makes this roll in secret.

Potion of Fire Giant Strength.name: Potion of Fire Giant Strength
Potion of Fire Giant Strength.description:
This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 25 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

Ring of Lightning Resistance.name: Ring of Lightning Resistance
Ring of Lightning Resistance.description:
(Requires attunement)

This ring has been inlaid with a citrine stone that glints when it catches the light.

You have resistance to lightning damage while wearing this ring.

For other rings of resistance, roll on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.MdTxWyYVhTIgtNcG]{Ring of Resistance} table

Masterpiece Painting of a Citdadel.name: Masterpiece Painting of a Citdadel
Masterpiece Painting of a Citdadel.description: A masterpiece painting of a lost citadel in the desert nearby, artist unknown.

Jeweled Crown.name: Jeweled Crown
Jeweled Crown.description: A jeweled crown from a long-forgotten desert kingdom.

Gold Music Box.name: Gold Music Box
Gold Music Box.description: A golden music box that plays a long-forgotten melody.

Xaantikorijek’s Looking Glass.name: Xaantikorijek’s Looking Glass
Xaantikorijek’s Looking Glass.description:
(Requires Attunement)

This handheld silver mirror is made from a portion of Xaantikorijek’s Glass Cavern, and the back shows his thoughtful visage. While you carry the mirror, you are resistant to lightning and thunder damage.

In addition, while you hold the mirror and can see a creature or object in its reflection, you can ask the mirror a question about the reflected creature or object’s past. The mirror answers the question by magically changing the reflection, showing an event from the subject’s past. The mirror can only show events that have occurred on the Mundane World. Once the mirror has shown an answer to a question, it can’t be used in this way again until the next dawn.

Xaantikorijek’s Looking Glass.name: Xaantikorijek’s Looking Glass
Xaantikorijek’s Looking Glass.description: While you carry the mirror, you are resistant to lightning and thunder damage.

Oil of Etherealness.name: Oil of Etherealness
Oil of Etherealness.description:
Beads of this cloudy gray oil form on the outside of its container and quickly evaporate.

The oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN]{Etherealness} spell for 1 hour.

utility.condition: Medium or smaller creature. Takes 10 minutes to apply.

Pearl-Encrusted Game Board.name: Pearl-Encrusted Game Board
Pearl-Encrusted Game Board.description: A pearl-encrusted game board with solid gold playing pieces, the rules of which have been lost to history.

Potion of Flying.name: Potion of Flying
Potion of Flying.description:
This potion's clear liquid floats at the top of its container and has cloudy white impurities drifting in it.

When you drink this potion, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 1 hour and can hover. If you're in the air when the potion wears off, you fall unless you have some other means of staying aloft.

Chime of Opening.name: Chime of Opening
Chime of Opening.description:
Wondrous item

This hollow metal tube measures about 1 foot long and weighs 1 pound. You can strike it as an action, pointing it at an object within 120 feet of you that can be opened, such as a door, lid, or lock. The chime issues a clear tone, and one lock or latch on the object opens unless the sound can't reach the object. If no locks or latches remain, the object itself opens.

The chime can be used ten times. After the tenth time, it cracks and becomes useless.

utility.condition: The sound must reach the target.

Glass Cavern.name: Glass Cavern
Glass Cavern.text:
Optimized for Five 17th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00019 inline]

Cavern Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Impending Doom. Hildifons Savil, a renowned dragonborn historian, has spent the last year researching ancient and devastating cataclysms, and he is confident another will happen soon. Hildifons believes Xaantikorijek experienced a similar disaster and might hold the key to preventing its recurrence. The historian begs the characters to seek the dragon and see if they can recover the wyrm's memories.

Shattered Memories. Xaantikorijek's voice reverberates through dragonkind across the timescape, signaling the elder dragon's recovery of a new memory. This results in more frequent and vicious dragon attacks everywhere. A group of nations pools their resources, offering the characters 200,000 gp to find the Voice of the Ages in his lair and learn what prompted the attacks.

Whispers in Glass. Mysterious glass structures start appearing throughout the Mundane World, bearing patterns that mirror the etchings in Xaantikorijek's mural (see area @UUID[.anPFocWA5T9FRjQg]{R2}). The structures are the product of the Ozvarthrax, a wicked dragonborn cult that seeks to gain the storm dragon's favor and use the wyrm as weapon to subjugate others. If the characters can get to Xaantikorijek's lair before the cult, they might be able to convince the wyrm to stand against the cult—or kill him before he can join.

Cavern Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of the Glass Cavern has the following features:

Ceilings and Walls. The ceilings of tunnels and the hallways are 40 feet high. All ceilings and walls are made of smooth glass and can't be climbed without supernatural aid. The glass is reinforced with magic, and unless otherwise specified, it is immune to all damage.

Illumination. Torches lit by the continual flame spell line the halls of the cavern, but the colorful glass walls absorb some of their illumination. Each area is filled with dim light, and only a light-creating spell of 3rd level or higher can cast bright light in the lair. All other effects that create bright light cast dim light instead.

Sandstone Floor. The floors of the cavern are sandstone.

Fire Giants

The fire giants are disciples of Zenith Aastrika led by a lightbearer named Genesis Karmark. Aastrika told the giants to seek out Xaantikorijek and help him regain his memories. The giants believe that secrets of enlightenment are locked inside the wyrm, and they protect him with their lives.

Visitors to the Glass Cavern are exceedingly rare. Xaantikorijek and the fire giants are suspicious but not immediately hostile to uninvited visitors. They attack those who are caught stealing or harming others in the lair. Otherwise, the fire giants bring intruders to Xaantikorijek to discern their intent through Xaantikorijek's Wyrm's Memories lair action. If he senses a creature has no ill intent, they are escorted from the cavern. If the creature has nefarious intentions, such as harming Xaantikorijek or stealing from him, they are attacked immediately. On rare occasions, Xaantikorijek detects knowledge within a creature who intrigues him and offers them shelter within the caverns, an exchange of knowledge, or even a small favor or piece of treasure in exchange for more information.

Resting in the Glass Cavern

If Xaantikorijek is dead or isn't in the lair, the characters can take a short or long rest in any unoccupied area of the cavern without interruption. If the dragon is alive, whenever they rest, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>80]]{20 percent chance} @UUID[Actor.AIzGTR8TPAt0ThpF] finds them halfway into the rest.

Entering the Glass Cavern

The hourglass chamber (area @UUID[.JUoTAXcb0I5gLadp]{R1}) provides the only entrance to the Glass Cavern. In the deepest part of a vast desert in the Mundane World, a lone patch of quicksand serves as a portal to this chamber; creatures submerged in the quicksand are instantly transported miles directly below the surface into the chamber.

Finding the patch of quicksand is easiest at night, for when Xaantikorijek slumbers, the sound of his snoring is transmitted through the patch and sounds like thunder throughout the desert. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill nature 16]] check identifies the thunder as a dragon's snores. A character can track the sound through the desert to the quicksand with a successful [[/skill survival 15]] check.

Xaantikorijek's presence and nightly snoring deters much of the desert's wildlife from approaching the quicksand patch, even during the day. A character knows this fact with a successful [[/skill history 20]] check, and a character can find this particularly barren section of desert with a successful [[/skill survival 20]] check.

A creature transported by the quicksand portal falls from the ceiling of the hourglass chamber (area @UUID[.JUoTAXcb0I5gLadp]{R1}) and lands harmlessly on a pile of soft, talc-like sand in the center of the room.

Glass Cavern Areas.name: Glass Cavern Areas
Glass Cavern Areas.text:
The following areas are keyed to the Glass Cavern Map.

@UUID[.JUoTAXcb0I5gLadp]{R1. Hourglass Chamber}

@UUID[.anPFocWA5T9FRjQg]{R2. Chamber of Vital Prophecy}

@UUID[.aqr7ZyCu4oSg032o]{R3. Giant Chambers}

@UUID[.TkfywvLIwuxFiXUr]{R4. Chamber of Reflection}

@UUID[.kEMk7W55iITGIbFo]{R5. Hoard Chamber}

@UUID[.YBLwXoEhzJGkm6re]{R6. Chamber of Stars}

Hourglass Chamber.name: Hourglass Chamber
Hourglass Chamber.text:
This area has a 120-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “This massive, hemispherical chamber is empty save for a heap of soft white sand in the middle of the room. The walls of the room are made of glass in vibrant, colorful layers; they shift from scarlet red to verdant green to deep blue as they ascend to the ceiling high above the sandstone floor.”
  • “From the zenith of the curved glass ceiling, a slow, methodical stream of sand feeds the pile.”
  • (Secret) A kingfissure worm, magically bound to Xaantikorijek, guards the entrance.

Kingfissure Worm. Under the sand hides a @UUID[Actor.frGuNSoRU4JCZzyq], covered in Draconic sigils, who is magically bound to guard the lair. A character who examines the ground and succeeds on a [[/skill skill=investigation/survival 20]] check notices that something enormous has been tunneling in the sand. If a creature enters the lair without permission from Xaantikorijek and remains on the ground in this area for 1 minute, the worm erupts from the earth and attacks.

A character who can read Draconic and succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 19]] check knows the worm's sigils were used in a ritual to bind the worm to Xaantikorijek's will. Treat the sigils as a 9th-level spell for the purpose of the dispel magic spell or similar effects. If dispelled, the sigils disappear and the worm is no longer bound to the dragon.

While bound to Xaantikorijek, the worm fights the intruders to the death. If unbound, the worm attacks the nearest creature they can sense, fights until reduced to 100 hit points, then flees.

If the characters battle the worm for more than three rounds, a fire giant red fist from the giant chambers (area @UUID[.aqr7ZyCu4oSg032o]{R3}) enters and attacks any intruders.

Trickling Sand. The trickle of sand comes from the quicksand portal used to enter the lair (see @UUID[.l6gywfyYZa6mHwE9#entering-the-glass-cavern]{Entering the Glass Cavern}). In its typical state, the portal is infinitesimally small, allowing only a single grain of sand (along with any creatures submerged in the quicksand) to enter the chamber and allowing no exit. However, when Xaantikorijek needs himself or another creature to leave his lair, he expands the portal to allow travel to the surface.

When Xaantikorijek recalls details of his past every few centuries, the quicksand above shifts to form a magical amplifier, allowing Xaantikorijek's voice to be heard by all dragons in the Mundane World.

Sand Pile. While the center pile of sand is perpetually filled, it never grows, but remains the perfect size to cushion the landing of whatever creatures fall from the ceiling. If a creature attempts to remove sand from the pile to decrease its size, the trickle of sand immediately adjusts to maintain the pile. If a creature adds sand to the pile, a mysterious breeze blows, dispersing precisely enough sand to maintain the pile's size.

Chamber of Vital Prophecy.name: Chamber of Vital Prophecy
Chamber of Vital Prophecy.text:
The giants don't enter this chamber because of the southern mural's effects. This area has a 100-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “The south wall of this chamber contains vivid splashes of colored glass that hint at a massive, vibrant picture covering the entirety of the surface. The picture has been largely scratched out with various sketches and memoranda.”
  • (Secret) There is an alcove 50 feet above the floor on the south wall. This contains a ball of yarn that Strika has taken from the hoard and tucked away (see “Treasure” below for more information).

Walls. The deep scratches on the walls of this room allow them to be climbed with a successful [[/skill athletics 18]] check. A creature with a climbing speed automatically succeeds on the check.

Southern Mural. When a non-Dragon creature looks at the mural, they must make a [[/save wisdom 20]] saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's head is filled with visions of the timescape coming to a catastrophic end, and they take [[/damage 10d10 psychic average]] damage. After a creature makes a saving throw against the mural's effects, succeed or fail, they are immune to its effects for 24 hours.

The glass on the south wall once displayed a mural of vital importance to Xaantikorijek. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill history 23]] check knows that the mural displayed a prophecy that led to Xaantikorijek killing the dragon Frezzelvarax nearly a thousand years ago. In the ensuing millennium, Xaantikorijek has used the walls of this chamber as a notepad, completely obfuscating the picture and its larger meaning. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals that the mural radiates an aura of divination magic.

A character who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=history/nature 16]] check recognizes rough sketches of extinct creatures from eras long past. A creature who understands Draconic can read various random notes Xaantikorijek has left for himself, such as “Bring back food for Genesis (what does he eat?)” or “The Ashen Song lies waiting.” At your discretion, you can include messages that offer story hooks for future adventures.

Treasure. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=investigation/perception 20]] check notices a little alcove in the wall 50 feet above the ground. It contains a @UUID[Item.Y5B6omwZOEdizCe1]{ball of ancient silk yarn} worth 25 gp. Strika the lightbender (see area @UUID[.kEMk7W55iITGIbFo]{R5}) stole this treasure from Xaantikorijek's hoard and tucked it away here to play with when she's bored. Xaantikorijek is aware but allows Strika to believe it is her secret.

Giant Chambers.name: Giant Chambers
Giant Chambers.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Boxes are stacked high in the southeast corner.”
  • “A massive curtain hangs from the ceiling just to the north of the entrance, completely obscuring that side of the room.”
  • (If the characters didn't attract the attention of the giants in area @UUID[.JUoTAXcb0I5gLadp]{R1}) “Loud, repetitive rumbles come from the other side of the curtain. Some big creatures are snoring.”
  • (Secret) Three fire giants, huddled on a heap of human-sized bedrolls, and a spring-fed well are on the north side of the curtain.

Fire Giants. If the three @UUID[Actor.E7FlUrn1seAy5gXC]{Fire Giant Red Fists} are asleep, the characters can move through this chamber with a successful group [[/skill stealth 16]] check. If the party fails this check and the giants awake, or if the characters already awoke the giants before entering the chamber, the giants listen in on the characters' conversation from the other side of the curtain. If the characters seem hostile, the giants attack. If the characters don't seem hostile, the giants appear and tell them to halt; one leaves to get Xaantikorijek in the chamber of stars (area @UUID[.YBLwXoEhzJGkm6re]{R6}) to question the characters while the remaining giants keep them here. If the characters try to leave before the dragon can question them, the giants attack. This room and the hall to get to it are cramped for the giants, who must squeeze while in these areas. They sleep in this room as to not take up too much space, which they view as a sign of respect to the dragon.

Supply Crates. The crates in the southeast corner are where the giants store food. They contain a year's worth of food for the giants — or enough to feed forty Medium or Small creatures for a year. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill investigation 16]] check discovers two @UUID[Item.3gESsxfEheAJOiLH]{potions of superior healing} tucked between the furthest crate and the wall.

Chamber of Reflection.name: Chamber of Reflection
Chamber of Reflection.text:
Xaantikorijek uses this chamber to stare at his reflection in an attempt to regain his memories. Due to the silver present in the sand that formed this chamber, its walls are reflective and the area is filled with bright light. This area has a 200-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “The walls of this circular room form a mirror dome.”
  • “Six big cats with brilliant, light-reflecting fur sit in a pride near the center of the room.”
  • (Secret) In the southeast wall of this chamber, there is a 1-inch-diameter hole through which Xaantikorijek passes from the chamber of stars (area @UUID[.YBLwXoEhzJGkm6re]{R6}).

Lightbenders. The six big cats are @UUID[Actor.9YBOGzC4Apq3YeNT]{Lightbenders}, the pets of the fire giants. The lightbenders don't attack the characters unless the party attacks first or unless the characters use a light source in the chamber that sheds bright light in a radius of 120 feet or greater (see “Reflective Walls”). If the characters battle the lightbenders, @UUID[Actor.AIzGTR8TPAt0ThpF] arrives from the chamber of stars (area @UUID[.YBLwXoEhzJGkm6re]{R6}) at the start of the third round of combat and attacks the party.

Reflective Walls. Instead of dampening light, the mirrored walls of this chamber double the effects of all illumination. For example, a torch sheds 40 feet of bright light and 40 feet of dim light, instead of its usual 20 feet of each. If a light source that creates bright light in a radius of 120 feet or greater is activated or carried into this area, each creature in the chamber must succeed on a [[/save constitution 15]] saving throw or be &reference[blinded] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

Secret Hole. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill perception 20]] check notices the hole in the southeast wall, and a successful [[/skill investigation 12]] check reveals the area behind this portion of the wall to be hollow. A creature can use an action to break an opening in the wall that is large enough for them to pass through.

If the wall is broken, it reveals the tunnel to the chamber of stars (area @UUID[.YBLwXoEhzJGkm6re]{R6}). Xaantikorijek can use his Fulguration villain action to pass through the hole or break the wall down.

Hoard Chamber.name: Hoard Chamber
Hoard Chamber.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “This massive chamber is filled with treasure stacked in neat piles.”
  • “Two fire giants move treasure fastidiously from one pile to another.”
  • “An abnormally large lion with glistening fur and a brilliant mane regards the giants with lazy boredom.”

Giants and Lightbender. Genesis Karmark, a @UUID[Actor.Ds5ba53huUogBJ0s], spends most of his waking hours attempting to organize this hoard. He is assisted by a @UUID[Actor.E7FlUrn1seAy5gXC] and accompanied (but in no way assisted) by Strika, Genesis's @UUID[Actor.9YBOGzC4Apq3YeNT] and best friend. Genesis believes that if the hoard is organized correctly, it will unlock a key memory from Xaantikorijek's past. When one system doesn't work, he moves onto another. When the characters arrive, he is organizing items by color.

If the giants notice the characters, they regard them with suspicion. Genesis asks them to stay in the chamber and not touch anything while the other giant goes to get Xaantikorijek from the chamber of stars (area R6). If the characters refuse to comply, Genesis and Strika attack.

Treasure. Most of Xaantikorijek's hoard is in this room (see @UUID[.BH4xpgPn4IPpLN71] for more information).

Chamber of Stars.name: Chamber of Stars
Chamber of Stars.text:
This dark, blackened chamber is where Xaantikorijek sleeps. It has a 120-foot-high ceiling and the following features:

  • “Many lighting strikes have scorched this domed chamber's glass walls, making them the deep black color of obsidian.”
  • “Gems embedded in the ceiling glisten like stars in a night sky.”
  • (If the characters enter without drawing Xaantikorijek to another area) “Curled in the center of this room lies a sleeping blue-scaled dragon.”
  • (If Xaantikorijek is dead) “A massive open doorway glows faintly red on the southeast wall of this chamber.”
  • (Secret) A secret magic door exists on the southeast corner of this chamber.
  • (Secret) If Xaantikorijek is here and the characters broke down the wall in the chamber of reflection to enter (area @UUID[.TkfywvLIwuxFiXUr]{R4}), he is only pretending to be asleep.

Xaantikorijek. If the great dragon @UUID[Actor.AIzGTR8TPAt0ThpF] is asleep when the characters enter this chamber, they can move in this chamber without waking him up by succeeding on a group [[/skill stealth 15]] check. If the dragon fakes sleep, a character can tell that Xaantikojroek is actually awake with a successful [[/skill insight 17]] check.

While faking sleep, Xaantikorijek listens to the characters and observes them with his blindsight. If they attempt to harm or steal from him, he attacks. If their intentions aren't hostile, he eventually rouses and asks why they disturb his rest.

Magical Door. Xaantikorijek created a 20-foot-wide, 50-foot-tall magical door in the southeast corner of this room. It leads to magma chambers that wind their way to the surface. He can open this door with a thought while in the chamber (no action required). If he dies, the door opens permanently. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals that the door radiates an aura of transmutation magic, and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] spell opens the door permanently.

Treasure. Xaantikorijek keeps the @UUID[Item.N3nWxTRgQuV7aDPa] (see @UUID[.BH4xpgPn4IPpLN71]) in this room. He leaves it on the floor when he isn't here and holds it close when he is.

Additionally, the ceiling of this chamber is embedded with @UUID[Item.dp7Jvduk8Ab4Yb6W]{fifty moonstones} (worth 50 gp each), @UUID[Item.VbnSlf5LYkH40GU6]{twenty pearls} (worth 100 gp each), @UUID[Item.zXc636gSiwbMFFc1]{nine topazes} (worth 500 gp each), and @UUID[Item.Ud4clAMDFGk03KKX]{one opal} (worth 1,000 gp). A character who can reach the gems can remove them with a successful [[/skill athletics 20]] check or [[/tool tool=thief/jeweler 15]] check.

Lair Actions

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.features.Item.2coBJvpUbnLPoZfQ inline]

Xaantikorijek's Hoard.name: Xaantikorijek's Hoard
Xaantikorijek's Hoard.text:
The bulk of Xaantikorijek's hoard is in area @UUID[.kEMk7W55iITGIbFo]{R5}. The hoard contains the following items:

  • @UUID[Item.t30XaHl2bteGt7jq]
  • @UUID[Item.Bks30cRijx1bZXE6]
  • @UUID[Item.Xt6cq10Rsns4p7Xs]
  • @UUID[Item.IfZoG3ksueCX4mob]
  • @UUID[Item.i2mb9tQq6oP6DO1D] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.FtDYOpLC1pIcxz5q] (worth 10 gp) containing 2 potions of giant strength (fire), a potion of flying, 2 vials of oil of etherealness, and 2 vials of oil of sharpness
  • @UUID[Item.N3nWxTRgQuV7aDPa] (see below)
  • @UUID[Item.OJfMx6FxVbpOMN0A]{19 obsidian stones} (worth 10 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.GGApdCyknLPV0Mrx]{Stylized amber figurine of a humanoid creature} (worth 250 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.CqFocjO0dGf3NWTL]{2 breastplates bearing the royal crest of a lost kingdom} (worth 400 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.6K9dOVJw9lWrwItZ]{4 matching silver chalices set with star rose quartz} (worth 750 gp each)
  • @UUID[Item.APTEImtUCwMyXUUw]{Box of jade animals, all of which have been extinct for centuries} (worth 2,500 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.froZRqZivJXRIy4d]{Gold music box that plays a long-forgotten melody} (worth 2,500 gp)
  • @UUID[Item.ab9Ug256fmUxHenp]{Masterpiece painting of a lost citadel in the desert nearby, artist unknown} (worth 2,500 gp)

Fiery Bite.description: You have been set on fire with the monster's flames. For the next minute, you take 3d6 fire damage at the start of each of your turns or until you or another creature takes an action to extinguish the flames.

Ireful Defense.name: Ireful Defense
Ireful Defense.description: When [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw, they can succeed instead. When they do, attack rolls made against them have advantage until the end of their next turn.

[[lookup @name]] exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 70 (20d6) fire damage, and any mundane metal objects they are wearing or carrying are melted into slag and destroyed. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and their equipment isn't destroyed.

Additionally, the fire remains in that area until the end of [[lookup @name]]'s next turn. For the duration, that area is difficult terrain, and a creature who enters that area for the first time on a turn or ends their turn there takes 14 (4d6) fire damage.

Lingering Flames.name: Lingering Flames
Lingering Flames.condition: When a creature enters the area or ends their turn there.

Blazing Rush.name: Blazing Rush

Ignite the Insolent.name: Ignite the Insolent
Ignite the Insolent.description: When a creature within 120 feet of [[lookup @name]] attacks them, the attacker must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker is set on fire for 1 minute or until the attacker or a creature who can reach them uses an action to extinguish the flames. A creature who is on fire at the start of their turn takes 10 (3d6) fire damage. If a creature who is already on fire is set on fire again on a subsequent turn, the damage isn't cumulative, but the duration of the fire resets to 1 minute.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions

[[lookup @name]] has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

That area is heavily obscured for creatures other than [[lookup @name]]. An enemy who needs to breathe and starts their turn within the cloud must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

Ashen Armor.name: Ashen Armor
Ashen Armor.description: [[lookup @name]]'s skin hardens into a protective armor of ashen scales, granting them 100 temporary hit points. Until all these temporary hit points are gone, a creature within 5 feet of [[lookup @name]] who touches them or hits them with an attack takes 14 (4d6) fire damage.

On a failed save, a creature takes 35 (10d6) fire damage plus 35 (10d6) radiant damage and is &reference[blinded]. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded. The blindness lasts until cured by a power, a spell, or a similar supernatural effect that removes the blinded condition.

Ferrous Greatblade.name: Ferrous Greatblade

Form Stance.name: Form Stance
Form Stance.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shapes their body to gain one of the following benefits until the start of their next turn:

  • Polearm Form. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s melee attacks have a reach of 20 feet instead of 5 feet.

  • Reckless Form. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on all melee attack rolls, but attack rolls against the [[lookup @name lowercase]] have advantage.

  • Shield Form. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains a +3 bonus to AC.

  • Fire Form (1/Day). The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s attacks deal an extra 13 (2d12) fire damage on a hit.

Convocation of Iron.name: Convocation of Iron
Convocation of Iron.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] imbues the power of iron in themself or another Elemental they can see within 30 feet of them, granting one of the following effects of that Elemental's choice:

  • Earth Reinforcements. Five @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.bestiary.Actor.pmwdGcMQxHNWpPKP]{Earth Sparks} appear in unoccupied spaces within 20 feet of the Elemental. The sparks understand the Elemental, follow their verbal commands, and act immediately after the Elemental in the initiative order.

  • Iron Skin. Metal covers the Elemental, granting them resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute or until their concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell).

Iron Skin.name: Iron Skin
Iron Skin.description: The monster has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute, or until their concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell).

Heat and Pressure.name: Heat and Pressure
Heat and Pressure.description: When an enemy moves out of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s reach, the enemy must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or gain a level of &Reference[exhaustion apply=false]. Creatures with resistance or immunity to fire damage are immune to this effect.

Visceral Sight.name: Visceral Sight
Visceral Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see any creature within 120 feet of them who isn't a Construct or an Undead. This sight ignores effects that obscure sight.

Convocation of Blood.name: Convocation of Blood
Convocation of Blood.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] imbues the power of blood in themself or another Elemental they can see within 30 feet of them, granting one of the following effects of that Elemental's choice:

  • Boiling Blood. The Elemental boils the blood of a creature within 5 feet of them who isn't a Construct or an Undead. The target must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target must choose to either take 27 (5d10) fire damage or make an attack with a weapon that has a damage die of 1d4 or greater against a creature of the Elemental's choice. If the attack hits, it deals an extra 11 (2d10) fire damage.

  • Essence Thief. The Elemental steals the essence of two creatures the Elemental can see within 30 feet of them. Each target must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 19 (3d12) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The Elemental can then teleport to an unoccupied space they can see within 5 feet of one of the targets.

Healing Heat.name: Healing Heat
Healing Heat.description:
When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets a fire giant with an attack, spell, or other supernatural effect that deals fire damage, that target instead regains a number of hit points equal to the damage that would be dealt. The target can choose to be hit by this attack or fail their saving throw against this effect.

Foundry Note

When dealing damage in this way, the GM can turn the damage into healing in the Damage Tray that appears in the damage roll in the chat log.

Living Blaze.name: Living Blaze
Living Blaze.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 180 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) fire damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can ricochet the flame toward another target within 5 feet of the first. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes another spell attack roll against the second target with disadvantage, dealing the same damage on a hit.

Flamelash.name: Flamelash
Flamelash.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] extends a whiplike flame to strike a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 20 (4d6 + 6) fire damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves the target up to 10 feet horizontally.

Travel by Fire.name: Travel by Fire
Travel by Fire.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses two willing creatures they can see within 30 feet of them. Each target takes 14 (4d6) fire damage damage and teleports, swapping places with the other target.

Dispelling Crack.name: Dispelling Crack
Dispelling Crack.description: The corpse spits a ball of concentrated thunder at the target. The target must make a [[/save]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage average]] damage and each spell of 5th level or lower affecting them ends. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

Unarmed Strike (Group Attack).name: Unarmed Strike (Group Attack)
Unarmed Strike (Group Attack).description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 3 bludgeoning damage plus 3 fire damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall &Reference[prone]. The DC for this saving throw equals 12 + the number of troopers who joined the group attack.

An increase to the save DC can be configured when you use this item.

Minion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. Rock (Group Attack).description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 6 bludgeoning damage.

Incorporeal Cloud.name: Incorporeal Cloud
Incorporeal Cloud.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The haunt takes 5 (1d10) force damage if they end their turn inside an object.

damage.condition: When the monster ends their turn inside an object.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Hg3BA65D495KkFBB]] attacks.

Spectral Wrath.name: Spectral Wrath
Spectral Wrath.description: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) force damage.

affects.special: A creature within the monster's space.

Wave of Despair.name: Wave of Despair
Wave of Despair.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] unleashes a wave of psychic pain. Each enemy within 20 feet of the haunt must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 33 (6d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Possess Object.name: Possess Object
Possess Object.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can magically manipulate a Large or smaller object within 30 feet of them that isn't being worn or carried by another creature. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can exert fine control on objects under their control, such as playing piano keys, slamming doors, opening windows, or writing with a quill.

As part of this bonus action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hurl the object up to 30 feet in any direction or use it as a ranged weapon to attack one creature within 30 feet of the object. The object has a +8 bonus to hit and deals 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage on a hit. The GM might rule that a specific object deals piercing or slashing damage based on its form.

Spell Scroll: Raise Dead.name: Spell Scroll: Raise Dead
Spell Scroll: Raise Dead.description:
5th Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

You return a dead creature you touch to life, provided that it has been dead no longer than 10 days. If the creature's soul is both willing and at liberty to rejoin the body, the creature returns to life with 1 hit point.

This spell also neutralizes any poisons and cures nonmagical diseases that affected the creature at the time it died. This spell doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, or similar effects; if these aren't first removed prior to casting the spell, they take effect when the creature returns to life. The spell can't return an undead creature to life.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time the target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.

Ceremonial Plate Armor.name: Ceremonial Plate Armor
Ceremonial Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Feather Token Bird.name: Feather Token Bird
Feather Token Bird.description:
Wondrous item

This tiny object looks like a feather. Different types of feather tokens exist, each with a different single-use effect. The GM chooses the kind of token or determines it randomly from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.OEdr086W61t1DRJo]{Feather Token} table.

Bird. You can use an action to toss the token 5 feet into the air. The token disappears and an enormous, multicolored bird takes its place. The bird has the statistics of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.p980augbCIdpK9ZX]{Roc}, but it obeys your simple commands and can't attack. It can carry up to 500 pounds while flying at its maximum speed (16 miles an hour for a maximum of 144 miles per day, with a one-hour rest for every 3 hours of flying), or 1,000 pounds at half that speed. The bird disappears after flying its maximum distance for a day or if it drops to 0 hit points. You can dismiss the bird as an action.

Foundry Note

The 144 charges represent the 144 miles the bird can travel when being able to travel at maximum speed to enable accurate distance-tracking as required.

Potion of Cloud Giant Strength.name: Potion of Cloud Giant Strength
Potion of Cloud Giant Strength.description:
This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 27 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

Potion of Speed.name: Potion of Speed
Potion of Speed.description:
The potion's yellow fluid is streaked with black and swirls on its own.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Szvk5FEVQW3uhJi5]{Haste} spell for 1 minute (no concentration required).

Oil of Etherealness.name: Oil of Etherealness
Oil of Etherealness.description:
Beads of this cloudy gray oil form on the outside of its container and quickly evaporate.

The oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN]{Etherealness} spell for 1 hour.

utility.condition: Medium or smaller creature. Takes 10 minutes to apply.

Potion of Flying.name: Potion of Flying
Potion of Flying.description:
This potion's clear liquid floats at the top of its container and has cloudy white impurities drifting in it.

When you drink this potion, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 1 hour and can hover. If you're in the air when the potion wears off, you fall unless you have some other means of staying aloft.

Potion of Invisibility.name: Potion of Invisibility
Potion of Invisibility.description:
This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid.

When you drink it, you become invisible for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is invisible with you. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

Dragon Compass.name: Dragon Compass
Dragon Compass.description: This brass compass has been calibrated not to point north, but to point toward the magical energy produced by true dragons. When you hold the compass, its needle points in the direction of the nearest Dragon who is at least a century old and on the same plane as you. If you are a Dragon who is at least a century old, the compass doesn’t point toward you while you hold it.

Staff of Fire.name: Staff of Fire
Staff of Fire.description:
(Requires attunement by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

You have resistance to fire damage while you hold this staff.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5SuJewoa1CRWaj1F]{Burning Hands} (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0]{Fireball} (3 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.X3DrXgxjwI2dvkD6]{Wall of Fire} (4 charges).

The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff blackens, crumbles into cinders, and is destroyed.

Staff of Fire.name: Staff of Fire
Staff of Fire.description: You have resistance to fire damage while you hold this staff.

Platinum Tiara set with Rubies.name: Platinum Tiara set with Rubies
Platinum Tiara set with Rubies.description: A platinum tiara set with numerous rubies.

Replica Ruby Rod.name: Replica Ruby Rod
Replica Ruby Rod.description: A replica of a ruby rod of a ruler of Hell, cut from a single ruby.

Spell Scroll: Meteor Swarm.name: Spell Scroll: Meteor Swarm
Spell Scroll: Meteor Swarm.description:
9th Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

Blazing orbs of fire plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 20d6 fire damage and 20d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.

The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

Ancient Storm Dragon Hide.name: Ancient Storm Dragon Hide
Ancient Storm Dragon Hide.description: The hide of an ancient storm dragon, collected from the trophies in Forzaantilirys' lair.

Wyrmling Storm Dragon Hide.name: Wyrmling Storm Dragon Hide
Wyrmling Storm Dragon Hide.description: The hide of a storm dragon wyrmling, collected from the trophies in Forzaantilirys' lair.

Animated Shield.name: Animated Shield
Animated Shield.description:
(Requires attunement)

While holding this shield, you can speak its command word as a bonus action to cause it to animate. The shield leaps into the air and hovers in your space to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, until you use a bonus action to end this effect, or until you are incapacitated or die, at which point the shield falls to the ground or into your hand if you have one free.

utility.condition: Command Word

Portrait of Frezzelvarax.name: Portrait of Frezzelvarax
Portrait of Frezzelvarax.description: A portrait of Frezzelvarax in a 30-foot-wide, 20-foot-long ornate gold frame.

Young Storm Dragon Hide.name: Young Storm Dragon Hide
Young Storm Dragon Hide.description: The hide of a young storm dragon, collected from the trophies in Forzaantilirys' lair.

Lava Crucible.name: Lava Crucible
Lava Crucible.description:
(Requires Attunement)

This 1-foot-diameter bowl is made of scorched and polished red dragon scales and engraved with fiery red runes on its exterior. While you carry the crucible, you are immune to fire damage and can speak and understand Draconic and Ignan.

Additionally, while you hold this crucible, you can use a bonus action to speak a command word and cause it to fill with lava. The lava is harmless to you, but other creatures who touch it take 33 (6d10) fire damage. While the crucible is filled with lava, you can use it in the following ways:

  • As an action, you make a melee attack with the lava against a creature or mundane object within 5 feet of you. Make an attack with a +11 bonus to the attack roll. The attack empties the lava from the bowl and deals 33 (6d10) fire damage on a hit.

  • You cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20]{scrying} (spell save DC 20). Your target’s image appears in the lava.

  • You cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1LkZvINag7KqBmDR]{conjure elemental}, but only to call forth fire elementals.

You can use another bonus action to speak the command word again and harmlessly empty the lava from the crucible.

Lava Crucible.name: Lava Crucible

Arrow of Undead Slaying.description:
An arrow of slaying is a magic weapon meant to slay a particular kind of creature. Some are more focused than others; for example, there are both arrows of dragon slaying and arrows of blue dragon slaying. If a creature belonging to the type, race, or group associated with an arrow of slaying takes damage from the arrow, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one.
Once an arrow of slaying deals its extra damage to a creature, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

Mount Brazen.name: Mount Brazen
Mount Brazen.text:
Optimized for Five 18th-Level Characters

@Embed[Compendium.mcdm-flee-mortals-where-evil-lives.books.JournalEntry.mcdmfmwl00refe10.JournalEntryPage.00adventure00020 inline]

Mount Brazen Story Hooks

You can use one of the following story hooks to integrate this lair into an adventure:

Burning Convoy. The villages around Mount Brazen ask the characters to deliver tribute to Mount Brazen to appease the grieving Forzaantilirys during the death anniversary of her beloved Frezzelvarax. As payment, the villagers offer the party a vorpal longsword. When the characters arrive, Forzaantilirys assumes they're part of the tribute and attempts to consume them.

Cinder Secrets. Xochitlin, a human cleric, recently translated ancient tablets that reveal a magical seal lies beneath Mount Brazen. This seal is tied to Goxomoc, a slumbering titan with the power to end the world. Fearing that Forzaantilirys's presence might weaken the seal before the titan's timely awakening, Xochitlin asks the characters to deal with the dragon.

Draconic Rest. Bright Akhros, one of the giants serving the dragon Xaantikorijek, learns that Forzaantilirys is keeping corpses of the storm dragon's progeny as trophies in her lair. Akhros tells the characters they will gain Xaantikorijek's favor if they can infiltrate Mount Brazen and destroy the corpses, putting the blue dragons' spirits to rest.

Mount Brazen Features

Unless otherwise noted, each area of Mount Brazen has the following features:

Ceilings. Forzaantilirys has expanded the tunnels and chambers in her lair, increasing their height to 60 feet.

Hotter than Hell. At the end of each hour a creature spends in the lair, they must succeed on a [[/save constitution]] saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion. The DC is 10 for the first hour and increases by 1 for each consecutive hour spent in the lair. Creatures in medium or heavy armor or heavy clothing have disadvantage on this save. Creatures who have resistance or immunity to fire damage automatically succeed on this save.

Illumination. Lava sheds bright light for 15 feet and dim light for an additional 15 feet. Otherwise, the lair is dark.

Lava. The lava pools and rivers in the volcano are 15 feet deep. The first time a creature enters the lava on a turn or starts their turn there, they take [[/damage 6d10 fire average]] damage. When a creature starts their turn submerged in the lava, they must succeed on a [[/skill athletics 15]] check or have their speed reduced to 0 until the start of their next turn. A creature who is resistant to fire damage has advantage on this saving throw, and a creature who is immune to fire damage automatically succeeds on it.

Volcanic Rock. The ceilings, floors, and walls are made of ash-streaked igneous rock and obsidian. These surfaces radiate heat. A wall can be climbed without equipment with a successful [[/skill athletics 13]] check.

Elemental and Giant Servants

Wicked elementals and fire giants serve Forzaantilirys in her quest to burn the world. These guards and soldiers attack intruders and fight to the death.

Captured Guards. If the characters question a captured guard and succeed on a [[/skill skill=intimidation/persuasion 20]] check, the guard reveals one of the following pieces of information:

  • The black rock chamber (area @UUID[.ACdne9iBoR5HwlAR]{F2}) is made of life-sapping stone, and invisible undead haunt that chamber.
  • The Draconic phrase to pass through the trophy room (area @UUID[.YGXjLMnqB1XnUUSP]{F3}) without triggering the trap is “Frezzelvarax my beloved, I'll not rest until Xaantikorijek the murderer is slain.”
  • There is a shortcut to help the characters navigate the volcano (see @UUID[.cAFFiYMP3TvXHgqu#navigating-mount-brazen]{Navigating Mount Brazen}). This information allows the character guiding the party through the tunnels to automatically succeed by 5 on their next Wisdom (Survival) check to navigate Mount Brazen's tunnels.

Resting in Mount Brazen

If @UUID[Actor.5FtZHXo1Alqdw9zf] is alive and in the lair while the characters rest in the volcano, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>70]]{30 percent chance} she finds them halfway through their rest. If Forzaantilirys is dead or not present, the characters can rest without interruption in any area of Mount Brazen once they deal with the area's enemies.

While resting, they must contend with the extreme heat of the lair (see “Hotter than Hell” in @UUID[.cAFFiYMP3TvXHgqu#mount-brazen-features]{Mount Brazen Features}).

Entering Mount Brazen

There are two ways to get to the heart of the volcano.

Secret Entrance. A tunnel to the ground entrance (area @UUID[.F6K66xwz7sNkg3qZ]{F1}) is hidden behind a lava fall at the base of the volcano. A creature approaching the volcano notices the tunnel with a successful [[/skill perception 22]] check. A creature searching the volcano's perimeter who succeeds on a [[/skill skill=investigation/survival 20]] check notices faint footprints in the ash just in front of the entrance, which indicate that an enormous dragon has landed there and then walked into the lava fall.

Into the Crater. The most obvious way into Mount Brazen is to scale or fly to the 10,000-foot-high peak of the volcano and enter through the volcanic crater (area @UUID[.3Zs0ztzl7vaEYF7c]{F5}). A creature can climb up the side of the mountain and avoid the flowing lava with a successful [[/skill athletics 18]] check. A creature who fails the check still reaches the top of the volcano but takes [[/damage 6d10 fire average]] damage from the lava.

A creature who flies into the crater must fly through a cloud of burning, toxic ash. If the creature needs to breathe, they must make a [[/save constitution 18]] saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 4d10 fire average]] damage and is &reference[poisoned] for 1 hour. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and aren't poisoned.

Come Prepared

Before the characters enter the tunnels of Mount Brazen, make sure they understand just how hot it is inside the volcano and what effect the heat could have on them. The characters have a better chance at winning the day if they come prepared to beat the heat or easily remove levels of exhaustion.

Navigating Mount Brazen

A sprawling network of 20-foot-wide tunnels connects the areas of Mount Brazen. The characters might travel the lair in reverse order if they enter the volcano through the crater (area @UUID[.3Zs0ztzl7vaEYF7c]{F5}). When the party leaves an area of Mount Brazen and attempts to go deeper into (or out of) the volcano, one character can make a [[/skill survival 20]] check to guide the others through the tunnels:

  • If the check fails, the characters take an hour to reach the next area. For instance, if the characters are traveling from area @UUID[.F6K66xwz7sNkg3qZ]{F1}, it takes them an hour to reach area @UUID[.ACdne9iBoR5HwlAR]{F2}.
  • If the check succeeds by 4 or less, it takes the characters 30 minutes to reach the next area.
  • If the check succeeds by 5 or more, the characters find a shortcut and can either make it to the next location in 15 minutes, or they can avoid the next area and make it to the area after the skipped one in 30 minutes. For instance, if the characters are traveling from area @UUID[.F6K66xwz7sNkg3qZ]{F1}, they can choose to make it to area @UUID[.ACdne9iBoR5HwlAR]{F2} in 15 minutes or area @UUID[.YGXjLMnqB1XnUUSP]{F3} in 30 minutes.

The characters can navigate their way back to any area they've visited (or skipped) without making an ability check. Travel between familiar areas takes only 15 minutes.

Ground Entrance.name: Ground Entrance
Ground Entrance.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Narrow lava rivers flow on the north and south edges of this tunnel, fed by a curtain of lava that covers the tunnel's exit to the outside.”
  • “A knight made of blood and two fire giants stand guard on the east side of the room.”

Guards. A @UUID[Actor.VKe7XQlVQdEGAnuz], a @UUID[Actor.lSAD3w5C7M4nbNoG], and a @UUID[Actor.DKFSublDD4M9guKC] guard this entrance. A creature just outside the lava fall can draw the guardians out of this area and the lair with a successful [[/skill deception 15]] check. The red fist attempts to grapple creatures and hold them in the lava.

Content Warning: Blood

The force of blood manipulates the blood of their enemies. If you or any of your players find descriptions of blood upsetting, you may want to avoid using the elementals or reflavor their abilities.

Black Rock Chamber.name: Black Rock Chamber
Black Rock Chamber.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Many blackened bones litter this vast, diamond-shaped cavern of worked stone.”
  • “The dark marble absorbs most of the light created by two flowing channels of lava on the north and south walls of the chamber.”
  • (Secret) Four haunts stalk this chamber.
  • (Secret) The rock used to build this chamber saps the energy of living creatures.

Haunts. Four @UUID[Actor.zDOjTsxDkreiZlAu]{Haunts} in the center of the room attack any creature who enters this area — except Forzaantilirys, for they know better than to harm the dragon. The haunts begin their assault by hurling bones at intruders. They don't leave this area.

Bones. The bones on the cavern floor make it difficult terrain for Medium and smaller creatures.

Necromancer's Marble. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill arcana 20]] check recognizes the black rock on the floor, walls, and ceiling of this chamber as necromancer's marble, a magic rock that absorbs light and life. The @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals the rock radiates an aura of necromancy.

Thanks to the necromancer's marble, what is normally bright light becomes dim light and what is normally dim light doesn't produce any light in this chamber.

When a creature who isn't a Dragon or Undead starts their turn in the chamber, they must make a [[/save constitution 15]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 5d12 necrotic average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Treat the marble as a 9th-level spell for the purpose of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] spell or similar effects. If dispelled, the marble loses its magic and the effects end.

Trophy Room.name: Trophy Room
Trophy Room.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “This chamber's floors and walls are scorched, and lava rivers flow on its north and south edges.”
  • “Eight blue-scaled dragons of various ages and sizes stand on display, each stuffed and mounted.”
  • “On the west end of the room, an enormous empty plaque meant for displaying a creature's head is mounted over an exit tunnel. It reads, ‘Xaantikorijek.’”
  • “Two arches scorched with Draconic runes hold up the ceiling in this chamber.”
  • (If a character can read Draconic) “The runes read, ‘My rage burns at the loss of my beloved Frezzelvarax. This chamber is a tribute to my beloved.’”

Dragon Gallery. Each of these storm dragon corpses are kin of Xaantikorijek murdered by Forzaantilirys and are now set as a trap for intruders. There are two ancient dragons, two adult dragons, two young dragons, and two dragon wyrmlings.

A creature who examines the room before entering and succeeds on a [[/skill skill=nature/perception 20]] check notices the scorch marks on the wall were made by lightning. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8] spell reveals each statue radiates an aura of necromancy magic. Casting a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8] spell on a corpse suppresses its effect for 1 hour.

When a creature enters this chamber, they trigger a trap if they don't speak the following phrase aloud in Draconic: “Frezzelvarax my beloved, I'll not rest until Xaantikorijek the murderer is slain.” If the trap is triggered, roll initiative.

When a creature enters the area without speaking the phrase, and again at the start of the initiative order for each round they remain in the chamber, roll on the Storm Dragon Gallery table to determine which statue targets a random creature in the gallery. The table lists each corpse's size, effect, and location; every corpse is immune to lightning, poison, psychic, and thunder damage. If a corpse's number is rolled but that corpse is destroyed or its magic is suppressed, then nothing happens. Additionally, each time a statue takes damage, it immediately activates, targeting a random creature in the gallery.

Each statue has an effect it targets a creature in the gallery with, as listed on the Storm Dragon Gallery table:

Dispelling Crack. The corpse spits a ball of concentrated thunder at the target. The target must make a [[/save constitution 18]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 6d10 thunder average]] damage and each spell of 5th level or lower affecting them ends. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

Lightning Breath. The corpse unleashes ball lighting from its mouth. The target and each creature within 60 feet of them must make a [[/save dexterity 20]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 6d10 lightning average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Spit Lightning. The corpse spits a ball of lightning at the target. The target must make a [[/save dexterity 14]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 3d10 lightning average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Thunder Roar. The corpse roars, unleashing a ripple of thunder at the target. The target must make a [[/save constitution 16]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 4d10 thunder average]] damage and is knocked &reference[prone]. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

@Embed[RollTable.t2pEdjBXP5PLFSih rollable]

Treasure. If the characters destroy a corpse, they can collect its hide with 10 minutes of work. Each @UUID[Item.aeKNuAUNm4yxDhOq]{ancient hide} is worth 10,000 gp, each @UUID[Item.peXdCJ6iMvfxYVdP]{adult hide} is worth 5,000 gp, each @UUID[Item.kZMiOAAWPvtTg4Hi]{young hide} is worth 2,500 gp, and each @UUID[Item.bZpVhZP6j3Gvl9f0]{wyrmling hide} is worth 1,000 gp.

Lava Lake.name: Lava Lake
Lava Lake.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “The tunnel gives way to a beach covered in ash, black sand, and volcanic rock against a lake of bubbling lava. A rocky ledge extends from the beach around the lake.”
  • “In the lava, boulders float like lily pads.”
  • “A stone island at the center of the lake holds gold, gemstones, and other treasures that refract the lava's light.”
  • (If Forzaantilirys is still alive and in the lair) “Atop the treasure, a great blood dragon gazes into a black bowl with glowing red runes etched around it.”
  • (Secret) The lava lake's depths are infinite. It serves as a portal to Quintessence.

Forzaantilirys. When the characters enter, @UUID[Actor.5FtZHXo1Alqdw9zf] immediately attacks, cursing them for intruding. She alternates between taking to the air and submerging herself in the lava. She also pushes the characters into the lava with her Claw attacks. The dragon fights until reduced to 100 hit points, then attempts to flee, diving into the lava lake and fleeing to Quintessence.

Floating Boulders. Each floating boulder can support 500 pounds of weight before sinking. If a creature standing on a floating boulder takes damage, they must succeed on a [[/skill acrobatics 14]] check or fall into the lava.

Lava Portal. When a creature dives 100 feet below the surface of the lava, they enter a similar lava lake in Quintessence, and the direction that was previously down for the creature becomes up.

Treasure. The treasure on the island is Forzaantilirys's hoard. See @UUID[.ShD8tEY1Im2F0xXe] for more information.

I do not care what you have come for. You are but an annoyance and have simply earned the right to burn before the rest of the world.

Forzaantilirys

Lair Actions

Volcanic Crater.name: Volcanic Crater
Volcanic Crater.text:
This area has the following features:

  • “Looking down into the volcano is like looking into the mouth of Hell. Amid the smoke and magma, a rocky path leads to tunnels that sprawl into the bowels of Mount Brazen.”
  • “Two centaurs made of iron patrol the ridge, and dozens of giants stand with boulders at the ready.”

Guardians. Two @UUID[Actor.D8kNpodtNU7lzYQv]{Forces of Iron} and thirty @UUID[Actor.qxNlR6P9UuIPaNVo]{Fire Giant Troopers} patrol the top of Mount Brazen. The giants hurl rocks at intruders they spot climbing up the volcano. Once enemies get to the summit, the elementals and giants attempt to push them into the lava pool at the bottom of the crater. The characters can avoid the notice of the guards with a successful group [[/skill stealth 18]] check.

Lava Pool. A 300-foot-deep lava pool sits at the bottom of the crater. There is a 500-foot drop from the top of the volcano to the surface of the lava. If a creature slides over the crater's edge, they can make a [[/save dexterity 15]] saving throw. On a successful save, they don't fall into the crater, but instead fall &reference[prone] in a space at the edge of the ridge. At your discretion, a character can spend inspiration to automatically succeed on this saving throw.

Tunnels. No ability check is required to reach the tunnels that lead deeper into the cavern.

Forzaantilirys's Hoard.name: Forzaantilirys's Hoard
Forzaantilirys's Hoard.text:
Forzaantilirys has amassed great wealth over the centuries by raiding and plundering mortals. Since the death of her mate, she's taken to killing storm dragons and claiming their hoards as her own. She keeps her hoard on an island in the middle of Mount Brazen's lava lake (area @UUID[.e79fbAeOxn5KauS6]{F4}).

The hoard contains the following items:

Her breath melts stone,
And her scales ignite,
But it's the dragon's ire
That burns so bright.
When our bones are black,
And the world is ash,
She will save the Voice
For the very last.
When his eyes flash blue,
While the earth just burns,
It will become clear.
His memories return.
Then her claws will slash,
And her fire will rage,
As the Voice gasps last,
“Thus will end my age.”
Then the Ashen Song
Takes his heart away,
As she whispers sweet,
“Vengeance came today.”

Ballad of the Ashen Song
